# 无上秘要

**The Supreme Secret Essentials**

**Title:** *The Supreme Secret Essentials*
*Author:* Anonymous (Tang Dynasty)
*Original:* 100 juan; extant: 68 juan
*Base Text:* *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Taiping Section
*Collated Versions:* Dunhuang manuscripts P.2861, DX169a+169a, DX2632a, S.80, P.2632, S.5382, P.2371, P.3327, P.3141, P.3773, and the fragmentary juan 52 of *The Supreme Secret Essentials* from *Lost Texts and Fragments* (Zhenzi 20), collated by Luo Zhenyu from Tang Dynasty Dunhuang manuscripts.
*Juan 1 and 2:* Originally missing

---

### **Juan 3: The Sun Chapter**

The Supreme Lord of the Southern Ultimate and Upper Primordial said:
The sun spans two thousand and forty *li* in breadth and length, forged of golden essence. Within, its radiance is of water essence; without, its flowing light shines forth. At its center lie cities and people of the seven treasures, with bathing pools where four kinds of lotuses—blue, red, yellow, and white—bloom. The people stand twenty-four feet tall, clad in vermilion robes, their lives waxing and waning with the four lotuses. Thus, the four seasons—spring, autumn, winter, and summer—proceed in turn.

The sun’s movement is governed by five *qi*-winds:
1. The Hour Wind,
2. the Direct Wind,
3. the Strong Wind,
4. the Revolving Wind,
5. the Traveling Wind.
Therefore, the regulation of the sun, moon, and stars, their ceaseless traversal of the Void, all depend on the winds weaving their warp.

The waxing and waning of the sun and moon’s movements arise from the convergence of the four seasons, their concealment and adornment. Above the Golden Gate, the sun passes through the Open Gate. Within the Golden Gate lies a pool of smelted golden essence, situated in the western quadrant.

Thus, on the day of *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring), the sun receives the refinement of its *hun*-soul within the Golden Gate, radiating its luminous brilliance beyond. At this time, its light is gentle and fresh, and the *qi* of all under heaven grows warm. This occurs once yearly, lasting forty-five days before ceasing.

Proceeding onward to the Cavern Yang Palace, the sun’s upper abode, also called Li Luo, located in the region of Floating Blackness. On the day of *Lixia* (Beginning of Summer), the sun within the Cavern Yang Palace exhales the essence of golden coldness, irrigating the palace. It further refines the Eight Rays in the Courtyard of Flowing Fire. At this time, the sun’s light grows dim yet intense, the yang *qi* overflows and scatters, and all under heaven swelters in great heat. This occurs once yearly, lasting forty-five days before ceasing.

Proceeding onward to the Eastern Well, the moon’s passage of radiant brilliance, situated in the region of Dai. On the day of *Liqiu* (Beginning of Autumn), the sun within the Eastern Well bathes in its halo of light, gathering the Eight Pristine *qi* and returning to the Palace of Vast Cold. At this time, the sky’s light is lofty and clear, and all under heaven grows cool. This occurs once yearly, lasting forty-five days before ceasing.

Proceeding onward to the Palace of Vast Cold, the moon’s upper abode, the canopy of the Seven Stars, located in the realm of Yu Shan. On the day of *Lidong* (Beginning of Winter), the sun conceals its essence within the Palace of Vast Cold, donning its crown and nurturing its embryo. At this time, the sun’s light is dark and overcast, and all under heaven endures great cold. This occurs once yearly, lasting forty-five days before ceasing.

In one year, the sun’s revolution completes its circuit, donning its crown in the four directions, totaling one hundred and eighty days. The remaining one hundred and eighty days belong to the moon’s domain. The separation and union of the two luminaries, the waxing and waning of yin and yang, mark the boundaries of their measured paths.

*Source:* *The Scripture of the Yellow Qi and Yang Essence of Cavern Reality*

Within the sun resides the Azure Emperor, whose taboo name is *Yuanchangwu* and whose style is *Zhaolongtao*.
Within the sun resides the Vermilion Emperor, whose taboo name is *Danlingzhi* and whose style is *Lühongying*.
The Central White Emperor, whose taboo name is *Haoyujiang* and whose style is *Huijinxia*.
Within the sun resides the Black Emperor, whose taboo name is *Chengcaoting* and whose style is *Xuanlüyan*.
Within the sun resides the Yellow Emperor, whose taboo name is *Shouyifu* and whose style is *Biaohuixiang*.

*Source:* *The Cavern-Real Scripture of the Jade Dawn: The Great Lord’s Swift Chariot to the Moon*

The Perfected of the Three Heavens call the sun *Round Brilliance of Luxuriance*.
The Perfected of the Nine Heavens call the sun *Lustrous Radiance of Purity*.
In the Heaven of Jade Worthies, it is called *Subtle Mystery*.
In the Heaven of Great Simplicity, it is called *Distant Light*.
The Immortals of the Heaven of Great Clarity call it *Great Illumination*.
The Supreme Perfected call it *Life of the Nine Luminaries*.
The Perfected of the Great Ultimate call it *Round Brightness*.
The Perfected of Eastern Florescence call it *Purple Radiant Brightness*, or sometimes *Imperial Round Pearl*.

In the Heaven of Primordial Purple, there is ever a radiant glow, dense as thin mist, from which the Nine Suns emerge, shining as one. The place of first light is the sun’s homeland.

*Source:* *Commentary on the Orthodox Scripture of the Great Cavern*

The Lady of Purple Tenuity said to the Divine Mother:
The sun is round in form yet square in its light; the moon is square in essence yet round in its image. The light is concealed within the form, the essence hidden within the image. The red light and yellow image are the *hun*-souls of the sun and moon.

*Source:* *The Scripture of the Hidden Book of Great Cinnabar of Cavern Reality*

### **The Moon Chapter**

The moon spans one thousand nine hundred *li* in breadth and length, its halo encircling seven thousand eight hundred and forty *li*. Within, it is illuminated by white silver, glass, and crystal; without, its blazing light shines brightly. At its center lie cities and people of the seven treasures, with bathing pools and groves of Eight Ascending Trees. The people of the moon stand sixteen feet tall, all clad in robes of blue-green. From the first to the sixteenth day of the lunar month, they gather white silver and glass, refining them in the smelter of blazing light. Thus, as the moon waxes, its light grows bright and clear.

From the seventeenth to the twenty-ninth day, in the groves beneath the Ascending Trees, they gather the flowers of the Three *Qi*, brushing away the light of the sun and moon. Thus, as the moon wanes, its light dims. The movement of the dark radiance is also governed by the warp of the five winds.

Thus, the system of sun, moon, and starry constellations courses through the Void, never resting. On the day of the Spring Equinox, the moon lodges above the Golden Gate. Above the Golden Gate lies the Gate of Spiritual Communication, where at this time the moon enters the refining pool of golden essence, tempered by the Stone Radiance and Water Mother, and adorned by the brilliance of flowering light. On this day, yang essence is poured into the Golden Gate, and yellow qi is received into the Jade Spring. The Supreme Perfected and all celestial beings gather the blossoms of the Ascending Trees to brush away the light of the sun and moon. The moon then bathes the countenances of the celestial beings with yellow qi. Therefore, on the Spring Equinox, the myriad qi grow warm, divine radiance harmonizes, and yellow qi and yang essence descend in union.

On the Summer Solstice, the moon lies concealed in the Cavern of Yang Palace. The Cavern of Yang Palace is the moon’s upper abode, where at this time it refines in the Court of Flowing Fire, tempered by the Eight Rays and brightened by the moon’s spirit-soul. On this day, yellow qi is poured into the Cavern of Yang, and yang essence is received into the Fire Palace. All celestial beings gather the verdant groves of Azure Void to brush away the light of the sun and moon, bathing the countenances of the celestial beings with yang essence. Thus, on the Summer Solstice, luminous qi surge, yang essence descends, yin receives the numinous, and the two radiances converge in splendor.

On the Autumnal Equinox, the moon lodges in the Hall of Vast Spirit in the Eastern Well, bathing in the Eastern Well’s pool to refine its spirit-soul and brighten the Eight Luminous Rays. On this day, the moon is tempered by yang essence in the sun’s radiance and exhales yellow qi into the Jade Pool. All celestial beings gather the blossoms of the Ringing Trees to brush away the light of the sun and moon. The moon then bathes the countenances of the celestial beings with yellow qi. Thus, the Autumnal Equinox is the day of the Celestial Grand Assembly, when yellow qi and yang essence descend in exchange.

On the Winter Solstice, the moon lies concealed in the Palace of Vast Cold. The Palace of Vast Cold is the moon’s upper abode, where at this time it nurtures the moon’s spirit-soul. On this day, yellow qi is received into the Cold Pool. All celestial beings gather the verdant groves of Azure Blossoms to brush away the light of the sun and moon. The moon then bathes the countenances of the celestial beings with yang essence. Thus, on the Winter Solstice, the Dao of cyclical movement treads the path of enduring yellow qi and yang essence in confluence.

The moon’s course circulates through the four quarters, hence its phases of waxing and waning. The sun’s path is yang; the moon’s path is yin. Though they move in concert, their revolutions reach the crown and girdle, each dwelling in the four seasons. Thus, the sun divides one hundred eighty days of yang, and the moon divides one hundred eighty days of yin, traversing three thousand six hundred degrees in total. When they converge, yang qi excites yin qi like stone.

—From the *Scripture of Yellow Qi and Yang Essence of the Cavernous Perfection*

The Most High said: The Azure Thearch’s Lady of the Moon is named Hidden Pearl, styled Fragrant Infant. The Vermilion Thearch’s Lady of the Moon is named Concealed and Remote, styled Graceful and Void. The White Thearch’s Lady of the Moon is named Spiritlike Orchid, styled Luxuriant and Flourishing. The Black Thearch’s Lady of the Moon is named Knotted and Upright, styled Tranquil and Metallic. The Yellow Thearch’s Lady of the Moon is named Pure and Radiant, styled Bright Countenance.

—From the *Scripture of the Cavernous Perfection on the Congealed Radiance Racing to the Moon*

Stellar Categories

The Most High said: The Five Stars are the spiritual roots of the sun and moon, the five viscera of the Celestial Embryo. Thus, celestial essence twines and coalesces to form the Five Stars, upon which Heaven and Earth rely to gather qi, and to which the sun and moon are bound for their radiance. If celestial qi is not nurtured, the Three Convergences wane and wax; if terrestrial qi is not nurtured, the myriad beings wither and stagnate. Waxing and waning cause Heaven to quake and Earth to tremble. When the constellations fail to hold their positions, the sun and moon suffer eclipses; when the Five Stars disorder their courses, the Two Images lose their light. When Heaven and Earth harmoniously unite, the Five Stars gleam with clarity, and when celestial essence converges, the Five Stars shine brightly, illuminating the Great Void above and illuminating the ten thousand multitudes below. The multitudes’ gains and losses cause the Five Degrees to err and reverse; the multitudes’ harmony and auspiciousness cause the stars to flow in accord with the Dao. Their reflection reveals fortune and misfortune, even the most minute detail is made manifest; their mysterious illumination reveals the most subtle end, where hidden merits and transgressions reside. The Five Thearchs report above to the True Sovereign among the stars, and the True Sovereign memorializes to the Jade Lord of the Most High. Thus, by the turning of the light of the celestial stems, they demonstrate to the myriad beings, and by traversing their positions obliquely, they announce calamity and fortune. Earth establishes the Five Marchmounts to symbolize the Five Phases’ stars; humans establish the spirits of the five viscera to emulate the function of the Five Positions. When the Three Qi revolve and converge, Heaven and Earth are arrayed in completeness.

The essence of the stars communicates above with all essences and below shares in the radiance of the luminous fluid. They exhale and inhale the Three Flowers, rinsing and nourishing the ten thousand numina. The Wood Star is a round mirror of wood essence, the darkly luminous star of the Eastern Sun’s gorge. Within it are nine gates, from which emerge nine points of brilliance, their radiance hanging down nine million li. Each gate is presided over by a Green Thearch, and in total nine Green Thearchs stand guard at the gates, attending the Central Green Sovereign Perfected Lord. The Fire Star is a round mirror of cinnabar essence, reflecting and observing the Southern Pavilion Star. Within it are three gates, from which emerge three points of brilliance, their radiance hanging down three million li. Each gate is presided over by a Red Thearch, and in total three Red Thearchs stand guard at the gates, attending the Southern Perfected Supreme August Lord. The Venus Star is a round mirror of metal essence, resplendently shining as the Western Star of Grand White. Within it are seven gates, from which emerge seven points of brilliance, their radiance hanging down seven million li. Each gate is presided over by a White Thearch, and in total seven White Thearchs stand guard at the gates, attending the Western Perfected Supreme August Dao Lord. The Water Star is a round mirror of water essence, penetratingly reflecting the Northern Dark Star. Within it are five gates, from which emerge five points of brilliance, their radiance hanging down five million li. Each gate is presided over by a Black Thearch, and in total five Black Thearchs stand guard at the gates, attending the Northern Perfected Supreme August Lord. The Saturn Star is a round mirror of earth essence, overshadowing and stabilizing the Yellow Path. Within the Saturn Star are four gates, from which emerge four points of brilliance, their radiance hanging down four million li. Each gate is presided over by a Yellow Thearch, and in total four Yellow Thearchs stand guard at the gates, attending the Stabilizing Origin Yellow Perfected Lord.

—From the *Scripture of the Cavernous Perfection on the Eight Simplicities*

The Seven Stars are forty thousand li from Earth, encircling seven hundred and twenty li. Their walls are made of metal essence and lapis lazuli, and the Seven Luminaries’ purple radiance opens their light. Within are the wandering palaces of the hosts of celestial beings and perfected ones, with the Palace of Broad Cold as their canopy. In one day and night, they revolve and complete one circuit of the heavens, just like the wheels of the sun and moon. Within, there also grows a forest of the Seven Treasures. Thus, after the hours of *xu* and *hai*, at the inception of generative qi, the Seven Stars undergo refinement in the Palace of Broad Cold, brightly manifesting purple effulgence among the Seven Luminaries. Their radiant essence scatters and flows, their purple effulgence pervading the heavens, and they exhale fluid to irrigate the various heavens. At this time, the hosts of perfected ones and thearchic immortals all gather the radiance of the Seven Luminaries and the purple effulgence of the orchids.

—From the *Scripture of Yellow Qi and Yang Essence of the Cavernous Perfection*

The First Star, Celestial Pivot, is the spirit-soul of the Yang Brightness Star. When the Celestial Pivot Star is extinguished and does not shine, though it emits light, it does not illuminate, secretly penetrating the Great Void. It encircles nine hundred and twenty li, opposite the northwest gate of the Yang Brightness Star.

The Second Star, Celestial Chariot, is the spirit-soul of the Yin Essence Star. The Celestial Chariot Star’s radiance shines distantly but does not blaze, secretly penetrating the Great Void. It encircles five hundred and fifty li, opposite the west gate of the Yin Essence Star.

The Third Star, Celestial Mechanism, is the essence-spirit of the Perfected Person Star. The Celestial Mechanism Star is fierce but not manifest, blazing but not radiant, secretly penetrating the Great Void. It encircles seven hundred and seventy li, opposite the southeast gate of the Perfected Person Star.

The Fourth Star, Celestial Balance, is the essence-spirit of the Dark and Hidden Star. The Celestial Balance Star is faint and concealed, hidden yet penetratingly luminous, secretly penetrating the Great Void. It encircles eight hundred li, opposite the east gate of the Dark and Hidden Star.

The Fifth Star, Jade Transverse, is the spirit-numen of the Cinnabar Origin Star. The Jade Transverse Star is great yet silent, surging but not blazing, secretly penetrating the Great Void. It encircles seven hundred and twenty li, opposite the northeast gate of the Cinnabar Origin Star.

The Sixth Star, Opening Yang, is the spirit-numen of the Northern Culmen Star. The Opening Yang Star is bright yet secretly illuminating, radiant but not blazing, penetratingly pervading the Great Void. It encircles seven hundred and seventy li, opposite the northern gate of the Northern Culmen’s lower cavern.

The Seventh Star, Shaking Brilliance, is the spirit of the Celestial Pass Star. The Great Brilliance Shaking Brilliance Star’s light revolves through the empty cavern, turning the mechanism of the Celestial Pass, secretly blazing in the Great Void. It encircles nine hundred li, above opposite the south gate of the Celestial Pass Star, below opposite the Northern Culmen Star.

The Eighth Star, Cavernous Brightness, is the essence-spirit of the Auxiliary Star. The Yang Brightness Cavernous Brightness Star’s light revolves through the various heavens, gathering and turning the upper constellations, flowing yang through the Great Void. It encircles nine hundred and ninety li, above opposite the southwest gate of the Wheel Star, on the upper beam of the Celestial Pass, the yang radiance of the Northern Culmen.

The Ninth Star, Hidden Origin, is the spirit of the Adjuvant Star. The Hidden Origin Star is luminously empty and numinously concealed, resting beneath the canopy of the flowering parasol, secretly shining its radiance within the empty cavern. It encircles nine hundred and ninety li, above opposite the southeast gate of the Adjuvant Star.

From the *Scripture of the Nine Radiant Mornings of Cavernous Perfection on Aerial Flight*:

The Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Northern Culmen Perfected Sovereign, declared: In times past, I wandered the Northern Heavens, urging my chariot through the Vast Cold, treading upon the Flowering Canopy, my hands parting the Nine Origins. My transcendent radiance soared to the Cloud Palaces, roaming and sporting in the Northern Mystery, carefree in the Hall of Feathered Shade, resting at the Gate of the Terrace of Repose. Gazing upon the turning mechanism to summon the revolutions, hastening the kalpas’ convergence to dance the wheel, I sighed at the myriad things in their withering decline, yet looked down upon Heaven and Earth enduring forever. Thus did I realize the wondrous subtlety of the Nine Stars and awaken to the supreme numinosity of the Ten Spirits.

The Nine Stars are the numinous root of the Nine Heavens, the luminous beam of Sun and Moon, the abyssal origin of the ten thousand kinds. Thus, Heaven possesses nine qi, and the Nine Stars serve as its spiritual pivot; Earth possesses nine provinces, and the Nine Stars serve as their sovereign; humans possess nine orifices, and the Nine Stars serve as the mansion of destiny; the Nine Palaces of Yin and Yang take the Nine Stars as their gates and portals; the Five Peaks and Four Seas take the Nine Stars as their abyssal mansion. Therefore, the Five and the Nine interweave as an unending warp and weft, governing the celestial lodges, revolving the Three Luminaries, regulating the Four Qi, ensuring the enduring existence of Heaven and Earth, serving as the origin of the ten thousand kinds, and the foundation upon which gods and immortals rely.

If Heaven lacked the Nine Stars, it could not attain its lofty clarity; if Earth lacked the Nine Stars, it could not achieve its supreme numinosity; if humans lacked the Nine Stars, their nine orifices would not shine. The Supreme Thearch combines them to communicate with the Perfected; gods and immortals rely upon them to attain completion; the Five Phases ride them to reach their measures; and the myriad things receive them to obtain life. When Heaven is clear and Earth is tranquil, the Nine Stars blaze with brilliance; when Heaven is agitated and Earth is obstructed, the Nine Stars become veiled and dim.

From the *Scripture of the Nine Daoist Paths of Cavernous Perfection on Aerial Flight Through the Return to the Origin* (Note: The character in the original text is unclear; it may be "depart" [去] rather than "wealth" [财].)

Scroll Four: Chapters on the Three Realms, the Nine Lands, the Numinous Mountains, the Forests and Trees, the Mountain Caverns, the Cavern-Heavens, the Divine Waters. *Supreme Secret Essentials*, Scroll Four.

**Chapter on the Three Realms**

The Perfected of the Great Ultimate said: To cultivate the Dao of aerial flight through the Three Realms, one must render the nonexistent utterly nonexistent and the existent utterly existent. By awakening to the threshold between existence and nonexistence—where the boundless unfolds without boundary—one naturally transcends the Three Realms, roams and revels in the Jade Capital, and soars through the ten directions.

**The Six Heavens of the Desire Realm:**
Great Yellow Sovereign Heaven of the Once-August,
Great Bright Jade-Perfect Heaven,
Clear Bright Howling Youth Heaven,
Mysterious Womb Level-Nurturing Heaven,
Primal Bright Literary Elevation Heaven,
Seven Luminaries Rubbing-Barren Heaven.

In these six heavens of the Desire Realm, yin and yang give rise to womb-born beings who live for ten thousand years.

**The Eighteen Heavens of the Form Realm:**
Void Transcending Balance Heaven,
Great Ultimate Concealing Veil Heaven,
Vermilion Bright Harmonious Yang Heaven,
Mysterious Bright Reverent Splendor Heaven,
Luminous Bright Ancestral Whirling Heaven,
Bamboo Grove August Reed Heaven,
Void Bright Hall of Radiance Heaven,
Contemplating Bright Upright Tranquility Heaven,
Mysterious Bright Reverent Celebration Heaven,
Great Radiant Ultimate Jade Heaven,
Primal Carriage Aperture Ascension Heaven,
Great Peace August Cliff Heaven,
Manifest Stability Ultimate Wind Heaven,
First August Filial Aura Heaven,
Great August Venerable Double Heaven,
No-Thought River Origin Heaven,
Upper Dice Joyous Music Heaven,
Ultimate Void Cloud Vow Heaven.

In these eighteen heavens of the Form Realm, yin and yang manifest form, yet remain distinct from the Desire Realm, never intermingling. Beings here are transformation-born, live for hundreds of millions of years, and neither die prematurely nor suffer harm.

**The Four Heavens of the Formless Realm:**
Luminous Court Rosy Dawn Heaven,
Abyssal Penetrating Primal Cavern Heaven,
Brush-Favored Wondrous Completion Heaven,
Elegant Joy Forbidden Upper Heaven.

In these four heavens of the Formless Realm, yin and yang possess form, yet bodies stretch hundreds of *li* without burden. Beings can conceal their forms and enter the infinitesimal, free from desire for form, knowing only the true appearance. Their years span kalpas, and though they do not study, they naturally perform good deeds, their blessings fulfilled.

Even demon kings who have not fully mastered the Dao may wander these heavens, yet they cannot transcend the Three Realms and remain subject to the great calamity of the fire kalpa. When the twenty-eight heavens cycle through mutual dissolution, all becomes chaos like a severed head. Those among them who study the true Dao may become seed-people; the Queen Mother welcomes them to ascend above the Four Heavens of Constant Fusion, Jade Prosperity, Brahmanic Crossing, and Splendid Flourishing. Those who study the sagely Perfected of the Three Realms but regress return to the human realm, passing through the Three Wretched Paths. Those who advance may ascend according to their merits.

Above each heaven lies a Gate of Life, within which are the hollow voids of chanting hymns, the demon kings’ numinous scriptures, and verses that rival the loftiest Perfected.

**First: The Aerial Flight Hymn of the Desire Realm**
The human path stretches far and faint,
The immortal path vast and boundless.
The ghostly path delights—
It is the human Gate of Life.
The heavenly path values life,
The ghostly path values endings.
The immortal path is ever auspicious,
The ghostly path ever inauspicious.
The exalted, pure, and numinous soar,
Mournful songs resound through the great void.
I only wish the immortal path to succeed,
Not the human path to wither.
In the Northern Capital’s Winding Spring Mansion,
A myriad ghosts gather.
They only seek to cut short human fate,
Severing the Gate of Life.
Sing the Cavern Chapter to subdue them,
Binding and sending the demonic essences to the Northern Feng.
Cut down the six ghostly blades—
The qi of the heavens surges boundless,
My Dao daily ascends in glory.

**Second: The Demon King’s Hymn of the Form Realm**
Lofty and vast, the bright qi soars on high,
Brahmanic practices fill the heavens, circling the ten directions.
Immeasurable great spirits—
All arise from my body.
I possess the Cavern Scripture,
Ten thousand recitations make one an immortal.
The immortal path values deliverance,
The ghostly path clings close.
Heaven and earth stretch boundless,
Foul qi swirls in murk.
The Three Realms bring joy—
Pass beyond them to endure.
Cross into my realm,
Your body enters the natural.
This joy in the moment—
Fleeting, by my grace.
The Dragon Han era surges boundless,
How can one distinguish the true?
My realm is hard to cross,
Thus I compose the Cavern Text.
Transform and soar through the void,
To test your body.
Success or failure, slackening or retreat—
How many will be delivered?
I laugh at those who fail to cross,
Thus I sing this hymn.

**Third: The Demon King’s Song of the Formless Realm**
Above the Three Realms,
The vast Great Luo stretches on.
No root of form above,
Cloud layers towering, majestic.
Only the Primordial Beginning,
Dwelling in the kalpa’s vastness,
Commands my realm,
Governed by the Mysterious Capital.
Those who transgress my realm
Enter the Jade Void.
I, the Upper King, rule,
Guiding and restraining the demon hosts.
Ten thousand transformations in the void,
Foul qi blooms in profusion.
Those who preserve the true are few,
Those who stray and delude are many.
The immortal path is hard to secure,
The ghostly path easy to corrupt.
The human path tests the heart’s sincerity,
Not by other immortals’ grace.
The Dao values the steadfast,
The Dao values the flourishing.
Those who do not delight in the immortal path—
How can they pass the Three Realms?
If they wish to traverse the Five Paths,
What can I do for them now? □

*From the* Scripture on the Salvation of Humanity Through the Cavern Mystery. **Chapter on the Nine Lands**

The Dao’s governance steers the world,
Unlocking the Mysterious Passage.
Three hues blend in primordial chaos,
Now present, now gone.
As the turning of fate reaches its limit,
The Three Qi radiate light.
Qi, pure and lofty, clarifies—
Accumulated yang forms Heaven.
Qi, congealed and turbid, coagulates—
Accumulated stagnation forms Earth.

*From the* Scripture of the Nine Heavens of the Cavern Mystery

The First Rampart: Glossy Earth
The Second Rampart: Rigid Earth
The Third Rampart: Stone-Fat Glossy Earth
The Fourth Rampart: Moist Glossy Earth
The Fifth Rampart: Golden-Grain Glossy Earth
The Sixth Rampart: Diamond-Iron Glossy Earth
The Seventh Rampart: Water-Restrained Translated Earth
The Eighth Rampart: Great Wind Glossy Earth
The Ninth Rampart: Cavern-Abyss Colorless Net-Weave Earth

These nine ramparts of Earth each possess Four Colored Earth Sovereigns:
The Sovereign of Proper Sound,
The Sovereign of Moving Sound,
The Sovereign of Wandering Sound,
The Sovereign of Brahman Sound.

Beneath the utmost depths lies the Cavern-Abyss Cavern-Source,
Weaving the world’s net,
Ensuring it does not fall.
Below, it is boundless and unbounded,
Without edge or limit—
All is the origin of the net-weave.

The Nine Lands and Nine Ramparts descend in nine layers,
Each with thirty-six sounds and thirty-six Earth Sovereigns,
Corresponding above to the Thirty-Six Heavens,
And in the middle to the Thirty-Six Kingdoms.
Thus, the Earth Sovereigns’ positions align with the titles of the Jade Emperor,
Yet their qi divides governance—
Only the names differ by rank.

Distances Between the Nine Lands:
The First Land lies ninety billion myriad *li* from Heaven.
The Second Land lies eighty billion myriad *li* from the First Rampart.
The Third Land lies one hundred twenty billion myriad *li* from the Second Rampart.
The Fourth Land lies twenty billion myriad *li* from the Third Rampart.
The Fifth Land lies twenty billion myriad *li* from the Fourth Rampart.
The Sixth Land lies twenty billion myriad *li* from the Fifth Rampart.
The Seventh Land lies twenty billion myriad *li* from the Sixth Rampart.
The Eighth Land lies eighty billion myriad *li* from the Seventh Rampart.
The Ninth Land lies eighty billion myriad *li* from the Eighth Rampart.

Beneath the Nine Ramparts lies the Cavern-Abyss Cavern-Source,
Weaving the world’s net,
Ensuring it does not fall.
Above, it is five hundred twenty billion myriad *li* from the First Rampart.

*From the* Scripture of the Cavern Truth: The Chapter on Foreign Lands and Liberation
*Chapter on the Spirit Mountain*

Fengdu Mountain lies in the north’s *gui* region, thus the northeast serves as the ghostly gate and the root of deathly *qi*. The mountain rises two thousand six hundred *li* high, with a circumference of thirty thousand *li*.

*From the* Scripture of the Cavern Truth: The Heavenly Pass Three Charts and the Seven Stars’ Shifting Degrees

To the south lies the state of Yishatuo. Beyond it stretches Long Isle, also called Green Mound. To its left and right stand Wind Mountains, whose peaks resound with constant tremors. Further lies Flame Isle, where Fireforest Mountain stands, and within its bounds dwell radiant beasts.

*From the* Scripture of the Cavern Truth: The Chapter on Foreign Lands and Liberation

Xuanlong Mountain lies northeast of Kunlun Mountain. Zhong Mountain resides north of the Weak Waters, nineteen thousand *li* distant. Its height reaches twelve thousand *li*, its summit spans seven thousand *li*, and its circumference measures thirty thousand *li*. Neither sun nor moon illumines it, yet its brilliance shines day and night, casting radiance a hundred thousand *li* beyond, where even the stars of the Milky Way cannot reach. The sages say the heavens are flawed in the northwest, and it is Zhong Mountain that illuminates the depths of the Nine Yin.

Kunlun Mountain rises thirty-six thousand *li* above the flat earth. At its summit lie three peaks, each spanning ten thousand *li*, its shape resembling an overturned basin. One peak faces due north, governing the essence of the Star of Dawn, and is called Terrace of Soaring Winds. Another faces due west, called Terrace of the Dark Garden. The third faces due east, called Terrace of Kunlun. Additionally, North Gate Mountain and Abyssal-Bearing Mountain are its branches, ascending to the depths of the Nine Heavens’ Celestial Pivot, the root of the myriad immortals, and the handle of heaven and earth’s revolutions.

*From the* Hidden Book of the Great Empyrean of the Cavern Truth

In the Eastern Flowery Realm stands Cloudwave Mountain, where the Lord of the Azure Youth at times rides the *qi* of the Round Pearl, ascends Cloudwave Mountain, and enters the Palace of the Gathered Flowers. At the edge of Fusang lies the Nine Elders’ Capital Mountain, where the Nine Elder Immortal Emperors and the Two Dao Lords convene the Nine Elders’ Capital, issue the talismans of the Numinous Gate, and summon the Perfected Kings and the myriad immortals to receive their duties.

Within the Great Clarity Heaven stands the Floating Detached Void Mountain, governed by the Three Heavenly Divine Kings, where the true *qi* of the Great Dao coalesces. In the Supreme Ultimate Heaven lies Lush Flower Mountain, beneath which stands the Jade Hall, dwelling place of the Five Numinous Perfected Lords. Within this heaven also rises Cold Youth Numinous Mountain, a peak the immortals and perfected ones frequently ascend.

In the Heaven of the Grand Tenuity stands Jade Longevity Mountain, where the Yellow and the Old reside, and where the myriad spirits gather. Within the Inner Radiance Heaven lies Purple Void Mountain, where the Lord of Azure Essence often rides his feather-light chariot, accompanied by the youths of the Dark Radiance, ascending this mountain at times.

In the Highest Clarity Heaven stands Rainbow-Reflecting Mountain, whence the nine suns emerge, governed by the Lunar Emperor, and where the radiant *qi* disperses. There also lies Golden Flower Convenience Mountain, whose summit holds the Great Elder’s Resting Hall, where the Eight Yellow and Old Lords ascend at times.

In the Jade Vacuity Heaven stands Flying Rosy Cloud Mountain, where those who recite the Great Cavern Scripture may enter. In the Supreme Unity’s Upper Primordial Heaven lies Golden Flower Mountain, dwelling place of the Supreme Unity’s Primordial Prohibition Lord. In the Seven Dawns Heaven stands Three Treasures Mountain, where the incense of reversed life wafts upward, and where the August Perfected Ones reside.

In the Primordial Dawn Heaven stands Three Elegance Mountain, from which the Yellow Radiance *qi* of the Primordial Dawn Heaven arises. In the Supreme Ultimate Heaven lies the Sun-Void No-Shadow Mountain, within whose great rosy clouds stands Peng’s Chamber, dwelling place of the Supreme Void Primordial Lord. In the Great Mystery Heaven stands Empty Peak Mountain, whence the divine radiance shines forth.

In the Jade Perfection Heaven stands Lofty Origin Mountain, which the Lord of the Myriad Flowers ascends at times, resting in the Palace of the Myriad Flowers. In the Jade Clarity Heaven stands Jade Root Mountain, dwelling place of the Five Elder Supreme Perfected Ones. There also lies Yellow Rosy Cloud Mountain, dwelling place of the Five Thearchs and the wandering ground of the Supreme August One.

Above the Nine Heavens dwell the Unfettered Divine Immortals, where the Nine *Qi* Venerable One ascends this mountain at times. In the Court of the Great Void stands the Great Rosy Cloud Peak, called Five Intervals Mountain, dwelling place of the Lord of the Great Void’s Dawn. In the Great Void Heaven stands Emei Mountain, atop which lies the Cavern Palace’s Jade Gate, where the names of those who attain the true immortal Dao are inscribed.

*From the* Jade Scripture of the Great Cavern of the Jade Perfection

The Numinous Treasure’s Dark Capital Jade Capital Mountain stands at the center of the upper heavens.

*From the* Jade Key Scripture of the Cavern Mystery

In the state of Lunaluowei lies Wushan, the Flying Numinous Mountain of Mount Sumeru, a separate domain of the Primordial Heavenly King, where the Queen Mother of the West first studied the Dao.

*From the* Hidden Annotations Scripture of the Cavern Mystery

In the far west of the state of Xina lies Yucha Mountain, the Floating Rosy Cloud Peak.

*From the* Numinous Book of the Cavern Mystery: The Scripture of Liberating Life

The Supreme Lord said: Wushan is the root of heaven and earth’s generation, the origin of the primordial *qi*. Those who seek its numinous domain and revere its spirits thus pay homage to the Five Peaks and command the sea gods.

*From the* Five Talismans Scripture of the Cavern Mystery

The Supreme Lord said: The Great Mystery Capital’s Jade Capital Mountain crowns the heavens of the eight directions. The immortals of the various heavens call this mountain by ten names:
First, the Heaven-Covering Summit Mountain;
Second, the Boundless Primordial Upper Mountain;
Third, the Dark Mystery Cavern-Void Mountain;
Fourth, the Lofty Supreme True Origin Mountain;
Fifth, the Myriad Treasures’ Hidden Convergence Blade Mountain;
Sixth, the Formless Great Awakening Mountain;
Seventh, the All-Encompassing Cavern Mystery Mountain;
Eighth, the Radiant Flower Supreme Perfection Mountain;
Ninth, the Inconceivable Mountain;
Tenth, the Great Mystery Capital Jade Capital Supreme August Mountain.

*From the* Jade Capital Mountain Scripture of the Cavern Mystery

Within the valleys of Mount Gouqu lies the land of Jinling, spanning thirty-eight *qing*. This is the land of the Golden Altar, where the soil is fertile, the earth rich, and the well water sweet. Those who dwell in this valley are destined to transcend the world and witness the Great Peace.

The *River Chart’s Inner Primordial Scripture* states: There exists a place where the earth is fertile, the soil rich, the water clear, and the mountains of Gouqu and Jintan lie beyond—such a place can transcend the world and ascend to the curved completion.

The *River Chart’s Central Chapter* states: Within the mountains of Gou and Jin, where mounds rise, neither weapons nor illness approach, nor do great waves ascend—this is the place.

The land of Jinling was anciently called the Land of Hidden Dragons. The *Record of Blessed Lands* states: The Land of Hidden Dragons lies west of Liugu Valley and to the right of Jintan, where one may dwell in lofty seclusion—this is indeed the blessed land of Jinling. Mount Gouqu is also named the Altar of Goujin, for within its grotto-heaven stands a golden altar a hundred *zhang* in height, whence its name derives. There is also Mount Jiji, so called for its accumulated gold, which likewise lends its name to the altar. Its source and marsh are termed the Cavern of Quju; observing the mountain’s winding contours, later generations combined the names to form Mount Gouqu. When the Three Lords Mao later governed its heights, the local elders transmitted it as the Mountain of Lord Mao. The hidden peaks of Mount Sanmao stand in succession, all bearing the single name of Mount Gouqu. Yet as people of the time described it in various ways, it acquired dozens of branch names, and this mountain is also called Gangshan.

The *Blessed Lands of Confucius* states: Between the ridges of Gangshan lies the Hidden Dragon Village, where one may avoid floods and illness. To the east stand Mount Sangai, Mount Sanhuo, Mount Santai, and the Two Golden Mountains—all renowned peaks of Gouqu, forming one mountain with Jintan. At the northern slope of Maoshan, where the grotto opens, lies Mount Liangchang, originally connected to Gouqu and sharing the same name. To the west lies another name for Mount Geyan, which is linked to neighboring peaks: to the west stands Mount Xuanxi, to the east Mount Yujuegen, and at the center Mount Ge. These three mountains intertwine, spanning three thousand *li* in circumference and rising two thousand seven hundred *li* in height, lying seventy thousand *li* from Kunlun. Within them stands Mount Gaohui, atop which a cavern radiates light like the sun, illuminating Mount Geyan, Mount Xuanxi, and Mount Yujuegen.

From the *Scripture of Daoist Traces*:

The Lady of the Purple Tenuity states: The Square Mountains stand true to the four directions, hence their name. Each face extends one thousand three hundred *li*, and the four sides together span five thousand two hundred *li*, rising nine thousand myriad *zhang* in height. There is also the Great Mountain of Everlasting Brightness, the High Mound of the Night Moon, each encircling a hundred *li*, and Mount Xuanhan. To the east, west, and south of the Square Mountains lie smaller Square Mountains, each three thousand *li* distant from the Great Square Mountains. The smaller ones measure three hundred *li* on each side. The Great Square Mountains face the south of Kuaiji, appearing seventy thousand *li* from its shores; gazing northeast, one sees the Village of Yanggu, six thousand *li* distant from the Square Mountains.

From the *Scripture of True Traces*:

[Section on] Forest and Tree Species.

The Easternmost Azure Emperor Lord states: In the land of Dafu Li, there grows the Green Forest Tree, whose leaves bear natural purple script. When the wind stirs the trees, their rustling produces resonant melodies of sacred tones, luminous and resplendent, piercing the vast heavens. Above them ever dwell nine-colored phoenixes; those who obtain their feathers immediately gain the power of flight.

In the Westernmost Xina Yu Kingdom, there stands the Seven-Treasure Qian Tree, bearing crimson fruits and white rings. Upon it perch phoenixes, peacocks, and golden-winged birds, which day and night, in six watches, emit their refined songs.

*From the* Scripture of Cavernous Mystery and Numinous Writings.

The Most High states: On Jade Capital Mountain, seven-treasure trees grow naturally. A single tree shades an entire heaven, and eight trees shade the eight directions of the Net-Spanning Heavens.

*From the* Scripture of Cavernous Mystery and Jade Capital Mountain.

In the eastern land of Heluoti, beyond its borders lies Fusang within the Azure Sea, where forests grow like mulberry trees, each several thousand *zhang* tall, the largest three thousand *wei* in girth. They grow in pairs from the same root, bearing fruit red as mulberries, which immortals consume. Their bodies turn golden, and their fruits ripen once every nine thousand years.

In the southern land of Yisha Pond, beyond its borders lies the Green Mound, where a great tree grows, three thousand *zhang* tall, the largest two thousand *wei* in girth.

On Kunlun Mountain grow the Golden Root Trees, forests of jade branches and cinnabar fruits. The Jade Purity considers them its fruits, and the trees are all inscribed with the scripts of thirty-six kingdoms. Above them dwell purple phoenixes, simurghs, white sparrows, osprey, parrots, red crows, and azure magpies.

*From the* Scripture of Cavernous Truth on Foreign Lands and Dispersed Wonders.

Within the Azure Palace of the Square Mountains stand hundreds of jade trees. Above them dwell phoenixes and nine-colored birds; below them grow lingzhi herbs. Jade wells contain naturally flowing springs; those who drink them attain lifespans equal to the Three Luminaries.

*From the* Scripture of Cavernous Truth, Essential Azure Writings, and Golden Root.

Within the Solar Mansion of the Cavernous Yang Palace grows the Hollow Azure Forest. Those who consume its blossoms acquire bodies radiant with golden light.

Along the Moon’s Luminous Path, within the Eastern Well, lies the Palace of Vast Numinosity, where grows the Three-Blossom High-Ring Tree. Once an eon, it naturally produces three blossoms of *qi*, resembling the glow of hibiscus. Those who consume one blossom attain an age equal to one eon.

Within the Lunar Mansion’s Palace of Vast Coldness grows the Azure Blossom Tree, four thousand *zhang* tall. Its leaves resemble bamboo but are crimson; its blossoms resemble mirrors but shine brightly; its fruits resemble plums but lack pits—these are the Crimson Tree and Cinnabar Fruits. Those who consume its leaves gain long life; those who consume its blossoms share the moon’s numinosity; those who consume its fruits feast and wander in Jade Purity.

*From the* Scripture of Cavernous Truth, Yellow Qi, and Solar Essence.

Laozi, passing westward over the Great Tortoise Mountain, saw the Supreme Perfected Queen Mother eating jujubes inscribed with jade script, their fruits shaped like cakes, as well as azure peaches and purple pears. Further north, ascending the Cavernous Void Ridge, he saw the Northern Florescence Perfected Lord and the Four-Florescence Immortals eating Cavernous Void melons, which ripen once every four eons.

Anqi Sheng said to the Supreme Perfected Lady: "Once, I wandered with you along the western shores of Restful Peace, tasting jujubes of extraordinary sweetness. The jujubes here can never compare. Yet though I recall this but recently, three thousand years have already passed." The Divine Woman replied, "I once shared a single fruit with you, and we could not finish it. How could these small jujubes compare?"

*From the* Scripture of Immortal Fruits and Daoist Traces.

The Lady of Right Florescence states: "Fire jujubes and intersecting pears—these are the medicines of soaring flight, not to be compared with golden elixirs."

*From the* Scripture of True Traces.

*Section on Mountain Caverns and Species.*

The Five Marchmounts and all renowned mountains possess cavern chambers. The cavern of Mount Wangwu spans ten thousand *li* in circumference. The cavern of Mount Weiyu spans ten thousand *li* in circumference. The cavern of Jade Mountain in Xicheng spans three thousand *li* in circumference. The cavern of Mount Qingcheng spans two thousand *li* in circumference. The cavern of the Three Mountains of Western Mystery spans one thousand *li* in circumference. The cavern of Mount Luofu spans five hundred *li* in circumference. The cavern of Red City and Cinnabar Mountain spans three hundred *li* in circumference. The cavern of Mount Linwu spans four hundred *li* in circumference. The cavern of Mount Juqu spans one hundred *li* in circumference. The cavern of Mount Kuocang spans three hundred *li* in circumference.

*From the* Scripture of Daoist Traces, *Section on Cavern Heavens.*

The Lesser Cavern of Pure Emptiness,
The Greater Cavern of Vast Clarity,
The Supreme Mystery of Total Perfection,
The Three Mysteries of Ultimate Perfection,
The Nine Chambers of Treasure Immortals,
The Upper Jade Clarity of Peace,
The Vermilion Brilliance of Radiant Perfection,
The Golden Altar of Flourishing Yang,
The Left Spirit of Hidden Emptiness,
The Hidden Mystery of Accomplished Virtue.

*From the* Scripture of Daoist Traces.

*Within the great heavens lie the cavern-heavens beneath the earth.*

*Section on Divine Waters.*

Within the Jade Clarity Heaven flows the Sea of Ten Thousand Fordings, its waves surging and linking the marchmounts. In the Primordial Heaven flows the River of Celebrated Origin, known as the Ford of the Host of Humankind. There is also the Pool of Flowing Swiftness, wherein stands a jade tree, encircled by lotus blossoms ten *zhang* in span. The pool stretches a thousand *li* in breadth, its waters fragrant and sweet. The Golden Florescence Immortals ever dwell amid the lotus blossoms, drinking from the Pool of Flowing Swiftness. On the Dark Continent lie the Three Weak Currents, which none but immortals may cross. In the Court of the Supreme Origin stands Jade Tablet Mountain, upon which lies the Pool of Limpid Depths, a thousand *li* in circumference. There is also the Imperial River Pool, north of the Dark Continent, where the Jade Numinous Immortal Mother and the Golden Florescence Immortal Maidens often wander and roam.

*From the* Scripture of the Great Cavern of Perfected Truth.

The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, in the world of Great Blessing and Abandoned Worthiness, the land of Uttarakuru, where the earth is congealed water essence and the ground is paved with lapis lazuli. The kingdom possesses a central pool spanning five hundred *li* in length and breadth, wherein grows jade fungus. The men and women of the land drink and eat of the pool’s waters, their faces like jade cream, free from illness and sorrow. Their lifespan reaches thirty thousand years, with no untimely deaths. After their lives end, their bones do not turn to ash, and even after ten thousand years, no foul odor of decay arises.

*From the* Wondrous Book of the Cavern Mystery.
*End of Scroll Four of the* Supreme Secret Essentials.

**Scroll Five of the Supreme Secret Essentials: Human Categories**

The Nine Heavens Venerable One addressed the Jade Lads of the Three Heavens, saying: When heaven and earth intermingle their revolutions, the two images unite in perfection, and yin and yang descend their *qi*, ascending in resonance with the Nine Heavens. Flowing cinnabar undergoes nine transformations, congealing *qi* into essence; essence transforms into spirit, and spirit transmutes into human form. Thus, humans mirror heaven and earth, their *qi* following the patterns of nature. The *qi* of nature is entirely the essence of the Nine Heavens, which coalesces into the human body, nurturing and fostering it. After nine months, the *qi* reaches fullness, the *qi* of the Nine Heavens pervades all, and in the tenth month, birth occurs. The formation of the embryo and its transformations may be auspicious or inauspicious, long-lived or short-lived, all depending on the predispositions of one’s former existence. If the congealed *qi* is impure, the viscera accumulate stagnation, the six palaces suffer damage, form and spirit lack stability, the body cannot receive numinous power, and dead *qi* enters the orifices—how then can life endure?

Yang *qi* is vermilion and called Mysterious Cinnabar; yin *qi* is yellow and called Yellow Essence. When yin and yang unite, the two *qi* descend as essence, transforming into spirit and forming the embryo, ascending in resonance with the Nine Heavens. The *qi* of the Nine Heavens then descends to fill the Cinnabar Field, merging with essence to congeal and gather at the Gate of Life. It must undergo nine cycles—this is the Cinnabar Field, where the upper transforms and the lower congeals, giving rise to the human form. In the first month, *qi* is received; in the second, numinous power is received; in the third, transformation occurs; in the fourth, essence congeals; in the fifth, the head and body take shape; in the sixth, the form is completed; in the seventh, the spirit’s positions are arrayed; in the eighth, the nine orifices become clear; in the ninth, the *qi* of the Nine Heavens pervades all, and sound emerges; in the tenth, the Director of Destinies inscribes the register, and life is received at birth. Thus, all humans are endowed with the *qi* of the Nine Heavens. The essence of yang descending into yin is called the Nine Cinnabars, which together form the human body.

In general, when humans receive life and congeal *qi*, the Nine Cinnabars ascend to transform within the womb, following the *qi* of the Nine Heavens. When the *qi* is full and the spirit complete within the fetal sac, one naturally recognizes one’s former existence, knows one’s original root, and understands the causes of karmic rebirth. The *qi* of the Nine Heavens forms the body, and upon beholding the yang path, the Three Luminaries become manifest—yet one forgets the causes of one’s birth and origin. This occurs because the fetal root is obstructed, the Three Passes are blocked, the Five Palaces are disordered, and dead *qi* clogs the gates, preventing the numinous pass from opening and causing one to forget one’s karmic causes. If the numinous and true *qi* of the Nine Heavens refine the jade embryo, briefly passing through the Purple Portal and treading the human path, one emerges naturally radiant, beholding the numinous and ascending one’s body to the Nine Heavens—no longer forming through the congealing of essence and reception of *qi* to become human.

All humans are born endowed with the *qi* of the Nine Heavens; *qi* congeals into essence, essence transforms into cinnabar, and cinnabar transmutes into human form. The embryo contains brilliance, following the patterns of nature. For example, those born in the seventh month receive the *qi* of the Parīttābha Heaven; those born in the eleventh month receive the *qi* of the Brahmakāyika Heaven; those born in the twelfth month receive the *qi* of the Brahmapurohita Heaven; those born in the first month receive the *qi* of the Nirmāṇarati Heaven; those born in the second month receive the *qi* of the Tuṣita Heaven; those born in the third month receive the *qi* of the Yāma Heaven; those born in the fourth month receive the *qi* of the Suyāma Heaven; those born in the fifth month receive the *qi* of the Akaniṣṭha Heaven; and those born in the sixth month receive the *qi* of the Uttarakuru Heaven. From the tenth month of conception to the sixth month, humans receive the *qi* of the Nine Heavens, and by the seventh month, completing the tenth month, the *qi* of heaven and earth is full, receiving the revolutions of the Great Yang to be born.

*From the* Scripture of the Nine Cinnabars’ Upper Transformation of Embryonic Essence *in the Cavern of Perfection.*

The Most High said: When humans receive life, they congeal essence and accumulate *qi*, receiving the embryo and gathering blood. Yellow and white, dark and obscure, congeal; cinnabar and purple merge with mist. Thus, bones congeal, saliva is produced, fluids disperse and flow, four transformations converge, and the Nine Palaces unite as one. The Five Spirits command the form and body, and the Great Unity determines the talismanic register. In an instant, one stands; in a flash, one is complete; in a trance, one is fully formed; and in a sudden release, one is born. Thereupon, the Nine Spirits enter and settle in their palaces, the Five Viscera mysteriously arise, and the Five Spirits preside over them. Parents only know the beginning of their child’s birth but do not realize that the Celestial Lords and Five Spirits come to dwell within.

The human body possesses honored spirits whose abodes are not fixed, moving in and out of the Six Voids. The Three Fields above and below alternate between yin and yang, shedding the old and absorbing the new, circulating and transporting primordial fluids. The Great Spirit arises in emptiness, internally congealing to form the body, washing and refining the substance, transforming the radiance into brilliance.

*From the* Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected *in the Cavern of Perfection.*

Humans receive life from the celestial soul, take form from primordial numen, and revolve through the *qi* of the Nine Heavens. They extend their destiny from the Great Unity, opening the Three Paths, accumulating spirit in the Dark Palace. Thus, the mysterious fluid coils sevenfold, flowing essences spread moisture, the sun and moon illuminate the Six Voids, and the mouth and ears operate the spirit’s vessels. Clouds move and rain descends, their virtue emulating heaven and earth. Within the womb, the Five Causes come to completion, and the Dao of establishing humans is thus. The Five Causes are the Five Spirits; the Three Paths are the Three Perfected. The Five Spirits are the soul of heaven; the Three Perfected are the Dao of heaven; the Nine *Qi* are the embryo of heaven; the Great Unity is the source of heaven; the sun and moon are the eyes of heaven; the mysterious fluid is the abyss of heaven; the Six Voids are the light of heaven; the Dark Palace is the treasury of heaven; the spirit’s vessels are the transformations of heaven; and the primordial numen is the metamorphosis of the Celestial Lord.

All this refers to the Nine Heavens as the transformations of the Celestial Lord, who transforms and divides into nine—this is called the Nine Palaces. The Nine Palaces transform and merge into one. For those who wish to cultivate themselves and seek life, they must follow the origin of their birth. The origin of birth refers to the Primordial Father and Mysterious Mother. The Primordial Father governs *qi*, regulating and ordering the Celestial Prior; the Mysterious Mother governs essence, transforming and forming the embryo. Essence and *qi* complete each other, and yin and yang generate one another. Clouds move, and the omen is fulfilled; the Dao unites with the Nameless. The numbers arise from the Three and Five, and the omen begins to take form. When seven and nine are complete, the omen’s body is formed. Harmonizing the Three and Five, seven and nine penetrate the obscure, emulating the Celestial Prior. One must rely on the Celestial Lord’s cultivation, the Heavenly Sovereign’s merit, which transforms ninefold into numen. When merit is accomplished, the human body is complete, and body and spirit unite. When the spirit departs, one dies; when the spirit is preserved, one lives.

Thus, the Three Origins are the beginning of the Dao, the Celestial Lord is the root of the Dao, the Great One is the transformation of the Dao, the Nine Heavens are the spirit of the Dao, the Nine Palaces are the dwelling of the Dao, and the Mysterious Fluid is the essence of the Dao. By nurturing the Three Fields, one attains immortality; at dawn, one roams the Six Directions, and at dusk, one guards the Mud Pill. Firmly holding the embryonic essence, the heart remains ever joyful. Those who study the Dao must take this as their foundation. Only those who encounter this scripture may begin to comprehend it—where the nine *qi* refine and infuse, and the Great One moves the spirit.

—Excerpt from *The Hidden Book of the Great Cinnabar of the Cavernous Realms*

The Heavenly Worthy says: *Qi* flows continuously, giving rise to manifold conditions of existence. Whether fortune or misfortune, good or evil, each has its root in fate. It is neither heaven, nor earth, nor man—it arises solely from the heart. The heart is the spirit. The body is not truly ours; what enables us to live comes from the void and the natural, temporarily lodged in the womb, transformed and born. The parents who bore us in the womb are not our original parents; our true parents lie elsewhere. They are most noble and revered, supreme and unmatched. The parents who gave us birth in this life are but temporary vessels of karmic conditions, bestowing the grace of nurture and sustenance. Thus, we repay them with ritual and call them parents. Therefore, the form we receive is not truly our own—it is but a borrowed dwelling, a temporary abode, a lodging for the self. The body is attached to us as form, manifesting existence and nonexistence. Thus, those who attain the Dao no longer possess form. If I have no body, what suffering can I know? The suffering I endure arises only because I have a body. With a body, a hundred evils arise; without a body, one enters the natural. When conduct aligns with the Dao, body and spirit become one. When body and spirit unite as one, it becomes the true body, returning to the original parents and attaining the Dao.

—Excerpt from *The Inner Sounds of the Cavernous Heavens and Myriad Celestial Scriptures*

When a person is conceived within the womb, the Three Origins nurture and sustain, and the nine *qi* coalesce into form. Thus, on the ninth day, the spirits disperse, and when *qi* fills the body, it can utter sound. Once sound and spirit are complete, the Nine Heavens rejoice. The Great One holds the talisman, the Celestial Lord bestows rank and destiny, the Registrar records the ledger, the Director of Destinies fixes the lifespan, the Five Emperors oversee birth, the Holy Mother guards the chamber, and the deities of heaven and earth, along with the Three Realms, stand guard in full array. The Marshal of the Nine Heavens faces east in the courtyard, reciting *The Nine Heavens’ Chapter on the Birth of Spirits* nine times. If the child is male, the myriad spirits chant in reverence; if female, they chant in devotion. If male, the Director of Destinies assents with respect; if female, she complies with deference. Only when the Marshal of the Nine Heavens issues the command and the myriad spirits chant their assent does birth occur. For one to be reborn into the human realm, emerging in the radiance of the Great Yang, startling heaven and earth, is a rarity beyond measure. The celestial perfected and earthly spirits, along with the Three Realms, all attend—such is no trifling matter. At the moment of birth, one is not to be deemed lowly. Therefore, those who cherish their form, preserve their spirit, honor their *qi*, and secure their root shall never perish but attain immortality, their bones and flesh ascending together to the Three Clarities. This is the virtue of *qi* uniting with the Three *Qi*, the Nine *Qi* merging as one. Yet, though born, people fail to revere their *qi*, honor their form, treasure their life, or cherish their spirit, bringing about their own ruin and severance from their original truth.

—Excerpt from *The Cavernous Scripture of the Nine Heavens’ Chapter on the Birth of Spirits*

The Dao says: Among all things, humans are the most noble. If one can keep the body free of trouble and the spirit formless, cultivating tranquility to attain the intent of non-action, one unites with the Dao.

—Excerpt from *The Scripture of Wondrous Perfection*

Laozi says: The spirit gives birth to form, and form completes the spirit. Without spirit, form cannot generate itself; without form, spirit cannot fulfill itself. Thus, form and spirit unite, mutually generating and completing one another.

—Excerpt from *The Scripture of the Western Ascent*

Humans are the most numinous of living beings, yet they fail to know themselves and do not guard their spirit, thereby inviting manifold evils. Those who understand this need not seek protection from celestial spirits—sufficiency lies within the self. Thus it is said: The body of one person mirrors a kingdom. The chest and abdomen are like the palace halls, the four limbs like the outskirts, the divisions of the joints like the hundred officials, the spirit like the ruler, the blood like the ministers, and *qi* like the people. Therefore, he who knows how to govern the body knows how to govern a kingdom. Cherishing the people brings peace to the kingdom; treasuring *qi* preserves the body. When the people scatter, the kingdom falls; when *qi* is exhausted, the body dies. The fallen cannot be revived. Thus, the perfected person dissolves incipient suffering and cures unformed illness, fortifying before trouble arises rather than pursuing what has already passed. The people are difficult to nurture yet easy to corrupt, so one must carefully weigh authority and virtue to maintain order, curtailing desires to strengthen blood and *qi*. Only then does the True One abide.

—Excerpt from *The Scripture of the August One*

The Heavenly Elder says: Humans are born of yin and yang, grow through primordial *qi*, yet not all fully embody the nature of the Five Constants. Only one in ten attains it. Those who resonate with fire gain clarity; with metal, strength; with water, purity; with wood, sovereignty; with earth, benevolence. Those who fail to resonate perish. Thus, heaven and earth possess the Five Phases, which in turn generate twenty-five phases. If one resonates with one of these, one may live a hundred years; with two, a hundred and twenty; with three, a hundred and thirty; with four, one may cultivate arts and live a hundred and forty years; with five, one may practice minor Daoist arts and live two hundred years; with six, one may practice the Great Dao and live without limit; with seven, one may comprehend the minds of spirits and ghosts; with eight, one may penetrate the divine will.

Those who resonate with nine attain communion with the divine spirits; with ten, they gain wisdom and clarity; with eleven, they remain free from affliction throughout life; with twelve, they align with the celestial will; with thirteen, the Five Marchmounts come to pay homage; with fourteen, they gain the protection of the Twenty-Eight Constellations; with fifteen, they summon the Jade Maidens; with sixteen, they become sages; with seventeen, they summon the Queen Mother of the West; with eighteen, they summon the Lord King of the East; with nineteen, they summon the Great One; with twenty, they summon the Northern Lord; with twenty-one, they summon the immortals; with twenty-two, their body becomes one with heaven and earth; with twenty-three, divine maidens come to be their companions; with twenty-four, they commune with the Heavenly Emperor; with twenty-five, they befriend the Supreme Sovereign.

The above is from *The Scripture of Divine Supervision from the Cavernous Divine Canon*, "Chapter on the Body’s Spirits."

The spirit of the brain is named Awakened Origin, styled Dao Capital.
The spirit of the hair is named Mystic Script Florescence, styled Dao Practice.
The spirit of the skin is named Permeating Multitudes, styled Dao Union.

The spirit of the nape is named Numinous Plan Cover, styled Dao Cycle.
The spirit of the spine is named Canopy Calendar Support, styled Dao Pillar.
The spirit of the nose is named Surging Dragon Jade, styled Dao Subtlety.
The spirit of the [missing character] is named Founding Beam Peak, styled Dao Fork.

The above are the Eight Spirit Lords of the Upper Section.

The spirit of the throat is named Hundred Streams Release, styled Dao Passage.
The spirit of the lungs is named Pure Numinous Birth, styled Dao Level.
The spirit of the heart is named Radiant Yang Flourishing, styled Dao Illumination.
The spirit of the liver is named Opening Lord Chapter, styled Dao Azure.
The spirit of the gallbladder is named Dragon Virtue Constraint, styled Dao Release.
The spirit of the left kidney is named Spring Origin Upright, styled Dao Minister.
The spirit of the right kidney is named Elephant Other Origin, styled Dao Master.
The spirit of the spleen is named Treasure Origin Complete, styled Dao Ascendant.

The above are the Eight Spirit Lords of the Middle Section.

The spirit of the stomach is named Together Unborn Nurture, styled Dao Expansion.
The spirit of the intestines is named Portentous Knee Health, styled Dao Return.
The spirits of the large and small intestines are named Meeting Delivery Stay, styled Dao Kitchen.
The spirit of the diaphragm is named Receiving Humiliation, styled Dao Void.
The spirit of the chest is named Vast Crystal Dwelling, styled Dao Spirit.
The spirits of the two flanks are named Warding False Steed, styled Dao Completion.
The spirit of the left yin and left yang is named Supporting Flow Rise, styled Dao Jade Tablet.
The spirit of the right yin and right yang is named Color Manifest Clarity, styled Dao Life.

The above are the Eight Spirit Lords of the Lower Section.

The above is from *The Scripture of Purple Origin and the Twenty-Four Spirits of Cavernous Perfection’s Formative Canon.*

On the day of one’s original destiny in the first month, as well as on *jiǎzǐ* and *jiǎxū* days at dawn, the Celestial Lord and the Great One, together with the Five Spirits, merge and transform into one great spirit within the human heart, named the Heavenly Essence Lord.

On the day of one’s original destiny in the third month, as well as on *jiǎshēn* days at the hour of *chén*, the Celestial Lord and the Great One convene with the Five Spirits, merging and transforming within into one great spirit. Its form scatters and its *qi* disperses, filling all the bones, named the Firm Jade Lord.

On the day of one’s original destiny in the fourth month, as well as on *jiǎwǔ* and *dīngmǎo* days at the hour of *sì*, the Celestial Lord and the Great One, together with the Five Spirits, merge and generate a great spirit. This great spirit suddenly divides its form, becoming a yellow *qi* that flows abundantly into all the essence and blood, named the Origin Life Lord.

On the day of one’s original destiny in the sixth month, as well as on *jiǎchén* and *wùyín* days at noon, the Celestial Lord and the Great One, together with the Five Spirits, transform into one great spirit that enters the human liver, named the Azure Clarity Lord.

On the third day of the seventh month, as well as on the day of one’s original destiny and *gēngwǔ* days at the hour of *sì*, the Celestial Lord and the Great One, together with the Five Spirits, merge and transform into one great spirit within the spleen, named the Nurturing Radiance Lord.

On the fifteenth day of the eighth month, as well as on the day of one’s original destiny and *gēngshēn* days at the hour of *shēn*, the Celestial Lord and the Great One, together with the Five Spirits, merge and transform into one great spirit within the human lungs, named the Supreme Origin Pure Jade Lord.

On the nineteenth day of the ninth month, as well as on the day of one’s original destiny and *wùxū* days at the hour of *yǒu*, the Celestial Lord and the Great One, together with the Five Spirits, merge and transform into one great spirit. This great spirit suddenly divides its form into two spirits, which disperse and reside within the two kidneys, named the Mysterious Yang Lord.

On the twentieth day of the tenth month, as well as on the day of one’s original destiny and *xīnsì* days at noon, the Celestial Lord and the Great One, together with the Five Spirits, merge and transform into one great spirit within the human gallbladder, named the Converging Scenery Lord.

On the twenty-eighth day of the eleventh month, as well as on the day of one’s original destiny and *bǐngzǐ* days at the hour of *sì*, the Celestial Lord and the Great One, together with the Five Spirits, merge and transform into one great spirit within the Purple Chamber of the Muddy Pellet, named the Flourishing Supreme Sovereign Lord.

The above is from *The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected from the Cavernous Perfection Canon.*

Three *cun* directly upward between the eyebrows lies the Palace of the Guarding Inch and Double Fields; one *cun* further inward lies the Palace of the Hall of Light; two *cun* further inward lies the Palace of the Cavernous Chamber; three *cun* further inward lies the Palace of the Cinnabar Field; four *cun* further inward lies the Palace of the Flowing Pearl; five *cun* further inward lies the Palace of the Jade Emperor. One *cun* above the Hall of Light lies the Palace of the Celestial Court; one *cun* above the Cavernous Chamber lies the Palace of the Ultimate Perfection; one *cun* above the Cinnabar Field lies the Palace of the Mysterious Cinnabar; one *cun* above the Flowing Pearl lies the Palace of the Supreme Sovereign.

Within the head are the Nine Palaces:
The Palace of the Jade Emperor, where the Divine Mother of Jade Clarity resides;
The Palace of the Celestial Court, where the Perfected Maiden of Supreme Clarity resides;
The Palace of the Ultimate Perfection, where the Empress of the Great Ultimate resides;
The Palace of the Supreme Sovereign, where the Queen of the Supreme Lord resides;
The Palace of the Hall of Light, where the Illuminating Perfected Lord, the Illuminating Youth Lord, and the Illuminating Perfected Maiden Lord—three lords—reside together;
The Palace of the Cavernous Chamber, where the Left Non-Male Child, the Right White Origin Lord, and the Central Yellow Elder Soul—three persons—reside;
The Palace of the Cinnabar Field, where the Supreme Perfected One of the Upper Origin and the Homeland of the Celestial Lord—two persons—reside.

The Palace of Mysterious Cinnabar, where the Perfected Lord of the Great One of the Mud-Pill resides;
The Palace of Flowing Pearls, where the Flowing Pearl Perfected Spirit, the Lord Controller of Destiny, conducts his affairs.

—Excerpted from *The Wondrous Scripture of the Supreme Simplicity and Numinous Vastness* of the Cavernous Perfection

The Red Child resides in the Upper Cinnabar Field Palace;
The Perfected Person resides in the Middle Cinnabar Field Palace;
The Infant resides in the Lower Cinnabar Field Palace.

—Excerpted from *The Jade Formula Scripture of the Four Palaces and the Feminine One* of the Cavernous Perfection

Within the human body, there are also three palaces and six viscera, one hundred twenty joints, and thirty-six thousand spirits. When a person commits evil, the body spirits report it to the three palaces; when a person performs good deeds, they celebrate their immortal name. Life and death, sin and fortune—none fail to first arise from the body spirits’ influence, resonating naturally in accord.

Humans are endowed with qi at birth, and qi coalesces into spirit. If one can nurture qi, the spirit will endure long; inwardly contemplating and guarding the true, the true will never leave the body.

—Excerpted from *The Scripture of the Three Primes’ Admonitions* of the Cavernous Perfection

The spirit of the hair is named Xunzhi.
The spirits of the two eyes are named Yingming.
The spirit above the nape is named Eastern King Father.
The spirit of the forehead’s gate is named Lord of the Mud-Pill.
The spirit between the brows is named Primal Radiance.
The spirits of the two ears are named Delicate Maiden.
The spirit of the philtrum is named Great One.
The spirits of the nostrils are named Penetrating Hut.
The spirit of the mouth is named Cinnabar Pearl.
The spirits of the two hands are named Yin of the Hun.
The spirit of the Upper Prime is named Majestic Completion.
The spirit of the Middle Prime is named Yellow Child.
The spirit of the Lower Prime is named Life-Radiance Child.
The spirit of the shoulders and back is named Vermilion Bird.
The spirits of the two flanks are named Concealed.
The spirit of the yin is named Exhausted Scribe.
The spirit of women is named Cinnabar Completion.
The spirits of the two knees are named Pivot Duke.
The spirits of the two meridians are named Following Master Kong.
The spirits of the two feet are named Upholding Heaven’s Pillar.

These nineteen spirits take the mortal’s surname as their given name, where the name is the appellation, and the appellation is the name.

The Liver is the Venerable Master Lord.
The Lungs are the Lord of Supreme Harmony.
The Heart is the Grand Commandant Duke.
The Spleen is the Cinnabar Mother Child.
The Kidneys are the Minister of Instruction, Minister of Works, Controller of Destiny, Recorder, Minister of Justice, and Commandant of the Court.
The Gallbladder is the Supreme Dao Lord.
The Stomach is the Grand Master of Remonstrance.
The Navel is the Great One.
The Large and Small Intestines are the Envoys of the Primal Beam.
The Mysterious Valley is the Great General.
The Triple Burner: on the left, the Sheaf; on the right, the Grain; with the Wind Earl, Rain Master, Thunder Duke, and Thunderbolt.

These ten govern eighteen thousand spirits. If one preserves them, the eighteen thousand spirits will not scatter. When they do not scatter, Heaven bestows eighteen thousand spirits to attach to the body, combining with the thirty-six thousand to wholly animate the form. When earth ascends to the three heavens, one becomes an immortal, with boundless transformations.

Humans emulate Earth, and Heaven shapes their form; when the spirit abides, the form is preserved, but when the spirit departs, the form decays. Ordinary people, unaware of preserving the spirit, act and rest at will, their intentions foolish and deeds perverse—thus the spirit scatters and the form withers. The immortal perfected and sages guard the spirit without fail, constantly preserving their freedom, their names inscribed on the left tally.

Those who aspire to learning should know that within the human body dwell thirty-six thousand spirits: three hun on the left, seven po on the right, yin and yang conjoined to jointly assist the spirit of consciousness; the lords of the five phases in their waxing and waning; one thousand two hundred forms and shadows within the body, guarded by one thousand two hundred luminous essences without—preserve them daily, continue them hourly, and never forget them in every thought, and you shall attain long life without death. If unable to preserve them constantly, do not neglect them during the eight solar terms; by invoking the body spirits, you shall enjoy health and strength, free from illness. If illness strikes, call upon them thrice to dispel envy. Always protect the child-body.

When preparing to sleep, press the left hand upon the heart and the right hand upon the navel, each for fourteen repetitions. Silently recite the incantation:

*"The body’s spirits assemble, rising from the head,
Traversing the four limbs down to the ankles."*

Upon completing the incantation, visualize them fully, then surrender to sleep. Auspicious dreams will surely come, and you may faintly perceive the spirits. If transgressions have invited calamity, the spirits will speak to you, manifest in forms, or attach to objects, prompting reflection. Through this, you shall discern the meaning—whether fortune or misfortune—with clarity, thus avoiding disaster and aligning with blessings. All endeavors shall prosper.

The Three Hun:
1. *Tai Guang* (Fetal Light)
2. *Shuang Ling* (Luminous Spirit)
3. *You Jing* (Hidden Essence)

The Seven Po:
1. *Shi Gou* (Corpse Dog)
2. *Fu Shi* (Concealed Arrow)
3. *Que Yin* (Sparrow Yin)
4. *Tun Zei* (Swallowing Thief)
5. *Fei Du* (Flying Poison)
6. *Chu Hui* (Expelling Filth)
7. *Jian Fei* (Perceiving Lungs)

*—Excerpted from the* Dong Shen Jing *(*Scripture of the Cavernous Divine*), "Chapter on Human Longevity"*

In the realm of *Yu Dan Wu Liang* Heaven, its inhabitants live for nine million years.
In *Shang Shang Chan Shan Wu Liang Shou* Heaven, its inhabitants live for three thousand six hundred years.
In *Shang Jian* Heaven, also called *Xu Yan* Heaven, its inhabitants live for one hundred fifty-two million years.
In *Dou Shu* Heaven, also called *Ji Ran* Heaven, its inhabitants live for six hundred eight million years.
In *Bu Jiao Le* Heaven, also called *Bo Ni Mi* Heaven, its inhabitants live for twenty-three billion four hundred million years.
In *Hua Ying Sheng* Heaven, also called *Ta Hua Zi Zai* Heaven, its inhabitants live for ninety-two billion one thousand six hundred million years.
In *Fan Bao* Heaven, also called *Bo Luo Ni Ye Ba* Heaven, its inhabitants live for seven kalpas.
In *Fan Mo Jia Yi* Heaven, also called *Fan Zhong* Heaven, its inhabitants live for two kalpas.
In *Bo Li Da He* Heaven, also called *Da Fan* Heaven, its inhabitants live for four kalpas.

*—Excerpted from the* Dong Zhen Tai Xiao Lang Shu Jing *(*Scripture of the Cavernous True and Great Radiant Jade Book*)*

To the far east lies the wilderness of *Ji Hao Lin*, where the land is called *He Luo Ti*. Its people stand two *zhang* tall and live for four hundred years.
To the far south lies the wilds of *Ji Dong Yang*, where the people stand two *zhang* and four *chi* tall and live for three hundred sixty years.
To the far west lies the vast expanse of *Hao Su*, where the people stand one *zhang* and six *chi* tall and live for six hundred years.
To the far north lies the courtyard of *Shuo Yin*, where the land is called *Xun Luo*. Its people stand one *zhang* and two *chi* tall and live for three hundred years.
Above, within the nine directions of *Shang Qing Yang Hui Kong*, where form and image dissolve, where shape and shadow vanish, the inscription of the void remains. The realm of primordial essence, pure and azure, is the natural land. Its people are the exalted Jade Emperor and the myriad sagely perfected ones, the root of all births—timeless and boundless, measuring years only by kalpas.
Directly below lies the great windy marsh, fifty-two billion *li* from the earth. This land is called *Da He Bao Zhen Wu Liang*. Its people stand nine *chi* tall and live for one thousand two hundred years.

*—Excerpted from the* Dong Zhen Wai Guo Fang Pin Jing *(*Scripture of the Cavernous True and External Lands’ Liberated Chapters*)*
