The Most High Dao Lord of *Da Fu Tang* Land said: In this realm, since the time visible to the eye, across seven million five hundred thousand kalpas, the people have shown no signs of aging or decline.
The Nine Qi Heavenly Lord of *Da Fu Li* Land said: Since entering this realm, across nine million nine hundred thousand kalpas, no one has sought immortality—all naturally escape death.
The Three Qi Heavenly Lord of *Chi Ming* Land said: Since dwelling here, across three million ten thousand kalpas, no sound of sorrow has been heard, only the sight of ageless people.
The White Emperor Heavenly Lord of *Xi Na Yu* Land said: Since entering this realm, across seven million kalpas, no voice of grief has been heard among its people.
The Five Qi Heavenly Lord of *Yu Dan Wu Liang* Land said: Since entering this realm, across five million kalpas, its men and women know only birth, unaware of their origins.

*—End of Scroll Five of the* Wu Shang Mi Yao *(*Supreme Secret Essentials*).*

**Chapter on Kalpas and Cycles**
*—Scroll Six of the* Wu Shang Mi Yao

The Heavenly Worthy spoke: After the Dragon-Han era, heaven and earth collapsed into ruin. Within that vast expanse, for a hundred million kalpas, primordial radiance endured—above, no colors reappeared; below, no abyss returned. Wind and marsh filled the void, dim and obscure, formless and shadowless, boundless and infinite, a chaos without end. This was called the *Yan Kang* era. Only when the Crimson Clarity dawned and light returned did heaven and earth resume their places.

After one kalpa’s cycle, heaven and earth shattered again, plunging once more into darkness. For five kalpas, all was dim and obscure, the Three Qi in chaos, borne by the turning of fate. Only when the *Kai Huang* era arrived did heaven and earth resume their places.

The Supreme Dao Lord abided in the Great Blessing Hall of the Land of Everlasting Joy for seven million five hundred thousand kalpas.
The Azure Emperor Heavenly Lord dwelled in the Eastern Pole’s *Bi Luo Kong Ge* of the Great Floating Li Land for nine million nine hundred thousand kalpas.
The Vermilion Emperor Heavenly Lord resided in the Southern Pole’s *Chan Li* World of the Crimson Clarity Land for thirty thousand kalpas.
The White Emperor Heavenly Lord remained in the Western Pole’s *Wei Luo Da Tang* World of the Land of Ultimate Bliss for seven million kalpas.
The Black Emperor Heavenly Lord stayed in the *Yuan Fu Qi Xian* World of the *Yu Dan* Land for five million kalpas.

*—Excerpted from the* Dong Xuan Ling Shu Jing *(*Scripture of the Numinous Writ of the Cavern Mystery*).*

The Heavenly Worthy of the Primordial Celestial Sovereign, the Celestial Venerable of the Supreme August, having received the sun and moon, drifted with the turning of fate, cycling through transformations. One radiance, one darkness; one destruction, one renewal; one death, one birth. The body undergoes ruin, one collapse, one completion. Traversing heaven and earth, the light alters, dim and distant, beyond comprehension. Since the Dragon-Han era, ninety-nine million nine hundred and ninety thousand great kalpas have passed.

*—Excerpted from the* Dong Xuan Zhu Tian Nei Yin Jing *(*Scripture of the Inner Sounds of the Cavern Mystery’s Myriad Heavens*).*

The Flying Heavenly Divine Persons of the Ten Directions addressed the Supreme Dao Lord: Since traversing the Three Realms and journeying through the thirty-two heavens, we have passed through great cycles, the revolutions of heaven and earth intertwining. Success and failure follow fate; life and death are not a single return. To this day, since the Crimson Clarity unfolded its pattern, nine thousand seven hundred billion kalpas have elapsed.

*—Excerpted from the* Dong Xuan Kong Dong Ling Zhang Jing *(*Scripture of the Numinous Chapters of the Cavern Mystery’s Empty Cavern*).*

The Dao said: The Celestial Pass lies at the northwest corner of heaven, aligned with the Dipper. The seven stars of the Northern Dipper are the handle of the Celestial Pass, the canopy of jade brilliance, the breath of the nine heavens and twelve celestial stems. When the Dipper’s handle turns the Pass, the nine heavens revolve together.

Heaven has four seasonal gates; the nine heavens comprise thirty-six seasons. In one day and night, the Dipper’s handle turns the Pass, passing through one seasonal gate. In thirty-six days, it completes the thirty-six seasons, and the thirty-six seasons’ completion marks one revolution of the nine heavens. One revolution of the nine heavens—three hundred and sixty cycles—constitutes one full cycle.

When the nine heavens complete one cycle, the qi of the six heavens all return to the uppermost three heavens. The three heavens alter their fate, hastening the meeting to expedite their passage. Three thousand six hundred cycles form the transition of a minor kalpa. When a minor kalpa transitions, the Nine Qi realign, the myriad emperors shift positions, the people perish, ghosts vanish, and the virtuous endure in purity. The six directions unite in peace.

Ninety-nine hundred cycles mark the end of a great kalpa. When a great kalpa ends, the count of the nine heavens is exhausted, and the fate of the six heavens is spent. As the six heavens near their end, qi surges between the Three and Five, and malevolent forces act with ferocity, seizing the moment to unleash their poisonous might upon the people. This arises from the exhaustion of fate and the extremity of numbers, riding the momentum to this outcome.

The Earth Mechanism lies in the southeast quadrant, beneath the Nine Springs at the mouth of the Nine Rivers, where the *weng* sound issues forth. The Numinous Mechanism connects upward to the celestial source’s flowing influx, and laterally swallows the profound depths of the nine caverns. The twelve temporal branches propel the four convergences of water eastward. In one day and night, qi accumulates, converging at the mechanism of the Nine Rivers. In thirty-three days, the mechanism turns—northwest receding, northeast expanding, southwest *weng*-ing. Expansion causes overflow; *weng*-ing causes depletion. Circulating through the four convergences, the celestial source flows downward, and the Nine Springs surge with waves—this is one cycle.

Three hundred and thirty cycles form one degree. One degree compels the Water Mother to hasten her meeting with the Dragon King, and the River Lord receives his reckoning from the Three Heavens. Three thousand three hundred degrees are called *Yin Pi*. When *Yin Pi* occurs, yin erodes, water surges, rivers burst, mountains sink, and the earth is submerged. Nine thousand three hundred degrees mark the end of a great kalpa, the extremity of yin’s fate. At this time, the Nine Springs surge with vast waves, the Water Mother stirs into motion, mountains and seas merge into darkness, and the six directions lie flat and open. This is the fullness of yin’s fate, the surging of earth’s qi.

Heaven is round with twelve guiding principles; earth is square with twelve temporal markers. The celestial principles turn the Pass through three hundred and sixty cycles for one revolution; the earth’s markers propel the mechanism through three hundred and thirty turns for one degree. Three thousand six hundred celestial revolutions form *Yang Bo*; three thousand three hundred earthly degrees form *Yin Shi*. Heaven’s qi reaches its extreme in the Great Yin; earth’s qi is exhausted in the Great Yang. Yang surges when stimulated; yin erodes when obstructed. When yin and yang surge and erode, the qi of heaven and earth reverse. The reversal of heaven and earth’s qi is called the transition of a minor kalpa.

When a minor kalpa transitions, the myriad emperors shift positions, the Nine Qi alter their courses, the sun and moon contract their revolutions, and the land surges into the Nine Springs. The Water Mother bursts through the Five Rivers, the Great Crow gathers at the Dragon Gate, and the Five Emperors convene in the Dark Capital. At this time, the wicked and defiled are extinguished, and the virtuous people endure.

Nine thousand nine hundred celestial revolutions form *Yang Shi*; nine thousand three hundred earthly degrees form *Yin Bo*. When *Yang Shi* occurs, qi is exhausted in the Great Yang; when *Yin Bo* occurs, qi schemes in the Great Yin. Thus, when yang is obstructed, it erodes; when yin is stimulated, it surges. When yin and yang erode and surge, heaven and earth transform—this is called the transition of a great kalpa.

When a great kalpa transitions, heaven overturns and earth upends, seas surge and rivers burst, people sink into mountains, gold and jade dissolve, and the six directions merge into darkness.

*—Excerpted from the* Dong Zhen San Tian Zheng Fa Jing *(*Scripture of the Orthodox Dharma of the Three Cavern Realms’ Three Heavens*).*

As the great kalpa of heaven and earth nears its transition, the perfected divine beings of the myriad heavens descend to roam the Five Marchmounts, gazing from afar upon the most learned people of the world. Amid the vast floodwaters filling the sky, they are all welcomed by the Five Dragons and ascended to the Blessed Lands, allowed to perish and be reborn together with the Primordial Beginning.

From the *Dong Xuan Yu Jue Jing* (*Scripture of the Jade Key of the Cavern of Mystery*):

The Most High Numinous Treasure governs the Seven Jeweled Mystic Terrace of the Jade Capital Mountain in the Mystic Metropolis. The perfected divine beings of the ten directions, the transcendent sages of wondrous conduct, and the flying immortals—all hover in the void, burning incense and scattering flowers. They circumambulate thrice daily, bearing the Ten Absolute Floral Banners in hand and reciting the Cavern Chapters. As sun and moon revolve in alternation, the Seven Stars turn the Celestial Pass. After three hundred thirty days, the Celestial Pass completes one revolution around the mountain. After three hundred thirty revolutions, the Nine Qi converge. After three thousand three hundred revolutions, the qi of heaven and earth intermingle. When the qi of heaven and earth intermingle, it is called the transition of a minor kalpa. After nine thousand nine hundred revolutions, a great kalpa reaches its completion. At this time, heaven sinks and earth vanishes, the nine seas merge into darkness, gold and jade dissolve, and not even the tiniest remnant remains.

**Rank of Emperors**
The Yellow Emperor said: The Three Sovereigns are the revered deities of the Three Caverns, the ancestral qi of the Great Existence. The Lord of Heavenly Treasure is the primordial origin of the Great Cavern’s Supreme Mystery and Jade Darkness. The Lord of Numinous Treasure is the primordial beginning of the Cavern of Mystery’s Supreme Simplicity and Primal Chaos. The Lord of Divine Treasure is the wondrous qi of the Cavern of Divinity’s Luminous Void and Supreme Emptiness. Thus, the Three Origins congeal and transform, and are called the Three Caverns. The qi-cavern of lofty emptiness resides within the division of the Great Veil. Therefore, the Great Cavern abides above the Jade Purity, the Cavern of Mystery lies within the domain of the Upper Clarity, and the Cavern of Divinity is collectively named within the Supreme Ultimate. The qi of the Great Cavern is the Heavenly Sovereign; the qi of the Cavern of Mystery is the Earthly Sovereign; the qi of the Cavern of Divinity is the Human Sovereign. The Heavenly Sovereign governs qi, the Earthly Sovereign governs spirit, and the Human Sovereign governs life. When the three unite to form virtue, the myriad things transform. Thus, the Heavenly Sovereign arises at the beginning of the *jiazi* epoch and the establishment of the Primordial Origin, ruling over the Three Mysteries of the Supreme Origin and the Empty Heaven. The Earthly Sovereign arises at the beginning of the *jiashen* epoch and the Supreme Numinosity, ruling over the Three Origins of the Primordial Simplicity and the Jade Heaven. The Human Sovereign arises at the beginning of the *jiayin* epoch and the Primal Chaos of Emptiness, ruling over the Seven Subtleties of the Vast Profundity and the Jade Heaven of Emptiness. The spirit of the Heavenly Sovereign is born prior to heaven, and after transforming to govern the world, each reigns for eighteen thousand years before ascending. There are also eight emperors who succeed in governance—those before Nüwa and Fuxi. They receive the numinous scriptures and wondrous arts to assist the sagely and aid in governance. Every emperor who rules must respond by delivering the world and establishing teachings, and thus their Dao is practiced. During the reign of the Heavenly Sovereign, he arranges and renews all things, receives the imperial writ, and determines the transformations to come. He records all matters of inception and establishment. After thirty-six hundred years, the Heavenly Sovereign’s transformation ends, and the Earthly Sovereign receives the mandate to oversee governance. Later, he petitions the Supreme Ultimate and receives the Earthly Sovereign’s writ to determine the renewal of heaven and earth. He receives the records of the Great Existence to branch out the newly transformed beings and unify them in equilibrium. The Heavenly Sovereign receives the fourteen chapters of the Great Existence’s imperial writ, the *Mysterious and Wondrous Illustrated Scriptures*, and summons the deities of heaven and earth, the lofty ones of the Nine Heavens, to review and rectify the renewal of heaven and earth and the inception of the myriad things’ transformations. The Earthly Sovereign continues thereafter, again receiving the imperial writ and summoning the host of deities to review and rectify with the *Mysterious and Wondrous Illustrated Scriptures of the Great Existence’s Mystic Center*. He governs the newly transformed kinds and aspects of the present ghosts, spirits, heaven, and earth, establishing the administration of their categories and numbers. Moreover, when heaven and earth possess fortune, the earth transforms without dissolution, and beings, though pressed, do not perish. They abide within the seven hundred twenty gates, transforming without altering their forms, changing species while their hearts remain unmoved. Those who preserve their past lives are rightly established as the Heavenly and Earthly Sovereigns, each completing thirty-six hundred years before transforming into spirits.

The Human Sovereign arises to oversee and act, again receiving the secret writs of the Great Existence. He summons the deities of heaven and earth, the parents of the lofty ones of the Nine Heavens, to further rectify all that exists and all that does not. He again rightly establishes those within the seven hundred twenty gates of transformation and the myriad ranks of the world’s rectification.

The Three Sovereigns said: The Dao of heaven is vast and great, mingling the worthy and the foolish. The strong dwell in the west, the weak in the east. The Nine Heavens determine the horizontal, the Nine Earths unite the vertical. Below, rulers and ministers form, establishing states and nations. Those who follow heaven prosper; those who do not meet misfortune.

*—Excerpted from the* San Huang Jing *(*Scripture of the Three Sovereigns*).*

The Dao is the mystery of the myriad things, the treasure of the good, and the refuge of the ungood. Fair words can be traded in the marketplace; noble conduct can be bestowed upon others. If people are ungood, why should they be abandoned? Thus, the Son of Heaven is established and the Three Dukes appointed. Though one may offer a large jade disk before a team of four horses, it is not equal to sitting and advancing this Dao. Why did the ancients value this Dao? Did they not say that by seeking it, one may obtain it, and by it, one may be absolved of sins? Thus, it is most precious under heaven.

*—Excerpted from the* Laozi De Jing *(*Classic of the Virtue of the Dao*).*

**Rank of Continental States**

In the east, ninety thousand *li* beyond the Middle Kingdom, lies the land called Heluoti. Beyond its borders stands Fusang, amid the Azure Sea, a square realm spanning ten thousand *li*, where the Great Perfected King maintains a separate governance. Farther out lies Shengzhou, beyond Fusang, its western edge adjoining Penglai. This land spans two thousand five hundred *li*, lying twenty-three thousand *li* from shore. Upon it dwell tens of thousands of immortals; the land knows neither cold nor heat, its climate ever mild. It abounds in divine herbs of transcendence—those who consume them soar through the air in flight.

East of Fusang lies Zuzhou, amid the Eastern Sea, a realm of five hundred *li*, seven thousand *li* from shore. Upon it grows the herb of immortality.

In the south lies the land of Yishatuo, eighty-one thousand *li* from the Middle Kingdom, known as the Floating Li Kingdom. Beyond it stretches the vast Dongyang Wilds, also called the Land of the Fire Court. Outside its borders lies Changzhou, also named Qingqiu in the Southern Sea, a realm of five thousand *li*. Farther still lies Yanzhou, at the heart of the Southern Sea, spanning two thousand *li*.

In the west lies the land of Niveiluolüna, sixty thousand *li* beyond the Middle Kingdom, at the edge of the vast Haosu Mound and the frigid caverns of the wilds. Beyond its borders lies Liuzhou, in the southern reaches of the Western Sea, a realm of three thousand *li*, nineteen thousand *li* from the eastern shore. Fenglinzhou lies at the sea’s center, spanning one thousand five hundred *li*.

In the north lies the land of Xuntuoluo, fifty thousand *li* beyond the Middle Kingdom, at the farthest reaches of the dark northern pole and the court of the Celestial Enclosure. This land is called the Land of the Heavenly Mirror. Beyond it lies Xuanzhou, a realm of seven thousand two hundred *li*, surrounded by sea on all sides, thirty-six thousand *li* from shore. Upon it stands the Great Dark Capital, governed by the Immortal Earl and Perfected Lord. Farther still lies Yuanzhou, a land of three thousand *li*, ten thousand *li* from the southern shore.

Above lies the Land of Primordial Essence, the realm of natural purity in the Nine Heavens, where form and color dissolve, where shadow and shape vanish. The four directions enfold all heavens, yet only the Jade Void and Purple Palace remain, woven from the mist of empty caverns, within the void and purity of the profound.

*—Excerpted from the* Dongzhen Waiguo Fangpin Jing *(*Scripture of the Outer Realms from the Cavern of Perfection*).*

The Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning addressed the Dao Lords of the Five Directions: When this true scripture emerged in this land during the Dragon Han era, it was compiled alongside the Most High and Great Sage, the Jade Emperor, into the Ten Divisions of Wondrous Scriptures, to deliver the Dharma and save humanity. Thus, this land was named the Great Hall of Blessings, the Abode of Eternal Joy. Its earth is fused with molten gold, and its pathways on all four sides are adorned with azure jade and luminous lapis, their radiance shining through. Therefore, the men and women of this land enjoy long life, untouched by early death, spared from all suffering and the eight adversities.

In the easternmost reaches lies the Great Floating Li Kingdom of the Azure Vault, where the earth is entirely of azure jade, and the pathways on all four sides are adorned with gold and silver treasures, resplendent and luminous. The men and women of this land know no aging, no sorrow, no suffering, no affliction—only joy prevails.

In the southernmost reaches lies the Crimson Bright Land of the Chanli World, where the earth resembles cinnabar fat, perpetually suffused with crimson qi, like a veil of deep red clouds. The pathways on all four sides are of lapis, their brilliance blazing, illuminating the entire land. Here, no sound of sorrow is heard—only the sight of ageless people.

In the westernmost reaches lies the Great Hall of Weiluo in the Xina Jade Land, where the earth is paved with white jade and the steps wrought of gold. On all four sides, treasures gleam with radiant splendor, casting light throughout the land. Here, only the strains of refined music are heard, never the sounds of grief. The men and women of this land all bear countenances of golden hue.

In the northernmost reaches lies the Land of Utmost Blessing and Abandoned Wisdom in the Yudan Kingdom, where the earth is infused with congealed water essence and lapis, and the land holds a frigid pool spanning five hundred *li*. The men and women of this land drink from the pool’s ice, their faces like jade fat, free from illness, free from sorrow. They live for thirty thousand years, untouched by decay, and when their lives end, their bones do not turn to ash. This land knows no rites or music—only the truth of the straightforward heart. It is also called the Land of No Affliction.

*—Excerpted from the* Dongxuan Lingbao Jing *(*Scripture of the Numinous Treasure from the Cavern of Mystery*).*

Discourse on Intent

To dwell in greatness while embracing smallness, to reside in wealth while embracing poverty, to abide in the valley of flourishing humility, to wander the abyss of profound lowliness—subtlety is their foundation, sparseness their root. Fear and dread form their dwelling, anxiety and trepidation their gate. Fortune is the precursor of misfortune, profit the source of harm, order the root of chaos, existence the foundation of ruin.

The ruler of supreme virtue is unadorned and without embellishment, neither seeing nor hearing, yet embracing the mysterious. Without intent, as if yet unrooted, they hold fast to emptiness and follow nature. Chaos merges into oneness, returning to the original root. The highest intent is rectified in formlessness, governed in soundlessness, fostering fortune before it arises, severing misfortune before it is born—thus, none know its name.

The ruler of lesser virtue acts otherwise: exalted in lofty honor and wealth, displaying glory and prizing beauty, delighting in merit and fame. When misfortune arises, they grieve; when bandits and harm appear, they strike back; when their person is humiliated, they seek vengeance. Growth and nurture depend on their strength, distribution and bestowal on their blessings. Affairs are conducted by their methods, crookedness by their laws. Rewarding good and punishing evil breeds false virtue and deceitful loyalty—such is what they call merit and fame, yet it stands in opposition to the Dao.

*—Excerpted from the* Miaozhen Jing *(*Scripture of Wondrous Perfection*), "Discourse on Royal Governance"*

The regulator of life and death is Heaven; the follower of nature and destiny is man. Do not attack those who do not defy Heaven; do not kill those who do not defy man. Thus, when royal law ought to kill but does not, it indulges Heaven’s destroyers; when it ought to spare but does not, it slays Heaven’s virtue. Governing in this manner leads later generations to multiply prohibitions and strictures, fostering the root of oppressive power—yet no virtue surpasses the sparing of life.

The Way of Heaven benefits without harming; the Way of the sage acts without contending. Therefore, those who contend with the times prosper; those who contend with others meet misfortune. For this reason, armor and weapons are kept unstationed, for they do not contend. What is inauspicious, men do not contend for; what is base and shameful, men do not desire. To accept what others do not desire is sufficiency; to obtain what others do not contend for is tranquility.

Those bold in daring often wield power and make decisive judgments. Serene and joyful in their abilities, they transmit the state’s benefit to the people, do not shrink from the mighty, overawe the hundred officials, and crush resistance beyond the borders. Governing thus, they attain half of goodness.

Those gentle in restraint are yielding, diminishing, and retiring. Fearful and cautious in speech, they ponder deeply and plan far ahead, anticipate calamity in affairs, and devote themselves to enduring leniency and broad bestowal. Governing thus, they also attain half of goodness.

The daring serve Heaven and follow Earth, and nothing is more spiritually potent than perfect sincerity. With benevolence, they delight in bestowal; with righteousness, they enforce judgments; with propriety, they foster reverence; with wisdom, they eliminate harm; with trustworthiness, they establish affairs; with virtue, they achieve greatness. Pardoning others as they would pardon themselves, governing others as they would govern their own children—governing thus, they attain the utmost goodness.

Not exalting the worthy prevents the people from contending; not prizing rare goods prevents them from stealing; not displaying what may be desired prevents their hearts from being disordered. In the governance of the sage, he empties their minds, fills their bellies, weakens their ambitions, and strengthens their bones. Ever causing the people to be without knowledge and without desire, he ensures that the clever dare not act—thus nothing remains ungoverned.

*(From the* Daoist Classic of the Dao *by Laozi)*

Governing a great state is like cooking a small fish. When the Dao is brought to bear upon the world, its ghosts lose their spiritual potency. Not that its ghosts lack potency, but their potency no longer harms people. Nor does the sage harm people. As neither harms the other, their virtues converge and return.

*(From the* Daoist Classic of Virtue *by Laozi)*

In a small state with few people, let the people possess tools of tenfold or hundredfold utility yet not employ them. Let them value life and not journey far, so that though there be boats and carriages, none ride in them; though there be armor and weapons, none display them. Let the people return to knotting cords for record-keeping. Let them find sweetness in their food, beauty in their clothing, peace in their dwellings, and joy in their customs. Though neighboring states lie within sight, and the sounds of their chickens and dogs carry across, let the people grow old without ever traveling between them.

The reason rivers and seas become kings of the hundred valleys is that they excel in staying low—thus they become kings of the hundred valleys. Therefore, when the sage wishes to rise above the people, he humbles his words before them; when he wishes to lead the people, he places himself behind them. Thus, though he dwells above, the people do not feel oppressed; though he stands ahead, the people do not feel harmed. Therefore, the world delights in exalting him without wearying. Because he does not contend, none in the world can contend with him.

*(From the* Daoist Classic of Virtue *by Laozi)*

*End of Scroll Six of the* Supreme Secret Essentials.

**Scroll Seven of the Supreme Secret Essentials: On Cultivating Truth and Nurturing Life**

Laozi said:
Heaven and earth unite their essence, yin and yang transform of themselves—yet calamities and misfortunes begin to sprout.
Indulgence in the changes of the five colors blinds one to the forms of fortune and misfortune;
Excess in the changes of the five tones deafens one to the sounds of good and ill;
Imbalance in the changes of the five flavors distorts speech so it no longer accords with truth or falsehood;
Greed for the changes of wealth and goods clouds judgment so one cannot discern uprightness from perversion.

When the five colors grow dense, the world goes blind;
When the five tones are tuned, the world goes deaf;
When the five flavors are harmonized, the world loses its savor;
When pearls and jade are prized, the world toils;
When coin and silk circulate, the world is overthrown.

Thus, the five colors are awls that pierce the eyes;
The five tones are hammers that block the ears;
The five flavors are axes that sever the tongue;
Wealth and goods are arrows that strike the body.
All these things, shifting and giving rise to one another, cannot be exhausted—
Hard to discern, yet easy to destroy;
Hard to obtain, yet easy to lose.
They are the palace of misfortune, the chamber of harm.

Therefore, the sage wears the color of no-color,
Listens to the sound of no-sound,
Savors the flavor of no-flavor.
Fame harms the body;
Profit defiles conduct.
Thus, to act is to levy a tax upon oneself—
Seeking glory, one gains little;
Doing good, one reaps scant reward.
For the fame that has a name empties my storehouse,
While the fame that has no name nourishes my dwelling.

To see beyond what the eye can bear dims its clarity;
To hear beyond what the ear can bear drains its essence;
To love beyond what the heart can hold drives the spirit away.
Pulled by desire, one hurries in affairs;
Rushing after profit, one trembles in motion.
Fear knits factions, and friendships are forged for self-aid—
This is not truth.
Though it does not accord with the Dao’s intent,
Even if one gains it, Heaven will not protect.

To entrust tasks to those unfit is to invite ruin; to engage in affairs beyond one’s capacity is to court failure. Thus, he who usurps the role of the Executioner must bear its blame, and he who takes up the carpenter’s tools will surely wound his hands.

Those who act yield to their passions and indulge their desires, gratifying the heart and exhausting the will. The lowly strive for nobility; the poor chase after wealth. Abandoning roots for branches, calamity becomes inescapable. No sin is greater than lust, no disaster greater than greed, no fault greater than transgression. These three are the chariots of misfortune—small, they destroy the self; great, they ravage the household.

*Excerpt from the* **Scripture of Wondrous Perfection**

The five colors blind the eye,
The five tones deafen the ear,
The five flavors dull the palate,
The chase of the hunt maddens the heart,
Rare treasures corrupt conduct.
Thus the sage tends to the belly, not the eye—
Discarding the one, embracing the other.

*Excerpt from the* **Virtue Scripture of Laozi**

Which is dearer, fame or the self?
Which is weightier, the self or wealth?
Which is more harmful, gain or loss?
Excessive love incurs great cost;
Hoarded wealth invites heavy loss.
He who knows contentment avoids disgrace;
He who knows restraint avoids peril—
Thus may one endure.

*Excerpt from the* **Virtue Scripture of Laozi**

The human form is a temporary convergence,
Yet within it dwells the spirit’s awareness.
This awareness, borne of qi,
Has no beginning, no end—
It arises of itself,
Refined or coarse in kind.
Life and death, suffering and joy:
Cultivate goodness, and joy abides;
Follow desire, and suffering in death recurs.
When suffering reaches its extreme,
It gives way to rebirth—
Yet without cultivating goodness,
Fleeting joy soon fades.
Thus the superior person exerts utmost vigor,
Accumulating virtue and forsaking evil.

*Excerpt from the* **Inner Vision and Hidden Writings of the Jade Radiance and Purple Glow**

Act, and the heart of Heaven responds;
Stillness attains the intent of Earth.
Speech that meets no resistance is called goodness.
Goodness is the root of the noble,
The chief of all conduct,
The dwelling of auspicious yang,
The coming and going of myriad blessings—
Flowing without stagnation,
Exhaustible yet inexhaustible,
Unchanged through a hundred kings,
Unaltered by common custom.
Above, it accords with Heaven;
Below, it accords with humanity.
It completes the ten thousand things,
Sustains and shelters all beings—
This is goodness.

To fail to recognize the Primal Head,
To overlook the Root Origin,
To deceive Heaven and belittle Earth,
To delude ghosts and defy spirits,
To twist words and distort intent,
To harbor resentment and tread in doubt—
This is ungoodness.
Ungoodness moves contrary to Heaven,
Rests in opposition to Earth,
Words harm beings,
Silence injures spirits.
To deceive Heaven and delude Earth,
To scorn ghosts and spirits,
To cling to self-righteousness,
To act against the sages—
Though it may seem good in the moment,
Evil qi gathers and flows.
Affairs may appear true in their falsity,
As mirages resemble clouds—
Yet lightning stirs not for them.
Thus the Dao of Heaven shows no partiality;
Humans, in turning against it,
Err of their own accord.

*Excerpt from the* **Scripture of Wondrous Perfection**

When all under Heaven know beauty as beauty,
Ugliness arises;
When all know goodness as goodness,
Ungoodness arises.
Thus being and non-being give rise to each other,
Difficulty and ease complete each other,
Long and short shape each other,
High and low incline toward each other,
Sound and voice harmonize with each other,
Before and after follow each other.
Therefore the sage dwells in non-action,
Practices the teaching without words,
Lets the ten thousand things arise without claim,
Gives life without possession,
Acts without reliance,
Leads without domination,
Accomplishes without dwelling.
Only by not dwelling
Does it not depart.

*Excerpt from the* **Dao Scripture of Laozi**

The Dao declares: Fortune and misfortune, blessing and calamity emerge from the unseen. Disaster is not something the rich and noble may petition to avoid, nor something the poor and lowly may wish away. Cultivate goodness, and fortune responds; commit evil, and calamity arrives.

*Excerpt from the* **Scripture of Ascending Origins**

Laozi said: I do not know those among the people who do good, nor those who do evil, nor those who act with loyalty and trust. Thus, when goodness accumulates, good qi arrives; when evil accumulates, evil qi arrives. Therefore the sage says: I cherish the beginning of all under Heaven and guard the Mother of all under Heaven—thus the ten thousand things revere and preserve life. My own intent remains unclear; how then could I know the good or evil of others? When goodness accumulates, divine clarity assists; the Dao of Heaven likewise protects the good.

*Excerpt from the* **Western Ascension Scripture**

The Lady of Purple Tenuity said to the Queen Mother: Hearing the Dao is difficult, yet not as difficult as hearing the Dao. Practicing the Dao is difficult, yet not as difficult as completing the Dao.

*Excerpt from the* **Hidden Writings of the Great Elixir of Cavernous Perfection**

It is difficult to be born into the human Dao,
More difficult to be born a man,
More difficult still to be born in the Central Kingdom,
Most difficult to be born in the family of a king, marquis, state preceptor, Daoist, or scholar.
To possess beauty and brilliance is difficult,
To believe in the Dao is difficult,
To practice the Dao is difficult,
To attain the Dao is difficult.

*Excerpt from the* **Scripture of Daoist Traces**

The Dao declares: For kings, nobles, Daoists, and commoners to be born as humans—
To leave the female form and become male is difficult.
Having become male, to possess keen intelligence,
All six senses intact,
A dignified and majestic form,
A voice like jade,
Qi like renowned incense,
Eyes like sunlight,
Drawing joyful admiration from all who behold—
This is difficult.
With all virtues already perfected,
To be born in a land of the Dao,
Where ruler and father are wise and virtuous,
Devoted to the Dao and its power—
This is difficult.
To be poor yet love the Dao,
Constantly mindful of bestowing kindness without ceasing—
This is difficult.
To be rich and noble yet believe in and honor the Dao,
Revering and serving the scriptures without negligence—
This is difficult.
To endure others’ malice without retaliation,
To master life and prevent decay,
To transcend the world and attain the immortal Dao—
This is difficult.
To behold the precious scriptures of the Three Caverns—
Cavernous Perfection, Cavernous Mystery, Cavernous Spirit—
To honor, recite, and venerate them with offerings and incense—
This is difficult.
To encounter and meet immortal sages and perfected beings,
To receive their teachings and transformation—
This is difficult.
These are the eight difficulties.
Without prior lives of diligent cultivation,
Accumulated virtue and merit in full—
How could one escape the foolish and deluded paths of the Three Evils
And attain this sacred assembly?

*Excerpt from the* **Secret Decisions of the Natural Scripture of Cavernous Mystery**

Perfected Lord Zhou said: The Dao may be learned,
Yet profound contemplation is truly difficult.

The immortal Dao may be sought,
Yet perfecting essence is truly difficult.
Perfected beings may be seen,
Yet nurturing will and nature is truly difficult.
Jade maidens may be employed,
Yet cultivating purity and chastity is truly difficult.

*Excerpt from the* **Cavernous Perfection Scripture of the Inner Chambers of the Grotto**

Grand Master of the Purple Prime said: In the world there are five difficulties:
To bestow alms while in poverty is difficult,
To study the Dao while in great wealth is difficult,
To master life and attain deathlessness is difficult,
To behold the Cavernous Scriptures is difficult,
To be born in an age of sagely rule is difficult.

*Excerpt from the* **Scripture of Perfected Traces**

The Lord said: Thus, those who study the Dao encounter nine afflictions—all grave maladies of humankind.
Should one discern these afflictions as maladies,
Then the immortal Dao is not far.
The afflictions are these:
One has aspiration yet no opportunity,
One has opportunity yet no companions,
One has companions yet no aspiration,
One has aspiration yet does not meet a teacher,
One meets a teacher yet does not awaken,
One awakens to the teacher yet is not diligent,
One is diligent yet does not uphold the Dao,
One’s will is confused and not steadfast,
One is steadfast yet cannot persist long—
These are the nine afflictions of humankind.
If in youth one delights in the Dao,
Firmly guarding the singular heart,
Neither water nor fire can frighten the mind,
Nor glory nor splendor sway the will,
Cultivating truth and embracing simplicity,
In time one will meet a teacher—
Then one need not fear the lack of anything.
Thus, one need not rely on companions to succeed,
Nor await inspiration to act.
This is the broad essential of immortal study.

*Excerpt from the* **Supreme Cavernous Perfection Scripture of the Great Ultimate Divination Signs**

The Perfected One said: The affliction is that one attains human birth yet does not cultivate virtue and nurture nature to preserve life.
The affliction is that one hears the scriptures yet does not believe.
The affliction is that one believes the scriptures yet covets wealth and does not receive them.
The affliction is that one receives the scriptures yet does not study and recite them.
The affliction is that one studies and recites them yet does not practice their teachings.
The affliction is that one practices their teachings yet does not persevere in the Dao.
The affliction is that one serves a teacher yet does not follow them to life’s end.
The affliction is that one ingests elixirs yet they do not take effect in time.
The affliction is that one’s Dao conduct is incomplete yet one boasts and seeks ascension.
The affliction is that one retreats to secluded mountains to read scriptures in quietude yet cannot endure its hardships.
These ten afflictions reside within a person.
If one does not guard against them,
The body will have no means of deliverance.
Thus it is said:
“There is a great affliction—it is that I have a body.”
This is what is meant.
Can one not reflect upon this?
Can one not reflect upon this?

From the *Dongxuan Scripture for Dispelling Demons*:

Valuing firmness and strength, scorning impulsive joy and anger—
Blessings and goodness depart through the gate,
While omens and calamities enter through the door.
Thus, the tongue and ears become afflictions,
And teeth and horns remain unsettled.
The mouth and tongue are the palace of misfortune and disaster,
The repository of peril and ruin.
Speech is where the great mandate resides,
The domain of punishment and calamity.
Words uttered invite affliction in,
Words misused bring ruin to the body.
Therefore, the sage fears when speaking,
Grieves when uttering words,
Ever as if treading on perilous ice.

From the *Scripture of Wondrous Perfection*:

Lord Dao-ling said: In the degenerate age, the people have three things to fear—examine them carefully:
First, jealousy toward the Dao and its teachings is to be feared;
Second, slander is to be feared;
Third, greed and desire are to be feared.
Jealousy toward the Dao and its teachings obstructs the circulation of scriptures and precepts;
Slander against Dharma masters weakens people’s faith in the Dao;
Greed for wealth and sensuality renders one despised by others.
These three—two external, one internal—must be absent before one may transmit the Dao.
One should diligently study and uphold them.

From the *Laozi’s Scripture of the Dao*:

Favor and disgrace are both met with alarm,
And the great affliction is prized as one’s own body.
What is meant by “favor and disgrace are both met with alarm”?
Favor, being inferior, is gained with alarm,
And lost with alarm—
This is what is meant by “favor and disgrace are both met with alarm.”
What is meant by “the great affliction is prized as one’s own body”?
The reason I have a great affliction
Is that I have a body.
If I had no body,
What affliction would I have?

From the *Dongxuan Jade Key Scripture*:

The Eastern Quarter’s nine *qi* form the Azure Heaven.
Heaven has nine origins;
The nine origins turn the Celestial Pivot,
Revolving thirty-three times in a cycle.
Day and night span thirty days;
Heaven’s *qi* completes one exchange.
Twelve exchanges make one degree.
Three hundred thirty degrees mark the Heavenly *qi*’s dominion over Wood,
When the Azure Emperor presides.
At three thousand three hundred degrees, the azure *qi* surges,
While the yellow *qi* wanes—
This is the yang number nine,
Nine being Heaven’s extremity,
Called the Lesser Yang Nine.
When the six heavenly *qi* ascend,
The hundred officials convene—
This is the Lesser Hundred Six.
At nine thousand nine hundred degrees,
The azure *qi* intensifies,
The yellow *qi* is eclipsed—
This is the yang number nine,
Called the Greater Yang Nine.
When the six heavenly *qi* reverse,
The hundred officials withdraw their *qi*—
This is the Greater Hundred Six.

The Southern Quarter’s three *qi* form the Vermilion Heaven.
The Celestial Pivot turns three hundred thirty degrees,
Marking the Heavenly *qi*’s dominion over Fire,
When the Vermilion Emperor presides.
At three thousand three hundred degrees,
The vermilion *qi* surges,
While the white *qi* wanes—
This is the Vermilion Emperor’s Lesser Yang Nine,
Lesser Hundred Six.
When the Heavenly *qi* surges in the Earth Palace during the years of *chen*, *xu*, *chou*, and *wei*,
The four *qi* drive out [harm],
And warfare and disaster spread.
Fire arises within Earth,
Gold and jade form naturally,
And the world is scorched and withered.
At nine thousand nine hundred degrees,
The vermilion *qi* intensifies,
The white *qi* is eclipsed—
This is the Vermilion Emperor’s Greater Yang Nine,
Greater Hundred Six.
When the *qi* intensifies in the Water Palace during the years of *hai* and *zi*,
Fire’s essence is extinguished,
Ten thousand *li* lie smokeless.
Floods overwhelm the heavens,
Only one in ten thousand among humans and beasts survives.

The Central Quarter’s one *qi* forms the Yellow Heaven.
The Celestial Pivot turns three hundred thirty degrees,
Marking the Heavenly *qi*’s dominion over Earth,
When the Yellow Emperor presides.
At three thousand three hundred degrees,
The yellow *qi* surges,
While the black *qi* wanes—
This is the Yellow Emperor’s Lesser Yang Nine,
Lesser Hundred Six.
At nine thousand nine hundred degrees,
The yellow *qi* intensifies,
The black *qi* is eclipsed—
This is the Yellow Emperor’s Greater Yang Nine,
Greater Hundred Six.
When the Heavenly *qi* intensifies in the Wood Palace during the years of *yin* and *mao*,
The nine soils collapse,
And the people have no place to stand.
Ten thousand plagues drive out [life],
Not one in ten thousand remains.

The Western Quarter’s seven *qi* form the White Heaven.
The Celestial Pivot turns three hundred thirty degrees,
Marking the Heavenly *qi*’s dominion over Metal,
When the White Emperor presides.
In the years of *shen* and *you*, the White Emperor’s Perfected Ones descend to the world to teach and transform.
At three thousand three hundred degrees,
The white *qi* surges,
While the azure *qi* wanes—
This is the White Emperor’s Lesser Yang Nine,
Lesser Hundred Six.
When the Heavenly *qi* surges in the Water Palace during the years of *hai* and *zi*,
Gold and jade dissolve and vanish,
Corpses fill the rivers and seas,
People devour one another,
And the seas turn to rivers of blood.
At nine thousand nine hundred degrees,
The white *qi* intensifies in the Fire Palace during the years of *si* and *wu*,
Metal and stone dissolve of themselves,
Warfare and disaster drive out [life],
And humans and beasts are extinguished.

The Northern Quarter’s five *qi* form the Black Heaven.
The Celestial Pivot turns three hundred thirty degrees,
Marking the Heavenly *qi*’s dominion over Water,
When the Black Emperor presides.
At three thousand three hundred degrees,
The black *qi* surges,
While the vermilion *qi* wanes—
This is the Black Emperor’s Lesser Yang Nine,
Lesser Hundred Six.
When the Heavenly *qi* surges in the Wood Palace during the years of *yin* and *mao*,
Crops wither and die,
Forests and trees collapse in great ruin,
Waters surge and rivers burst their banks,
Floods overwhelm the heavens,
People drift as corpses,
Bones and blood part ways.
At nine thousand nine hundred degrees,
The black *qi* intensifies,
The vermilion *qi* is eclipsed—
This is the Black Emperor’s Greater Yang Nine,
Greater Hundred Six.
When the Heavenly *qi* intensifies in the Earth Palace during the years of *chen*, *xu*, *chou*, and *wei*,
Rivers and seas run dry,
The seabed turns to dust,
And people, birds, and beasts
Are scorched to death without exception.

The five directions’ Celestial Pivots turn thirty-two times in nine thousand nine hundred degrees,
And the *qi* of the five directions all ascend to the Primordial Beginning.
The azure yang *qi* revolves within the Mysterious Capital’s Jade Capital Mountain’s Pivot,
Circling through the various heavens,
The sun, moon, and stellar lodges,
Beyond the ten voids.
After ninety-nine myriad, nine thousand, nine hundred ninety-nine degrees,
The *qi* returns at the juncture of one kalpa,
And Heaven and Earth, the myriad beings,
Mountains, rivers, and seas,
Metal, stone, and people
All dissolve and vanish at once.
Moreover, the yang *qi* turns the Celestial Pivot,
While the yin *qi* turns the Earth’s Mechanism.
The mouths of the nine rivers,
The ebb and flow of waters—
All correspond to Heaven’s divisions,
And their conjunctions follow the same pattern.
Thus, the yang number nine is called the Yang Nine,
And the yin number eight is called the Eight Disasters.
Heaven and Earth’s revolutions and degrees—
Humans are likewise the same.

From the *Dongxuan Jade Key Scripture*:

The Dao states: The Natural Revolutions of the Numinous Treasure include the Greater Yang Nine, Greater Hundred Six, Lesser Yang Nine, and Lesser Hundred Six.
Three thousand three hundred years make a Lesser Yang Nine and Lesser Hundred Six;
Nine thousand nine hundred years make a Greater Yang Nine and Greater Hundred Six.

From the *Dongxuan Revolutions and Degrees Scripture*:

Heaven’s adversity is called the Yang Nine,
Earth’s depletion is called the Hundred Six.

The Master Anqi said to the Lady of Supreme Perfection, Royal Consort Wang: "Formerly, when this humble one journeyed to the mouth of the Nine Rivers, I encountered the Lord Controller of Yang and the Lady of Western Han. Together we beheld a vision, and they inquired of me concerning the periods of the Yang Nine and Hundred Six. I replied that my years were few and I knew nothing of the reckoning of revolutions and adversities. Now that I have been granted this seat, I beg to ask of these numbers."

The Lady said: "The cycles of destiny flow vast and boundless—these are not matters you can swiftly comprehend. Yet Heaven and Earth possess the Greater Yang Nine, Greater Hundred Six, Lesser Yang Nine, and Lesser Hundred Six. Heaven’s adversity is called the Yang Nine; Earth’s depletion is called the Hundred Six. These two calamities mark the waxing and waning of Heaven and Earth, the surging and eclipsing of yin and yang. The greater cycle spans nine thousand nine hundred years; the lesser, three thousand three hundred. When this destiny converges, not even a sage-ruler can avert it. As for the vanishing of misfortune and the bequeathing of fortune—one can only await the joy that follows.

The Yang Nine: Heaven parches, seas surge, and the land scorches.
The Hundred Six: Seas dry, and hills sink into abysses."

From the *Daoji Jing* (Scripture of the Dao’s Traces):
The seventh scroll of the *Wushang Biyao* (Supreme Secret Essentials) concludes here. The eighth scroll is duplicated and thus not recorded; now it is fully preserved in the eighty-seventh scroll.

**Chapter on the Ascent and Descent of Spirit-Officials**

Should the August Jade-Pure Supreme Perfected Thearch violate the luminous statutes, they shall be struck from the Thearch’s register, demoted to disperse among the perfected, and relegated to govern the Central Palace of the Great Purity. After a hundred years, they may advance in rank according to their merit.

Should Upper-Purity Perfected Persons neglect immortal affairs, slacken in their duties, or fail in their true tasks—leaking precious precepts or conferring ranks upon the unworthy—they shall be struck from the register of Upper Perfected, reduced to serve as overseers of the Five Marchmounts, and may advance in rank after a thousand years according to their merit.

Those who hold the positions of Upper Primordial Lady or Primordial Lord but neglect their imperial duties, fail in their proper tasks, transgress ritual bounds, arrive late or miss appointed hours, or lightly divulge celestial treasures—thus conferring ranks improperly—shall be stripped of their Perfected Thearch’s register, demoted from the Purple Void’s rank, and placed among the wandering spirit-officials of the Middle Mystery and Pure Tenuity. After seven hundred years, they may advance in rank according to their diligence.

Those who bear the title of Great-Purity Immortal but neglect their official duties, delay or abandon immortal affairs, fail in their true tasks, or leak celestial statutes—transmitting them to the unworthy—shall be struck from the register of Perfected Immortals and reduced to serve as overseers of the Five Marchmounts. After two thousand four hundred years, they may advance in rank according to their diligence.

Those who hold the title of Flying Immortal of the Five Marchmounts but fail in their governance, neglect their immortal duties, or treat the Dao’s scriptures with disdain shall be struck from the register of Right Immortals and reduced to serve as overseers of the Three Offices. After two thousand four hundred years, they may advance in rank according to their diligence.

All who hold positions as overseers of the Five Thearchs, Four Directors, or Three Offices but fail in their proper duties, slacken or neglect their tasks, disregard celestial statutes, or mismanage affairs—imposing punishments unjustly—shall be stripped of their ranks as Right Perfected and reduced to serve as scribes and overseers. After three thousand six hundred years, they may advance in rank according to their diligence.

All who receive the Jade Tablets of Upper Perfected—whether as Gatekeepers, Supervisors, Jade Lads, Feathered Immortals, Attendant Gentlemen, Directors of the Upper Palace, Regulators of Standards, Overseers of the Perfected, Attendant Gentlemen of the Immortal Host, Masters of Prohibitions, Great Ministers of Rites, or Directors of Feathered Scripts—if they fail in their duties, neglect their proper tasks, or breach celestial statutes, shall be stripped of their Upper Perfected’s tablets and compelled to serve as scribes of the Three Offices, overseeing ghostly multitudes. After seven thousand years, those who demonstrate diligence may advance in rank according to their merit.

From the *Siji Mingke* (Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles):
**Chapter on the Assembly of All Sages**

The Most High Sage Emperor Lord proclaims: On the first day of the first month, the third day of the third month, the fifth day of the fifth month, the seventh day of the seventh month, the ninth day of the ninth month, and the eleventh day of the eleventh month—these six days of the year mark the times when the celestial virtue aligns in convergence. The Seven Sages determine the roster, the Five Emperors record the names, the Western Tortoise inscribes the register, and the Eastern Florescence compiles the scroll. On these days, the Primordial Celestial converges in jubilation; the Four Offices deploy their hosts, lofty canopies manifest on high, jade chariots of the Yuqing Realm revolve, the Nine Emperors gird themselves in the east, the Seven Sages unite in numinous power, and the myriad Perfected and ten thousand Immortals ascend to their stations in the Golden Court. The Three Mornings flank the imperial carriage, the Seven Origins blaze with radiance, heaven and earth are purified and resplendent, the Ten Realms stand solemn and clear. The Nine Heavenly Thearchs dispatch Perfected Inspectors, the Most High Seven Sages send the Left Immortal of the Registers, the Queen Mother of the Western Tortoise commands the Five Elders, the Immortal Lords, the Four Hoary Ones, the Central Perfected, and the Azure Lad of Eastern Florescence to dispatch the Jade Lads who lead the Immortals. Each division of flying immortals, wheel-turning feathered riders, patrols the Ten Heavens and the Five Marchmounts and famous mountains, secretly observing those of the Cavernous Origin who have already attained the Dao, the wandering immortals and officials of the scattered ranks, and later disciples. Those whose names are recorded in the registers but whose bodies have not yet ascended, or whose dark records bear no name yet who cultivate with arduous diligence, their aspirations surpassing even the Jade Clarity—on high, they move the Jade Emperor. All who study with their bodies on these days, purify themselves in fasting, burn incense, cast aside all wayward thoughts, align their wishes with the celestial will, concentrate their thoughts in earnest meditation, and cultivate the numinous scriptures, shall be commended by the Five Emperors. Their names shall be inscribed on the White Tablets and recorded in the Azure Register, and the Four Poles shall be dispatched to descend and confer upon them the rank of Upper Perfected. On these days, should any treat the celestial treasures with disdain, divulge the mysterious scriptures, or incur the Seven Harms upon their bodies, they shall be impeached by the Four Offices and listed on the White Tablets. Their names shall be struck from the Azure Register and reassigned to the offices of ghosts.

From the *Dongzhen Qisheng Yuanji Jing* (*Scripture of the Primordial Record of the Seven Sages of the Cavernous Perfection*):

At midday on the sixth day of the first month,
At the evening meal hour on the first day of the first month,
At midnight on the seventh day of the third month,
At the breakfast hour on the ninth day of the fourth month,
At midnight on the fifteenth day of the fifth month,
At midday on the third day of the sixth month,
At midnight on the seventh day of the seventh month,
At midday on the fourth day of the eighth month,
At dawn on the second day of the ninth month,
At dawn on the first day of the tenth month,
At dawn on the sixth day of the eleventh month,
At midnight on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month.

From the *Dongzhen Basu Jing* (*Scripture of the Eight Simplicities of the Cavernous Perfection*):

On these twelve days, the Five Planetary Stellar Lords, the Supreme Perfected Celestial Lords of the Great Dao, and the August Lords of the Most High ascend together to the Upper Clarity, where they behold the Nine Profound Supreme Lords of the Dao. Moreover, the thirty-six Heavenly Emperors of the Thousand Perfected and all the Flying Immortals of the Grand Clarity and above universally celebrate in the Grand Ultimate’s Upper Palace. There, they deliberate upon the diligence or negligence of those who seek the Dao in the world, and inscribe the jade names of those who study the Dao. These shall be engraved upon the Golden Pavilion and recorded upon the petal-bound registers.

---

The Five Venerable Divine Elders of the Primordial Numinous Treasure, the Heavenly Emperors and August Lords, and the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct regularly convene six times a year—on the first days of the first, third, fifth, seventh, ninth, and eleventh months—in the Uppermost Three Heavens’ Numinous Capital Palace, upon the Terrace of Primordial Yang and Purple Tenuity. There, they compute the celestial origins, examine and verify the revolutions of destiny. The Heavenly Emperors of each heaven dispatch the Great Ones of the Celestial Emperors, along with messengers of the sun, moon, and stellar lodges. The Three Offices summon and review, while the Five Marchmounts, Four Watercourses, and the great spirits of rivers and seas traverse the world below. None fail to investigate merits and transgressions, selecting and distinguishing the seed-people. During these months, all beneath heaven and upon earth tremble in solemnity, observing fasts and upholding precepts, revering and serving the Celestial Perfected. Scholars, in accordance with the regulations of these months, perform purification rites, their merits recorded by the Three Offices and their names listed by the Five Emperors.

---

The August Assemblage of the Most Sagely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the Northwest Heaven, the Supreme Lord of the Boundless Dao, and the Perfected August Elder regularly convene on the first day of each month at the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace of the Jade Capital Mountain in the Numinous Treasure’s Mystic Capital of the Northwest. There, they offer purification rites and present celestial documents, reviewing the merits and transgressions of humans and ghosts upon the earth. On this day, the Northern Dipper is commanded to descend, joining the Three Offices in summoning and reviewing, while the Four Departments expose deceit. They traverse the world below, investigating and examining the multitudes, itemizing the weight of good and evil to be reported above. On this day, those who uphold the upright purification rite, transgressing no regulations, have their sins expunged by the Three Offices. Their names are recorded in the Mystic Register, and the hosts of the myriad spirits guard and protect them, allowing them to become seed-people. Those who commit evil and violate the law have their names transferred to the Offices of Earth.

---

The August Assemblage of the Most Sagely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the North Heaven, the Supreme Lord of the Boundless Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, and the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct of the Numinous Treasure regularly convene on the eighth day of each month at the Dark Primordial Terrace of the Jade Capital Mountain in the Upper Numinous Capital of the North. There, they offer purification rites and present celestial documents, reviewing the registers of destiny and the lifespans of the earth’s multitudes. On this day, the Northern Dipper’s Office of Demon-Slaying is commanded to descend, joining the Controllers of the Eight Extremities in traversing the world below. They oversee and examine the weight of merits, transgressions, good, and evil, reporting them in detail. On this day, those who commit evil and violate the law have their names transferred to the Offices of Earth. Those who uphold the purification rite with sincerity, transgressing no regulations, have their sins erased by the Three Offices. Their names are recorded in the Immortal Registers of the Three Heavens, and the celestial and terrestrial spirits are notified to guard and protect them, ensuring that the myriad calamities do not afflict them.

---

The August Assemblage of the Most Sagely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the Northeast Heaven, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Supreme Lord of the Boundless Dao, the Most High Divine August Lord of Myriad Transformations and Myriad Births, and the Supreme Mystic Elder regularly convene on the fourteenth day of each month at the Palace of Pervading Yang and Pure Tenuity of the Jade Capital Mountain in the Numinous Treasure’s Mystic Capital. There, they offer purification rites and present documents to the Perfected, reviewing the merits and transgressions of those who study the Dao across the world, as well as the affairs of ghosts and spirits. On this day, the Great One’s messengers are commanded to descend, joining the Northern Fengdu Earl’s messengers in traversing heaven and earth. They oversee and examine the depth of merits and transgressions among humans and spirits, reporting them in detail to the Upper Palace. Those who perform purification rites and establish virtue have their names inscribed in the Nine Heavens, recorded in the Immortal Registers. Ghosts and spirits are promoted in rank according to their merits. Humans and ghosts who commit sins have their names transferred back to the ghostly bureaus.

---

The August Assemblage of the Most Sagely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the East Heaven, the Supreme Lord of the Three Heavens of the Grand Clarity and Primordial Origin, the Supreme Mystic Elder of the Boundless Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the August Elder of the Most High, the August Lord of the Most High, the Celestial Emperor of the Upper Perfected and Azure Spirit, the Celestial Emperor of the August Elder, the Supreme Emperor of the August Elder, the Nine Elders of the Immortal Capital, the Nine Qi Elders, and the myriad layers of the Dao’s qi—along with the twelve hundred official lords, the Eastern Pole Elder beneath the Jade Steps of the Grand Clarity, the Azure Florescence Great Spirit, the Prime Minister Sima, the Golden Gate Posterior Sage Emperor of the Azure Youth, the Perfected of Primordial Yang and Beginning Azure, the Nine Immortal Lords of the Numinous Treasure, and the Azure Harmony Jade Maidens, the Four Lords of the Hosts of Immortals—regularly convene on the fifteenth day of each month at the Azure Florescence Jade Steps Palace of the Jade Capital Mountain in the Grand Mystic Capital of the Numinous Treasure. There, they offer purification rites and present celestial documents, collectively reviewing and determining the depth of merits and transgressions of those who study immortality. On this day, the Celestial Emperor himself descends, along with the sun, moon, and stellar lodges, all above and below heaven and earth, the spirits of the Five Marchmounts and Four Watercourses, and the gods of rivers and seas. None fail to descend in solemnity, traversing the various heavens and the world below, examining and verifying the weight of merits and transgressions of scholars and the multitudes, reporting them in detail to the Azure Palace. On this day, those who perform purification rites and uphold the precepts are protected and recommended by the Five Emperors, their names reported to the Eastern Florescence. They are transformed from life and death into immortals, their names inscribed throughout the Three Realms. The spirits guard and protect them, ensuring that the thousand calamities do not afflict them. Those who violate the regulations have their names transferred to the Offices of Earth.

---

The August Assemblage of the Most Sagely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the Southeast Heaven, the Supreme Elder of the South of the Boundless Dao, the Cinnabar Spirit Perfected of the Southern Pole, and the Grand Harmony Jade Maidens regularly convene on the eighteenth day of each month at the Cinnabar Terrace of the Mystic Cavern in the Jade Capital Mountain of the Grand Mystic Capital of the Numinous Treasure. There, they offer purification rites and present celestial documents, collectively reviewing the registers of the celestial multitudes and distinguishing good from evil. On this day, the Celestial Emperor commands the heavens to descend and traverse the earth below, overseeing and examining the weight of merits and transgressions of the multitudes, reporting them in detail to the Cinnabar Terrace of the Mystic Cavern of the Numinous Treasure. On this day, those who revere and uphold the true scriptures of the Numinous Treasure, burn incense, perform the Dao, observe purification rites, make vows, and transgress no regulations have their names recorded by the Controllers of Destiny in the Register of the Living. The terrestrial spirits guard and protect them, their blessings and fortunes increasing daily, and their ten thousand wishes fulfilled. Those who violate the regulations and transgress the prohibitions have their names erased from the Register of the Living and transferred to the Offices of Ghosts.

---

The August Assemblage of the Most Sagely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the South Heaven, the Supreme Crimson Emperor of the South of the Boundless Dao, the Cinnabar Spirit Elder, the Grand Harmony Jade Maidens, the Controller of Longevity Sima, the Lord of Life-Inscription, the Controller of Destiny, the Controller of Records, the Southern Pole Deliverer from the World, and the Lord of Myriad Fortunes regularly convene on the twenty-third day of each month at the Palace of Primordial Yang and the Mystic Cavern in the Jade Capital Mountain of the Grand Mystic Capital of the Numinous Treasure. There, they offer purification rites and present documents to the Celestial Perfected, collectively reviewing the lifespans and destinies of the celestial multitudes and distinguishing good from evil.

On this day, the Perfected commands the Eight Divine Envoys of the Great One to descend and join the Three Officials in their investigations, traversing the world to oversee and record the good and evil deeds of heaven and humanity. Those who on this day cultivate and uphold the *True Scripture of the Numinous Treasure*, burn incense and perform the Dao, observe fasts and make vows, and transgress no prohibitions—such persons shall have the Controller of Lifespans and the Sima of Longevity inscribe their names in the Register of Life, extending their years and augmenting their destiny. The Earthly Officials shall be commanded to guard and protect them, designating them as virtuous citizens. Those who violate the statutes and break the precepts shall have their allotted years diminished and their lifespans shortened.

The agely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the Southwest Heaven, the Heavenly Venerable Elder of the Boundless Dao, the Primordial Perfected Lord of the Southern Pole, and the Grand Numinous of Cavernous Yang regularly convene on the twenty-fourth day of each month at the Vermilion Palace of the Grand Mystic Capital’s Jade Capital Mountain. There, they collectively review the records of the Three Officials and the Nine Bureaus, the Five Marchmounts and Northern Feng, the Twenty-Four Peaks of Mount Tai, meting out punishments and penalties, and determining the severity of the labors imposed upon ghosts, spirits, and celestial and earthly beings.

On this day, the Perfected commands the Northern Culmen to descend and join the Three Officials in their investigations, issuing decrees against the wicked in the northern realm. They traverse the world, reexamining the various bureaus and concurrently overseeing the good and evil deeds of the myriad people, reporting them in detail. Those who on this day cultivate and uphold the *True Scripture of the Numinous Treasure*, burn incense and perform the Dao, and maintain fasts and uphold the precepts—such persons shall have the Northern Culmen report their meritorious deeds, inscribe their names in the Upper Palace, and erase their names from the Register of Sins, thereby becoming seed-people of the Dao. Those who violate the statutes and break the laws shall be consigned to perpetual ghostly servitude.

The agely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the Western Heaven, the Jade Immortal Mother of the Western Flower and Golden Diadem of the Boundless Dao, the Supreme Imperial Lord of the Golden Watchtower and Posterior Sage, and the Perfected of the Four Poles regularly convene on the twenty-eighth day of each month at the Seven Treasures Palace of the Golden Watchtower in the Jade Capital Mountain of the Grand Mystic Capital. There, they offer purification rites and present documents to the Celestial Perfected, collectively reviewing the divisions of the sun, moon, and stars, and recording the names of those who have attained the Dao.

On this day, the Perfected commands the Great One to descend and traverse the celestial lodges, overseeing the world and reporting the good and evil deeds of disciples. The stellar lodges, the jade armillary sphere, and the jade balance all gather somberly at the gates of the Celestial Watchtower. All disciples who cultivate fasts, uphold the precepts, contemplate immortality, and meditate upon the Dao shall have the Great One report their names to the Register of Immortals, thereby becoming seed-people of the Dao. Those who violate the statutes and break the laws shall be impeached by the Three Officials and consigned to perpetual servitude as sinful citizens.

The agely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the Lower Heaven, the Myriad Immortals of the Mystic Abyss and Primordial Yellow of the Boundless Dao, and the Perfected of the Four Controllers and Five Emperors regularly convene on the twenty-ninth day of each month at the Yellow Chamber of the Grand Mystic Capital’s Jade Capital Mountain in the High Emperor Heaven. There, they offer purification rites and present documents to the Celestial Perfected, calculating and reviewing the affairs of the Five Marchmounts and Four Waterways, the River and Sea Water Emperors, and the earthly spirits and ghosts, as well as the weighty transgressions recorded in the ledgers of the myriad people.

On this day, the Perfected dispatches the Central Great One to descend and join the Three Officials, the Nine Bureaus, and the Nine Divisions in their investigations. They traverse the Five Marchmounts, the Three Officials’ watery domains, and the water palaces, rectifying ghostly affairs, overseeing the merits, transgressions, and severity of the ledgers of the people, and reporting them in detail. Those who on this day cultivate and uphold the *True Scripture of the Numinous Treasure*, burn incense and perform the Dao, and maintain fasts and uphold the precepts shall be protected by the Three Officials and the Nine Bureaus. Their meritorious deeds shall be reported, their names erased from the ledgers of transgressions, and their names inscribed in the Three Heavens. Divine luminaries shall guard and protect them, and a thousand calamities shall not befall them. Those who violate the statutes and break the prohibitions shall have their names transferred to the Earthly Officials and consigned to perpetual servitude as sinful citizens.

The agely and Perfected Divine Lords of the Primordial Numinous Treasure in the Upper Heaven, the Lords of the Boundless Dao in the Upper, Lower, Central, Four Directions, and Eight Quarters, the Most Supreme and Venerable Elder, the Unsurpassed, Unbounded, Infinite, and Inexhaustible, the Universally Illuminating and All-Observing, the Most Exalted and Utterly True, the Innumerable Hosts of the Dao and qi, the Primordial, Vast, Unbounded, and Formless, the Spontaneously Self-So and Primordially Rootless, the Profoundly Quiescent and Mystically Pervasive, the Fount of Great Wisdom, the Orthodox Alliance of Might, the Boundless Dao of Non-Action, the Divine Lord within the Dao, the Unsurpassed Primordial Myriad Billions of the Innumerable Hosts of the Dao and virtue, the Divine Lords from whom the Heavenly and Earthly Parents and the divine immortals emerge, the Divine Immortals who gather therein—the Heavenly Father of the East, the Heavenly Mother of the West, the Solar Emperor, the Lunar Lady, the Perfected Lords of the Five Stars, the August Consorts of the Five Stars, the Perfected Lords of the Seven Stars of the Jade Armillary Sphere, and the Great Divine Officials of the Celestial Bureaus—regularly convene on the thirtieth day of each month at the Seven Treasures Purple Tenuity Palace of the Jade Capital Mountain in the Grand Mystic Capital. There, they offer purification rites and present documents to the Celestial Perfected, and the myriad emperors, divine hosts, celestial and terrestrial beings assemble to calculate the great and minor kalpas, the great and minor cycles of one hundred and six, the revolutions of heaven and earth

The Most Perfect and Divine Honored Ones of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace regularly dispatch the Great Envoys of the Central Terrace of the Great Unity on *jiǎzǐ* days to traverse all heavens and earth, inspecting and examining the spirits, deities, and miscellaneous demonic essences. On such days, those who observe purification fasts and burn incense are recorded by the Great Envoys of the Central Terrace for their virtuous deeds, which are then memorialized to the Three Heavens. The Celestial Thearch then appoints them as Overseers of Heaven, commanding the earthly spirits and deities.

The days of the Eight Nodal Festivals are the great celebratory assemblies of the Eight Heavens. On these days, the Great Sage Honored Ones of the various heavens, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, and the Divine Immortals all ascend to the Upper Palace of the Numinous Treasure Mystic Capital on Jade Capital Mountain to pay homage and celebrate the Celestial Perfected. They uphold the precepts, observe purification fasts, wander in recitation of scriptures, and each dispatches the majestic divine spirits of the Celestial Perfected to traverse the world—across the Four Seas and Eight Directions, the Five Marchmounts and famous mountains—examining the merits and transgressions of disciples and the myriad people, assessing their gravity and recording them in detail.

On these days, the constellations, the revolving mechanisms of the sun and moon, and the earthly spirits and deities all stand in solemn reverence. All who observe purification fasts, uphold the precepts, and revere the celestial patterns are commended by the Five Thearchs. The heavens separately inscribe their names in the Jade Register, recording them as the Seed People. This is reported to the Three Officials, and divine spirits attend and guard them. Their gates and households are ordered and solemn, and the myriad calamities do not afflict them. For those scholars who attain the Way, the administrators of the Three Realms welcome them, and the divine immortals deliver them from the world, elevating them as Perfected Ones.

Those who commit evil and violate the precepts are investigated and reported by the examining officials, then transferred to the Earthly Bureau, forever becoming Sinful People.

*—Concluded from the* Wondrous Mystery Primordial Five Elders’ Red Script Jade Chapters Sutra, *from* The Supreme Secret Essentials, *Scroll Nine.*
