*Scroll Twenty of the* Wushang Biyao *begins*

**Songs of the Immortals**

The celestial net descends from Heaven’s records,
Nine Dipper’s jade-green void,
Purple canopy veils the layered peaks,
Mysterious essence illumines the eight corners.
Above dwell the Nine Morning Guests,
Chanting hidden feather-script,
Striding through the northern Han,
Abiding long between Heaven and Earth.

They rein in at the Dark Feather Terrace,
Soaring to the Nine Origins’ realm,
Where cavernous spirits dwell in profound depths,
Cloud-nets hang suspended in empty ascent.
Below stand the Gatherers of Truth,
Gazing upward to summon the Jade Dawn’s host.
Thrice circling the radiant Yang,
Ninefold returning to the cavern’s wilds,
They ascend in lofty steps to the August Honored One,
Singing the dragon-soaring hymn.

Jade clouds gleam over the northern wastes,
Jasper branches verdantly veil the slopes,
The Nine Numinous Terrace arises in emptiness,
Its luminous essence blazing with grand auroras.
Heaven’s gates turn through layered darkness,
Eons pass in repeated cycles.
Mounting my feathered chariot,
I stride the Weaving Maid’s River,
Preserving the numinous in constant transformation,
Forever forgetting the world’s vastness.

These three stanzas emerge from the Jade Purity Upper Palace. The Nine Yang Jade Chapters and Nine Radiance Jade Maidens ever chant them upon the Flowering Dawn, harmonizing the union of form and soul, awakening the numinous perfected within the hidden passes. For all who cultivate the Seven Origins’ flying steps and traverse the Nine Stars’ Way—without these song-chapters, none may presumptuously ascend the celestial net or tread the Dark Dipper.

*From the* Dongzhen Huiyuan Jiudao Jing *(Scripture of the Ninefold Return to the Origin from the Cavern of Perfection)*

The Primordial Heavenly King bestowed upon the Southern Culmen Lord of Life the *Seventy-Four Transformations of the Upper Clarity* within the Cloud Chamber. At that time, the Three Origins’ Overseer of Perfected Ones, the Upper Origin’s Wuying Emperor, sang the *Song of the Upper Origin’s Cavern Gate Transformation of Inner Perfection*:

Three purities flow through fivefold clouds,
Winding through the ninefold ridges,
Crimson numina open the azure chamber,
Golden radiance blazes in the eastern auroras.
Three dawns illumine the Grand Void,
Upper Clarity’s peaks rise steeply,
Jasper gates coil through winding halls,
Flying tiers interlace in uneven ranks.
Here stand the myriad emperors’ palaces,
Each true one dwelling in their own abode.
Primordial qi is fundamentally the Mysterious One,
Its transformations—what could be more numerous?
Bound in titles through a hundred charts,
Transformations sprout like roots and shoots.
Dispersing numina beyond the nine degrees,
Adorning countenance not with morning blossoms,
They firmly establish the ten-thousand-eon court,
Weaving splendor into a hundred-thousand kalpas’ branches.
The Southern Culmen opens the dark domains,
Wondrously transcending the world’s snares.
Violating prohibitions permits no concealment—
What can one do with frivolous concealments?

The Middle Origin’s Yellow Venerable Emperor sang the *Song of the Middle Origin’s Cavern Transformation of Inner Perfection*:

Lofty, the Three Perfected spread,
Dividing the ninefold numinous qi.
Jade Void arrays eight thrones,
Transformations wheel without trace or reach.
Bound in titles, the myriad emperors roam,
Their life’s work spanning boundless existence.
Jasper palaces tower amid grand auroras,
Golden light suffuses the cavern’s deep mists.
Jade terraces stand in the empyrean,
Flowing essence gleams beneath the purple canopy.
August ones occupy the numinous wastes,
Flying tiers flourish in the grand auroras.
Embracing truth within the Three Elixir Storehouses,
Dispersing numina beyond the nine bounds,
Qi transforms without beginning or end,
Swiftly responding to numinous convergences.
Who can fathom the dark transformations?
Turning countenance, they reverse old age.
The Southern Culmen inherits the dark phoenix,
Thus binding the central girdle.

The Lower Origin’s White Prime Emperor sang the *Song of the Lower Origin’s Cavern Void Transformation of Perfection*:

Towering, the grand aurora’s gates,
Golden portals coil through ninefold layers.
Cinnabar radiance illumines the jasper heavens,
Flying clouds press upon the dark vault.
Divine transformations leave no trace in the court,
True titles bear their original tracks.
Dispersing qi through the nine numinous doors,
Dividing into the myriad emperors’ palaces,
Each emperor has their own realm,
Each true one their own direction.
Silently arising above the auroras,
Obscurely within the Grand Void,
The wheel turns by its own motion,
Ten thousand eons make but one end.
Cavern transformations dwell in the cinnabar numinous grotto,
Vast and distant, the Nine Mysteries commune.
Dark contemplation carries the silent chamber,
Eight effulgences may soar through empty space.
Coiling through the land of transformations,
Wondrous indeed, the Primordial Lord!
The Southern Culmen’s earnest heart stirs,
Thus turning the spirit peaks.
Subtly treading the shifting effulgences,
They arise as the myriad immortals’ lineage.

*From the* Dongzhen Bianhua Qishisi Fang Jing *(Scripture of the Seventy-Four Transformations from the Cavern of Perfection)*

The August Jade Emperor commanded the Upper Palace’s Jade Maidens—Xu Farong, Xiao Huizhong, Tian Sifei, and Li Yunmen—to pluck the cloud zither’s strings, their voices harmonizing as they sang the *Chapters of the Grand Cavern’s Lofty Clarity and Mysterious Precepts*, and the *Poems of the Three Paths and Five Sufferings*:

The Grand Cavern encompasses the Three Bonds,
Primordial transformation holds form and formlessness.
Silent as the rootless teaching,
Yet Xiao and Cao wield numinous might.
Alas! Within the Three Paths,
Sorrow and suffering arise therefrom.
Those who master this precept,
Refine their goodness through kalpas’ ends.
When eons conclude, they are reborn in Heaven,
Their bodies joining sun and moon.
Foolish and deluded, they follow worldly fancies,
Pursuing shallow learning for vain glory.
Proclaiming transformation without discipline,
They lightly leak the Heavenly Treasures’ scriptures.
Their eyes’ karma enters the gates of death,
The Four Poles bind their names.
Soul and spirit tread the Nine Perils,
The Five Sufferings ever entangle them.
Feeding on fire, treading the Blade Mountains,
Their hardships know no moment’s peace.
Sighing at the origins of fortune and misfortune,
How clear they are amid the vast!
The Lofty One’s stern precepts,
Make men lament fortune and misfortune.
The immortal’s path depends on fate,
Yet in darkness, it is already decided.
Without fate, it will not unfold—
Once awakened, suffering is ever greatest.
If one can revere the Mysterious Teachings,
They will naturally transcend the empyrean.
But if they covet the burdens of prison,
Why forcefully seek amusement?
Dwelling in guilt, the Four Luminaries bind,
The dead soul treads the Nine Perils.
Dragged through the Five Sufferings’ courts,
The Three Paths’ bonds never dissolve.
The numinous sinks beneath the Nine Darks,
Ten thousand eons without dawn’s reprieve.
Grieving for the Primordial’s teachings,
How can one not sigh in sorrow?

Vast and distant, above the Nine Mysteries,
Obscurely at the dawn of transformation’s beginning.
Without form, without shadow,
Without depth, without measure.
The Two Modes initiate the unfolding,
Qi coalesces to form sediment.
Three dawns illumine the Primordial Chamber,
Five and nine establish the net’s records.
Fortune and misfortune arise from man,
Good and evil—who indeed decides?
If one can awaken to the Mysterious Teachings,
They will rise transcendent and lofty.
But if they wield the axe of life’s felling,
Transgressions accumulate within the heart’s earth.
Sinking in guilt, the Four Luminaries bind,
Ancestral punishments are truly deserved.
Born bearing the wind’s blades,
The Five Sufferings know no end.
Seven ancestors fill the dark night,
Ten thousand eons make but one reckoning.
Lingering in the Three Paths,
Unawakened to life and death.

*From the* Dongzhen Siji Mingke *(Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles from the Cavern of Perfection)*

**Nine Yang Songs**

Reining in the effulgences upon the dark steps,
Clarifying the true, feasting in Purple Clarity...

**Nine Yang Songs (continued)**

Crimson sleeves sweep the round firmament,
Dragon robes ascend the Great Clarity.
Unfurling reins beyond the lofty void,
Four Elders pass in brocade chariots.
Myriad immortals pay court to the Emperor’s chamber,
Incense smoke arises in the empty air.
Jade terraces array the Primal Ones,
Golden script awaits the Jade Court’s summons.
The Buddha ascends to celestial repose,
Bearing blossoms that radiate numinous splendor.
The body transcends countless kalpas,
The spirit secures peace through myriad ages.
Wandering light draws forth luminous brilliance,
Aligning with the sun’s awaiting decline.
Gossamer winds harness eight chariots,
Riding swiftly to gaze upon the Nine Heavens’ verge.
Tipping banners on the spirit’s summit,
Rosy peaks gird the sky’s expanse.
Hand in hand with the Western August One,
The Jade Dawn becomes my teacher.
Inhaling the pearl blossoms’ nectar,
I perceive the Luminous Pass unfurl.
Within the Tiger-skirted Jade Hall,
I soar with the Twin Effulgences.
Yoking my chariot from the Nine Mysteries,
The Golden Chamber stands serene and still.
Dragon carriages ride the Three Clouds,
Divine winds fan the flying mists.
Bathing in the Weaving Maiden’s River,
Feasting with the Lofty Primordial Ones.
Together we array the radiant dances,
Ever guests amid the void.
Wandering the Two Boundless Realms,
Inward vision entangles itself.
Beyond the Nine Rosy Mists,
Eternally preserving countless eons.
Evening lodged in the Western Flower Hall,
Each dawn with the Fusang Lord.
Vast and bright, gazing upon the Great Void,
The spirit’s path knows no round or square.
Purple reins gather the Five Clouds,
Parting the skies to tread the numinous winds.
Turning the chariot toward the Winding Mound,
Dragon coaches usher in the True August One.
To the left, the Vast Radiance’s worthy is recorded,
To the right, the Four Seas’ lads are summoned.
The numinous phoenix sings with golden flutes,
The spirit tiger arrays celestial bells.
Ever with the Mysterious Effulgence’s origin,
Roaming carefree amid the dawn’s rosy clouds.
Banners soar to fan the Broad Cold,
Swaying the Morning Star’s palace.
Purple brilliance streams with cascading light,
Nine rosy mists veil the vast heavens.
Morning enters the Hall of Rare Woods,
Evening feasts in the Crimson Subtle Chamber.
The Three Qi merge in soaring eaves,
Double pivots turn the divine winds.
Chanting dispels the demonic verses,
All four seats intone the numinous hymns.
Perched and settled beyond the kalpas,
Dwelling in form through ten thousand eons.
Resounding in the Grand Tenuity’s precincts,
Towering in the Nine Mysteries’ abode.
Within, the Hold-Fast-to-Quiet worthies,
Where flute notes still the dark depths.
To the west, the Six Ridge Masters,
Seeking radiance to converse at dawn.
Neither imperial guests nor flying immortals’ companions,
I transcend with feathered canopy,
Wandering the limpid islets.
Opening the void above the Eight Poles,
Lofty mists ascend with the light’s rise.
Reining the winds to the Three Heavens,
Forever feasting in the Mysterious Chamber.
The Northern Asterism knots the Vermilion Lodge,
Suspended like the Nine Void Peaks.
Flying chariots attend the Rosy Summit,
Dragon skirts brush the lofty effulgences.
Eight winds unfurl brocade carriages,
Six Qi issue from the Jade Well.
Resplendent, the round wheel blazes,
Five skies veil the radiant glow.
Resting without end through kalpas,
The empty reins know no leisurely stillness.
Urging the chariot through the Mysterious Desert,
Silken reins guide through the Hall of Rare Woods.
Subtle wonders meet the primal chaos,
Eternal fans stir the Five Mists.
Eight scenes halt the jade wheels,
Pure coaches behold the luminous true.
To the left, tread the flying journey,
To the right, gaze upon the Eight Heavens.
Vast and open, ascending the Harmonious Dawn,
Looking up to grasp the August Center’s hand.
Utterly at ease, the Mysterious Principle unites,
The numinous wondrous embodies the spirit’s treasure.
Morning feasts at the Southern Flower Gate,
Evening bows in the Jade Dawn’s court.
Tiny and still, the chariot amid quietude,
Eight scenes fan the cloud carriages.
The Mysterious Terrace knots the Nine Rosy Mists,
Crimson ranks descend the verdant essence.
Hidden mushrooms array the secluded steps,
Phoenix brains illumine the Five Cities.
The Three Origins’ coaches bear green banners,
Enduring winds display majestic radiance.
Above, they summon the void’s immortals,
Drawing me with the Vermilion Fire Bell.
Ten absolutes command myriad demons,
Forever preserving the qi’s harmonious arising.

True Persons’ hymns and verses,
In the Supreme Four-Flowered Palace,
And within the Mysterious Pass’ Jade Terrace,
Upon the Windy Mysterious Mound’s chambers,
Are sung by divine lads and maidens,
Also to instruct those destined for the Dao below,
That those who should become immortals may hear and chant them.

**Six Yin Songs**

Flying winds scatter the dark waves,
The azure billows begin at the radiant cliffs.
Linked waves tower like mountain peaks,
Abyssal surges surpass the Nine Heavens’ verge.
Transcending the drowning ford’s edge,
Rejoicing in the Heavenly Blade’s stream.
Flying billows ride the whirlwind,
Clouds and waters sprinkle the dark ladder.
Buoyantly ascending the Flower Lads,
Morning roaming the Four Directions’ terrace.
Turning light to the Grand Mystery’s consort,
Bearing sashes that entwine and bind.
Responding to the destiny’s grand assembly,
Summoning one another to hasten the appointed time.
Ten thousand kalpas form one pact,
A thousand eons never part.
Commanding the chariot from the Three Mysteries,
Drifting and flying through the Milky Way.
Guests of the August Great Harmony’s court,
Where Yu Yi gazes upon the Pure Void.
Knots of radiance beyond the smoky verge,
Seeking light where the Seven Voids blaze.
White dragons soar the Purple Heaven,
Wandering the Nameless Lodge without end.
Dragon banners turn the jade wheels,
Four luminaries scatter with the light.
For now, awaiting the time’s communion,
Warming until the Perfect Dao’s dawn.
The Two Mysteries transcend towering peaks,
The Jade Terrace’s wondrous waves gleam.
Nine Qi entwine the hidden mushrooms,
Ten thousand ages knot the trailing vines.
Vast and empty, the Primal Simplicity’s light,
Numinous brilliance illumines the dawn’s river.
Treading between the Two Mysteries,
Looking up to grasp the Round Essence’s motion.
Jade cinnabar offered to the divine true,
Years reckoned beyond countless kalpas.
At times veiled in the Nine Numinous Chamber,
Moving through the Two Revolutions’ change.
Morning feasts in the Effulgent Yang Palace,
Climbing radiance where virtue is concentrated.
Wandering the Double Mystery’s summit,
Fluttering, descending flying dragons.
Aligned beyond the Eight Falls,
Lofty steps in the Heavenly Gate’s chamber.
Scattering winds arise in the cinnabar room,
Clouds gather in the winding depths.
The leisurely realm refines the Standard Child,
Refining the pure in the vast heavens.
Eternal continuity holds the scene within,
Dragon mists gird the mountain’s visage.
Empty and absolute, the Broad Cold’s abode,
The utmost numinous and the Dao’s wonder unite.
Accumulating stillness, the Mysterious Eight Openings,
Silken mists veil the eternal thoroughfare.
I ascend within the Yang’s vastness,
Empty winds harness the divine winds.
Cloud terraces illumine the Northern Mystery,
Dragon springs plumb the secluded peaks.
Jade essences circle the dark ravines,
White blossoms crown the hollow summits.
Chewing the Dragon Chamber’s qi,
The spirit embryo endures the Nine Heavens.
The High Mystery fixes the golden script,
The Two Luminaries part the rosy tips.
Yoking the chariot within the Great Desert,
Vast and empty, attaining eternal stillness.
The Western Mystery’s roots are dense and deep,
Lofty radiance brushes the blazing light.
Tiny and distant, the flowing rosy mists clear,
Nurturing light to part the vast purity.
The chamber’s purity enfolds the Double Fire,
Serene wonders lodge in orchid’s birth.
Commanding the chariot to fly the Eight Scenes,
Fans gather as they turn toward the southern verge.
Soaring above the Yang’s brilliance,
Tigers roar in the Eight Poles’ city.
Though ten thousand miles seem distant,
A moment’s transcendence defies lingering spirits.

At the lofty assembly lies wondrous delight,
The upright chariot expounds its essence refined.
The Supreme Dao shines deep and luminous,
Wisdom arrives, warming the sutras of wisdom.

The Supreme Lord’s Perfected Eight Pure Spirit Yin and Three Harmonies Songs, six chapters in all,
Tune the Purple Sovereign’s Jade Consort and the Darkly Balanced Jade Pipes,
Settling the rhythms of their notes.
To the right: Yin Songs and Yang Songs,
Fifteen chapters in total.
The Supreme Jade Dawn Lord of the Great Dao commanded the Grand Simplicity Perfected,
the Hua Xia Noble Scion, and the Grand Culmen Purple Yang Duke Lu Xu to compose and sing the Eight Pure Perfected,
That those who chant them ceaselessly may cause their essence-spirit to merge with the music,
Their five spirits to harmonize,
And the myriad evils to be barred from entry.
The beauty of these songs—
The Grand Culmen Purple Yang Duke’s Yang Songs, nine chapters,
Illuminate the Dao of the Nine Dawns;
The Yin Songs, six chapters,
Benefit the essence of the Six Qi.
Those who chant them concentrate the Three Spirits,
Those who possess them dispel misfortune.

From *The Supreme Perfected’s Eight Pure Yang Songs, Nine Chapters*

The Orthodox Unity Perfected addressed Zhao Sheng, saying:
“The Nine Heavens’ Thearchs commanded the Plain Girl to compose the Yin Songs, nine chapters,
To harmonize with the Yang Songs.
Scholars who practice the Dao recite and chant them.
Eastward they roam the peaks of Penglai,
Westward they cross the Nine Rivers’ ford.
Flying Sanskrit ascends to the void above,
Shaking forth radiance upon the heavens.”

Amidst the flowering groves they rest and roam,
What fear of failing to attain long years?
Northward they wander to the isles of sea,
Southward they tread the forest’s wild frontier.
Lush verdure glows in double-bright array,
Crimson phoenix leads her fledglings’ cry.
Once worldly glory’s bonds are cast aside,
Why not treasure the immortal’s dwelling high?

The Yin Songs resound in sorrowful refrain,
Chanted by the lofty immortals’ choir.
Roaming free on Song Peak’s soaring heights,
They rise through emptiness to heaven’s sphere.
The Eight Tones’ hymns in measured cadence flow,
Subtle wonders waft upon the breeze.
Wandering the limpid woods they pause to share
Verses with the sages, hand in hand they go.

The Eight Tones in solemn chant ascend,
Gentle winds bear the sacred hymn aloft.
In tranquil night a plaintive song takes flight,
Twin Yin melodies in harmony arise.
The weaving maid pours forth her homeward lay,
A poignant sorrow stirs the heart’s deep core.
If not a lofty immortal, how could one
Preserve the true and wise forevermore?

In the distant Spirit Dawn’s celestial grove,
Immortals soar to reach the Mystic Garden’s height.
The Nine and Five cannot be held for long,
Why covet then the Eight Tones’ fleeting sound?
The Five Notes of palace and zither mourn,
Only the Nine Yang’s gaze can bring delight.
First one hears the lonely soul’s lament,
Then finds no joy in the secluded mystery’s door.

The Mystic Sanskrit soars to empty skies,
Resplendent, beckoning the exalted spirits on.
Fear only the lack of steadfast resolve,
Not that the heart may fail in purity.
Once entered in the Cavern Chamber’s void,
What worry that the Dao may not be won?

Majestic stands the Imperial Culmen’s hall,
Resplendent gleam the Jade Grove’s radiant bowers.
Flying rosy clouds descend in streaming light,
Twin luminaries reveal their jade-like grace.
The phoenix bears the sacred script in beak,
Chanting aloud to gladden primal power.
Wandering visions waft the Sanskrit breath,
Flying songs pause with the Jade Perfected’s presence.

The Yin Songs’ subtle recitation flows,
The Western Melody enters the Two Ease.
Yang Songs harmonize with Yin’s response,
Twin dances whirl in graceful, fluttering flight.
Abandon now the journey of worldly fame,
Let lofty immortals bind our kinship true.
Carefree, what realm do we traverse now?
Entering and exiting the Gates of Myriad Wonders’ door.

Jade Capital showers forth compassion’s grace,
Golden Towers spread their boundless favor wide.
Following to the Tortoise Mountain’s lodge,
Singing, laughing in the Fusang’s sacred grove.
Long abiding in the Great One’s dwelling,
Returning life to bow before the Three Honored Ones.

From *The Scripture of the Three Sovereigns*

Dragon banners dance in the Great Void,
Flying wheels course the Five Peaks’ slopes.
Wherever they roam, all is carefree,
Stirred by feeling, they raise dark hymns.
Non-reliance surpasses reliance,
Yet through encounter, harmony is found.
Why deem the Canglang’s waters too remote?
The Mystic Well is not deemed overfull.

In dense seclusion, step by step they seek,
All converging within the Four Seas’ net.
How could it compare to beyond the Radiant’s edge,
Where three kalpas pass but once?
Swiftly they depart from Western Flower,
Between non-reliance and reliance’s span.
Now gazing at the Five Peaks’ summits high,
Now leaping the Celestial River’s ford.

Releasing the wheel, they seek the empty boat,
Wherever they go, all is bound in bliss.
A mustard seed suddenly becomes ten thousand acres,
Within it lies Mount Penglai’s height.
Small and great are fundamentally not distinct,
Far and near share the selfsame bond.
They act as reliance comes,
I act in non-reliance’s sight.

In the Ninth Flower’s Peaceful Consort’s song,
According to *Declarations of the Perfected*,
Within non-reliance’s Great Non-Being,
Reliance’s vast expanse has bounds.
Small and great are waves upon one sea,
Far and near converge in one meeting’s tide.
Plucking strings on the Mystic Dawn’s peak,
Golden flutes conduct the Eight Qi’s flow.
Why not revel in the spirit’s wine,
Gaze with joy upon the Nine Clans’ pride?

Being and non-being attain the Mystic’s turn,
The two reliances thus interlace.
From *The Song of the Azure Lad of Square Vessel*,
The Perfected of Southern Peak’s Great Void sings:

Riding the whirlwind, fanning the Great Void,
Eight Sceneries soar in lofty clarity.
Above, they float beyond the Purple Dawn,
Below, they gaze upon the abyss’s end.
The Mystic Heart dwells in the empty cavern’s midst,
Above and below, no drifting, no pause.
Within the two reliances’ bounds,
Reliance has no place to strive.

Embodying non-being, one can die,
Embodying being, one preserves life.
Eastward they gather for the lofty chant,
Why dispute the two reliances’ worth?

From *The Song of the Central Candidate Lady*,
The Purple Prime Lady’s song:

Mystic resonance lies beyond all forms,
Harmonious sounds arise from principle’s own call.
Spirit clouds gather in the Purple Dawn,
Orchid winds fan the green-tasseled carriage’s way.
The Highest Perfected feast in Jade Terrace’s halls,
Far removed, they stand as earthly immortals’ mark.
What they seek is noble, far-reaching advance,
Thus they flourish, surpassing all in grace.

Delighting in those Eight Pure Scripts,
The Dao’s attainment was never far.
How can worldly affairs be foreseen?
They cause your form and qi to fade away.

From *The Scripture of True Traces*

The Four Perfected descended to the Southern Peak’s Lady.
Thereupon, the Perfected of the Grand Culmen intoned *The Song of Fanning the Void*:

Cinnabar radiance blazes in Highest Clarity,
Eight Winds stir the Great Rosy Clouds.
Turning my Spirit Dawn’s chariot around,
I arrive at the Jade Ridge’s slopes.
Alas! Beyond heaven and earth,
The Nine Enclosures are all my home.
Above, I gather the sun’s midst essence,
Below, I drink the Yellow Moon’s bloom.

In the spirit’s vision, emptiness alone,
The Peng’s path knows no idle evil.
Glancing back, I see Wei Xian’an,
Turbid qi harms your harmony.
Diligently refine the Mystic’s thoughts,
Once the Dao is attained, we’ll meet again.

Next, the Azure Lad of Square Vessel sang:

Great Rosy Clouds fan the spirit’s splendor,
Nine Qi have no constant form.
Mystic reins fly beyond the dawn,
Eight Sceneries ride in lofty clarity.
Holding the Jade Thearch’s sleeves,
They bear me to be born in the dawn’s midst.
Gazing upon the Seven Luminaries’ chambers,
Bright and clear, yet also dark and deep.

Surpassing! O son of the Wei clan,
You have both heart and feeling.
Mystic excellence arises from joyous meeting,
Your name inscribed in Golden Script on Eastern Flower.
Xian’an, what you secretly refine,
We pledge to meet at Yang Luo’s banks.

Next, the Divine King of Fusang sang:

At dawn, the Grand Thearch’s hall is opened,
Leaping beyond the Gourd’s waters wide.
The Azure Sea’s jade waves take flight,
Linked peaks stand tall as mountains’ height.
Floating wheels amid the cloudy waves,
Nine Dragons rise together, reins held tight.
Tiger banners glow at Rosy Ford,
Spirit winds unfurl in ordered might.

Hua Cun has long delighted in the Dao,
Thus attaining the lofty spirits’ likeness.
Uprooted and moved beyond the Three Bonds,
The meeting of resonance now begins.
We pledge to meet at Yang Luo’s palace,
Once the Dao is attained, to bear Wei’s son away.

Next, the Perfected of Pure Emptiness sang:

Swiftly driving, controlling Pure Emptiness,
They linger in the Western Flower’s lodge.
Jade wheels turn as dawn’s last light,
Tiger banners disperse in misty haze.
Kind winds stir the cinnabar pennants,
Bright torches illumine the Eightfold Radiance.
Loosening robes within the wall’s embrace,
Divine bells chime with sparkling grace.

Dwelling in light like forest branches,
Nine strings plucked within the Mystic’s core.
They lift from me the sorrows of a thousand ages,
Release the sighs of a thousand years.
Joyful gazes know no end,
Through the night, they await the dawn.

He sang again:

Amidst purple haze, the mystic void whirls,
Divine winds know no ridge’s bound.
In an instant, the Nine Realms are filled,
Dazzling, the vast emptiness opens—serene.
The Eight Windows shine without constancy,
Now dark, now bright, in shifting glow.
Gazing through the Three Cinnabar Fields,
Silent, still—form and shadow arise.
Mind congeals within the Mud-Pill Palace,
How radiant the Purple Chamber gleams!
The Supreme Emperor commands my coming,
As if answering a divine summons.
I meet my sister-disciples,
Their cloud-borne grace, their carriage poised and bright.
Ashamed, like jade cut by a master’s hand,
I refine their innate brilliance yet more.
Lush and dense, the Way of Nurturing Life,
Dissolving knots of calamity and blight.
The sacred tryst has its appointed hour,
Hand in hand, we ride forth together.

Thereupon, the Lady received the investiture rites in full. Then the Queen Mother of the West, the Saintly Lord of the Golden Portal, the Primordial Lord of the Southern Culmen, the Lady of the Ninefold Subtlety, the Queen Mother of Tortoise Mountain, the Three Primordial Ladies Feng Shuang, Li Zhu, and Zi Yang, the Left Immortal Duke Shi Lucheng, the High Immortal of the Supreme Ultimate Yan Gai, and the Noble Scion—all lingered in divine revelry the livelong day, discoursing on stillness and delving into the formless. The Perfected of the Upper Realms circled in radiant flight, their feathered canopies askew. Each commanded her attendant maidens to array the tuned melodies, golden and stone instruments resounding, a tumult of voices rising. Phoenix flutes swirled on the wind, simurghs sang with chiming jade, the Nine Clouds kept time, the Eight Sounds scattered in splendor.

Then the White Queen Mother rose, pacing as she stood, bending low to intone. Her brocade sleeves gathered the dawn, her cloud-skirt rode the void. Tinkling pendants flashed and gleamed, her sash and girdle hung with luminous jade. At her left hip, the Dragon Script; at her right, the Tiger Seal. Her form composed, her bearing graceful, her four limbs at ease—she struck the rhythm and sang:

I mount my Eightfold Radiance chariot,
Swiftly ascending into Jade Clarity.
Dragon skirts sweep the celestial vault,
Tiger banners command the crimson hosts.

At the carefree bounds of the Mystic Ford,
the myriad streams never pause for a moment.
Alas, these partings and meetings—
when kalpas end, heaven and earth collapse.
One must seek the scene within the Void,
where there is neither death nor birth.
Embodying that natural Dao,
in silent contemplation merge with the Great Obscurity.

The Southern Marchmount towers with true essence,
its jade luster gleaming with keen spirit.
Those who bear no burdens in their affairs
receive the numinous in the emptiness of their hearts.
Within the Crimson Mound’s joyous gathering,
together we delight without end.

The Three Primordials’ Ladies—Feng Shuang, Li Zhu, and Ziyang—plucked their cloud-lutes and sang in reply:

From Jade Clarity beyond the Nine Heavens,
the divine halls soar beyond the flying rosy clouds.
The cloud-terrace gleams, towering and grand,
the numinous summer luxuriant with verdant splendor.
Five-colored clouds rise with emerald radiance,
the Eight Winds stir the green qi.
Gazing upward, they chant to dissolve demonic songs;
bending low, they study wisdom and insight.
The myriad perfected ones unfurl the dawn’s light,
singing of the Crimson Chamber’s assembly.
The virtuous child of resonant power stands forth,
her divine radiance soars on high.
The Celestial Marchmount ascends in empty construction,
the cloud-terrace deeply secluded and profound.
Roaming the sea, one awakens to the well’s narrowness;
treading the real, one perceives the world’s filth.
Dancing wheels feast in the layered chambers,
the fish-trap and fish naturally fade away.
I turn to the great *chun* net,
forever parting from the ephemeral world of morning-born beings.

---

From the *Scripture of the Dao’s Traces*:

The Most High Sage Thearch,
at the inception of the Ninefold Mystery’s qi,
when the void and numinous first divided,
ascended to the nine-tiered, sevenfold-luminous Crimson Palace.
He wandered above the bright rosy clouds,
in the desolate vastness of the Nine Emptinesses.
The Western Consort struck the rhythm,
heavenly maidens arrayed their chimes.
Dragons roared, tigers blew,
simurghs danced, phoenixes sang.
The Four Perfected joined in song,
the Eight Sounds harmonized in unison.
The cloud-zithers rang out clearly,
shaking the Three Clarities with their overwhelming splendor.

---

From the *Seven Saints’ Primordial Record of the Wondrous and True*:

The Supreme Clarity’s Western Radiance Purple Consort and the Queen Mother of the West
each commanded their attendant maiden Wang Tingxian of Broad Splendor and others
to pluck the cloud-jade zithers.
They also commanded the attendant maiden Andeyin Fan Quzhu
to strike the Kunming jars.
They further commanded the attendant maiden Zuobaorong Han Longbin
to blow the phoenix and simurgh flutes.
And they commanded the attendant maidens Zhao Yunzi and Li Qingyu
to tap the flowing-gold stones.

---

From the *Declarations of the Perfected*:

The Lady of the Southern Culmen said:
The lesser Shangxian immortals of the Fangzhu often play the Nine Numinous Flutes for their own amusement.
Those who can play them are heard forty *li* away.
The flutes have thirty holes,
are two or three *chi* in length,
and when nine flutes play together,
the hundred beasts dance in joy,
and phoenixes and birds come to harmonize with the sound.

---

From the *Perfect Writ of the Great Cavern*:

The Queen Mother of the West performed music for Mao Ying,
commanding her attendant maiden Wang Shanghua
to play the Eight Jade Zithers.
She also commanded the attendant maiden Dong Shuangcheng
to blow the cloud-harmony reed pipes.
She further commanded the attendant maiden Shi Gongzi
to strike the Kunting bells.
And she commanded the attendant maiden Xu Feiqiong
to beat the quaking-numinous jade chimes.
She also commanded the attendant maiden Wan Jueqing
to tap the Wuling stones.
She further commanded the attendant maiden Fan Chengjun
to strike the cavern-yin chime-stones.
And she commanded the attendant maiden Duan Anxiang
to perform the intricate melodies of the *chanbian*.
Then all the sounds blended together,
the numinous music startling the heavens.
The Queen Mother commanded her attendant maidens Yu Shanbin and Li Longsun
to sing the *Mystic Cloud* melody, whose lyrics say:

Though the Great Image may seem desolate,
I grasp the gate of the Nine Heavens.
Parting the clouds, I float on the Eight Radiances,
in an instant descending to the lower earth.

The Great Emperor intones the *Fu Palace* melody—
who could fathom the bitterness of wind and dust?
The Perfected Lady of Supreme Truth, Wang,
at times plays the zither herself.
Her zither has but one string yet yields the five notes,
its lofty tones resounding for miles around.
All the birds gather in the grotto-chambers,
circling and soaring, driven away yet unwilling to depart—
surely this is the music of heaven and humankind,
the wondrous sound of spontaneity.

The Four Perfected descend to the quiet chamber of the Lady of the Southern Marchmount,
where they receive her and inquire about the constricted affairs of the mortal world,
the laws governing women’s governance.
Though she is called a lofty spirit,
there is nothing she has not thoroughly examined.
Thus, their discourse and feast proceed in rough outline.
The Four Perfected chant and sing,
and the Perfected of the Great Ultimate first commands
Song Dexiao, the Jade Maiden of the Northern Frigid Realm,
to play the *Nine Qi* zither.
Next, the Azure Lad of the Fangzhu commands
Yan Jingzhu, the Jade Maiden of the Eastern Florescence,
to strike the bell of the Western Fullness.
The Spirit-King of Fusang’s Yang Valley further commands
Jia Quting, the Jade Maiden of Cloud Forest,
to blow the phoenix-cry xiao.
The Perfected of Pure Emptiness then commands
Xianyu Lingjin, the Jade Maiden of Flying Mystery,
to tap the *Ninefold Jade Rhythm*.

*(From the* Dao Ji Jing*)*

The Most High Dao Lord observes a pure fast and upholds the precepts
in the Jade Realm of Xina, atop the Floating Gauze Peak of Yucha Mountain.
The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning rides the *Eightfold Radiance Jade Chariot*,
borne by the *Threefold Simplicity Flying Clouds*,
adorned with a jade wheel and feathered canopy,
its five-colored effulgence of blossoming light.
Divine winds and dark drums resound,
distant dances unfurl their banners,
jade groves tremble with echoes,
jade branches stir the flutes,
cloud-songs soar through the void,
phoenixes cry in the great mystery,
heavenly harmonies ring clear,
myriad sounds converge in wild harmony.
Divine consorts join in chorus,
while the host of immortals sway in graceful procession.

The Celestial Worthy further commands
the Jade Maiden of Flying Mystery from the Golden Numinous Upper Palace of the Western Florescence,
the Perfected of the Radiant August,
to play the *Fivefold Harmony* zither.
The *Cloud Dragon Jade Zither* is strummed,
the *Nine Phoenix* xiao is blown,
the *Divine Continent* sheng is sounded.
The heavens each perform their divine dragon arts and music,
an innumerable throng.

*(From the* Dongxuan Kongdong Lingzhang*)*

Thus concludes the twentieth scroll of the *Supreme Secret Essentials*.

**Section on the Governance of the Orthodox Unity *Qi***

On the seventh day of the first month of the second year of Han’an in the reign of the Supreme, at midday, the Twenty-Four Governances descended—eight upper, eight middle, and eight lower—corresponding to the twenty-four *qi* of Heaven and the twenty-eight lunar lodgings, bestowed upon Celestial Master Zhang Daoling to uphold and propagate.

On the seventh day of the seventh month of the first year of Shanghuang, the Supreme Great Dao Lord Lao established the eight upper-grade governances:
Yangping Governance, corresponding above to the Horn Mansion, governing within the Shu Commandery.
Lutang Governance, corresponding above to the Neck Mansion, governing upon the Upper Immortal Terrace, an ancient site of transcendence. Formerly, in the first year of Yongshou, the Supreme Lord Lao led Celestial Master Zhang here, where he governed alongside the Four Garrisons, the Grand General of the Year Star, and the hundred spirits of river shrines. Together, they split stone to make covenants, all submitting to the Orthodox Unity Alliance of Might.
Heming Mountain Governance, corresponding above to the Root Mansion, its mountain connected to the Celestial Stronghold Mountain of Qingcheng. It is also said that Master Yin presides here, also within the Shu Commandery.
Liyuan Mountain Governance, corresponding above to the Chamber Mansion, connected to Lutang Mountain, above which lies the Shu Commandery.
Gegui Mountain Governance, corresponding above to the Heart Mansion, connected to Liyuan Mountain, above which stands Xiangli Mountain, also within the Shu Commandery.
Gengchu Governance, corresponding above to the Tail Mansion, its mountain rising three hundred and ninety *chi* above the plain. At times, immortals come and go here, where one may transcend calamity and nurture nature. Formerly, this was where Zhang Lishi attained the Dao. The mountain contains two stone chambers and three dragon heads, within the Guanghan region.
Qinzhong Governance, corresponding above to the Winnowing Basket Mansion. Formerly, Han Zhong attained transcendence upon this mountain, within the Guanghan Commandery.
Zhenduo Governance, corresponding above to the Dipper Mansion. Its mountain rises two hundred and eighty *zhang*, upon which grow divine mushrooms and numinous herbs, also within the Guanghan Commandery.

On the fifth day of the tenth month of the first year of Wuji, the Orthodox True Non-Ultimate Supreme established the eight middle governances...

Changli Governance, corresponding above to the Ox Mansion. Formerly, this was where Li Babai first studied the Dao, wandering among the famous mountains of Shu. Daily, he would appear at play in the Chengdu marketplace at sunrise and lodge upon Mount Qingcheng by dusk. To the south of the mountain lies a stone chamber, before which stand three Dragon Gates, also within the Guanghan Commandery.

Lishang Governance, corresponding above to the Woman Mansion. Formerly, Master Li Zi studied the Dao and attained flying transcendence here. The mountain contains two stone chambers and a divine spring, where white deer, white turtledoves, and white swans come at times to drink, also within the Guanghan Commandery.

Yongquan Governance, corresponding above to the Emptiness Mansion. Formerly, Ma Mingsheng studied the Dao and attained transcendence here. The Supreme Lord Lao came to this place, transforming his form to visit this governance. Above it lies a spring whose waters cure the illnesses of the myriad people without fail. Later generations transmitted this as "incantation water." The governance lies within the Suining Commandery.

Chougeng Governance, corresponding above to the Rooftop Mansion. The governance lies nine *li* from the Min Mountain and Jiang River. The mountain rises one thousand seven hundred *zhang* above the plain. Formerly, this was where the Yellow Emperor, Xuanyuan, studied the Dao. The mountains and ridges to the left and right of this governance are all connected in succession. To the northwest of the mountain flows the Mo River, and the mountain also bears divine mushrooms and numinous herbs, within the Qianwei Commandery.

Beiping Governance, corresponding above to the House Mansion. Upon the mountain lies a pool. The mountain spans two hundred *bu* in length and breadth, and within it grow divine mushrooms and numinous herbs. Formerly, this was where Wang Ziqiao attained transcendence, also within the Qianwei Commandery.

Benzhu Governance, corresponding above to the Wall Mansion. The mountain rises one thousand three hundred *zhang*, upon which lies a stream. To the north of the governance stands a fragrant grove, and a dragon cavern with an earthen passage connects to Mount Emei. Formerly, this was where Guo Zi attained the Dao, also within the Qianwei Commandery.

Mengqin Governance, corresponding above to the Straddler Mansion. The mountain rises one thousand *zhang*. Formerly, Yi Yin studied the Dao upon this mountain, where grow golden-fluid mushrooms and herbs of immortality. Those who consume them transcend the world, within the Yuexi Commandery.

Pinggai Governance, corresponding above to the Harvester Mansion. At the foot of the mountain stands a jade figure, thirteen *chi* in height. Formerly, Cui Xiaotong of Wu Commandery studied the Dao upon this mountain and attained flying transcendence, also within the Qianwei Commandery.

On the seventh day of the first month of the second year of Wuji Shanghuang, the Primordial Dao Lord, Mysterious Elder, established the eight lower governances:

Yuntai Governance, corresponding above to the Stomach Mansion. Formerly, Celestial Master Zhang, leading three hundred seventy disciples, resided upon this mountain governance. After two years of teaching and transformation, they ascended to heaven in broad daylight. One year later, the Celestial Master’s wife also ascended to heaven. This is the very place where Zhao Sheng plucked the peaches, within the Baxi Commandery.

Jinkou Governance, corresponding above to the Pleiades Mansion. Formerly, Chen Anshi studied the Dao upon this mountain and attained transcendence. The mountain is also called Mount Pingyuan, within the Hanzhong Commandery.

Houcheng Governance, corresponding above to the Net Mansion. Formerly, Xia Ziran studied the Dao upon this mountain and attained transcendence. It is also called Mount Huangling, within the Hanzhong Commandery.

Gongmu Governance, corresponding above to the Turtle Beak Mansion. Su Ziyu studied the Dao upon this mountain and attained transcendence. It is also called Mount Beifengxian, within the Hanzhong Commandery.

Pinggang Governance, corresponding above to the Three Stars Mansion. Formerly, Li A studied the Dao upon this mountain and attained transcendence, within the Qianwei Commandery.

Zhubu Governance, corresponding above to the Well Mansion. Formerly, Wang Xing studied the Dao upon this mountain and attained transcendence. It is also called Mount Qiuchang, within the Qianwei Commandery.

Yuju Governance, corresponding above to the Ghost Mansion. On the seventh day of the first month of the first year of Yongshou, the Supreme Lord Lao rode a white deer, and Celestial Master Zhang rode a white swan, coming to sit upon a jade bed with carved legs. Thus, it was named Yuju Governance, to the left of the south gate of Chengdu.

Beimang Governance, corresponding above to the Willow Mansion. Formerly, Wucheng Zi studied immortality upon this mountain and attained the Dao, within the Jingzhao Commandery.

On the seventh day of the seventh month of the first year of Han’an, the Celestial Master established the twenty-four governances, entrusting them to his successor to correspond with the twenty-eight mansions.

Ganghu Governance, on Mount Lanwu, corresponding to the Star Mansion.
Baishi Governance, on Mount Xuanji, corresponding to the Extended Net Mansion.
Jushan Governance, on Mount Fanyang, corresponding to the Wings Mansion.
Zhongmao Governance, on Mount Yuandong, corresponding to the Axletree Mansion.
The above four governances all lie within the Hongyang Commandery.

The successor, in the second year of Jian’an on the fifth day of the tenth month, established the eightfold configuration as ordained by the Celestial Master:

Liyuan Governance, on Mount Xuanchang;
Lili Governance, on Mount Gaozhang;

Pinggong Governance, on Mount Zhongtou;
Gongmu Governance, on Mount Shenxiong;
Tiantai Governance, on Mount Huangniu;
Laixiang Governance, on Mount Xiaoshi;
Daiyuan Governance, on Mount Shangdang.

The Celestial Master, in the second year of Taiyuan on the seventh day of the first month, established the eight *kouyou* governances:

Emei Governance, within Shu Commandery;
Qingcheng Governance, within Shu Commandery;
Taihua Governance, within Jingzhao Commandery;
Huangjin Governance, within Shu Commandery;
Cimu Governance, within Chengshan Commandery;
Hefeng Governance, within Shangdang Commandery;
Pingdu Governance, within Ba Commandery;
Jiyang Governance, within Wei Commandery.

The above is from *The Chart of Orthodox Unity Qi Governances*.

**Scroll Twenty-Three of *The Supreme Secret Essentials* concludes.**
**Scroll Twenty-Four of *The Supreme Secret Essentials*: The Three Treasures**

The Heavenly Treasure Lord is the august deity of the Great Cavern.
The Heavenly Treasure Elder is the ancestral qi of the Heavenly Treasure Lord.
The Elder is the qi of the Primal Jade Sovereign of the Chaos of Undifferentiated Great Nonbeing—nine myriad, nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine hundred million qi. Later, in the first year of the Dragon Han era, the Heavenly Treasure Lord was transformed into being. At the time of revealing the scriptures, he was titled the Supreme Great Possessor of the Jade Clarity Palace.

The Numinous Treasure Lord is the august deity of the Cavern Mystery.
The Numinous Treasure Elder is the ancestral qi of the Numinous Treasure Lord.
The Elder is the qi of the Primal Jade Void of the Crimson Chaos of Undifferentiated Great Nonbeing—nine myriad, nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine myriad qi. Later, in the era of the Dragon Han’s unfolding chart, the Numinous Treasure Lord was transformed into being. After one kalpa, in the first year of the Crimson Brightness era, at the time of revealing the scriptures to deliver humankind, he was titled the Jade Capital of the Seven Treasures of the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Upper Clarity Mystic Metropolis.

The Divine Treasure Lord is the august deity of the Cavern Spirit.
The Divine Treasure Elder is the ancestral qi of the Divine Treasure Lord.
The Elder is the qi of the Primal Jade Void of the Profound Stillness and Mystic Pervasion—nine myriad, nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety myriad qi. Later, in the first year of the Crimson Brightness era, the Divine Treasure Lord was transformed into being. After two kalpas, in the first year of the Supreme Sovereign era, at the time of revealing the scriptures, he was titled the Supreme Clarity Great Ultimate Palace of the Three Sovereigns’ Cavern Spirit.

Though these three titles differ in name and era, their root is one and the same. They divide into the Three Qi of the Mysterious Primordial to govern the Three Treasures, all being the august deities of the Three Qi.

The above is from *The Cavern Mystery Scripture of the Nine Heavens*.

---

The Three Treasures are: first, the Treasure of the Dao; second, the Treasure of the Most High Scriptures; third, the Treasure of the Dharma Masters.
It is also said that the Three Venerables are: first, the Venerable Dao; second, the Venerable Most High Scriptures; third, the Venerable Dharma Masters.

The above is from *The Cavern Mystery Scripture of Petition and Inquiry*.

---

I possess Three Treasures, which I safeguard and uphold.
The first is compassion; the second, frugality; the third, not daring to be foremost in the world.
Through compassion, one may be courageous; through frugality, one may be expansive; through not daring to be foremost in the world, one may become the chief of vessels.
Now, to abandon compassion yet seek courage, to abandon frugality yet seek expanse, to abandon the rear yet seek the fore—this is death.
Through compassion, one prevails in battle and stands firm in defense. Heaven will deliver him, shielding him with compassion.

The above is from *The Scripture of Virtue of Laozi*.

**The True Writ**

**The True Writ**

At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy was seated in the Cypress Mound Lodge within the Crimson Clarity World, beneath the Long Mulberry in the Fragrant Garden, together with the Five Venerable Thearchs, the Great Saints of the Ten Directions, the Host of Boundless Perfected Ones, and the Assembly of Noble Elders. As the Heavenly Worthy turned his divine carriage, the hosts of heaven descended from their seats. Then clouds and mists surged thickly, the four quarters darkened and merged, and for three days and nights the profound yin did not disperse. Heaven and earth were without light, as in the time before the Dragon Han, deep and obscure.

The Five Venerable Thearchs advanced and made obeisance, addressing the Heavenly Worthy: "Today, as we attend your seat, we have never before witnessed such a phenomenon when the Heavenly Worthy sets forth. When you journey forth, the hosts of heaven empty their carriages; the Perfected Ones of the Highest Realms, the Divine Immortals, Jade Maidens, sun, moon, and stars, the Jade Armillary and Jade Balance, the officials of the Three Realms, the divine immortals of the Five Peaks, the water thearchs of rivers and seas—all spirits and numina without exception—stand in solemn reverence, awaiting the Perfected Ones. The heavens become bright and the qi pure; winds do not stir the branches; the earth is without flying dust; rivers and seas are still and silent; mountains and peaks conceal their mists. The seasons are harmonious, the qi settled; the living and the dead rejoice together. Yet now the celestial radiance is veiled, and bright day turns to gloom. Heavenly beings are filled with dread—we know not the reason. Since this has come to pass, we humbly beseech your instruction, that all present may be enlightened and all universally attain peace."

The Heavenly Worthy replied: "Today, as we sit together in joy—a rare encounter—the heavens manifest auspicious signs, and numinous responses arise spontaneously. The jade script shines resplendently, obscuring the celestial light. At the inception of the unmanifest, the beginning is plunged into darkness. Such a convergence of time and felicity is seldom seen. Now I shall universally reveal the wondrous celestial portent for the four assemblies, to deliver all beings. Let all here present close their eyes and prostrate upon the ground."

Thereupon, the assembly of Great Saints simultaneously closed their eyes and prostrated, awaiting the command. In an instant, the celestial qi cleared, the gloom vanished, and a five-colored radiance illumined the five directions. Suddenly, a celestial writ appeared in the empty void above, its characters a full *zhang* in size, emerging naturally within the five-colored light. Its resplendent patterns gleamed, its eight corners trailing rays of brilliance, their dazzling radiance overwhelming the eyes, making it impossible to gaze directly upon.

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the four assemblies: "This numinous script of the Eight Gatherings has no fixed form; its purport is profound and subtle, difficult to fathom in detail. Since heaven has sent down this response, the wondrous Dao should be made manifest. Let brushes be taken up to transcribe its true sounds, that the imperial Dao may flow freely and its blessings extend to the ten directions."

The Heavenly Perfected, the August One, bowed his head in reverence and addressed the Heavenly Worthy: "Through the revolutions of birth and death, traversing countless kalpas, though I have often attended your seat, never before have I encountered such a day—when I have chanced upon the sagely Dao, the opening of the scriptures of all dharmas, and beheld the celestial writ arising naturally, the most true. This is the qi of the Eight Gatherings, harmonizing the sounds of the Five Accords. My foolish sentiments and shallow thoughts cannot fully comprehend it. Now, having been seated in this assembly and witnessed these profound mysteries, I have received your command in trepidation. I dare not conceal my feelings, though I tremble in fear. Lacking divine guardianship, I shall exhaust my understanding to transcribe its sounds, hoping that even one in ten thousand may accord, revealing to future generations what they have not yet attained. I humbly beseech your compassionate indulgence." Thereupon, he took up his brush.

The Supreme Perfected brushed the mat; Jade Maidens held the cloth; Golden Lads wafted incense; maidens of the Moon Palace scattered flowers; essences of the sun sprinkled nectar; the Five Venerable Ones supervised the trial; the Three Realms guarded the Perfected.

The Heavenly Perfected, the August One, declared: "The celestial writ’s jade characters condense the soaring and mysterious qi to form the numinous script, harmonizing the Eight Gatherings into sound and the Five Accords into chapters. When the great cycle begins its course, the jade-like sounds arise spontaneously. The divine qi plays in emptiness; the Shao music resounds through the void. It shines above the various heavens, illumining the depths of the Great Obscurity. Together with the Dragon Han, it transforms; unfolding the Crimson Clarity in the era of Yan Kang. It refines water and fire through life and death, enduring through countless kalpas. It opens the Eight Level Paths in the subtle and minute, planting the dew-like radiance in the Great Yang. The Two Modes await it to divide; the Three Luminaries rely upon it to distinguish. The Supreme Saints ride it to the formless; the Five Peaks treasure it for its numinosity. All beings receive qi through it; kingdoms enjoy peace through it. Vast is its great model; majestic is its lofty honor. From being it gives rise to non-being, becoming the root of heaven and earth. Those who attain it do not die; those who uphold it endure forever. Those who treasure it receive the descent of the Perfected; those who cultivate it become divine immortals. It delivers the corpses from the long night, refining the living souls in the Vermilion Palace. This wondrous transformative script emerges from spontaneity, exalted above the Great Void, the ancestor of the ten thousand thearchs. Its majestic numinosity is vast and boundless—difficult to name."

The Heavenly Perfected, the August One, continued: "The great Brahma’s hidden language, the sound of the boundless, arises from the soaring and mysterious qi of heaven, harmonizing the five tones to form it. The boundless cavernous chapters of heaven expound the profound mysteries of the various heavens, praising the opening of the Great Existence. They govern the qi of spontaneity, universally delivering those who study immortality, rescuing the lives of the living and the dead, drawing forth the souls from the long night. The wondrous dharma of the Primordial Beginning endures through countless kalpas. Its sounds are clear, and its Dao flows forth. The great dharma is revealed, and the various heavens rejoice."

The Boundless Great Saints, the Host of Perfected Ones, the Assembly of Noble Elders, the Five Venerable Thearchs, the Venerable Spirits of the Ten Directions, the Divine Immortals, and the Jade Maidens all circumambulated thrice while offering incense and intoned the following ode:

The Heavenly Worthy turns his jade carriage,
Descending to his seat in the Fragrant Garden.
The Perfected Ones, the Great Saints,
The Boundless Kings of Heaven.
Divine immortals guide the sun and moon,
Majestically unfolding the cloud palaces.
The Five Thearchs flank the radiant axle;
The Three Realms encompass the ten directions.
This day’s felicity at the assembly of Perfected Ones—
Joy unmatched.
The wondrous convergence arises spontaneously,
Numinous portents emerge from the empty void.
Resplendent, it inaugurates the obscure epoch,
Veiling the light of sun and moon.
The profound yin persists through the night;
The four assemblies stand in reverence.
The numinous destiny unfolds as ordained—
Suddenly the vast heavens brighten.
The celestial writ of the Eight Gatherings,
Its five tones harmonized into chapters.
The Heavenly Perfected deciphers its wondrous rhymes,
Resounding through the Great Existence.
The jade sounds defy comparison,
Universally accomplishing heaven and earth’s work.
Above, it plants the roots of the various heavens;
Vast and majestic, the ancestor of divine immortals.

In the midst, the Mystic Grotto-Palace unfolds,
Spacious, the Eight Secluded Chambers lie open.
It opens the path through life and death’s decree,
Drawing forth the Lords of the Long Night.
The Five Torments of hell dissolve,
Blades of the Mountain of Knives lose their edge.
The Five Paths’ original counterparts to souls,
Through kalpas uncounted, all become youthful once more.

Majestic, the Great Vehicle’s transformation,
Its merit universal, without partiality.
The Heavenly Venerable reveals the Great Existence,
Vast and resplendent, the myriad heavens brighten.
Wondrous, the Dragon-Han Dao,
The Eight Gatherings coalesce into form.
Radiant, it soars within the void,
Its streaming light illumines the Three Realms’ courts.

The divine chart unfolds the numinous assembly,
The jade script responds to the scene and arises.
Heavenly Perfected Ones commune with wondrous essence,
The Five Harmonies conjoin to form the scripture.
Resonant, the jade tones ring,
Floating, they ascend to the Highest Clarity.
It opens the path through endless kalpas,
The Nine Dark Realms receive illumination.

Towering, the Great Dharma Gate,
Instructing all living beings.
Its merit boundless,
Joy and felicity celebrate ten thousand ages.

At this time, beneficent grace flows universally,
Blessings shower the ten directions.
Those who believe and turn toward the deathless
All attain long years.
The aged revert to youth,
The sick instantly recover.
Withered bones quicken with qi,
Dead souls return to the living.
The Five Torments are wholly dissolved,
Hell’s chambers grow tranquil and still.
All who harbor intent
Attain the divine immortals’ way.

The Heavenly Venerable addresses the Four Assemblies of Perfected Ones:
“Today, within this kalpa of shared assembly,
The celestial mysteries of the spontaneous jade script are revealed,
Delivering all people.
Its blessings vast and universal,
Profusely benefiting all beings.
The Great Dharma now refined,
Grace rains without exception.
The boundless worlds
All receive illumination.
The Nine Dark Realms open in pardon,
The Long Night’s souls are absolved.
The living rejoice,
The dead are restored.
All heavenly and mortal beings,
Karmic bonds of kin—
Be they male or female,
Roots of good and evil fate,
From beginningless time to this present life,
Revolving through birth and death,
Calamitous bonds entwined—
Heaven and earth’s rise and fall,
Merit and transgression hard to discern.
Now, in accord with the Great Pardon,
A universal proclamation is issued to all heavens.

The sun, moon, and stellar lodgings,
The Jade Armillary and the Balancing Beam,
The Southern and Northern Dippers,
The Controllers of Life and Death,
The Lord Han who presides over records,
The Southern Prosperity Earth Palace,
All earths and waters,
The Five Marchmounts and numinous mountains,
The Three Officials and Nine Bureaus,
The Twelve River Sources,
The Long Night’s palaces,
Within the Nine Dark Realms,
The Four Controllers and Five Thearchs,
All divine spirits—
Examine the registers and ledgers,
Trace and verify the original roots.
Whether without good or evil,
The roots of weight and light,
Distinctions of life and death,
Itemized names and listed words—
All are erased,
Karmic bonds severed.
Universally united in celebration,
From this day made new.
Within this kalpa,
All attain the Perfected Dao.
The vast blessings universally bestowed,
Let none be left aside.
By the Heavenly Venerable’s command,
All heavens reverently comply.”

Thereupon, the Four Assemblies rise as one to bow,
Raising hands toward the above,
Pointing hands toward the below—
No above, no below,
No bound, no end,
No depth, no distance,
No seclusion, no concealment,
No great, no small,
No number, no termination.
All universally delivered,
Together receive illumination.

With a snap of the fingers, the assembly is addressed,
All hear as one.
At that moment, the Four Assemblies simultaneously raise their hands,
Bowing their heads toward heaven in reverence.
The thirty-two heavens’ sun, moon, and stellar lodgings
All brighten at once.
Beneath the earth, to the Nine Dark Realms’ boundless depths,
Light and radiance penetrate completely,
No more darkness or obscurity,
All hidden realms universally revealed,
Earth’s treasuries laid bare.

Mountains, rivers, streams, and ravines
All become level and smooth.
Winter blossoms bear fruit,
Withered trees burst into bloom.
Joy bestowed upon all,
Merit borne by all beings.
Fish and dragons leap and surge,
Birds and beasts rejoice and sing.
Numinous songs converge,
No sorrowful cries upon the roads.
Heaven stills, earth silences,
The Three Palaces grow hushed and tranquil.
Judgments and retributions cease,
The Five Paths no longer arise.
Humans and spirits rejoice in peace,
The sagely Dao attains great harmony.

---

Excerpted from *The Inner Sounds of the Various Heavens in the Cavernous Mystery*

The Primordial Beginning’s Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure’s Five Chapters of Vermilion Script
Arose within the primordial void before the Primordial Beginning,
Before heaven and earth took root,
Before sun and moon shone,
Dim and obscure,
Without ancestor or lineage.
The numinous script flickered,
Now present, now absent.
The Two Modes awaited it to divide,
The Great Yang awaited it to shine.
The divine chart transformed the course of destiny,
The mysterious signs shifted and changed.
Riding the moment, responding to the convergence,
Therein it abided.

Heaven and earth received it and divided,
The Three Luminaries received it and radiated light.
The numinous script flourished,
Illuminating the Highest Clarity.
Issuing from the Heaven of Primordial Azure,
Its color unbounded by direction.
The script’s patterns curved and turned,
Beyond tracing or fathoming.

The Primordial Beginning refined it in the Cavernous Yang’s halls,
Forged it in the flowing fire’s courts,
Purified its true script,
Polishing it to emit radiance.
The Cavernous Yang’s qi was vermilion,
Thus it is called the Vermilion Script.
The divine chart now resplendent,
The myriad thearchs pay homage to the Perfected.
Soaring through the void,
They circumambulate the upper palaces.
Burning incense and scattering flowers,
Reciting the numinous chapters—
At that time, twelve mysterious portents descended from heaven,
Twenty-four responses emerged from earth.
Above, they celebrated the Nine Heavens’ numinous mysteries,
Extolled the Three Heavens’ precious illumination.
The divine winds stirred,
The imperial Dao flourished.

The Primordial Beginning issued the command,
The Great Perfected held the brush,
The Jade Consort smoothed the mat,
Forging gold into tablets,
Inscribing jade chapters.
The Five Elders recorded them,
Sealing them within the Nine Heavens’ Numinous Capital Palace.
Jade maidens tended the incense,
Great Splendor held the cloth.
Jade lads stood in attendance,
Jade steps led to the audience hall.
The Nine Heavens’ script
Was not for ghosts or spirits to hear.
Heaven treasured it to attain floating,
Earth concealed it to attain stability.
The Five Thearchs guarded it to secure peace,
The Three Luminaries rode it to attain brilliance.
Supreme sages revered it to attain the Perfected,
The Five Marchmounts followed it to attain numinosity.
The Son of Heaven obtained it to attain governance,
The kingdom’s destiny enjoyed it to attain great peace.
Truly the numinous script’s wondrous power,
Marking heaven and earth’s mysterious root.
Its majestic numinosity vast and boundless,
Universally bestowed without end.
Vast and expansive, the great transformation,
The ancestor of divine luminaries.
Its measure unfathomable,
Towering, the Great Void.

**The Vermilion Script of the Nine Qi of the Azure Heaven of the Eastern Direction**

Within the Azure Heaven of the Nine Qi’s Primordial August Thearch, amidst the verdant mists of the Towering Green,
There is an Elder who oversees the charts and records, gathering qi and summoning immortals.

The twenty-four characters to the right
Govern the summoning of the Nine Heavens’ Thearchs,
The verification of the divine immortals’ charts and registers.

**Instructions for Daoist Practitioners of Immortality**

On the days of one’s life-destiny, the *jiazi* cyclical sign, or the Beginning of Spring, the Daoist aspiring to immortality shall inscribe in blue ink the twenty-four characters upon a white slip, recording their name, year, and month beneath, and cast it upon the sacred peaks of the numinous mountains. After nine years, the immortal officials shall arrive, and the practitioner shall attain the flying immortals’ body.

**Mars assists the liver; Horn and Neck govern the true.**
**Root, Chamber, Heart, and Tail revolve through the four seasons.**
**Winnowing Basket presides over the seven luminaries, aligning the Dipper’s bright wheel.**
**Receiving qi, it seizes the false; sweeping away calamities and crowds of misfortune.**

The thirty-two characters to the right govern the summoning of the celestial lodges’ stellar officials, rectifying the heavens’ divisions and degrees. Should the eastern constellations fall into disorder, inscribe in vermilion the thirty-two characters upon blue paper, expose them in the central courtyard for nine days and nine nights, and each evening recite the separate incantation as prescribed. Upon completion, burn the text with fire, scatter the ashes into the blue smoke, and carve the thirty-two characters upon a blue-green stone to bury in the eastern direction. Heavenly disasters shall dissolve of themselves, and the stellar lodges shall return to their proper positions.

**The incantation of the Eastern Mountain’s spirit, capturing and summoning the Nine Heavens.**
**The vermilion script’s talismanic command, marshaling the assembly at Mount Feng.**
**Binding demons and dispatching ghosts, none slain shall escape.**
**All shall hasten to the Wooden Palace; dare any delay?**

The thirty-two characters to the right govern the subjugation of demonic spirits and the rectification of the Nine Heavens’ qi. Perform this method by inscribing in vermilion upon a blue-green wooden slip, facing the northeast with the text while reciting the separate incantation thrice. Ghosts shall bind their own forms, myriad demons shall perish of themselves—proceed with utmost sincerity.

**To command the water spirits of the Eastern River and the vast seas,**
**To quell the great kalpa’s floods and the dragons bearing disaster upon their backs.**
**The Water Palace opens the way, clearing a thousand paths and ten thousand passages.**
**The Vermilion Script of the Thearch—wind and fire brook no inquiry.**

The thirty-two characters to the right govern the subjugation of the Eastern Sea’s Water Thearch, the great kalpa’s heavenly disasters, and the summoning of dragons and water spirits. When encountering water disasters or desiring to cross great waters, inscribe in yellow the thirty-two characters upon blue paper, recite the separate incantation, and cast it into the water. The body shall pass safely, dragons shall bear away calamities, the River Earl shall offer obeisance, and one may traverse beneath the waters.

---

**The Vermilion Script of the Three Qi of the Southern Direction’s Cinnabar Heaven**

Within the Cinnabar Heaven of the Southern Direction, the Vermilion Thearch’s Jade Hall,
There abides a great spirit named the Vermilion August One.
Above, flames flow like smoke; the Three Qi surge with radiance.
Divine immortals receive their mandate, responding to the Great Yang’s movement.

The thirty-two characters to the right govern the Nine Heavens’ divine immortals’ charts and registers, and the stellar lodges’ names for those learning immortality. The Daoist shall, on the days of their life-destiny, the *jiazi* cyclical sign, or the Beginning of Summer, inscribe in vermilion the thirty-two characters upon a white slip, record their name, year, and month beneath, and cast it upon the sacred peaks of the numinous mountains. After nine years, the immortal officials shall arrive, and the practitioner shall attain the flying immortals’ body.

**Mars assists the heart; Well and Ghost guard Chamber.**
**Willow, Star, Spread, and Wing resist the four quarters.**
**Chariot’s Rear presides over the seven lodges, revolving the celestial constant.**
**Summoning and hastening the assembly, rectifying the Way’s courier routes.**

The thirty-two characters to the right govern the summoning of stellar officials and the rectification of the heavens’ divisions and degrees. Should the southern constellations fall into disorder and various disasters and anomalies arise, inscribe in vermilion the thirty-two characters upon blue paper, expose them in the central courtyard for three days and three nights, and each evening recite the separate incantation as prescribed. Upon completion, carve the thirty-two characters upon a red stone and bury it in the southern direction. Heavenly disasters shall dissolve of themselves, and the stellar lodges shall return to their proper positions.

**The Vermilion Script’s numinous command, northward subjugating Mount Feng.**
**Binding and dispatching demonic lineages, severing and extinguishing evil roots.**
**The talismanic teachings’ punitive authority, clearly enumerating the crimes’ origins.**
**The incantation of the Southern Mountain’s spirit, its might subduing the eight directions.**
**Hosts of demons perish utterly; ten thousand trials collapse and vanish.**

The forty characters to the right govern the subjugation of the Northern Feng’s ghostly qi and its rectification. Perform this method by inscribing in yellow upon a red wooden slip, facing the northeast with the text while reciting the incantation thrice. Ghostly essences shall perish of themselves, myriad demons shall bind their own forms—proceed with utmost sincerity.

**The Southern River’s Water Thearch, the Great Earl Dragon King.**
**The divine incantation flows forth, universally sweeping away inauspiciousness.**
**Floods and flying disasters, summoning dragons from above.**
**Clearing waterways, opening a thousand paths and ten thousand passages.**
**Dare any resist? Subdued and sent to the Fire Palace.**
**None disobey the Vermilion Script’s proclamation.**

The forty-eight characters to the right govern the Southern Sea’s Water Thearch and the great conjunctions of fate, when floods surge forth in all directions. Summon dragons and water spirits when encountering such disasters or desiring to cross great waters. Inscribe in yellow the forty-eight characters upon blue paper, recite the separate incantation, and cast it into the water. The body shall pass safely, and the water officials shall offer obeisance.
