**The Vermilion Script of the Central Yellow Heaven**

The Central August One, sovereign of the numinous,
The Yellow Upper Heaven’s origin,
First engendering the Five Elders,
The Central August One, lofty and revered,
Receiving qi and overseeing the true,
Governing the host of immortals,
Presiding over the mysterious charts,
Examining the jade texts of the stellar lodges,
Impelling the qi’s movement and hastening its flow,
Universally proclaiming to the myriad spirits.

The forty characters to the right govern the divine immortals’ jade tablets and the stellar lodges’ names, all converging in the single immortals’ qi. The Daoist aspiring to immortality shall, on the days of their life-destiny, the *jiazi* cyclical sign, the Spring Equinox, Summer Solstice, Autumn Equinox, or Winter Solstice, inscribe in yellow the forty characters upon a white slip, record their name, year, and month beneath, and cast it upon the sacred peaks of the numinous mountains. After nine years, the immortal officials shall arrive, and the practitioner shall attain the divine immortals’ body.

**Saturn assists the spleen, revolving through the Northern Origin.**
**[...] governs the false, severing evil and extirpating roots.**
**[...], sweeping away filth and dispelling miasmic vapors.**
**[...] rectifying the Mysterious Dipper, illuminating the celestial passes’ degrees.**
**The Nine Heavens’ talismanic command, transmitted by the Golden Horse’s courier routes.**

The forty characters to the right govern the subjugation of stellar officials and the rectification of the heavens’ degrees and measures. Should the central constellations fall into disorder and various disasters and anomalies arise, inscribe in vermilion the forty characters upon blue paper, expose them in the central courtyard for twelve days and twelve nights, and each evening face the Thearch while reciting the separate incantation as prescribed. Upon completion, burn the text with fire, scatter the ashes into the blue smoke, and carve the forty characters upon a yellow stone to bury in the central direction. Heavenly disasters shall dissolve of themselves, and the stellar lodges shall return to their proper positions.

**The edict subjugating the Northern Thearch, blocking and sealing the ghostly gate.**
**Shearing away inauspiciousness—none shall stand before it.**

The sixteen characters to the right govern the subjugation of the Northern Thearch, the rectification of the heavens’ qi, and the inspection of ghostly essences. Perform this method by inscribing in white the sixteen characters upon a yellow wooden slip, facing the northeast with the text while reciting the separate incantation thrice.

Perform this method, and ghostly essences shall self-annihilate; celestial demons shall be bound in form. Proceed with utmost sincerity.

**The Central Mountain Divine Incantation, summoning dragons to ascend the clouds.**
**Commanding the confluence of the Yellow River, the nine water sources.**
**No slackness nor indulgence—good and evil shall be wholly distinguished.**
**A thousand demons, ten thousand deceits, all shall face the August Lord.**
**None shall dare test this power.**
**The solar blaze sears and scorches; the vermilion script of jade characters proclaims far and wide.**

The forty-eight characters to the right govern the subjugation of the Central Sea’s Water Thearch, the four springs’ waters, the reckoning of surging flood disasters, and the summoning of water spirits to restrain flood dragons. When encountering flood disasters or crossing great waters, inscribe the forty-eight characters in yellow upon blue paper, recite the separate incantation as prescribed, and cast the text into the water. You shall traverse safely, and the water officials shall receive you.

**The True Writ of the White Heaven of the Seven Qi of the West**
**The White Heaven of the West, the Seven Gates of the White Thearch.**
**The golden numen shines dimly; the Great Flower scatters its mist.**
**White stones towering, the seven qi swirl in abundance.**
**Above resides the Great Divine Elder of Primordial Generation, who governs the lung qi, presides over the Nine Heavens’ reckoning, inspects and fixes the registers of destiny, and commands the summoning of perfected immortals.**

The forty-eight characters to the right govern the summoning of immortal qi. Daoist adepts seeking immortality shall, on their natal day, the first *jiazi* day, or the day of the Autumn Commencement, inscribe the forty-eight characters upon a wooden slip, record their name and age beneath, and cast it upon a sacred mountain. After nine years, the immortal officials shall arrive, and the adept shall attain divine transcendence.

**The Great White inspects the lungs; Kui and Lou guard the soul.**
**Stomach, Pleiades, Net, and Turtle Beak govern the seven barriers.**
**Shen unites the Dipper’s handle; they receive the talisman from the Northern Origin.**

The twenty-four characters to the right govern the stellar officials of the White Thearch, rectifying the celestial degrees. For any aberrations among the western stellar lodges or the arising of disasters, inscribe the twenty-four characters in vermilion upon blue paper, expose it in the central courtyard for seven days and nights, facing west each evening while reciting the separate incantation as prescribed. Upon completion, burn the text with fire, scatter the ashes into the blue smoke, and carve the twenty-four characters upon a white stone to bury in the western direction. Heavenly disasters shall dissolve of themselves, and the stellar lodges shall return to their proper positions.

**The vermilion script of jade characters, the correct writ of the Nine Heavens.**
**Subjugating and summoning the ten thousand qi, all universally return to the August Lord.**

The sixteen characters to the right subjugate the ghostly qi of the Six Heavens. Perform this method by inscribing the sixteen characters in black upon a white wooden slip, facing the northeast with the text while reciting the separate incantation seven times. Proceed thus, and ghostly essences shall self-annihilate; the myriad demons shall be bound in form. Proceed with utmost sincerity.

**The Western Mountain Divine Incantation, the Eight Might and Seven Transmissions.**
**Talismanic water ascends dragons; summoning mountains dispatches clouds.**
**Herein are the records inspected, all arriving together at the August Gate.**
**Assisting and protecting the perfected transcendents, severing and extinguishing the sources of evil.**
**Should any inauspiciousness arise, cut it off with the Golden Barrier.**
**The vermilion script of talismanic commands, conveyed by wind and fire couriers.**

The forty-eight characters to the right govern the subjugation of the Western Sea’s Water Thearch and the myriad essences within the waters. Summon cloud dragons to prevent water disasters. To discern the forms of water spirits or when floods overwhelm the heavens, inscribe the forty-eight characters in yellow upon blue paper, recite the separate incantation as prescribed, and cast the text into the water. You shall know the myriad forms of water spirits; flood dragons shall bear you across, and the water officials shall receive you.

**The True Writ of the Dark Heaven of the Five Qi of the North**
**The Dark Heaven of the North, the five qi meandering.**
**Within resides the Qi Thearch, the Dual August Ones of the Grand Tenuity.**
**They govern the talismanic commands, refining the Eight Might of immortals.**
**Clad in azure skirts and feathered headdresses, dragon-patterned and phoenix-embroidered robes.**
**Exalted by the Supreme Thearch, their dominion extends to the Jade Stair.**

The forty characters to the right govern the registers of perfected transcendents and divine immortals. Daoist adepts seeking immortality shall, on their natal day, the first *jiazi* day, or the day of the Winter Commencement, inscribe the forty characters in *qi*-script upon a white wooden slip, record their name and age beneath, and cast it upon a sacred mountain. After five years, the immortal officials shall arrive, and the adept’s name shall be entered into the immortal registers.

**The Northern Asterism assists the kidneys; Dipper and Oxguard defend the gates.**
**Maiden, Void, Rooftop, and Encampment open the four directions.**
**The Wall unites the seven stars, seizing the inauspicious and correcting the wrong.**
**Repelling disasters and sweeping away filth, illuminating the Dao with resplendent brilliance.**

The thirty-two characters to the right govern the stellar officials of the northern direction, rectifying the heavens’ qi. For any aberrations among the northern stellar lodges or the arising of disasters, inscribe the thirty-two characters in vermilion upon blue paper, expose it in the central courtyard for five days and nights, facing north each evening while reciting the separate incantation as prescribed. Upon completion, burn the text with fire, scatter the ashes into the blue smoke, and carve the thirty-two characters upon a *qi*-stone to bury in the northern direction. Heavenly disasters shall dissolve of themselves, and the stellar lodges shall return to their proper positions.

**The Northern Mountain Divine Incantation, stirring the yang to summon thunder.**
**Flowing bells scatter and fall; the simian of heaven displays its might.**
**The legions of the Northern Feng all perish and crumble.**

The twenty-four characters to the right govern the subjugation of celestial demons, the Northern Thearch, and the myriad ghosts. Perform this method by inscribing the twenty-four characters in blue upon a *qi*-wooden slip, facing the northeast with the text while reciting the separate incantation five times. Proceed thus, and ghostly essences shall annihilate their forms. Proceed with utmost sincerity.

**The nine rivers pour forth; the crow mothers flock in flight.**
**Flood dragons open the path; watery thoroughfares cleave open.**
**The vermilion script of jade characters, conveyed by dragon couriers on the wind.**

The twenty-four characters to the right govern the Northern Sea’s Water Thearch, restraining the myriad essences within the waters and summoning flood dragons to bear the body. When crossing great floods or encountering water disasters, inscribe the twenty-four characters in yellow upon blue paper, recite the separate incantation as prescribed, and cast the text into the water. You shall instantly know the myriad forms of water spirits, traverse the flood disaster, flood dragons shall open the watery paths, and the water officials shall come forth to receive you.

The above is excerpted from *The Scripture of the Vermilion Writ of the Cavernous Mystery*.

**The Nine Empyreans turn the heavens; white slips and blue registers.**

The Supreme Sage Lord received it from the Nine Voids.
He wove the soaring Dark-Purple Qi into characters of spontaneity—
the Mystic Register wherein later disciples inscribe their names upon attaining the Dao.
Their numinous tones harmonize, their jade clarity receives the truth.
Some manifest as written forms, some as hidden sounds.
Above and below, the four gatherings all reveal the Mystic Name.

In the Hall of Vast Numinosity, the Void-Born inscribed the scripture—
the old text comprised one hundred thousand five-character lines.
Its graphs lacked fixed forms, its rhymes lacked fixed sounds;
none but the Supreme Sages could fathom its meaning.
After seven thousand years, it was inscribed upon the chamber of Kunlun,
the source of the Northern Cavern.
Each character measured a zhang square, its patterns resplendent and radiant.
The four gatherings trailed luminous rays, born of emptiness in dim brilliance—
now present, now absent.
Flowing light and Purple Qi swept away its defilements;
golden essence smelted and refined its patterns.
Through kalpas uncounted, the characters remained vivid and bright.

In the first year of the Middle August, on the seventh day of the ninth month,
the Seven Sages, in unison of spirit, purified their palace with fasting.
They swore solemn vows to Azure Heaven, kneeling in reverent devotion.
Receiving the Numinous Text, the Most High resolved its obscurities;
the Seven Sages penetrated its wondrous tones.
It was recorded as the *Chapter of Attaining the Dao in the Nine Empyreans of the Vast Heavens*,
inscribed upon slips of white silver, bound with soaring azure script.
Enclosed in a cloud-brocade pouch, sealed with the Seal of Destiny’s Summons,
it was entrusted to the Five Elders of the Immortal Metropolis,
where the Left Duke safeguards its register in the Jade Palace.

The Most High declared:
*“Gather the Three Treasures into wondrous script,
weave the Three Qi into a sublime talisman.
Its marvels are unfathomable, its heights unreachable,
its depths unplumbed—how majestic and subtle,
such is the virtue of this Jade Chapter!
If you can devote yourself to its contemplation,
you shall ascend to Heaven in broad daylight.
The Way of Undying culminates in this Numinous Text.”*

Excerpted from *The Primal Record of the Seven Sages of the Cavernous Truth*, “Auspicious Omens”

At the dawn of the Primordial Chart, the Most High revealed the Twelve Numinous Portents:

First, when there was neither Heaven nor Earth, in the profound obscurity of primordial darkness, the Numinous Script glimmered unseen, without origin or ancestor. The revolutions of fate unfolded of themselves, becoming the root of the myriad qi. From the emptiness, truth congealed; the qi, pure and lofty, clarified into the vast expanse of Heaven, suddenly and mysteriously self-arising.

Second, when the Two Modes divided the frame, the flowing qi condensed below, unfolding the foundation of the Earth, all forms taking shape at once.

Third, when the thirty-six thousand suns and moons shone as one, illuminating all Heavens, no hidden place remained unpenetrated.

Fourth, when the Supreme Sages, the Great Spirits, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, and the innumerable hosts paid homage in the Jade Court, circling through the Great Void, they extolled and chanted the Numinous Script.

Fifth, when Heaven spontaneously produced music and dance, a hundred thousand myriad kinds arose as one, their radiant tones resounding through the cloud-palaces to celebrate the divine Perfected.

Sixth, when the numinous winds sang in a hundred voices, filling the ten directions of space, the harmonies of gong and shang merged into the Cavernous Chapters.

Seventh, when the celestial pivot halted and the stellar lodges ceased their motion, Heaven knew neither day nor night, and the four seasons dawned as one.

Eighth, when purple clouds exhaled their splendor, suffusing all Heavens, every being in the myriad realms was bathed in light.

Ninth, when spring, autumn, winter, and summer brought neither scorching heat nor freezing cold, the four qi harmonized in gentle balance, and all that was withered and decayed revived.

Tenth, when the Five Marchmounts stood firm, the talismanic charts and scriptures unfolded as one, manifesting the boundless mystery of the Daoist teachings.

Eleventh, when the seven treasures of the Mysterious Below scattered across the lands, they sustained the multitudes of the people.

Twelfth, when the wondrous forests of the seven treasures spontaneously arose in the void, their radiance and shade extended to cover the Ten Heavens.

Excerpted from *The Cavernous Mystery Scripture of the Vermilion Writ*, “Earthly Responses”

The Twenty-Four Earthly Responses of the Vermilion Writ’s True Scripture to Celebrate the Divine Perfected

First, when the primordial heavens were in chaos, devoid of light, the morning cock heralded the dawn, the four seasons attained mysterious clarity, the heavens brightened, the earth unfolded, and the Five Phases came into being.

Second, when thirty-six thousand suns and moons above and below shone as one, their radiance pierced the darkest nights without end.

Third, when the Azure Bird bore a missive to inform the Five Thearchs, the celestial divisions were rightly measured.

Fourth, when the White Tiger spewed forth gold, the Five Spirits were pacified and secured.

Fifth, when the Azure Dragon presented the talisman to announce the Water Thearch, the rhythms of time were regulated, and rivers and seas opened wide.

Sixth, when the Jade Phoenix bore the imperial seal to offer to the sovereign, the state was stabilized, the throne preserved, and the Five Marchmounts endured forever.

Seventh, when the simurghs cried and phoenixes sang, their soaring melodies resounded in harmony.

Eighth, when flocks of birds soared and danced, they rejoiced at the summit of the heavens.

Ninth, when dragons leapt and cavorted, they stirred the deep abysses and marshes.

Tenth, when the waters of the Yellow River stilled, fish scales interlocked in assembly.

Eleventh, when sweet dew arose of itself and magic mushrooms flourished in abundance.

Twelfth, when winter brought no frost, withered trees bloomed as one.

Thirteenth, when forests, crops, and grains bore flowers and fruit in both winter and summer, their yield was lush and plentiful, untouched by blight or decay.

Fourteenth, when the four qi harmonized, calamities and epidemics ceased, heaven and humanity rejoiced, and none met untimely death.

Fifteenth, when venomous creatures sealed their fangs, no harmful intent arose.

Sixteenth, when lions and fierce beasts dwelt as neighbors to humankind.

Seventeenth, when the blind, deaf, lame, and afflicted throughout the world simultaneously regained their forms, free from injury or illness, all attained health and vigor.

Eighteenth, when the aged reverted to youth and the young never aged, their countenances flourished with radiant splendor.

Nineteenth, when birds, beasts, and the six domestic animals conceived and bore young, all—whether already born or yet unborn—were nurtured, none harmed or lost.

Twentieth, when women with child throughout the world gave birth to sons.

Twenty-first, when the earth’s treasuries released their stores, gold and jade lay exposed, scattered across the roads, none hidden or concealed.

Twenty-second, when heaven quaked and earth split, withered bones revived, sunken corpses and wandering souls universally rose as living beings, and the world sang in celebration of great peace.

Twenty-third, when the earth sprouted lotus blossoms, heaven and humanity rejoiced, all exulting without exception.

Twenty-fourth, when the Five Marchmounts opened wide, talismanic scriptures emerged in unison to instruct heaven and humanity.

At that time, none who studied failed to ascend as immortals.

These twelve numinous portents and twenty-four responses above praise the divine precincts of the Primordial Beginning and delight in the enlightenment of the Five Elders. Once the numinous writ resounded, the Dao spread forth. Heaven and earth unfolded, the true Dharma flourished, the divine wind spread afar, and the myriad qi diffused their essences. The Five Thearchs lent their aid, marshaling celestial immortals, commanding spirit officials, and guiding the movements of yin and yang. They rooted the Three Luminaries in the Mysterious Origin, preserving heaven and earth for eternal endurance. They secured the Five Marchmounts within the Numinous Abode, governing the kalpic rhythms at the Three Passes. They established the state’s destiny in accord with the charts, guided the five qi to nurture the people, and broadly propagated the Primordial Heaven’s teachings to instruct the ten directions. Their majestic power expanded boundlessly, illuminating even the most hidden realms. Such divine marvels, resplendent and grand, defy full description.

Excerpted from *The Cavernous Mystery Scripture of the Vermilion Writ*
*Supreme Secret Essentials*, Scroll Twenty-Four (conclusion)
*Supreme Secret Essentials*, Scroll Twenty-Five

**Essential Methods of the Three Sovereigns**

**Heavenly Sovereign’s Scripture:**
It is said: "That which constitutes the Qian is the essence of pure yang. The sun and moon hang forth their light, and the twenty-eight constellations." Whoever knows this scripture shall stand alongside me.

The first essential is to seek longevity;
The second essential is to seek concealment of form;
The third essential is to shun worldly glory.
Only by comprehending these three essentials can the Dao be perfected.

Through longevity, one may wander upon Mount Hua;
Through concealment of the body, one’s celestial stipend is assured;
By forsaking glory and renouncing emolument, heaven bestows gold and jade.
Should one wish to withdraw and enter the deep mountains, one must recite the *Inner Scripture of the Heavenly Sovereign*—only then will success be certain.

The Yellow Emperor said: **Earthly Sovereign’s Scripture** gives birth to the myriad things, nurturing all without exception. A household possessing this scripture shall be foremost in wealth and honor. It is the foundation for seeking immortality and practicing austerities, the mother of a thousand transformations and ten thousand changes, all of which the earth receives. It encompasses the impure and hidden, serving as the lord of soil.

The Yellow Emperor said: **Human Sovereign’s Scripture** encompasses knowledge of life-and-death registers, the names of the hundred ghosts, and the appellations of the myriad spirits—these are the great celestial graphs of the Three Sovereigns. The Yellow Emperor obtained the divine charts and celestial graphs, thereby knowing the names of the Nine Heavens’ sacred mountains and rivers. If one can summon the various spirits according to this scripture, one may attain longevity, command the Registrar of Life to erase one’s name from the ledger of death, and have one’s obstacles removed. Only then, through cultivating the Dao and seeking arts, can one assuredly become a divine immortal.

Should one desire to ascend as an immortal, one must sever yin and yang—only then may one seek an audience with the Jade Maidens. If unable to ascend as an immortal or sever yin and yang, one may still summon the Plain Maiden to serve as one’s guide and assistant. When pacing in circles, if one perceives a figure resembling a human form and hears the sound of zither music, it is she. Thereafter, one shall surely enjoy an extended lifespan of over three hundred years.

This earthly record of celestial graphs must not be transmitted recklessly. If one wishes to pass it to descendants, one must first fast and meditate for seven days, ensuring no misfortune befalls the body—only then may it be transmitted within the family. To ascend as an immortal, one must seek this scripture. By cultivating it, the true essence of all arts arises from the Sovereign’s Dao, firmly establishing Qian and Kun. From the Nine Heavens downward, the spirits of the Five Marchmounts and Four Waterways may all be consulted regarding fortune or misfortune, wealth or poverty. Perform it with solemnity, treating even minor matters with reverence. One must not act arrogantly or carelessly, lest one harm oneself. Should one summon recklessly, the sin shall extend to one’s ancestors.

The celestial graphs state: Those who wish to summon the Nine Heavens, Nine Earths, Five Marchmounts, Four Waterways, Three Rivers, Four Seas, Supreme Unity’s Northern Lord, the sun and moon, the various spirits, the Five Thearchs, the Father-Mother Ladies, the various maidens, the recording clerks, the inspectors of transgressions, and the officials of prohibitions—all must do so according to this method. In times of illness, when pestilence spreads, or when official matters press urgently, this may be employed.

1. The first thirty graphs are the seal-script of the Nine Heavens; they must not be carelessly invoked. They may summon the Nine Heavens’ inspectors of transgressions. In cases of illness, they may be invoked.
2. The next twelve graphs summon the Palace Registrar of Life.
3. The next twenty graphs summon the Father-Mother Ladies of the Nine Heavens.
4. The next ten graphs summon the Father-Mother Ladies of the Five Thearchs.
5. The next ten graphs summon the Father-Mother Ladies of the Supreme Unity.
6. The next ten graphs summon the Father-Mother Ladies of the Northern Lord.
7. The next five graphs summon the Father-Mother Ladies of the Five Marchmounts.
8. The next ten graphs summon the Father-Mother Ladies of the Four Waterways.
9. The next five graphs summon the Father-Mother Ladies of the Three Rivers.
10. The next nine graphs summon the Father-Mother Ladies of the Three Dukes.
   In times of urgency, summoning the Father-Mother Ladies of heaven and earth’s various spirits to fulfill tasks shall ensure lifelong freedom from calamity.
11. The next four graphs summon the Queen Mother of the West.
12. The next five graphs summon the King Father of the East.
13. The next seven graphs summon Laozi, also called Old Peng.
14. The next fifteen graphs summon the Generals of the Sun and Moon, along with their Father-Mother Ladies.
15. The next ten graphs summon the River Lord, to inquire about water matters.
16. The next nine graphs are the names of the Nine Heavens.

**Methods of the Heavenly Sovereign’s Scripture, First Section**

1. The first eighteen graphs summon the Heavenly Thearch to rescue from urgent peril. Write them in crimson on fine silk, inscribing a *gen* trigram above, and place them in a propitious location. Face west, cross your hands, and hold your breath for fifty exhalations—the Heavenly Thearch will surely appear. Do not be afraid; proceed calmly. Should you have an urgent affliction and request aid, you will assuredly be delivered.
2. The next eighteen graphs summon the celestial spirits to rescue from criminal punishment. If one is to be punished according to the law, invoking this method will ensure auspiciousness.
3. The next nineteen graphs summon the Most High. If a household suffers grave illness or has offended the celestial spirits, and the afflicted cannot discern their malady—if they sense heaviness in the four limbs—summon the Most High and request aid, facing north as in the above method; it shall be auspicious.
4. The next seventeen graphs summon the Lord of the Supreme Unity. If a household seeks high promotion in office or rank, yet their desires remain unfulfilled for years, summon the Supreme Unity to request advancement. Write in black and white on black silk, inscribing a circle two *chi* in diameter, and face north as in the above method. The Supreme Unity will surely entrust the Registrar of Emoluments to bestow office and rank.
5. The next eighteen graphs summon the Northern Lord. If one fears water-related calamity or suffers from water-borne illness, invoke as in the Supreme Unity’s method—the Northern Lord will surely come. State your request as instructed, and you shall be free from harm. If one merely inscribes these graphs of the Northern Lord on one’s clothing, one may sail ten thousand *li* without wind or waves, and the boat shall not sink; this may be tested.
6. The next ten graphs summon the Registrar of Life. If a household faces urgency or one’s lifespan is exhausted and illness is dire, write the graphs on paper, face southeast, and place them on the ground. Prepare a five-colored silk ribbon, five *fen* in width and two *chi* in length, and place it before the paper. After a moment, the Registrar of Life will surely come. State your request, and it shall be auspicious.
7. The next fourteen graphs summon the Registrar of Emoluments.

If one seeks to ascend as an immortal and summon the Traveling Kitchen, inscribe the graphs on green silk, two *chi* in diameter, facing northeast, following the Celestial Theft’s method—then the Registrar of Emoluments will surely come. To invoke the Celestial Emoluments and Traveling Kitchen, avoid the mundane world and ascend as an immortal, purify oneself through fasting, and after a hundred days, the Traveling Kitchen will surely arrive, and one shall ascend as an immortal. For those who have not obtained rank or emoluments, seeking them shall surely yield results.

8. The next twenty graphs summon the Registrar of Perils. If a household suffers discord, quarrels, mutual suspicion, or internal and external strife, write these graphs on paper, inscribe them on a day of harmony, and summon on a day of union—then the Registrar of Perils will surely come to reconcile, ensuring the household knows no affliction, the state knows no suffering, and all shall be as one, surely auspicious.

9. The next three graphs summon the Celestial Chancellor. Inscribe them on silk, nine *cun* in diameter, and place them on auspicious ground. If one has violated celestial patterns or seeks unfulfilled wishes, perform this method to summon the Chancellor, and one’s desires shall surely be granted.

10. The next thirteen graphs summon the Six Dings. If a household suffers from malevolent illnesses, oppressive nightmares, ghostly afflictions, stabbing pains in the heart and abdomen, or corpse influences entering the viscera, inscribe this method on paper to summon the Six Dings and inquire of them. The Six Dings shall bow their heads and treat the affliction. They shall gather all local spirits, and the outcome shall be auspicious.

11. The next twelve graphs summon the Sun and Moon Generals. If a household has members suddenly deaf or blind, inscribe these graphs and place them in the sunlight by day and moonlight by night—do not act when there is no sun or moon. The Sun and Moon Generals shall come to inquire, and they shall surely cure the affliction.

12. The next eleven graphs summon Feilian. If a household has young children suddenly ill or suffering from chronic ailments, inscribe this method on paper, face west, and summon to inquire—they shall surely recover.

13. The next seven graphs summon the Sun Wanderer. If a household has a nursing mother suffering from severe illness, inscribe this method on paper and inquire—they shall immediately recover.

14. The next twelve graphs summon the Censor. If one wishes to travel afar to avoid misfortune or encounters obstructed roads, inscribe this method to summon the Censor and inquire—the roads shall immediately clear.

The remaining graphs summon the General of the Monthly Destruction. If a household’s dwelling or burial site violates the General of the Monthly Destruction, inscribe this method to summon and inquire—the outcome shall be auspicious and free from harm.

**Earth Sovereign’s Writ, Second Method**
1. The next eleven graphs summon the Earth Lord. If a household suffers from jaundice or bodily swelling, or wishes to break ground, inscribe this method on yellow cloth, two *chi* in diameter, using ink. The Earth Lord shall soon come to respond to the inquiry—then it shall be auspicious.

2. The next eighteen graphs summon the Earth Spirit Lord. If a household has violated the earth spirit, or another household’s earth spirit is present, or one wishes to relocate or fell the spirit tree, inscribe this method on paper, face west, and the Earth Spirit Lord shall soon come to issue commands—then it shall be auspicious.

3. The next five graphs summon the Registrar of the Yin. If a household suffers from hidden yin illnesses or others plot in secret against them, inscribe this method on paper to summon the Registrar of the Yin and inquire—then it shall be auspicious.

4. The next twenty graphs summon the Wardens of the Paths and Crossroads. If one suddenly falls ill while traveling, inscribe this method and place it on the road—the Wardens of the Paths and Crossroads shall come to inquire, and it shall be auspicious.

5. The next nine graphs summon the Gate Marshal and Door Guardians, leaders of the hundred malevolent spirits. Inscribe them on paper facing north, and soon the Gate Marshal and Door Guardians shall come to command the leaders of the hundred malevolent spirits to protect one’s household—then it shall surely be auspicious.

6. The next twenty-eight graphs may summon the hundred birds.
7. The next thirteen graphs may summon snakes, vipers, insects, and rats, each named in the celestial patterns.
8. The next four graphs summon the Western Marchmount.
9. The next ten graphs summon the Northern Marchmount.
10. The next eleven graphs summon the Southern Marchmount.
11. The next twelve graphs summon the Central Marchmount.
12. The next six graphs summon the Eastern Marchmount.
13. The next five graphs summon the Four Waterways.
14. The next twelve graphs summon the Three Rivers. The remaining graphs summon the hundred beasts, including the qilin, and all their rulers shall come—these are recorded in the celestial patterns.

To know the location of ancient corpses and burial sites, inquire of the Wardens of the Paths and Crossroads, and the location shall be revealed.

**Human Sovereign’s Writ, Third Method**
1. The next twelve graphs summon the hundred ghosts and control the Six Dings.

2. The next twelve graphs summon the Overseers of Destiny, the Recorders of Deeds, the Great Unity, and the Celestial One.
3. The next twelve graphs summon the hundred spirits within the earth. The locations of gold, silver, copper, iron, jade discs, and precious treasures—all may be known. Those who wish to take them may do so; those who do not may refrain.
4. The next twelve graphs summon the souls and ghosts within the household. All wardens of the Eight Prisons may be summoned as well.
5. The next sixty-two graphs summon the Recorders of the Nine Heavens. They command the erasure of death registers and the removal of death records. The remaining graphs are recorded in the celestial patterns.

**Inner Sounds of the Three Sovereigns**
The Vermilion Talisman of the Azure Womb is received from the Queen Mother of the West by the Nine Heavenly Parents. On the first day of the greater month, one swallows the red script; on the first day of the lesser month, one swallows the qi script. Both require fasting, burning incense, and performing rites beforehand. Once ingested, they prevent hunger, replenish essence, fortify the brain, lighten the body, enhance beauty, and extend life without end. Daoists who have not seen this text and practice qi refinement in vain endure hardship for naught.

**Inner Talisman for Deploying the Nine Heavens’ Forces**
Derived from the seventieth graph of the Human Sovereign. Only with this talisman may one tame tigers, wolves, leopards, and beasts. Daoists entering mountains without it will find ferocious creatures unafraid, even attacking them.

**Inner Sounds Talisman of the Golden Light**
Derived from the sixty-fifth graph of the Heavenly Sovereign. It marks the beginning of the Dao’s qi, the essence of stars, and the primal breath of the Five Planets, the essence of gold and jade. When qi enters the body and essence penetrates the bones, one becomes like gold and jade, the body like the stars. Daoists who consume elixirs without swallowing this talisman will never attain immortality.

**Inner Talisman of Soaring Celestial Waters**
Derived from the ninety-third graph of the Great Script. The Central Heaven has a fixed cycle: once every three thousand years, a great flood arises. Daoists listed in the immortal registers who lack this talisman cannot pass through. During a great flood, wearing this talisman on the head allows entry into sacred mountains. The spirits of rivers, lakes, and mountains will open the path, ensuring passage through peril. It is ingested once yearly. On a *renzi* day, inscribe it in ink, consume it with water on a one-foot square of paper, and write "great flood" with the cyclical sign *zi* within it. Upon crossing the waters, remove it.

**Great Contract for Ascending to Heaven as an Immortal**
Derived from the sixty-eighth graph of the Human Sovereign. This contract is received alongside the seal. Without receiving the Great Contract of the Three Heavens, one cannot command the Three Officials of Water or the spirits of mountains, rivers, and lands, who will not fear them. If one acts without proper authority, misfortune will rebound. The twelve hundred chapters cannot be enacted without the contract; even possessing it, one cannot act without proper reception.

**Secret Texts of the Three Sovereigns’ Inner Writings**
The foremost technique of immortals is to summon the ten thousand spirits. When the ten thousand spirits obey, the method of summoning is as follows: inscribe cinnabar on white silk, fast, and invoke them. Face north, spread the text upon the ground, and wear the *Nine Heavens’ Talisman for Deploying Forces*. Within the time it takes to eat a meal, the ten thousand spirits will arrive—ghosts and spirits will come from behind, while the gods will approach from the front. At that moment, one’s mind will naturally comprehend.

**Transmitted Writings of the Three Sovereigns**
Daoists without these transmitted writings will not meet immortals.

**Yin Talismans of the Five Marchmounts**
Also called the *Scripture of the Colored Heaven’s Womb*. Those who possess the charts of the Five Marchmounts but lack these yin talismans will not receive the protection of the five spirits dispatched by the Marchmounts.

**Talisman of the Supreme Lord’s Eternal Abidance**
Derived from the celestial patterns in the middle chapter of the Supreme Lord’s scripture. On the eight seasonal nodes, inscribe it in cinnabar at dawn and ingest it. After three years of practice, the Supreme Lord’s Venerable One will erase one’s name from the death registers and elevate it to the *Register of Eternal Abidance*. Daoists without this talisman who merely study the Dao will still not escape death.

**Talisman of the Lower Chapter of the Great Script**
Daoists who seek myriad blessings and wish to meet immortals, or desire to know fortune and misfortune, may inscribe it in cinnabar on a three-inch square and swallow it. Lie down in stillness, and the next day’s fortunes or misfortunes will be known.

**Summoning the Supreme Name**
Invoke the Supreme Great Harmony, and within the time it takes to eat a meal, its form will appear.

**Summoning the Heavenly Sovereign’s Supreme Name**
Invoke the Overseer of Destiny. Inscribe in blue-green on a one-foot scroll, fast for seven days, and place it in the courtyard. Within the time it takes to eat a meal, the Overseer of Destiny will appear in form, and one may inquire about fortune or misfortune.

**Summoning the High Heavenly Name**
Invoke the Recorder of Deeds.

**Summoning the Supreme Name**
Invoke the Overseer of the Yin. Wearing this talisman averts weapons.

**Summoning the August Heavenly Name**
Invoke the Overseer of Perils. Inscribe in red on blue-green silk and place it in the house; the Overseer of Perils will arrive immediately, and one may inquire about fortune or misfortune.

**Summoning the Azure Heavenly Name**
Invoke the Mountain Spirits. Inscribe on white silk five inches in length and place it in the room with cinnabar.

**Summoning the High Sovereign’s Name**
Invoke the River Earl. Place it in water, and the River Earl will arrive immediately; one may inquire about water-related matters.

**Summoning the Supreme Lord’s Name**
Invoke the Celestial Chancellor. Inscribe in cinnabar on yellow silk and place it in the room; the Celestial Chancellor will arrive immediately, and one may inquire about the feasibility of one’s endeavors.
