The Jade Thearch commanded the Highest General Transcendent Lord to compile and collate the treasure catalog, uniting them into a corpus of scriptures, inscribed upon purple-glowing silk and gold tablets as chapters. All derive from the Dao of the Supreme Sovereign and Primordial Antiquity, compiled by the lofty sages, and transmitted to the Azure Essence Emperor Lord. The above is from the *Supreme Perfection Azure Essence Purple Writings Scripture*.

The *Golden Perfected Jade Radiance Eight Effulgences Flying Scripture* originated above the Nine Heavens, prior to the Primordial Effulgence. Mysterious light flowed and reflected, now present, now absent—dark essence gleaming like mist, illuminating the cavernous jade palace, accumulating for over seven thousand kalpas. Its script is most luminous, visible above the Void Mystery and within the Grand Void, unfathomable upon gazing, indestructible even if defaced. Thus, in the first year of the Jianshi era, the Elder of the Nine Heavens received it from the Void Mystery and transmitted it to the Primordial Celestial King, the Vast Life Grand Perfected, the Most High Great Dao Lord, the Azure Perfected Youth, the Five Elders of the Upper Perfected, the Thirty-Nine Thearchs, the Supreme Sovereign Master, the Myriad Origins Dao Lord, the Southern Culmen Supreme Origin Purple Simplicity Three Origin Lords, the Queen Mother of the Western Tortoise, the Grand Simplicity Three Origin Lords, and the Grand Perfected Lady. The Supreme Sovereign Master transmitted it to the Purple Clarity Emperor Lord; the Primordial Celestial King transmitted it to Master Yellowstone and the Three Heavens Jade Youth; the Most High Great Dao Lord transmitted it to the Eastern Sea Youth and the Purple Tenuity Lady. The Later Sage Nine Mysteries Golden Portal Emperor Lord entrusted it to the Most Exalted Minister, the Azure Lad, the Four Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate, and the Lord of the Western Citadel. Thus, the treasure instructions were all transmitted orally from Perfected to Perfected.

The above is from the *Supreme Perfection Golden Perfected Jade Radiance Eight Effulgences Flying Scripture*.

Such are the treasure writings, which the Grand Thearch Lord always treasured and kept secret, transmitting them to the Celestial Thearch Lord. The Celestial Thearch Lord transmitted them to the Southern Culmen Supreme Origin Lord; the Supreme Origin Lord transmitted them to the Grand Tenuity Celestial Thearch Lord; the Grand Tenuity Celestial Thearch Lord transmitted them to the Golden Portal Sage Lord; the Golden Portal Sage Lord entrusted them to the Most Exalted Minister, the Azure Lad, to instruct those destined for transcendence.

The above is from the *Supreme Perfection Heavenly Pass Three Diagrams Seven Stars Shifting Degrees Scripture*.

The *Hidden Writings of the Golden Mystery Inner Text of the Conjoined Radiance of the Dawn Mandate* of the Jade Clarity Bei Wei Ye Qu Initial Silence Heaven was received by the Great Emperor of Fusang from the Great Empyrean Perfected King and transmitted to the Celestial Thearch Lord of Grand Tenuity. The *Hidden Writings of the Golden Mystery Inner Text of the Aligned Radiance of the Mysterious Dawn* of the Jade Clarity Chong Rong Yu Yu Di Sha Heaven was received by the Queen Mother of the West from the Northern Culmen August Supreme Master and transmitted to the Upper Perfected Lord of Vermilion Essence. The *Hidden Writings of the Golden Mystery Inner Text of the Lofty Dragon Mist* of the Jade Clarity Dan Yuan Cha Treasure Wheel Dharma Heaven was received by the Later Sage Nine Mysteries Golden Portal Emperor Lord from the High Prime Void August Pure Scenery Lord and transmitted to the Most Exalted Minister, the Azure Lad.

The above is from the *Scripture of the Highest Golden Mystery Feathered Chapters of the Cavern Realms*.

The Most High Great Dao Lord addressed the Northern Culmen Perfected Duke, saying: "The Way of the Nine Stars’ Upper Dharma and Mysterious Reflection was received by me from the Primordial Beginning. Through seven hundred million kalpas, amidst the formation and decay of heaven and earth, the rise and fall of the ten thousand kinds, this Way alone endures. Even now, I cultivate it above the clouds and cannot forget it in due season, for my mind delights in its loftiness and wonder, and I cherish the encounters of those who receive it. Those who come to life only learn the flight of the fledgling swallow yet know not the method of wandering in darkness and treading the void—how then may they enter the gates of the layered heavens and witness the beginning and end of heaven and earth? Without this Way, you shall remain estranged from the Nine Dawns and the Lady of the Transcendent Domain, though you bear the empty title of imperial registry and soar in lofty eminence. You may ride cloud-dragons and roam the Five Peaks, merely avoiding death—but to tread the Dipper’s handle, wander the Flowery Dawn, and ascend the Jade Clarity, such remains beyond your reach. When governing the kalpic fortunes, sealing the ten heavens, examining the mysterious registers, and administering the divine immortals, you ought to receive this Dharma to govern the ten thousand lives. Now I transmit it to you—guard it well and cultivate it in secret!"

In the Heaven of Immeasurable Longevity, beneath the Flowery Dawn with golden sheep and silver geese arrayed in ranks, the Perfected Duke received the oral instructions and cultivated them, transmitting them further to the Azure Lad of the Square Cauldrons.

The above is from the *Scripture of the Cavern Realms’ Nine Ways of Returning to the Origin and Flying Feathered Writings*.

Formerly, the Most High Great Dao Lord received the *Flying Feathered Writings*, the *Nine Perfected Ascending Mysterious Record*, the precious words of the Purple Texts and Green Gold characters, and the Way of Treading the Void and Treading the Floating Scenery from the Void August Perfected Dao Lord of the Mysterious Clarity Upper Palace. The Yellow Elder Lord transmitted it to the Nine Subtleties Grand Perfected, the Jade Guardian Golden Portal Most Exalted Minister, and the Grand Controller of Destinies, High Master of the Dawn. The Azure Lad Grand Lord taught this text to those who would become Perfected Ones.

The above is from the *Scripture of the Most High Flying Feathered Writings of the Cavern Realms*.

The Six Heavenly Writs of the Orthodox Dharma of the Upper Clarity Pure Tenuity Heaven were transmitted by the Primordial Beginning to the Nine Heavens’ Father and Mother, the Myriad Beginnings Master. The *True Writ of the Three Heavens*, also called the *Golden Yang Cavern Numinous Writ*, issued from the Jade Chapters of the Three Heavens and was transmitted to the August Supreme Master. The *Registers of the Myriad Writs of the Most High* were transmitted by the Most High to the Golden Portal Emperor Lord. The *Tiger-and-Leopard-Dispelling Talisman* was received by the Nine Qi Venerable Lord from the Heavenly Emperor Lord of the Mysterious Private Yin Mound’s Pure Harmony Palace. The *August Radiance True Writ* was transmitted by the Most High Prime Lord to the Yellow Chariot Purple Tenuity Mysterious Palace. The *Jade Flying Heavenly True Writ* was transmitted by the Grand Clarity Primordial Beginning Heavenly King to the Queen Mother of the West. The *True Writ of the Myriad Immortals Opening Heaven of the Mysterious Continent’s Immortal Elders* was transmitted by the Eastern Sea Lad to the Attained Daoist of the Kunlun Wall Terrace’s Numinous Flying Heavenly Perfected, and by the Most High Grand Master to the multitude of immortals who attained the Dao. The *Highest True Writ of Penglai* was transmitted by the August Supreme August of the Mysterious Accomplished Pure Heaven to Ning Feng.

The above is from the *Scripture of the Orthodox Dharma of the Three Heavens of the Cavern Realms*.

The Emperor Lord entrusted it to the Most Exalted Minister, the Azure Lad, to teach to later students.

The above is from the *Scripture of the Yellow Qi and Solar Essence of the Cavern Realms*.

They were passed down orally alone and not recorded in writing.

The above is from the *Scripture of the Great Admonitions of Observing the Body of the Cavern Realms*.

The Celestial Thearch transmitted it to the Later Sage Golden Portal Emperor Lord, who commanded that it be entrusted to the immortal ministers, dukes, and kings who had already attained perfection, without transmitting it to the middling immortals.

The above is from the *Scripture of the Dharma Wheel of the Cavern Mystery*.

**Chapter on the Time Limits for Transmitting Scriptures**

The *Precious Scriptures of the Highest Clarity* comprise three hundred scrolls, nine thousand jade instructions, and seven thousand talismanic diagrams. According to the old regulations, they were transmitted once every ten thousand kalpas. Since the Six Heavens withdrew and the Three Ways became properly illuminated, the cycles of destiny have accelerated. As the Dao now responds to the times, the regulations have been revised: transmission is permitted every seven hundred years. If within those seven hundred years there appears one whose sincerity and bone-essence align with the mysterious register of the Highest Clarity, they may receive transmission in accordance with the covenant.

The above is from the *Scripture of the Seven Turns and Seven Transformations Dancing in Heaven of the Cavern Reality*.

For all those who possess the *Feathered Scripture of Flight of the Supreme* and ascend through the Nine Ways of Mysterious Ascension, transmission is permitted once every three thousand years, with six transmissions allowed. If one encounters a suitable recipient, the teachings may be conferred in a single day.

According to the statutes of the Nine Heavens, it emerges once every ninety thousand years.

The Supreme Great Dao Lord further instructed the Azure Lad: The Nine Heavens have their prohibitions, and transmission occurs but once in ten thousand kalpas. Now, as the cycles of destiny converge and qi returns to the Highest Clarity, the Dao’s course responds to the Golden Terrace. Following the mysterious statutes, if within seven hundred years a suitable recipient appears, three transmissions are permitted.

The *Feathered Scripture of Treading the Celestial Net* of the Supreme, inscribed within the inner register of the Nine Luminaries Lord and the Nine Star Ladies, is a text of hidden transformations, the esoteric Way of the Lofty Void, and the forbidden writings of the High Sovereign Jade Emperor. According to the statutes of the Nine Heavens, it emerges once every ten thousand kalpas. Since the beginning of the Kaihuang era, the reckoning of destiny has accelerated. By imperial decree, the Supreme Great Dao Lord has transmitted it to later students who are destined to become Perfected, permitting three transmissions every nine thousand years. If within those nine thousand years a suitable recipient appears, instantaneous transmission is allowed.

The time limits for transmission conclude here—

These texts may not be reproduced once transmitted.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Retrograde Nine Dao Flying Feather Scripture*. Within a century, if an advanced student of the Perfected has not yet encountered this text, transmission to two persons is permitted.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Three Primordials Jade Registers of Distribution Scripture*. The *Cavern-Real Celestial Pass Three Charts Seven Stars Shifting Degrees Scripture* emerges once every seven hundred years. According to the statutes of the Four Poles’ Luminosity, three persons may receive transmission within those seven hundred years.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Yellow Plain Forty-Four Directions Scripture*. According to the ancient statutes of the Primordial Sovereign, this scripture was transmitted once every ten thousand kalpas. When the Three Heavens established rectitude, the rule was revised to permit three transmissions every seven thousand years. If a suitable recipient appears within seven hundred years, three transmissions are also permitted.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Supreme Plain Numinous Great Possession Wondrous Scripture*. Initially, one transmission was allowed every three hundred years, then again after seven hundred years, one further transmission was permitted.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Nine Perfected Central Scripture*. According to the statutes of the Four Poles’ Luminosity, three transmissions are allowed within seven hundred years; if a suitable recipient appears within a century, two transmissions are permitted.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Primordial Origin Transformation Treasure Perfected Upper Scripture*. The *Jade Clarity Hidden Writings* comprise four scrolls—these are the forbidden texts that the Lofty Jade Sovereign once received from the Jade Mystery Supreme Sovereign Dao Lord. Treasured and wondrously secret, they were entrusted to the Four Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate, who were charged with their concealment. Transmission is permitted to three persons within five thousand years, to be conferred upon Perfected of the Highest Clarity. If three suitable recipients appear within a single year, transmission is also permitted. Once the limit is reached, no further transmission may occur.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Supreme Hidden Writings Scripture*. According to the statutes, those whose bone configurations align with immortality and whose names are inscribed in the Emperor’s register may receive transmission. If such a person appears, three transmissions are permitted within seven hundred years.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Nine Elixirs Upper Transformation Womb Essence Central Record Scripture*. The Supreme Plain Numinous possesses the Great Jade Chapters and the Nine Perfected Luminous Statutes, all transmitted to those whose bone configurations align with the Perfected. According to the ancient statutes of the Primordial Sovereign, this scripture was transmitted once every ten thousand kalpas. When the Three Heavens established rectitude, the rule was revised to permit three transmissions every seven thousand years; if a suitable recipient appears within seven hundred years, three transmissions are also permitted.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Feminine Unity Inner Spirit Treasure Jade Names Scripture*. The Nine Reds are composed of the flying, mysterious feathered chapters of the qi of the Nine Heavens, crystallized into jade script. This Dao is most wondrous, and according to the statutes, it is transmitted once every seven thousand years.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Nine Red Speckled Talismans Inner Perfected Scripture*. The numinous script manifests its marvels within the Lofty Void. After ninety thousand kalpas, the Master of the Mysterious Metropolis received it from the Supreme Void, and later the Azure Lad transmitted it to those whose jade names predestined them for divine transcendence. Three transmissions are permitted every seven hundred years; if a suitable recipient appears within a century, two transmissions are allowed.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Supreme Lofty Winding Plain Upper Scripture*. Formerly, the Upper Primordial Lady transmitted the hidden script to the Jade Maiden of Supreme Harmony. Every seven hundred years, it is to be conferred upon those whose authenticity aligns with the Mysterious Dao.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Jade Clarity Hidden Scripture*. The *Cavern-Real Supreme Lofty Golden Mystery Feathered Chapters Scripture*, according to the statutes, is transmitted every seven hundred years to those whose destiny aligns with transcendence.

The Four Perfected say: According to the Luminous Statutes, three persons may receive transmission within seven hundred years, provided they are destined to become Perfected.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Divine Elixir Registers of the Nine Forms of the Numinous Scripture*. The *Cavern-Real Azure Essentials Purple Writings Scripture*, according to the Mysterious Statutes, permits three transmissions within seven hundred years. The ancient statutes mandated transmission once every ten thousand kalpas. After the Six Heavens receded and the Three Ways were rectified, the reckoning of destiny accelerated. In response to the Dao’s unfolding, the statutes were revised to permit transmission every seven thousand years. If within seven hundred years a person of utmost sincerity whose bone configuration aligns with the Mysterious appears, transmission is granted in accordance with the covenant.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Supreme Lofty Primordial Origin Dao Chapters Scripture*. The *Three Heavens’ Hymns of Praise* were secretly preserved by the Primordial Origin of the Three Heavens within the Three Plainnesses’ Chambers and the Nine-Bend Jade Chamber, transmitted once every thousand years.

The Azure Lad says: Since the Tang era, those who have received this text—seven thousand in number—have all ascended on flying dragons, soaring with darkling wings, or transforming their forms through the turning of wheels, subtly guiding themselves through the void. Such marvels cannot be fully recorded. According to the statutes of the Three Heavens, it emerges once every seven hundred years.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Three Heavens’ Rectifying Dharma Scripture*. The *Cavern-Real Supreme Empyrean Numinous Writings*, transmitted once every ten thousand kalpas to the Supreme Perfected King.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Eight Plainnesses Perfected Scripture*. The Dao of racing the sun and moon is treasured and concealed by the Four Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate and the Nine Sovereigns of the Highest Clarity, as well as the Jade Chapters of the Mysterious Void Lady. One transmission is permitted every three hundred years, and again after seven hundred years, one further transmission is allowed.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Jade-Scripted Lunar Halo Scripture*. All these are the scriptures of the Supreme, each governed by fixed statutes. Three transmissions are permitted within seven hundred years; beyond this, they may not emerge again.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Golden Writ Jade Characters Upper Scripture*. According to the statutes, if within seven hundred years a person bearing a golden name and a purple character of the Eastern Florescence, destined for the Highest Clarity, appears, three transmissions are permitted. If no such bone configuration exists, it is concealed within the Jade Palace and may not be revealed for ten thousand kalpas.

The *Purple Writings Vermilion Characters Lunar Soul Hidden Sounds*: If within a century a person bearing a golden name and inscribed in the Emperor’s register appears, one transmission is permitted.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Yellow Qi Yang Essence Three Dao Sequential Progress Scripture*. The talismans of the Seven Origins for summoning the numinous and attaining the Perfected follow the ancient statutes, transmitted once every ten thousand kalpas. If a suitable recipient appears, three transmissions are permitted within seven hundred years.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Golden Perfected Jade Radiance Eight Effulgences Flying Scripture*. The chapters on attaining the Dao within the Nine Empyreans of the Turning Heavens were recorded in the Jade Palace by the Five Elders of the Immortal Metropolis in the Left Hall of the Duke. According to the statutes of the Four Poles’ Luminosity, it is transmitted once every ten thousand kalpas.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Seven Sages’ Primordial Record of the Turning Heavens and Nine Empyreans Scripture*. It is concealed within the Palace of the Grand Tenuity’s Numinous Metropolis above the Nine Heavens. According to the statutes of the Four Poles’ Luminosity, it is transmitted once every ten thousand kalpas. If one bears the bone destiny of the Mysterious Chart’s recorded name and encounters immortality, three transmissions are permitted within seven hundred years.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Grand Tenuity’s Yellow Writ*.
The Supreme Ultimate Perfected One states: Those who study the Dao may transmit this scripture to one person after forty years. Those who have extended their lifespan may transmit it to one person after four hundred years. Those who have attained Earthly Immortality may transmit it to one person after four thousand years. Those who have attained Heavenly Immortality may transmit it to one person after forty thousand years. Those who have attained the Supreme Cavern-Silence and Most High Perfected One may transmit it to one person after forty thousand kalpas. Those who have received the Great Rites of the Supreme Numinous Treasure have fulfilled the transmission statutes.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Mysterious Scripture of the Five Invocations*.
The Supreme Great Dao Lord states: I formerly received this from the Primordial Heavenly King, who commanded that it be transmitted to Immortal Kings, Immortal Ministers, and Highest Perfected Ones, but not to Middle Immortals. From those without the Mysterious Chart’s imperial jade name of the Highest Clarity, it must not be seen or heard. As a forbidden text of the Nine Heavens, it is transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Mysterious Scripture of the Essential Exegesis of the True Writ*.
The *Cavern-Mysterious Scripture of Wisdom* may be transmitted three times in a thousand years. The *Cavern-Mysterious Scripture of the Dharma Wheel* may emerge once every forty thousand kalpas when the Nine Heavens issue a decree.
The Heavenly Worthy addressed the Flying Heavenly Divine Beings, saying: The *Luminous Perfected Regulations* are enacted once every forty thousand kalpas. Now, transgressing the prohibitions, I entrust this to you—guard it well. It is also said: Transmit it in accordance with the covenant every seven hundred years.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Mysterious Scripture of the Nine Heavens*.
The *Cavern-Mysterious Scripture of Pacifying the Will* may be transmitted three times in a thousand years.
The Great Void Perfected One addressed the Left Immortal Duke of the Supreme Ultimate, saying: According to the Supreme Great Rites, one person may receive it every forty thousand kalpas. Having received this scripture and attained Perfection, I have already transmitted it to fifty-four persons, and you are the fifth.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Mysterious Scripture of Spontaneous Nature*.
According to the *Great Regulations of the Luminous Perfected*, it is enacted once every forty thousand kalpas. It is also said: If a suitable recipient appears within four hundred years, transmission is permitted.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Mysterious Scripture of the Yellow Register’s Simple Writ*.

*Supreme Secret Essentials*, Scroll Thirty-Two—end.

**Chapter on Light Transmission and Punishment**

The Fusang Great Emperor shall transmit the scriptures to the Four Perfected Ones of the Supreme Ultimate, consulting the Queen Mother of the Western Tortoise. The Queen Mother addressed the Great Emperor, saying: In the era of the Supreme August, those who studied and beheld the precious texts, thereby ascending to Jade Clarity, all cultivated the secret and numinous Dao in silence, never uttering it aloud nor revealing it to others. They subtly sensed the utmost quiescence, thereby attaining the Supreme Perfected. Thus, the Dao values concealment and stillness, transforming without form and emerging without sound.

Since I received the true scriptures from the Nine Heavens, countless kalpas have passed, yet I have transmitted them to fewer than three persons. By the end of the Central August Prime, I reached the Northern Prime Heaven, the land of Xina, the Mountain of the Mirror People’s Crows, and the Peak of Qilai. Within the Numinous Palace, I concentrated the qi of the Nine Mysteries and the Orthodox Unity, coalescing it into characters. Later, the Golden Portal Emperor of the Nine Mysteries of the Later Saints beheld the numinous text. By the mandate of the Immortal Capital, brushes were set in motion to transcribe it, and an oath was sworn to Heaven to cultivate the Dao. Upon its completion, he ascended to the Golden Portal.

The Most High, deeming me reckless in divulging celestial treasures, stripped me of my title as a Perfected of the True Origin and demoted me to a scattered numinous official. Only after five hundred years was I restored to my original Perfected state.

The Primordial Beginning established the offices of the Four Departments and the Five Emperors among the divine soldiers precisely to inspect leaks and punish them with the Wind Blade. How can one not be cautious!

Later learners are as numerous as the forest, yet not one attains immortality—why? Their intent lies in the reckless disclosure of Daoist texts, banishing celestial Perfected. Since the Dao does not descend, heavenly punishments subtly manifest. Advancing and retreating, they lose resolve, dying alone in empty mountains, their efforts in vain, their regret beyond words!

The Dao does not reveal itself without diligence, nor does it act without it. Upon beholding true scriptures, one should secretly cultivate and seek the numinous. The divine Perfected are easily moved; one may attain immortality in a matter of days.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Eightfold Simplicity True Scripture*.

The great characters of the Celestial August, Terrestrial August, and Human August of the Highest Clarity all contain wondrous and subtle methods and Cavern-Mysterious precious texts. Without a golden name in the Azure Palace of Fangzhu, one cannot know of them. Those who possess these texts yet transmit them to unworthy recipients, who tread upon them with impurity, disrespect the numinous, and violate their prohibitions, shall cause their seven ancestors to suffer interrogation, be condemned to the right-hand offices, endure mountain fires, and undergo transformation after each tribulation, reborn into non-human destinies.

The *Cavern-Mysterious Numinous Treasure Upper Scripture*, the talismans and jade formulas of the Great and Lesser Kalpas, the precious texts of the Highest Clarity, and the Dao of the Mysterious Cavern—without the Jade Bone, the Mysterious Chart, the Purple Characters, and the Green Names, one cannot know of them. Those who possess these texts yet fail to revere them, defile the true texts with disdain, and recklessly disclose them, banishing the non-Perfected, shall violate their prohibitions. Their seven ancestors shall be interrogated and condemned to the right-hand offices, punished with the trials of the Knife Mountain and Fire Realm, the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings. After three tribulations, they shall pass, reborn into non-human destinies.

The *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Highest Cavern True Scripture*, the *Wondrous Scripture of the Great Simplicity of the Primordial Numinous*, the *Five Elders’ Treasure Scripture of the Female Jade Tablet*, the *Purple Writ of the Golden Flower Cavern Chamber’s Upper Text*, the *Primal Register of Tortoise Mountain*, the *Jade Chapters of the Highest Clarity’s Great Empyrean Jade Writ of the White Tablet and Golden Root*, and the *Precious Scrolls of the Upper Palace*—thirty-one scrolls in total—these are the independent formulas, the Dao of the Highest Mystery’s radiant reflection. The Cavern-Heaven Jade Clarity’s precious texts are the utmost for those who have already attained Perfection. Those with golden offices and jade treasuries, whose names are inscribed on the Emperor’s tablets and registers in the Purple Court, upon receiving these scriptures, if they fail to uphold the regulations, show negligence and disbelief toward the celestial Perfected, and recklessly disclose the sacred texts, allowing the world to see and hear of them, shall be reported by the Jade Lads. Their seven generations of ancestors shall suffer interrogation.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Four Poles Bright Regulations*.

The *Hidden Text of the Moon’s Soul in Cinnabar Characters of the Purple Writ*—if one recklessly speaks of it and informs three persons, one shall die and become a ghostly official, unable to attain immortality.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Scripture of the Yellow Qi and Yang Essence*.

The Most High said: Those who leak celestial texts and hidden writings shall be reported to the Heavenly Emperor. Their three generations of ancestors shall be executed, and the Three Offices shall be ordered to sever their lives. In life, they shall suffer water and fire; in death, they shall become lowly ghosts.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Most High Eightfold Simplicity True Scripture*.

The Highest Sage Lord said: Those who receive the texts of the Seven Sages’ Mysterious Record, the Nine Empyreans’ White Tablet, and the Azure Register, yet whose masters do not swear oaths, recklessly disclose the precious texts, or whose disciples receive them without faith, secretly peruse the jade scrolls—all shall suffer the interrogation of the Wind Blade. Their seven ancestors shall be condemned, endure the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings, and remain unredeemed for ten thousand kalpas. The Five Emperors’ divine soldiers constantly investigate leaks; one must be vigilant in upholding and practicing them.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Seven Sages’ Primal Record Scripture*.

Those who receive the methods of the *Formulas and Verses of the Crooked Simplicity* must not engage with others but seek subtle responses. Only when a suitable recipient is found may they transmit it. To transmit it to an unworthy person or recklessly disclose the precious scriptures shall cause one’s seven generations of ancestors to suffer dark interrogation in hell.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Scripture of the Crooked Simplicity’s Formulas and Verses*.

Those with predestined affinity to behold these texts must have a record of immortality. The Jade Emperor’s precious secrets are not transmitted to the world. Those who recklessly speak of them shall be pierced by the Nine Heavens’ *Ci Jian*, reported to the Emperor Lord. The Most High shall order the Five Emperors’ divine soldiers to punish their persons, and their seven generations of ancestors shall suffer interrogation by the Water Office.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Azure Essentials and Purple Writ Scripture*.

Without a mysterious name on the Cinnabar Terrace or green characters in Jade Clarity, one cannot recklessly transmit them. Unless one possesses a spiritually exceptional bone, ascends the Mysterious Peak to swear an oath, and arrays golden and azure pledges to the numinous, these texts cannot be transmitted, nor their sounds heard. Those who recklessly disclose them shall cause their seven ancestors to be condemned, their own lives lost, and endure the trials of the Three Wretched Paths.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Jade Pendant’s Hidden Origin and Cavern-Flying Inner Writ Scripture*.

The Most High Dao Lord said: Those with predestined affinity to behold these texts must have a spiritually exceptional nature and an assured share of immortality. These divine scriptures are not transmitted to the world. Those who recklessly speak of them shall be pierced by the Three Heavens’ *Ci Jian*, reported to the Emperor Lord, who shall proclaim their sins as transgressions of disclosure.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Yellow Plain’s Forty-Four Directions Scripture*.
To transmit these in violation of the precepts is to betray one’s oath, causing three generations of ancestors to be tried by the Water Bureau, oneself to forfeit all hope of immortality, and to die as a lowly ghost.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Hidden Radiance’s Record of Form and Spirit Scripture*.
Those who align with the True must receive these texts; the receiver shall treasure and conceal them, never recklessly transmitting them. To disclose these numinous writings is to cause nine generations of ancestors to be tried and condemned to the Bureau of Ghosts.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Great Empyrean’s Numinous Jade Writ Scripture*.
The method of transmission requires master and disciple to pass them on in reverence for the Mysterious and Secret. To transmit to the unworthy, to disregard the statutes, is to betray and profane the Heavenly Treasures, to violate the oath with negligence and disdain. One shall die as a lowly ghost, and seven generations of ancestors shall suffer the punishments of wind and fire. Unless bound by the same covenant, one ought to seal one’s lips.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Nine Perfected’s Central Scripture*.
Should a master transmit without regard to the proper time, the disciple shall personally endure the trials of the Wind Blade.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Transformations’ Treasure of the True Upper Scripture*.
The Nine Reds are the soaring, mysterious feathered writ of the Nine Heavens’ qi, congealed into jade script. To recklessly disclose or transmit them to the unworthy is to cause seven generations of ancestors to be tried, and oneself to perish in the River Source.

It is further said: Those who receive without invoking the Heavenly Numinous shall have the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens of the scripture report them to the Most High, punished by the Five Thearchs’ divine soldiers. Those who recklessly disclose shall be punished with the annihilation of nine generations of ancestors, while those who receive without swearing an oath shall bring calamity upon seven generations of ancestors, their own bodies subjected to the Wind Blade, as decreed by the Natural Heavenly Scriptures.

Thus the Upper Prime Lord declared to the Five Thearchs: “Scriptures must not be transmitted without an oath, nor received without proper invocation, lest their truth be lost. The responsibility for life and death in such matters rests with both parties; scholars ought to adhere to the text and uphold it.”

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Nine Red Striped Talismans of the Five Thearchs’ Inner Perfection Scripture*.
To recklessly disclose these treasured writings is to break one’s oath and suffer bodily ruin, causing seven generations of ancestors to be tried by the Bureau of Ghosts.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Dragon Radiance’s Nine Writs of the Red Scriptures*.
To transmit to the unworthy is to consign oneself to wind and fire, and seven generations of parents and ancestors to be tried by the Water Bureau.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Golden Tiger’s True Talismans*.
To transmit to the unworthy is to be reported to the Northern Thearch, bringing calamity upon seven generations of ancestors, who shall be eternally condemned to the Bureau of Ghosts, while one’s own body perishes and form is ruined.

To the right: From the *Cavern-Perfected Highest Jade Clarity’s Inscribed Names of the Inner Writ*.
Here ends Scroll Thirty-Three of the *Supreme Secret Essentials*.

Scroll Thirty-Four of the *Supreme Secret Essentials*
"On Master and Disciple"

1. *Dongxuan* Precious Writs: Dunhuang manuscript reads *Dongyuan* Precious Origin.
2. *Yè*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *yān*.
3. *Lu*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *lù*.
4. *Láng*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *lǎng*.
5. *Guān*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *gǔ*.
6. *Dì*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *zhāng*.
7. *Tōu*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *jiū*.
8. *Yuánjì*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *Xuánjì*.
9. *Jué*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *jué*.
10. *Pèi*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *pèi*. *Yuán*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *xuán*.
11. *Qì*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *qì*.
12. *Shì*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *dé*.
13. *Yāng yán qī zǔ*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *yāng dài qī xuán*.
14. *Tiān*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *shī*.
15. *Xíng*: Dunhuang manuscript reads *xíng*.

The Most High said: Those of you in future generations who wish to propagate the numinous inner teachings must establish eleven matters to gain the trust of all people, so that you may then transmit this scripture.

First, maintain perfect sincerity, with no inner corruption.
Second, relieve and aid the orphaned, the elderly, and the poor, with a heart of compassion.
Third, exhort others to shun evil and cultivate goodness, as earnestly as between father and son.
Fourth, seek no fame or reputation, regarding gain and loss as one.
Fifth, in secluded places, diligently perform rites and prostrations, cultivate all merits and virtues, as if in the midst of a great assembly.
Sixth, do not deceive, so that the people trust you as they trust the four seasons.
Seventh, suddenly abandon glory and splendor, so that rank does not cling to your person.
Eighth, forsake your wife and children from afar, dwelling alone in quietude.
Ninth, draw near to the wise and learned, broadly inquiring into the good Dao.
Tenth, the Dao abides in darkness and obscurity—do not cling stubbornly to certainty. Discuss and deliberate with the worthy, and do not insist on your own views.
Eleventh, always practice humility and reverence toward others.

These are the eleven matters for propagating the inner teachings; you must diligently study and uphold them.

The Most High addressed Ziming, saying: Those who study the Dao, upon hearing the Dharma, should be as one starving craves food; upon meeting one who may be their teacher, they should be as one ill finding a physician. Why cling to humility and deference? They should be like the poor of the world, who, for the sake of clothing and food, borrow and labor, serving others, never shirking toil or hardship, never avoiding high or low, elder or younger, but offering all for wealth. Those who study the Dao should be likewise: in seeking the Dharma and serving a teacher, do not discriminate by status, nor speak of seniority. Do not say, "I am older, while they are young," or "They are of low birth, while I am a lofty scholar." Those who harbor such thoughts still cling to the attitudes of life and death in the mundane world and do not comprehend the essentials of the perfect and equal truth. Such people study the Dao in vain, hoping for merit in vain!

There is no high or low among people; where there is the Dao, there is honor. The so-called elder need not be one of advanced years; what matters is broad knowledge and deep insight. One should not say, "Their studies came after mine, while mine came first—how can I now reverse and take them as my teacher?" Those who think thus belong to the company of the foolish and envious; they are not my disciples.

The Dao demands humility and deference, yielding to ability and deferring to virtue. Follow only what is good; do not exalt yourself and belittle others, nor insist on your own rightness while condemning others. This is a grave illness in the study of the Dao.

You must teach future generations to be cautious—cautious indeed!

The Most High said: Though disciples may receive many teachings, they should still revere their original teacher; the original teacher should also humble themselves before their disciples. The reason is this: in attaining the Dao and delivering the world, none do so without learning from a teacher. Having a teacher is like a tree having roots—because of the roots, the branches flourish and spread. Those who study the Dao likewise take their original teacher as their foundation, gradually perfecting great wisdom. Once great wisdom is perfected, it can in turn perfect lesser wisdom, just as a tree produces seeds from its roots, and the seeds in turn produce roots, extending and multiplying without end. From the teacher, one receives the Dao, gradually increasing and accumulating virtue. When one’s virtue surpasses that of the teacher, one may then teach the teacher. This is what is meant by "the Dao is noble, the person is base"—the principle is thus.

Lord Daoling said: If, as you teach, the original teacher should also defer to the disciple, then what of the rites, rules, and forms for receiving the Dao? How should one show respect to earlier and later teachers?

The Most High said: Both earlier and later teachers deserve respect. The reason is this: the original teacher is the root of one’s learning. It is like building a mountain—it begins with a single basket of earth, gradually achieving height and grandeur. The original teacher is likewise the foundation for one’s initial awakening. The later teacher brings completion. It is like fine attire and adornments—all things are prepared, yet without the final crowning, one cannot go forth to engage in human affairs. The later teacher is likewise thus. Though one may study the Dao for a long time, if the superior methods are not complete, one cannot attain the Dao.

From the *Scripture of Ascending Mystery*

Master Yin said: From the time my hair was still bound in youth, I loved the Dao and virtue. I left my home and followed my teacher east and west, north and south, abandoning the Five Classics, secluding myself from the world for over twenty years beside famous mountains. In cold, I had no time for clothing; in hunger, no time for food. I dared not think of returning home, dared not rest from my labors. I served my sagely teacher, awaiting their pleasure, my face dirty, my hands calloused, until at last I was recognized.

From the *Scripture of Daoist Traces*

The good are the teachers of the not-good; the not-good are the resource for the good.

One who does not value their teacher nor cherish their resource—though they may possess knowledge, they remain deluded. This is called the essential mystery.

From the *Daoist Scripture of Laozi*

Laozi said: Without a luminous teacher, how can one resolve doubts and difficulties?
My Dao is like a single hair—who can truly discern its divisions?
From the beginning of past ages, all that has transpired is like dust and sand.
Each movement entails kalpas of effort; I reflect and find it arduous indeed.

From the *Scripture of Western Ascension*

The Most High Mysterious Unity Perfected One said: The teacher is a treasure.
To study the Dao without a teacher is to fail; without a teacher, there is no deliverance; without a teacher, there is no transcendence.
Thus, the teacher is my father.
If a disciple does not revere the teacher’s Dao, they cannot subdue demons, will ruin their own body, and how then may they ride the Eight Radiant Dragon Chariot or ascend the Jade Terrace of the Great Ultimate?
You now study the Dao of Highest Clarity, aspiring to ascend and soar, to eternally enjoy boundless fortune. Yet if you slight your teacher and practice the Dao, seeking the flight of flesh, it is like casting a night-shining pearl away—you will lose your one true path.

The Most High Mysterious Unity Perfected One, Yu Luoqiao, addressed the Left Immortal Duke of the Great Ultimate, saying: You have accumulated kalpas of thought and action, mortifying the body to save beings, delivering all that lives, extending kindness even to grasses and trees. You entrusted yourself to forests and hills, restrained your passions, endured hardship, revered your teacher and lineage, labored without weariness, cultivated a resolute and earnest will—thus attaining utmost virtue. You have ascended to the Purple Orchid Terrace and the Golden Towers of the Highest Clarity Palace, where jade texts with purple characters record your towering merit. Your conduct aligns with that of the highest immortals. The Most High has commanded the Perfected One of the Great Ultimate to be your Master of the Three Caverns. Now, I am further commanded to serve as your First Initiating Teacher. You may resume your seat, and I shall instruct you in the turning of the Dharma Wheel, the essential admonitions, and the decisive precepts.

The Second Perfected One of the Most High Mysterious Unity, Guang Miaoyin, addressed the Left Immortal Duke, saying: You have revolved through the cycles of birth and death, forming karmic bonds with the good. Through kalpas, you have accumulated merit, lifetime after lifetime, never ceasing. You abandoned glory and renounced rank, entrusting yourself to secluded hills. In hunger and cold, on perilous paths, you thought of the Dao without complaint. You revered the teacher’s treasure as if facing a deity, your heart gentle and yielding, ever joyful in sitting and rising. You maintained long fasts and diligent contemplation, never neglecting the proper times. Your concentrated sincerity has penetrated deeply—thus you are named among the elect of Highest Clarity. The Most High has commanded me to be your Second Initiating Teacher. I shall fully instruct you in the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, the roots of birth and death, and the essential admonitions.

The Third Perfected One of the Most High Mysterious Unity, Zhen Dingguang, addressed the Left Immortal Duke, saying: For seven generations, you have been benevolent, cutting your own flesh to save the destitute, extending kindness even to birds and beasts, moistening your own body with generosity. You have also accumulated diligent service to your teacher’s treasure, thinking not of furs in the cold nor of taste in hunger. Amid hardships in mountain forests, your devotion has never wavered. The Purple Treasury has received your true nature, and a wondrous light has arisen from your neck, drawing the descent of the exalted. You have been granted the rank of Immortal Minister to repay your past virtue—how majestic indeed! The Most High has commanded me to be your Third Initiating Teacher. Now, I shall instruct you in the boundless wondrous penetrations, the turning of the spirit, and the essential precepts of meditative absorption.

From the *Scripture of the Wheel of Mysterious Caverns*

If scriptures are not received from a teacher, the spirit does not move. Should the world lack a Dharma Master and no register be transmitted, one may offer a pledge of faith to the Pure and Cold [realm], or in a secluded chamber invoke the Mysterious Teacher. Facing north, bow three times, then spread offerings upon the ground to relieve the hungry and destitute. With equanimity and single-mindedness, proceed thus. If a teacher exists in the world, this method need not be employed.

From the *Hidden Commentary on the Mysterious Caverns*

From the *Divine Immortals Section of the Jade Register of the Middle Prime*:
Reverence for the teacher’s demeanor begins with the Scripture Master—thus rites should be observed.
The ancestral lineage of the Three Clarities begins with the Register Master—thus rites should be observed.
The records of life and death, the means of deliverance, begin with the Deliverance Master—the teacher who transmits scriptures and delivers one from the five paths of difficulty—thus rites should be observed.
In learning, if one does not honor the Three Teachers, the Three Treasures will not descend, the Three Realms will not show respect, and demonic forces will harm the body.

From the *Divine Immortals Section of the Yellow Register of the Lower Prime*:
The ritual of merit and demeanor in serving the teacher: When the Scripture Master initiates disciples, the three who receive the Dharma Master are immediately enrolled among the meritorious in the heavens. Once merit and name are established, they may traverse the Three Realms, and the Five Emperors become their guests.

From the *Divine Immortals Section of the Yellow Register*:
The ritual of merit and demeanor in serving the teacher: When the Register Master initiates disciples, the seven who receive the Dharma Master are immediately enrolled among the meritorious in the heavens. Their names are recorded in the immortal registers, their seven generations of ancestors ascend, and they advance to the celestial halls.

From the *Divine Immortals Section of the Yellow Register*:
The ritual of merit and demeanor in serving the teacher: When the Deliverance Master initiates disciples, the nine who receive the Dharma Master are immediately enrolled among the meritorious in the heavens. Their names are inscribed on white tablets, and their great merit ensures that nine generations of ancestors ascend together, all attaining freedom in the Seven Jeweled Forests.

From the *Divine Immortals Section of the Yellow Register*:
When initiating disciples under the Three Teachers: If the Scripture Master has already ascended, the Register Master should also be initiated. If the Register Master has ascended, the Deliverance Master should also be initiated. According to the regulations, merit and name are reported to the heavens. If all Three Teachers have ascended, three disciples should be initiated and entrusted to virtuous fellow students. The fellow students must follow the regulations, reporting merit and name to the heavens without omission.

From the *Golden Register of the Mysterious Caverns*

From the *Central Scripture of the Most High*:
The teacher is so called because of the scriptural practice they embody; the recipient studies it, aligning in sincerity. Their joys and sorrows are intertwined, their bond equal to life and death. Only then can they be tested and proven, together ascending the immortal courts. Thus, facing east, one bows and receives instruction, pledging in the secluded chamber. Superior and inferior are made manifest, the three covenants distinguished. With diligent heart, one treasures the scriptural storehouse, practicing its essential words. Sincerity is maintained with single-mindedness; reverence for teacher and scripture is preserved in the heart’s core, never faltering.
Only thus may one speak of communion with the divine and the covenant of Dao and virtue.
To uphold the scriptures while concealing their Dao, to act in accordance with their vows—then above, one’s name is inscribed on the jade tablets, recorded in the imperial registers of the Great Ultimate.

From the *Esoteric Writings of the Great Cinnabar* (*Dongzhen Taidan Yinshu Jing*), "Faith and Pledges" Chapter:

The Flying Heavenly Divine Persons declare: To receive the ten sections of the wondrous scriptures of the Numinous Treasure, cast three golden dragons into the watery abodes and sacred mountain dwellings, uniting these three places as the pledge of immortal study.

It is further said: Prepare silk banners of five colors, each forty feet in length, to invoke the Five Thearchs as the pledge of sworn testimony.

It is further said: Use five ounces of finest gold to covenant with the Five Marchmounts as the pledge of the precious scriptures.

It is further said: Employ twenty-four thousand gold coins as surety for the twenty-four life-officials, the pledge of revering the true. If gold is lacking, bronze may suffice.

It is further said: The celestial writings are secret and weighty; without faith, they are not treasured. Thus, the perfected sages test the heart through pledges. Without faith, one is deemed base in the Way; without covenant, the treasure is treated lightly.

It is further said: If one receives the scriptures while pledges remain incomplete, and later encounters a worthy person who brings the required pledges to request transmission, one should fulfill the missing pledges with what has been received. Any surplus from the former master’s vestments may be used for one’s own ritual purposes.

It is further said: Of the pledges for receiving the scriptures, one-fifth is to be offered to the ancestral master. Another two-fifths are to be dispersed to the destitute and mountain-dwelling Daoists. The remaining pledges are to be used for one’s own ritual needs—burning incense, lighting lamps—to establish merit for the disciple.

It is further said: When the Heavenly Kings and Thearchs dispel calamities and deliver from peril, use five-colored patterned silk, its length matching the number of zhang, and dragons made of finest gold. For imperial decrees, employ purple-patterned silk; for commoners, plain silk. Dragons are to be made of standard gold. The rites of lamp-lighting and supplication follow the same method as above.

---

From the *Scriptures of Clarity and Illumination* (*Dongxuan Mingzhen Jing*):

The Heavenly Worthy asks: Why does the Great Dao so demand wealth and treasures from people, compelling them to perform meritorious works? It observes their miserly hearts and tests their intentions. If one possesses yet does not disperse, what can they seek? Those who, though impoverished, rouse their resolve with steadfast clarity, toiling diligently at the master’s gate without fear of hardship—such ones are witnessed by the Dao. Their merit moves the various heavens. Thus, offering wealth corresponds to the heart, and extending the heart corresponds to wealth; their merit is equal.

The ancients sought the heart; the latter age seeks wealth. The ancients attained immortality only through the heart; the latter age achieves deliverance only through wealth. This is so because in the latter age, wealth is prized while the Dao is not. If one were to offer ten thousand pounds of gold and a single scripture of immortality in a barren mountain, the people of the latter age would covet the gold, not the scripture. Gold can only bring bodily affliction, while the scripture can secure long life. Though all know this, they cannot escape their own stinginess and greed. If they cannot escape stinginess and greed, how can they be called followers of the Dao? Thus, it is not the Dao that exalts people—this is what is meant.

---

From the *Scriptures of the Three Primal Realms’ Admonitions* (*Dongxuan Sanyuan Pinjie Jing*):

The Most High declares: Pledges are to be used for purificatory fasts, offering incense and oil to the scriptures and the Dao, creating fields of blessing for all, and dispersing alms to mountain-dwelling Daoists, the destitute, and those afflicted by the six miseries of the world. The Dharma Master must not privately use them; the transgression is grave. Those who mislead others in the study of the Dao—students of the Dao, beware! Beware!

---

From the *Scriptures of Natural Illumination* (*Dongxuan Ziran Jing*):

The Heavenly Worthy addresses the Left Mystic Perfected: When you transmit these scriptures, you must follow the pledges of the hidden canons, using gold, coins, patterned silk, and other items all in accordance with the prescribed forms.

This method originates from the profound contemplation of the Primordial Sovereign of Vast Emptiness and Pristine Simplicity. It is constantly treasured and practiced by the Primal Elders of the Five Directions.

The recipient provides five parts of finest gold and five ounces of undyed silk to honor the spirits of the Five Directions’ Primal Elders. The silk banner corresponds to one’s destined lifespan of one hundred twenty years. For each year beyond, one *gong* of silk is added for a prince, one *zhang* for a commoner, and one *chi* for the poor. These three types of offerings must not be omitted; to receive the transmission while lacking them is to incur transgression. Adjustments may be made according to wealth or poverty.

---

From the *Scriptures of Subtle Contemplation and Resolute Will* (*Dongxuan Siwei Dingzhi Jing*):

The Perfected One states: The transmission protocols for the *Five Thousand Character Scripture* are identical to those of the *Numinous Treasure*, reserved exclusively for those of exceptional talent and resolve who diligently recite and seek the Dao of spontaneous ascent to immortality. The recipient must present fifty *chi* of undyed silk as ritual offering to the *Numinous Treasure*, receiving both scriptures simultaneously atop a renowned mountain peak.

The Immortal Duke says: Those of lofty virtue in the world who wish to recite and aspire to ascend as immortals should receive it alongside the *Numinous Treasure*.

—From the *Scriptures of Ritual Offerings in the Cavernous Mystery* (*Dongxuan Fuzhai Jing*)

The Lord Emperor of the Grand Tenuity Heaven addressed the Supreme Minister, the Azure Lad, and the Lord of the Western City: Those whose hearts delight in the Dao, who joyfully and diligently focus on the profound, who do not begrudge wealth and treasure, and who esteem the Dao above all else—only to such persons may one speak of it. Those who inwardly covet riches and outwardly harbor frivolous desires are barred from the Dao, which seals itself away like jade tablets locked behind golden gates. After their ascension and deliverance, the scriptures are concealed within sacred mountains.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Supreme Numinous Tiger* (*Dongzhen Taishang Shenhu Yujing*)

For the transmission of true names and concealed arts, in accordance with the *Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*, one must provide eight taels of purple gold and eighty *chi* of cinnabar-patterned brocade.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Eight Hidden Arts of the Cinnabar Radiance Dao* (*Dongzhen Danjing Daojing Yindi Bashu Jing*)

Whenever a master receives ritual offerings for an alliance, they must distribute them to the destitute and impoverished, relieve the urgent distress of the sick and poor, succor the starving in mountains and rivers, and fund the public works of the divine spirits. If one privately appropriates them for personal sustenance or greedily hoards them for profit, then the master’s seven generations of ancestors will suffer prolonged torment in hell, and their own body will enter the Wind and Blade Hell.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Lofty and Sagely Golden Mystery* (*Dongzhen Gaosheng Jinxuan Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern Real Scripture*, the *Eightfold Jade Register of the Eight Winds’ Meandering Path of the Emperor Unity* of the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the *Mysterious Reversion of the Great Cinnabar and the Five Penetrations of the Twelve Supreme Vows*, the *Ninefold Array of the Mysterious Mother’s Prior Entry into the Golden Flower Chamber of the Feminine Unity*, and the *Numinous Writ of the Purple Text’s Ninefold Mysteries*, which fills the five viscera with *langgan* and radiant cinnabar, one must first sever the binding cord to proceed. The regulations are as follows:

Fashion a ring from purple gold, one *cun* in diameter, and cut it in half. Master and disciple shall each wear one half for life. Use a blue silk cord, nine *chi* in length, and sever it in half, wrapping each half around their respective ring halves before wearing them. Prepare a piece of blue brocade, one *chi* and eight *cun* in size, and divide it in half to make pouches to hold the gold rings and blue silk cords. Once the rings are divided, the disciple bows three times to receive the scripture.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Great Cavern* (*Dongzhen Dadong Zhenjing*)

For the transmission of the *Ninefold Luminous Statutes of the Supreme Plain and Numinous Great Possession’s Jade Chapters*, in accordance with the statutes, the recipient must provide three taels of fine gold, one hundred *chi* of purple silk, twenty-seven *chi* of blue silk, five taels of red thread, one *jin* of aloeswood, and one tael of cinnabar, presenting them to the master as tokens of the alliance.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Jade Formulae of the Inner Deities of the Four Palaces* (*Dongzhen Sigong Neishen Baoming Yujue Jing*)

Five colors of brocade, fifty *chi* each, are used to petition the immortal officials of the Five Emperors. Five taels of purple gold serve as pledges to the oaths of the Five Directions. Five *jin* of aloeswood ascend as offerings to the Three Primordial Palaces. One *jin* of true pearls serves as the token of the cinnabar alliance. One inscribed knife severs the path of deathly *qi*. Seven gold pearls are used to summon the essences of the Seven Primes. Seventy *chi* of crimson silk serve as the pledge of the Flaming Radiance.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Purple Transcendence and Flaming Radiance’s Divine Mystery* (*Dongzhen Zidu Yanguang Shenxuan Bianjing*)

For the transmission of the *Hidden Writings of the Great Perfected of the Mysterious Mound*, one must provide forty *chi* of white silk, ten *chi* of blue silk, three pairs of gold rings, and nine taels of incense. The white silk substitutes for the blood oath of plain silk; the blue silk serves as the pledge for the three transmissions over seven hundred years; the gold rings signify the unbreakable vow of secrecy; and the incense serves as the luminous alliance with the spirits.

For the transmission of the *Formulae of the Plain Silk Oral Instructions*, one must use forty *chi* of cinnabar-dyed silk and two pairs of gold buttons as tokens of the *True One of the Imperial Mystery*.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Plain Silk Oral Instructions* (*Dongzhen Qusu Jueci Jing*)

For the transmission of writings inscribed in cinnabar on purple silk, the disciple must present seven taels of fine gold, forty *chi* of yellow silk, and thirty-two *chi* of blue silk, swearing an oath before transmission.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Yellow Qi and Yang Essence* (*Dongzhen Huangqi Yangjing Jing*)

For the transmission of the talismans for summoning spirits, attracting the perfected, capturing demons, and the *Seven Primes of the Vast and Open*, in accordance with the luminous statutes, the disciple must present one *jade dragon* and one *golden fish*, one hundred *chi* of purple silk, and three taels of fine gold to the master possessing the scripture, swearing an oath to the Nine Heavens.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Golden Perfection and Jade Radiance’s Eightfold Ascent* (*Dongzhen Jinzhen Yuguang Bajing Feijing*)

In ancient times, oaths were sworn by tasting blood and cutting hair, erecting altars to inform Heaven, as unbreakable pledges of secrecy. Nowadays, one may substitute offerings of gold and silk for the body’s flesh and hair, arranging them in a secluded place to invoke the Supreme August One. The ritual requires three gold rings, bright and lustrous, and thirty-nine *chi* of blue silk to replace the threefold covenant. Alternatively, they may be joined into twenty-seven *chi*. The ritual offerings must be recorded in full and may not be privately used for personal gain.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Hidden Writings of the Great Cinnabar* (*Dongzhen Taidan Yinshu Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Writings of the Seven Sages’ Mysterious Record, the Nine Heavens’ Reversion, the White Tablets of the Plain Register*, the disciple must present seven taels of fine gold, seventy-two *chi* of purple silk, and seven taels of superior cinnabar, approaching the master facing north to receive the transmission after swearing an oath to the Lofty and Sagely Heaven.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Seven Sages’ Mysterious Record* (*Dongzhen Qisheng Xuanji Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Nine Perfected Mysterious Scriptures*, one must first taste blood and ascend the altar in layers, cutting hair to swear an unbreakable oath of secrecy. Later sages, deeming blood-tasting injurious to the vital *qi* and hair-cutting a violation of the body’s integrity, now substitute yellow gold for the blood oath and thirty-two *chi* of soft blue silk for the hair-cutting pledge. The master must not disperse the oath offerings for private gain or misuse them; they must be bestowed upon mountain-dwelling recluses, solitary practitioners, and impoverished Daoists.

—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Supreme Ascent on Feathered Wings* (*Dongzhen Taishang Feixing Yujing*)

For the transmission of the *Scripture of the Great Mystery*, the disciple must present three *liang* of finest gold, one hundred *chi* of purple silk, twenty-seven *chi* of blue damask, five *liang* of red thread, one *jin* of aloeswood, and one *liang* of cinnabar, then approach the master to receive the text.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Pure Numinous Great Mystery* (*Dongzhen Suling Dayou Miaojing*)

For the transmission of the *Scripture of the Central Record of Embryonic Essence*, the disciple must present one *jin* of finest gold, eighty *chi* of white silk, and one *jin* of cinnabar to substitute for the oath sworn facing north, pledging in solemn covenant, and may not transmit it lightly or without faith.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Nine Elixirs’ Supreme Transformation of Embryonic Essence* (*Dongzhen Jiudan Shanghua Taijing Zhongji Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Scripture of the Nine Crimson-Speckled Talismans*, the disciple must present three *liang* of finest gold, fifty *chi* each of five-colored patterned silk, thirty *chi* of brocade damask, and one *jin* of finest incense, then approach a five-colored cliff to report to the Five Thearchs before transmission.
—From the *Cavern-Real Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Nine Crimson-Speckled Talismans* (*Dongzhen Shangqing Jiu Chi Banfu Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Purple Phoenix Crimson Writ*, the disciple must present one gold tiger tablet and one jade slip, ninety *chi* of purple silk, and one *jin* of vermilion, then jointly report and pledge in covenant before transmission.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Dragon Radiance Nine-Script Purple Phoenix Crimson Writ* (*Dongzhen Longjing Jiuwen Zifeng Chishu Jing*)

For the transmission of the *True Gold Tiger Talismans*, the disciple must present a gold tiger jade bell and thirty *chi* each of plain brocade and black gauze as an oath to the Golden Perfected, pledging in covenant to Heaven and Earth an unspoken pact.
—From the *Cavern-Real True Talismans of the Celestial Thearch of the Grand Tenuity* (*Dongzhen Taiwei Tiandi Jun Jin Hu Zhenfu*)

For the transmission of the *True Tiger Talismans*, the disciple must present ten *liang* of finest gold as a pledge to the divine Perfected, ninety *chi* of brocade to swear an oath to the Nine Heavens, and thirty *chi* of blue damask to pledge the heart. Devoted to the Dao and delighting in the Perfected, they must diligently focus the mind on the Mystery and not begrudge material goods.
—From the *Cavern-Real Divine Tiger True Talismans of the Jade Pendants of the Supreme* (*Dongzhen Taishang Yushou Shenhu Zhenfu*)

For the transmission of the *Eightfold Pure Real Scripture*, the disciple must present forty *chi* of white silk and two pairs of silver rings to the master possessing the scripture. For those undertaking the practice of the Five Penetrations, the disciple must present thirty-two *chi* of blue cloth to the master possessing the scripture as a lifelong pact of non-disclosure.
—From the *Cavern-Real Eightfold Pure Real Scripture* (*Dongzhen Basu Zhenjing*)

For the transmission of the *Three Primes Jade Tallies*, the disciple must present five *liang* of finest gold, ninety *chi* of phoenix-patterned gauze, and thirty-two *chi* of *ba*-patterned damask, then ascend the native sacred peak with the master to receive the scripture.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Three Primes Jade Tallies* (*Dongzhen Sanyuan Yujian Bujing*)

For the transmission of the *Supreme Scripture of the Treasure Perfected*, the disciple must present nine *liang* of finest gold, forty-seven *chi* of cinnabar-ground yellow brocade, twenty-two *chi* of blue cloth, and one gold fish and jade dragon each, then ascend to pledge facing north and report to the Nine Heavens before transmission.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Primordial Beginning’s Transformations of the Treasure Perfected* (*Dongzhen Yuanshi Bianhua Baozhen Shangjing*)

For the transmission of the *Scripture of the Yellow Court*, the disciple must establish an oath and pledge not to disclose it. In ancient times, ninety *chi* of dark numinous brocade, forty *chi* of gold-slip phoenix-patterned gauze, and nine pairs of gold buttons were used to substitute for the hair-cutting and blood-tasting oath of non-disclosure. These items are marvelous fabrics from the divine realm, not found in the mundane world. Now, brocade may be substituted with white silk, gauze with blue cloth, and buttons with gold rings, which are sufficient to pledge faith to the Nine Heavens, regulate and report to the Three Officials, and all are to be offered to the master possessing the scripture.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Inner Radiance of the Yellow Court* (*Dongzhen Huangting Neijing Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Scripture of the Foreign Release of Karma*, the disciple must present nine *liang* of finest gold and thirty-six *chi* of *ba*-patterned damask as a pledge.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Foreign Release of Karma* (*Dongzhen Waiguo Fangpin Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Purple Writ*, the disciple must follow the regulations of the Nine Perfected Mysterious Code, cultivate according to the methods and standards, and present one gold fish and one jade dragon as pledges in accordance with the covenant, along with one hundred *chi* of purple damask and forty *chi* of blue silk, then approach the master possessing the scripture to receive it.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Azure Essentials and Purple Writ* (*Dongzhen Qingyao Zishu Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Golden Writ*, the disciple must present two *liang* of finest gold, forty *chi* of blue silk, and ninety *chi* of white gauze, then pledge in covenant before transmission.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Jade Pendant Golden Bell Supreme Ultimate Golden Writ* (*Dongzhen Yupai Jinchang Taiji Jinshu Shangjing*)

For the transmission of the *Supreme Yellow Plain Scripture of the Forty-Four Directions*, the covenant requires one jade tablet, one *chi* and five *fen* in length and one *cun* and four *fen* in width, to pledge to the Four Poles of the Supreme Perfected. Additionally, forty *chi* of yellow plain silk and two pairs of gold rings are used to substitute for the blood-tasting oath of non-disclosure.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Yellow Plain Forty-Four Directions* (*Dongzhen Huangsu Sishisi Fang Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Seven Stars’ Transfer of Degrees*, the disciple must present thirty-one *chi* of blue silk, seventy *chi* of red damask, ninety *chi* of phoenix-patterned gauze, seven pairs of gold buttons, and one pair each of gold fish and jade dragons as pledges for the covenant.
—From the *Cavern-Real Scripture of the Celestial Pass Three Diagrams and Seven Stars’ Transfer of Degrees* (*Dongzhen Tianguan Santu Qixing Yidu Jing*)

For the transmission of the *Numinous Writ of the Grand Empyrean*, the recipient must present nine *liang* of finest gold and ninety *chi* of purple silk to pledge faith to the Nine Heavens, after which the master will then pledge and transmit.
—From the *Cavern-Real Numinous Writ of the Grand Empyrean* (*Dongzhen Taixiao Langshu*)

**Section on Transmission of Degrees**
When transmitting scriptures, the master possessing the text must first seek a spiritual response before proceeding. They should enter the chamber, burn incense, and secretly vow to the divine spirits, then bow before the scripture and silently pray:
*"Supreme Primordial Sovereign, Great Divinity of the Immortal Capital, on this auspicious day, I humbly present eight wishes. Desiring to transmit this supreme method, I dare to report to the Numinous Origin—may I know if it is permissible?"*
After the prayer, they should retire to rest and will surely receive a divine response. The disciple will then know in their heart whether it is favorable or not and may proceed with transmission only after careful consideration.

The method for the master transmitting scriptures is as follows: First, bow to the four directions to invoke the divine spirits as the principal masters, then slowly take up the scripture, stand, and raise it toward the heavens to pray, reporting and pledging to the divine spirits as a covenant of the mysterious code. They must state the name of the disciple receiving the scripture and report to the great divinities the title of the scripture being transmitted, establishing its regulations and inscribing them in records, adorning the text with elegant phrases to present it. After the prayer, the disciple should bow twice and kneel to receive it.

Upon receiving the scripture, the disciple should bow twice again.

This is the inner method of the covenant between the Perfected and the gods—it need not be preserved in full, nor require blood-oaths or daring leaks of its pacts. Whenever a master transmits scriptures, they must first purify themselves through fasting and seclusion, avoiding all worldly affairs. They should first invoke the divine spirits, seeking secret resonance, and only then proceed with transmission. If the signs appear disordered or the omens inauspicious, this is the celestial spirits manifesting their judgment, forbidding the transmission. Should a disciple disregard the divine spirits and transmit to two individuals, according to the statutes of the *Yellow and Plain Registers*, the disciple will face dark retribution, their seven generations of ancestors confined to hell for eternity, and their own body doomed to perish—how then could immortality be hoped for?

**From the *Dongzhen Huangsu Sishisi Fang Jing***

The Most High said: Dao-ling, know that those worthy of receiving this scripture possess ten traits:
1. They seek superior methods and follow goodness as water flows downstream.
2. They draw near to the wise and virtuous, free from doubt in their conduct.
3. They are discerning, able to distinguish truth from falsehood.
4. They are cautious, their words never exceeding their deeds.
5. They are gentle and mild, seldom committing transgressions.
6. They can serve as disciples to those superior to themselves, without arrogance.
7. They revere their masters and treasure their teachings as a pauper treasures treasure.
8. They can serve their masters and elders without shirking toil.
9. They harbor no resentment toward former masters.
10. They earnestly request instruction, persisting day and night without slackening—these are the ten traits.

Ziming addressed the Most High, saying: If in future ages there are Daoist scholars who have not yet encountered true scriptures, and suddenly discover this text in mountain caves or among heterodox practitioners, foreign masters, or those of deviant views, and upon reading it from beginning to end recognize its authenticity and essential teachings—yet find no master to transmit it—may they practice and transmit it?

The Most High said: They may practice it themselves and cultivate it as the scripture instructs, but they may not transmit it to others. Why? Learning requires a master’s transmission. Without a master’s transmission, what foundation is there? First, it risks misleading later students; second, without a master’s transmission, others may not believe it, and if disbelief arises, slander may follow—thus, it may not be transmitted. One must seek a master to receive and transmit it. If, after searching the four seas, no master can be found, one may seclude themselves in a quiet chamber, make vows, and cultivate in earnest. If they encounter a person of utmost sincerity who possesses the ten traits above, earnestly seeking instruction with unwavering resolve, and first presents a token of faith—testing their resolve without wavering, their heart growing ever more steadfast—then transmission may be granted. If within the four seas a master can be found where human traces reach, one must obtain a master and not transmit recklessly.

Ziming further inquired: If in the latter ages there are Daoist scholars who have already received the outer teachings of the *Lingbao* registers and covenants, practicing the Five Chapters, but have not yet encountered this inner teaching—may they receive and practice it upon later encountering it?

The Most High replied: They must first receive the covenant of the *Seventy-Two Character Register of the Plain and Yellow* and the *Supreme Register*, and only then may the scripture be transmitted. Why? The registers and covenants of the two teachings do not encompass the ten directions, nor do the great invocations of the Most High. Thus, the officials, spirits, gods, earth deities, dragons, and ghosts of the ten directions will not come to protect and empower the covenant of the scripture.

**From the *Shengxuan Neijiao Jing***
*Concluding the Thirty-Fourth Scroll of the* Wushang Miyao

**From the *Wushang Miyao*
*Thirty-Fifth Scroll: Rites of Transmission, Purificatory Fast, and Petition for Initiation***

All Daoist practices shall follow the newly established imperial rites.

The required duration of observance is as follows:
- *Ten Precepts* and *One True Writ*: seven days
- *Five Thousand Characters*: three days
- *Three Sovereigns*: five days
- *True Writ*: seven days
- *Highest Clarity*: nine days

First, one must bathe and purify, bearing incense and offerings. Proceeding to the master, bow thrice, kowtow, and kneel upright to receive the petition.

**Text of the Petition:**
[Name of] commandery, county, village, and hamlet, [male/female] disciple.

If receiving the *Ten Precepts*, *Five Thousand Characters*, or *Three Sovereigns*, state: *Pure Faith Disciple* [Name], aged [years].
If receiving the *True Writ*, state: *Cavern Spirit Disciple* [Name], aged [years].
If receiving *Highest Clarity*, state: *Cavern Mystery Disciple* [Name], aged [years].
If receiving the *True Writ* or *Highest Clarity* out of sequence, state: *Pure Faith Disciple* [Name], aged [years].
If five ranks receive transmission together, state: *Pure Faith Disciples* [Names], [number] persons; *Cavern Spirit Disciples* [Names], [number] persons; *Cavern Mystery Disciples* [Names], [number] persons, bowing reverently to seek the Dao.

**Petition:**
On this day, the radiant flow of time has already slipped away. Ever fearful that this subtle *qi* may suddenly sink into that darkness—darkness without dawn, an endless night from which escape is hard.

The lonely and suffering soul, distressed and weary, seeks refuge yet finds none. Prostrate, I have heard that the Heavenly Worthy, the Great Sage, has expounded teachings—if receiving the Ten Precepts, state: *The Ten Precepts and Fourteen Articles for Upholding the Body*. If receiving the *Five Thousand Character Writ*, state: *The Five Thousand Character Scripture of Dao and Virtue*. If receiving the *Three Sovereigns*, state: *The Cavern Spirit’s Three Sovereigns’ Talismanic Charts and Jade Scripts*. If receiving the *True Writ*, state: *The Numinous Treasure’s True Writ, Talismanic Charts, and Jade Scripts*. If receiving *Highest Clarity*, state: *The Cavern Perfection’s Highest Clarity Talismanic Charts and Jade Scripts*. If the five ranks receive transmission together, summarize the preceding five methods, stating: *The texts are concise, the matters essential—nothing, however minute, is left untransmitted*. Mortals, being dull, must devote themselves wholeheartedly to the rare opportunity of reception. Should one receive the teachings at dawn and perish by dusk, there shall be no regret or resentment. Thus, I exhaust all sincerity, preparing the offering as prescribed. Bowing my head in reverence, I present this petition for your hearing, humbly beseeching fulfillment. Respectfully submitted on the [day] of the [month] in the year of [Tai Sui] [Celestial Stem-Branch].

**Next: Entering the Dao-Field and Secret Invocation Method:**
