To the Four Superior Merit-Officials, Dragon-Tiger Envoys, Orthodox Unity’s *Qi*-Generating Attendant, the Serene and Unadorned Maiden—if there is a matter to report at night, I request the Luminous Youth and the Supreme Mystery Maiden to accompany me into the Yellow Chamber, that my words may be conveyed and heard above.

**Source:** *The Scripture of the Golden Register*

**Next: The Method of Silent Reflection on the Three Masters**

First, reflect upon the direction where the Scripture Master resides, bowing in the heart three times, praying that the Master attain the Dao of immortality and elevate my person to transcendence. Next, reflect upon the direction where the Register Master resides, bowing in the heart three times, praying that the Master attain the flight of immortality, opening the path for my seven generations of ancestors and parents to ascend early to the Heavenly Hall, that I may obtain the True Dao and ascend into the Formless. Then, reflect upon the direction where the Initiation Master resides, bowing in the heart three times, praying that the Master ascend to the highest immortality, opening the path for me through the Five Realms and Eight Difficulties, that my name be inscribed in the Register of Immortals, and I forever become a Perfected Person.

**Source:** *The Jade Register Scripture*

**Next: The Method of Activating the Incense Burner:**
To the Supreme Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Origin, the Three *Qi* of the Most High Lord Lao, summon forth the Three and Five Merit-Officials within the body of so-and-so, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Left and Right Bearers of Incense, the Courier Dragon Riders, the Golden Youth Attending Incense, the Jade Maiden Attending Incense, and the True Talismans of the Five Emperors—thirty-six of each—commanding them to exit the passes and inform the local earth gods and true officials of this realm. I now burn incense and present this nocturnal petition, praying that the *qi* of the Most High’s Ten Directions and Orthodox Perfected may enter my body, that my words swiftly ascend before the August Person of the Supreme Ultimate Great Dao, the Jade Sovereign of the Limitless Heaven.

**Source:** *The Ordinances of Illuminating Perfection*

**Next: The Method of Presenting Petitions:**
The Supreme Numinous Treasure’s Most High Three Caverns Disciple, so-and-so, Master of the Sacred Peak, and others, reverently address the Most High Three Treasures and the Perfected of the Ten Directions. By karmic affinity of past lives, we were born under the transformation of the Mysterious Perfected, delivered and rooted in faith. Our former masters transmitted the Three Caverns’ precious scriptures through covenants, and we have served, revered, and cultivated the fasts and retreats. Yet from the day we received the Dharma, we must exhaust our humble capacities to propagate its teachings, guiding all beings so that those who have not heard may hear, and those who have not seen may see. May the wind of the Primordial Beginning spread through the Ten Directions, and the compassionate grace of the Most High universally moisten the hidden and manifest. For all who turn toward this path, we dare not fail to report above. Respectfully spoken.

We, the humble disciples, now present our earnest and fervent plea, bearing our sincerest devotion to seek and receive the precepts. Should we receive the Ten Precepts, we shall uphold the fourteen virtues of bodily discipline. Should we receive the Five Thousand Characters, we shall reverently study the *Scripture of the Dao and Its Virtue in Five Thousand Words*. Should we receive the Three Sovereigns, we shall treasure the *Jade Scripts, Talismans, and Charts of the Cavernous Divine Three Sovereigns*. Should we receive the True Writs, we shall honor the *Jade Scripts, Talismans, and Charts of the Numinous Treasure True Writs*. Should we receive the Supreme Clarity, we shall venerate the *Jade Scripts, Talismans, and Charts of the Cavernous Perfection Supreme Clarity*. If all five ranks are received together in this assembly, we shall collectively record the preceding five Dharma teachings, preserving them forever as the treasures of our bodies. We shall diligently follow the Dharma, maintaining purity, burning incense, and performing the Dao-circuits. Beginning at dawn tomorrow, we shall adhere to the ancient codes of dignity, fulfill our roles and duties, and proclaim the regulations and prohibitions, so that all learners may submit to the Dharma teachings.

We humbly beseech the Most High Venerables, the Three Treasures’ majestic deities, the Great Dharma Masters who oversee the fasts, and the attendant Perfected of the scriptures to deign to witness and examine our words. May they bestow their favor upon the officials of the Three Realms, the local earth gods and territorial deities who guard this place, and upon us, the disciples, so that our dwellings may be purified, malevolent impurities dispelled, and our every aspiration met with response. We shall, at dawn tomorrow, perform the Dao-circuits according to the Dharma and report further.

Next, the Three Hymns of Wisdom:

**First Hymn:**
Wisdom arises from the formless,
Radiant and boundless, transcending the Ten Directions.
It structures emptiness, towering in the Mysterious Empyrean,
While all heavens draw from its flowing fragrance.
Its wonder defies thought,
Yet through emptiness, true and real communion is achieved.
What seems to exist ultimately does not,
And what seems not to exist holds all within.

**Second Hymn:**
Wisdom constantly observes the body,
Foremost in the study of the Dao.
Subtly it enters the Mysterious Workshop,
Naturally recording my spirit.
The Heavenly Worthy ever shields and protects,
While demon kings pledge their guardianship.
Resplendent is the Vajra body,
Transcendent, a Supreme Clarity Immortal.

**Third Hymn:**
Wisdom engenders the root of precepts,
For the true Dao, precepts are the foundation.
From them arise the Three Treasures,
Revered and received by lofty immortals.
Riding this deathless vessel,
Swiftly it ferries the multitudes.
When the time comes to expound the precepts,
All heavens bow their heads in homage.

Next, the Homage to All Heavenly Worthies:

With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Mysterious Dawn in the North.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Ascended Immortals and Supreme Saints in the Northeast.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Treasure Sovereign in the East.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Life-Nurturing and Destiny-Deliverance in the Southeast.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Mysterious Perfection and Myriad Blessings in the South.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Great Numinous and Void Sovereign in the Southwest.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Supreme Wonder and Utmost Limit in the West.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Boundless Great Florescence in the Northwest.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Void and Luminous Sovereign in the Upper Realm.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the True Sovereign and Cavernous Divine in the Lower Realm.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Lofty Jade Sovereign of the Past.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Primordial Beginning of the Present.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Supreme Ultimate of the Future.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Jade Capital and Mysterious Terrace.
With utmost sincerity, we pay homage to all the Perfected, Immortals, and Attained Holy Multitudes.

The master then faces west, sits upright, and expounds the precepts, while all disciples prostrate themselves to receive them.

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the Most High Lord of the Dao, saying: "Now I shall universally proclaim and propagate the Dharma’s resonance, awakening all beings. For men and women alike, I shall dissolve calamities, avert misfortunes, invoke blessings, deliver destinies, and eradicate the roots of suffering. May the living perceive the Dao and escape the Eight Difficulties; may the dead rejoice, feast in the heavens, and swiftly be reborn among humans as Wheel-Turning Sage Kings. All who perform fasts and seek the Dao must single-mindedly request and receive the Ten Precepts, earnestly upholding them without forgetfulness. Focus your minds, contemplate in silence, and reflect upon the natural order. Do not allow stray thoughts to disturb your forms and spirits. Those who can do so shall now listen attentively:

**First Precept:** Let the heart harbor no malice or jealousy. Do not cultivate hidden harm. Guard your speech, be cautious of transgressions, and let your thoughts dwell in the Dharma.

**Second Precept:** Uphold benevolence and refrain from killing. Pity and aid all beings, extending compassionate salvation to all.

**Third Precept:** Maintain chastity and yield to righteousness. Do not indulge in lust or theft. Constantly cultivate good thoughts, diminishing the self to aid others.

**Fourth Precept:** Be free from sensuality and desire. Let the heart not wander. Uphold purity and caution, ensuring your conduct remains unstained.

**Fifth Precept:** Let your speech be free of malice. Do not adorn your words with florid embellishment. Be loyal and upright within and without, avoiding verbal transgressions.

**Sixth Precept:** Abstain from alcohol and regulate your conduct. Harmonize your qi and nature, preserving your spirit from harm and avoiding all evils.

**Seventh Precept:** Do not envy those who surpass you or contend for fame and merit. In all matters, yield and retreat, humbling yourself to deliver others.

**Eighth Precept:** Do not criticize or disparage the scriptures and teachings. Personally uphold the Dharma, ever reverent as if in the presence of the divine.

**Ninth Precept:** Do not incite discord or engage in slander among the four classes of beings and heavenly folk. Such faults harm and deplete the spirit and qi.

**Tenth Precept:** In all actions and deeds, maintain equanimity and single-mindedness. Let harmony prevail among people, and tranquility among spirits, ever thus in your conduct."

The Heavenly Worthy declared: "When establishing fasts and performing Dao-circuits, the Four Heavenly Kings arrive in flying green-wheel clouds and eight-scene jade chariots. Perfected beings and jade maidens hold floral banners, leading with phoenix songs, followed by celestial harmonies. White cranes and lions chant poems in unison. Incense is burned, flowers scattered, drifting through the void as they come to witness the Dao-circuits and listen to the Dharma’s resonance. The Heavenly Kings descend, and the myriad spirits pay homage. How could one not fully devote oneself to this Dharma?"

First receive the Ten Precepts, then perform the Dao-circuits. Proceed with refined steps and graceful bearing, calm the mind and close the thoughts. In sitting, rising, lying, or resting, never depart from proper form. Thus the Heavenly Kings rejoice, and the ranks of the Upper Clarity ascend—this may be called attaining the Dao within the square inch of the heart.

*—From the Scripture of Great Precepts*

Next, the appointments of the assembly officials:

Appoint the High Merit Great Dharma Master, who must be of lofty virtue and profound understanding of subtle meanings.

Next, appoint the General Lecturer Dharma Master, who must be of keen talent and wisdom, well-versed in the Dharma’s regulations.

Next, appoint the Fast Supervisor, who must oversee and correct all transgressions and faults.

Next, appoint the Scripture Attendants, who must tend to the scriptures and arrange the sashes and robes.

Next, appoint the Incense Attendants, who must manage the censers and ensure the incense fire never ceases.

Next, appoint the Lamp Attendants, who must prepare the lamp implements, facing toward the West.

Next, appoint the Seat Attendants, who must ensure the seating mats are laid out evenly and the adornments are orderly.

Next, the thirty-six articles of penalties for faults:

If entering the fast hall with shoes or sandals improperly worn,
If the chanting of good sounds is not in unison,
If the Dharma robes, headscarves, or caps are not properly arranged,
If hair hangs loose before the Dharma seat—
each of these offenses is penalized with ten bows of reverence.

If in sitting, rising, bowing, or yielding, the etiquette is lost,
If the lamp fire goes out while tending the lamps—

If the mind fails to dwell in clarity and emptiness, causing disturbance to others,
If one falls asleep at the Dharma seat—
each of these offenses is penalized with twenty bows of reverence.

If one fails to proceed when the bell’s sound has ceased,
If one fails to attend the morning audience with the master,
If the sequence of prostrations is disorderly,
If the incense smoke breaks off while tending the incense—
each of these offenses is penalized with thirty bows of reverence.

If the Precentor fails to lead the chanting,
If one enters or leaves without paying homage to the Three Treasures,
If while reciting scriptures one disrupts questions or corrupts the text,
If one rushes about without proper order—
each of these offenses is penalized with forty bows of reverence.

If the hymns of praise are not sung with goodness,
If one departs the fast hall without mutual notification,
If while listening to scriptures one leans or sits improperly,
If one wears the Dharma robes inside out—
each of these offenses is penalized with fifty bows of reverence.

If one circumambulates without following the proper sequence,
If the Precentor strikes the bell too early or too late,
If one ascends the altar out of turn,
If the Fast Supervisor, upon witnessing an offense, fails to admonish it and is exposed by others—
each of these offenses is penalized with sixty bows of reverence.

If one wears brown robes or Daoist headscarves and caps when entering or leaving,
If one overturns the incense burner or lamp fire,
If one burns incense without washing the hands,
If one speaks with outsiders during the proceedings—
each of these offenses is penalized with seventy bows of reverence.

If one arrives after the chanting of "Silence and Contemplation" has concluded,
If the Seat Attendants fail to arrange the adornments and are questioned about it,
If one speaks of worldly affairs,
If one departs and does not return—
each of these offenses is penalized with eighty bows of reverence.

If one engages in frivolous laughter at the Dharma seat,
If one indulges in frivolous speech at the Dharma seat,
If one misses a single period without attending,
If within the fast’s bounds one raises the voice or displays a harsh countenance—
each of these offenses is penalized with ninety bows of reverence.

The above is excerpted from the *Scripture on the Arrangement of the Fast*.

Next, having proclaimed the regulations, each makes two bows to the master.

Next, the master faces east, kneels, and invokes the Perfected Officials.

The Supreme, Numinous Treasure, Unsurpassed Three Caverns disciples of such-and-such a mountain, so-and-so and others, humbly address:

The Primordial Celestial Worthy of Numinous Treasure and the Unoriginated,
The Supreme Dao Lord of the Limitless Great Way,
The Most High Jade Emperor,
The Great Perfected Saints who have attained the Dao,
The Host of Perfected Ones,
The Venerable Lords,
The Thirty-Two Celestial Emperors,
The Jade Void Emperor,
The Jade Emperor,
The Great Emperor,
Donghua,
Nanji,
Xiling,
Beizhen,
The Seven-Treasure Mystic Terrace of the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace in the Jade Capital of Xuandu,
The Numinous Treasure Perfected Sovereign of Luminous Augustness—

We, by karmic affinity from past lives, were born in an age of Daoic transformation. Through the mysterious and true, we were awakened and delivered, gaining entry into the root of faith. Our former masters transmitted to us the sacred scriptures of the Three Treasures. We have made offerings and paid reverence, placing merit-making first. Now we respectfully present so-and-so and others for transmission and ordination.

If receiving the Ten Precepts, one may say: *The Ten Precepts and Fourteen Articles for Upholding the Body*.
If receiving the *Five Thousand Characters*, one may say: *The Scripture of the Dao and Its Virtue in Five Thousand Characters*.
If receiving the Three Sovereigns, one may say: *The Jade Script Talismans and Charts of the Cavernous Spirit Three Sovereigns*.
If receiving the True Writs, one may say: *The Jade Script Talismans and Charts of the Numinous Treasure True Writs*.
If receiving the Highest Clarity, one may say: *The Jade Script Talismans and Charts of the Cavernous Truth Highest Clarity*.

If five ranks are received together in the same assembly, one may collectively record the preceding five methods. After bathing in purity and burning incense, lighting lamps, reciting scriptures, and performing the circumambulation, in accordance with the ritual, one invokes the Heavenly Immortals, Flying Immortals, Earthly Immortals, Perfected Ones, Divine Persons, Sages, the Thirty-Two Celestial Overseers of the Fast, the Golden Lads who attend the incense, the Jade Maidens who scatter flowers, the Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors—thirty-two of each—along with the messengers who transmit words and memorials, the flying dragon riders, and others, to descend together and oversee the fast hall. Having made the incense offering and voiced the vows, which ascend as they are spoken, once the proceedings are complete, one reports back to the Perfected Officials.

The above is excerpted from the *Regulations of Luminous Perfection*.

Next, the method for replenishing the incense burner:

Incense Officials and Messengers,
Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger,
All the spirit officials who attend the incense—
may they cause the chamber of stillness to naturally generate the golden liquid, the cinnabar essence, and the numinous mushrooms.
May the host of Perfected Ones and the hundred spirits gather before this incense fire.
We pray that so-and-so and others may receive blessings under heaven and be favored in the ten directions.
May the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens attend the incense smoke, transmit our words, and present them directly before the Supreme and Limitless Dao.

The above is excerpted from the *Regulations of Luminous Perfection*.

Next, the recitation of the Precepts and Hymns:

The Dao is the school of no-mind,
the field where all merit is sown.
No fixed master presides over merit-making—
each follows their own original vow.
Empty the self to respond to all beings,
direct the mind without partiality.
The Great Sage expounds the supreme teaching,
like rain falling from the heavens,
reaching all, high and low,
while the lowly become profound.
The sea is sovereign of the hundred rivers,
for it can contain dragons and scaled creatures.
Through ten thousand kalpas, wisdom and function are preserved—
how could this depend on a single lifetime?
Hold fast to the precepts without the slightest lapse,
and in life after life, good affinities will form.
With concentrated thought, contemplate the Great Vehicle,
and you shall embody the true Dao.

The above is excerpted from the *Scripture of the Divine Lord’s Inquiries*.

Next, the method of the oratory’s esoteric invocation:

Mysterious and supreme, the Great Yin,
the eight windows open in clarity.
Before the maiden who communicates with spirits,
present your entreaty.
When the matter is complete,
the myriad spirits return to their places in profound stillness.

The above is excerpted from the *Scripture of the Golden Register*.

*Esoteric Essentials of the Supreme*, Scroll 35, concludes.

*Esoteric Essentials of the Supreme*, Scroll 37:
The Rites for Transmitting the *Five Thousand Characters of the Dao and Its Virtue*

The Method for Receiving the Pledge of the *Five Thousand Characters*:

A person must offer fifty feet of white silk and one golden dragon. If one has cultivated merit and conduct but is impoverished and unable to comply, one may adjust the offering according to one’s means, rather than strictly adhering to the scripture’s standard.

The above is excerpted from the *Scripture of Hidden Annotations*.

The Method for the Initial Esoteric Invocation upon Entering the Oratory:

The Four Luminaries’ Merit Officers, Messengers Who Communicate with the Perfected, Speech-Conveying Merit Officers, and Jade Maidens Who Serve in Stillness—may they transmit my words to the presiding deities of the Dao chamber. May the primordial qi of the Upper Prime enter my body.

The above is excerpted from the *Scripture of the Golden Register*.

Next, chant the invocation for stillness in accordance with the proper method.

Next, the Method for Contemplating the Three Masters:

First, contemplate the direction where the Scripture Master resides. Bow in the heart three times, praying that the master attain transcendence and that my own body ascend and be delivered.

Next, contemplate the direction where the Register Master resides. Bow in the heart three times, praying that the master attain the flying transcendents, open the path for my seven generations of ancestors, and swiftly ascend to the celestial halls, so that I may attain the true Dao and ascend into the formless.

Next, contemplate the direction where the Ordination Master resides. Bow in the heart three times, praying that the master ascend and be delivered, attaining the ranks of the lofty transcendents, open the path for me through the five destinies and eight adversities, inscribe my name in the transcendents’ register, and forever make me a Perfected.

The above is excerpted from the *Scripture of the Jade Register*.

Next, the Method for Kindling the Incense Burner:

The Most High Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Beginning, the Three Non-Beings’ Most High Lord Lao—summon forth from within so-and-so’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Official Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Riding Couriers Who Bear Incense, the Golden Lads Who Attend the Incense, the Jade Maidens Who Scatter Flowers and Convey Words, and the Thirty-Six Officers of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans. Once they emerge, let them don their regalia and report to the true officials and presiding deities of this land and territory. I now burn incense and confer ordination, praying that the qi of the Most High’s ten directions’ true and perfected may enter my body. May my entreaty swiftly reach the presence of the Most High’s Boundless Great Dao, the Utmost Perfected Jade Thearch.

The above is excerpted from the *Scripture of Illuminating the Perfected*.

Next, the Method for Venerating the Three Treasures:

With utmost sincerity, I bow my head to the Most High’s Boundless Great Dao.
With utmost sincerity, I bow my head to the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, I bow my head to the Great Master of the Mysterious Tradition.

The above is excerpted from the *Ritual of the Golden Register*.

Next, master and disciple kneel in reverence as the covenant text is read aloud.

On the first day of the such-and-such month in the year of the Celestial Stem and Branch Jia-Yi, the devout disciple so-and-so of such-and-such district, county, township, and village, aged such-and-such years, along with others, has long been ensnared by the senses—eyes and ears drawn to sounds and sights, body and mind stained by glory and favor—ever harboring desires, with no means to return to purity. We have heard that in the boundless, ageless seventh month, on the day of Jia-Zi, the August Elder, about to pass westward through the Hangu Pass, encountered Lord Xi of the Pass, who delighted in long life and sought to receive the scripture of a single word from an enlightened master. The Old Master said: "Excellent indeed is your question! My Dao runs deep and must not be transmitted carelessly. The Dao of life enters the abdomen, where spirit and luminosity are preserved; the hundred joints and orifices, the six Jia spirits, all interconnect within the body, weaving without end. Embracing embryonic breathing to guard the center, one unites above with Heaven. Practicing this, one becomes an immortal on the spot and is ordained as a Perfected. If transmitted without proper method, calamity befalls the body—life ends, name perishes, and descendants fall into ruin." Though we are but fleshly beings without wisdom, we have secretly cherished this teaching without cease, our resolve unwavering, earnestly hoping to receive and uphold it.

Now, in accordance with the statutes of the Illuminated Perfected, bearing tokens of faith, I vow with sincere heart to journey to the Three Caverns Master of [specific prefecture, commandery, county, village, and hamlet], Master [Mountain Name] of [Personal Name], to receive the Five Writings of the Dao and Virtue. I shall cultivate and revere them as the treasure of my body, swearing an unbreakable covenant. Should I violate the statutes or breach the pact, may I be bound in the eternal darkness of the Nine Prisons, without protest.

—From *The Rites for Transmitting the Five Thousand Character Register*

Next, the master holds the scripture while the ritual drums resound thirty-six times.

**Visualization Practice:**
First, visualize the Azure Dragon to the left, the White Tiger to the right, the Vermilion Bird before, the Dark Warrior behind, and beneath your feet the Eight Trigrams Spirit Tortoise. Thirty-six lions prostrate before you. A kerchief adorned with the Seven Stars crowns your head. The five viscera generate the five *qi*, and a net of scriptural patterns covers your body. The Three Ones attend the scripture, each accompanied by a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders for protection.

—From *The Esoteric Commentary Scripture*

Next, recite the transmission hymn:

O’er the ethereal peaks they drift,
Radiant light dwells in the Supreme Mystery.
From beginning to end, through endless kalpas,
It eternally preserves Heaven, Earth, and Humankind.
Worldly lords seek to attain Brahman,
While Daoists chant and attain it.
The worthy now receive and uphold it,
Transmitting it in accord with the method.
In this age, no Perfected One appears,
This treasure is not carelessly revealed.
Hold fast to it, ascend to Great Clarity;
Discard it, and fall into the Nine Dark Realms.
I expound the Dao of Non-Action—
Serene and still, it is attained naturally.

—From *The Rites for Transmitting the Five Thousand Character Register*

Next, the master bestows the scripture, and the disciple kneels to receive it, then returns to their place. When all is complete, each bows to the master three times.

Next, take refuge in all the Venerable Dao:

With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Jade Dawn Heavenly Worthy of the Mysterious Upper Realm in the North.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Perfected Heavenly Worthy of the Upper Sage Realm in the Northeast.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Jade Treasure August Heavenly Worthy of the East.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Heavenly Worthy of the Southeast, Who Nurtures Life and Delivers Destiny.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Mysterious Perfected Heavenly Worthy of Myriad Blessings in the South.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Supreme Numinous Void August Heavenly Worthy of the Southwest.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Supreme Wondrous Utmost Heavenly Worthy of the West.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Boundless Supreme Florescence Heavenly Worthy of the Northwest.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Jade Void Luminous August Heavenly Worthy of the Upper Realm.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Perfected August Heavenly Worthy of the Cavern Spirits in the Lower Realm.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Highest Jade August Heavenly Worthy of the Past.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Present.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Supreme Ultimate Heavenly Worthy of the Future.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in the Jade Capital and the Mysterious Terrace of the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace.
With utmost sincerity, I take refuge in all the Perfected Immortals and Attained Sage Hosts.

—From *The Numinous Treasure Scripture*

Next, chant three hymns in unison, circling once.

The great worthy delights in the scripture and precepts,
Receiving them as the treasure of the body.
To seek learning is ever belated,
To cultivate the body, one regrets not starting sooner.
All must delve into the profound and obscure,
Yet time slips by, and years grow old.
Grasping the scroll, one draws near the ultimate,
Only to face death’s bitter sorrow.
Thus, in my youth, I abandoned the world to study the Dao.
To practice immortality is urgent,
To uphold the precepts and restrain the heart’s passions.
Let emptiness and equanimity dwell in the upright *qi*,
And immortals and sages will naturally seek you.
If you do not trust these teachings,
Why dwell in the mountains?

—From *The Scripture on Dispelling Demons*

To study immortality, sever worldly attachments,
Each thought accumulates upon the last.
Coming and going disturb my spirit,
Restless, it cannot endure.
Extinguish thoughts, abide in tranquil emptiness,
And softly enter the silence of the void.
Seek the scriptures as if parched with thirst,
Hold fast to your resolve like gold or stone.
Preserve this, and you shall soar the mysterious path,
The Five Numinous Ones will deliver your talismanic register.

—From *The Esoteric Commentary on the Supreme Ultimate*

Next, the master faces east to return the immortal officials:

The Supreme Numinous Treasure, Unsurpassed Three Caverns disciple, Master [Mountain Name] of [Personal Name], and others, now reverently address:
The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneity,
The Supreme Dao Lord of the Boundless Dao,
The Highest Jade August One and all the Attained Great Sage Perfected Hosts,
The Lords and Elders,
The Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors,
The Jade Void Emperor,
The Jade Emperor,
The Great Emperor,
Eastern Florescence,
Southern Culmen,
Western Numinosity,
Northern Perfection,
Mysterious Capital,
Jade Capital,
Golden Watchtower,
Seven Jeweled Mysterious Terrace,
Purple Tenuity Upper Palace,
Numinous Treasure Perfected Ones,
Luminous August Lord of the Dao—
We, by karmic affinity of past lives, were born amidst the transformation of the Dao. The Mysterious Perfected guided and delivered us, enabling us to enter the root of faith. Our former masters swore oaths and transmitted the Three Treasures’ divine scriptures. We revered and served them, making merit our priority. On [specific date], we respectfully transmitted the scriptures and practiced the Dao with [Personal Name] and others, establishing the fast and vigil, burning incense, and making repentant vows.

Now that the transmission is complete, we invoke the Heavenly Immortals, Earthly Immortals, Flying Immortals, Perfected Ones, Divine Humans, Sages, Overseers of the Fast, Attendant Incense Lads, Jade Maidens Who Scatter Flowers, Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors, Messengers Who Transmit Words, Flying Dragon Riders, and all who have overseen the fast, guarded and labored diligently. May each be rewarded according to their merit, advance in rank and grade, and restore their celestial positions. We now reverently make this report.

Next, restore the incense burner:

Incense Officials and Envoys,
Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger,
Attendant Spirit Officials of the Incense—
May the quiet chamber naturally generate the golden liquid elixir and azure mushroom blossoms. May the host of Perfected and the hundred spirits gather before this incense fire. We pray that after [Personal Name] and others receive the Dao, the multitude of spirits will protect and escort them, that they may swiftly attain immortality.

May the Emperor enjoy myriad blessings,
May the world receive grace.
Jade Lads and Jade Maidens of the Ten Directions,
Attendants of the fragrant smoke—
Transmit these words directly to the presence of the Supreme Boundless Dao.

—From *The Scripture of Illuminating Perfection*

Next, recite the hymn of upholding the precepts:

The Dao is the origin of Non-Heart,
All acts are fields of merit.
To establish merit has no fixed master,
Each vow arises from the individual.
Empty yourself to respond to all beings,
Focus your heart without partiality.
The Great Sage expounds the supreme teaching,
As rain descends from heaven.
Lofty peaks are universally embraced,
Yet the humble become profound.
The sea is king of a hundred rivers,
For it can contain dragons and krakens.
Through ten thousand kalpas, preserve wisdom and function,
Not merely for the span of years.
Uphold the precepts without the slightest lapse,
And in every life, good affinities shall form.
With concentrated thought, contemplate the Great Vehicle,
And you shall embody the true Dao.

—From *The Scripture of the Immortal Duke’s Inquiry*

Next, the Esoteric Invocation of the Daoist Altar:

The Mysterious Upper and Supreme Yin,
Eight windows open in radiance.
When supplication is made,
The Maiden transmits the numinous.
Once the affair is complete, return to position,
And the ten thousand spirits shall silently settle.

—From *The Scripture of the Golden Register*

*End of Volume Thirty-Seven of The Supreme Secret Essentials*

---

**Volume Thirty-Eight: The Rites of Conferring the Cavernous Divine and Three Sovereigns**

**The Altar Arrangement:**
Next, arrange the altar after the night’s dew has settled. The altar’s length and breadth should be either thirty-two feet or twenty-four feet, with height and expanse adjusted according to the number of participants. Open three gates: the Gate of the Celestial Sovereign at *zi*, the Gate of the Terrestrial Sovereign at *shen*, and the Gate of the Human Sovereign at *yin*. Each gate shall bear an inscribed placard. Adorn the railings with lamps and fires, adjusting their number as needed. Entry and exit must be made through the Gate of the Human Sovereign.

—From *The Scripture of the Numinous Treasure Retreat*

**The Seating of the Three Sovereigns:**
For the Celestial Sovereign’s seat: spread eighteen lengths of black silk.
For the Terrestrial Sovereign’s seat: spread sixteen lengths of white silk.
For the Human Sovereign’s seat: spread sixteen lengths of blue-green silk.

—From *The Scripture of the Numinous Treasure Retreat*

**The Three Sovereigns’ Life-Link Pledges:**

The Life-Link Pledges correspond to the years of one’s life: the Son of Heaven uses lengths in *pi*, dukes and marquises use lengths in *zhang*, and commoners use lengths in *chi*. The same applies to the three seats. The Son of Heaven uses purple damask; others use plain silk according to the directional colors. All are placed upon the Human Sovereign’s table, along with three golden dragons. Commoners use golden rings.

—From *The Scripture of the Numinous Treasure Retreat*

**The Three Sovereigns’ Ritual Pledges:**
The pledge consists of four hundred *chi* of white silk; for the impoverished, forty *chi*. These include the seat stabilizers, life-link pledges, and the three kinds of ritual offerings. If one possesses merit and conduct but is too poor to prepare them fully, one may adjust according to one’s means; this should not be taken as the standard.

—From *The Scripture of the Numinous Treasure Retreat*

**Next: Entering the Altar, Burning Incense, and Activating the Brazier**
The maiden of incense smoke ascends to report to the August Lords, the Lesser Manifestation of the Perfected, [name and cyclical year], who has purified through retreat, severed worldly dust, and awaits the numinous convergence of the Five Penetrations. May the highest aspiration be fulfilled, calamities extinguished, blessings born, and ascent achieved to the Three Heavens.

—From *The Scripture of the Numinous Treasure Retreat*

**Next: Facing north, bow twice to the Perfected Lord of the Celestial Sovereign.**

Next, face southwest and bow twice to the Perfected Lord of the Earthly Sovereign. Then, face northeast and bow twice to the Perfected Lord of the Human Sovereign. Next, unfurl the first two *chi* of the received scripture upon the altar table, and bow twice together. The disciple prostrates to the east from the west side, while the master kneels facing west, reciting their titles and positions.

The disciple, a minor manifestation of the Perfected, [name and cyclical year], of the Three Caverns, respectfully addresses: Supreme Primordial Lady, Great Divinities of the Immortal Capital, and the Three August Perfected Lords—this disciple now seeks to transmit the precious scriptures of the Three Sovereigns to [name, prefecture, county, village, and given name]. May it be permitted?

Prostrate and await the command. Remain prostrate for the duration of one incense burning. When no wind stirs, rise and bow twice as a disciple. Prostrate again, while the master kneels and reads the covenant text:

In the cyclical year [year], the [month], the [day] of the [cyclical day], the pure and faithful disciple [name], aged [age], from [prefecture, county, village], now approaches Master [name], of the Sacred Peak, to receive the inner scriptures of the Three Sovereigns, the celestial texts in great characters, along with all talismans. The offerings are presented according to ritual propriety, and the covenant is sealed with the elixir of immortal waters, marked with a single stroke as token.

[Name] as transmitter of the Dao shall not conceal truth or disseminate falsehood. [Name] as recipient of the Dao shall uphold the master’s covenant and oath, refraining from unfilial conduct, lack of benevolence, disloyalty, or malice; from greed, lust, or violence; from reckless transmission to the unworthy; from blaming the master or resenting the Dao; or from hypocrisy. After attaining the Dao, should one betray the original master or slander the true and orthodox, one shall incur great calamity in this life, extending to descendants.

Next, both sip the elixir water and jointly inscribe a single vermilion stroke beneath the covenant text.

Then, the disciple prostrates before the offerings while the master, holding the scripture, kneels.

Visualize the deities of the Three Palaces: within each palace resides a Perfected One, appearing as an infant, unclothed, exhaling purple *qi*, which flows through master, disciple, and all present.

Next, the transmission of the scripture is chanted:
The celestial texts of the Supreme,
Recount the origins of heaven and earth.
The August Ones proclaimed the mysterious decree,
As the scriptures of utmost truth.
The worthy now receive and uphold them,
Aspiring to ascend to the Great Void.

—From *The Scripture of the Supreme Ultimate’s Esoteric Commentary*

Next, the disciple kneels to receive the scripture. Upon completion, bow twice to the master. Then, master and disciple each bow twice to the Three August Lords.

Next, chant the *Yang Songs* three times, circling thrice:
The azure-horned *Yang Song* resounds,
Wafting through the ten directions.
Azure radiance illumines the world,
Bearing me to the ninefold heavens.
The western string strikes its tune,
Awakening the Eastern August Lord.
The Primordial Cavern initiates its course,
As yang first sprouts myriad buds.
Harmonious winds stir jade branches,
Lofty forests gleam with cloudy veils.
Gou Mang urges the farmer’s toil,
Sun-feathered wings blaze in eastern dawn.
Immortal sages wander the Mystic Garden,
Soaring chants rise with clarion calls.
They rein in their light in the chambers of great auroras,
Aligning wheels in the courts of the nine heavens.
All immortals lift their soaring chants,
The *Yang Poems* resound in due season.
Were one not of the spiritually attuned,
How could one partake in this transformative rite?

—From *The Scripture of the Cavernous Divinity*

Next, the method of returning to the immortal office.

Supreme Perfected Disciples of the Three Caverns of the Numinous Treasure, Master So-and-So of Such-and-Such Mountain, So-and-So and others, humbly address:

The Vast-Void-Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy,
The Boundless Great Dao Supreme Lord of the Dao,
The Exalted Jade Emperor and the Great Sage Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao,
All Lords and Elders,
The Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors,
The Jade Void Emperor,
The Jade Emperor,
The Great Emperor,
Eastern Florescence,
Southern Culmen,
Western Numinosity,
Northern Perfection,
Mystic Capital,
Jade Capital,
Golden Portals,
Seven-Jewel Dark Terrace,
Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace,
Numinous Treasure Perfected Ones,
Radiant August Lord of the Dao—

We, by karmic affinity of former lives, were born to encounter the transformative power of the Dao. The Mystic Perfection initiated our deliverance, enabling us to enter the root of faith. Our former masters, through sacred covenants, transmitted the Three Treasures’ divine scriptures. We have upheld reverent offerings and rites, prioritizing merit above all. On such-and-such day of such-and-such month, we, together with So-and-So and others, transmitted the scriptures and practiced the Dao, establishing the fast and vigil, burning incense and offering repentance.

Now that the transmission is complete, we invoke the presence of the Heavenly Immortals, Earthbound Immortals, Flying Immortals, Perfected Ones, Divine Beings, Sages, Overseers of the Fast and Vigil, Golden Lads who attend the incense, Jade Maidens who scatter blossoms, Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors, Messengers who transmit words and memorials, and Flying Dragon Riders. May they deign to oversee this place of fasting, safeguarding and laboring diligently. According to their merits, may they each receive rewards, ascend in rank and grade, and restore their celestial positions. We humbly present this memorial for your august attention.

—From *The Scripture of Radiant Perfection*

Next, the method of restoring the furnace:

The Maiden of Incense Smoke ascends to report to the August Lord. The minor perfected, So-and-So, having purified the fast and severed worldly dust, aspires to the five spiritual penetrations. May our highest wish be to attain perfection, extinguish calamities, and generate blessings, ascending to the Three Heavens.

Next, recite one verse before departing:

The pursuit of immortality is urgent,
Devotion to precepts restrains the heart’s passions.

The pure and serene primordial qi resides,
Immortal sages naturally seek one another.
If one does not believe the Dharma’s words,
Why dwell in the mountain forests?

—From *The Scripture of Dispelling Demons*

*Volume Thirty-Eight of The Supreme Secret Essentials* concludes here.

**Volume Thirty-Nine: The Rites for Transmitting the Cavernous Mystery’s True Writ**
*Volume Thirty-Nine of The Supreme Secret Essentials*

**Method for Establishing the Altar and Fasting Under the Stars:**

The method for the numinous altar: the altar’s length and width should be twenty-four feet, or thirty-two feet, adjusted according to the number of participants. The four sides each have gate curtains, each nine feet long. Five gates are constructed, each five feet wide (or four feet). The remaining curtains are seven feet long.

Two strands of blue-green cord connect the gate placards. Each placard is three inches and two fen wide, and three inches and four fen long.

- **Primordial Yang Gate of Azure Radiance** in the east: inscribed in vermilion on a blue-green placard.
- **Great Radiance Cavernous Yang Gate** in the south: inscribed in yellow on a red placard.
- **Golden Watchtower of Pervading Yin Gate** in the west: inscribed in black on a white placard.
- **Vast Spirit of Yin’s Genesis Gate** in the north: inscribed in blue-green on a black placard.
- **Lofty Dawn of Primordial Yellow Gate** beneath the King’s Gate, above the four seasons: inscribed in white on a yellow placard.
- **Gate of the Assembly of Upper Immortals and Perfected** above the King’s Gate: inscribed in purple on a yellow placard.

The six gates above may be used in simplified form. If employing a double altar with ten gates, arrange them according to *The Yellow Register Scripture*.

The Central Gate corresponds to the four seasons, beneath the King’s Gate and above the four seasons. The Gate of the Assembly of Perfected is above the King’s Gate and the four first months of the seasons.

- **Spring King** in *mao* (卯): Central Gate in *chou* (丑), Gate of the Assembly of Perfected in *si* (巳).
- **Summer King** in *wu* (午): Central Gate in *chen* (辰), Gate of the Assembly of Perfected in *shen* (申).
- **Autumn King** in *you* (酉): Central Gate in *wei* (未), Gate of the Assembly of Perfected in *hai* (亥).
- **Winter King** in *zi* (子): Central Gate in *xu* (戌), Gate of the Assembly of Perfected in *yin* (寅).

The King’s Gate has no separate gate. In spring, use the Azure Radiance Gate; in summer, the Cavernous Yang Gate; in autumn, the Pervading Yin Gate; in winter, the Yin’s Genesis Gate. Enter and exit through the Gate of the Assembly of Perfected.

**Method for the Six Grades of Offerings:**

- Five bolts of five-colored silk, as tokens for the Five Emperors.
- Nine golden dragons, as tokens for the Nine Heavens, each weighing one tael.
- Five golden dragons, as tokens for the Five Marchmounts, each weighing one tael.
- Twenty-four thousand gold coins, as tokens for the twenty-four qi of life.
- Life-destiny silk, its length corresponding to the recipient’s age:
  - The Son of Heaven uses one bolt,
  - Dukes and kings use one *zhang*,
  - Commoners use one *chi*.
  The regulations are as specified.

If one cannot afford these alone, they may be provided collectively.

If the collective cannot afford these, let the amount be measured according to wealth and poverty.

**Method for Setting Up the Offering Tables:**
- Place one table at each of the Five Gates. On each table, set one incense burner, one dragon, and one bolt of silk matching the directional color. One table holds the scriptures, with a red cloth beneath and a blue cloth covering them, placed before the honored image. One table is for presenting memorials and petitions before the master. One table holds the nine golden dragons, gold coins, and other tokens, placed before the honored image.

**Method for Entering the Altar and Kindling the Incense at Nightfall:**
Invoke the Supreme Three Heavens, the Primordial Origin of the Three Qi, the Most High Lord Lao: summon forth from within the bodies of so-and-so the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Left and Right Incense-Bearing Courier Dragon Riders, the Incense-Attending Golden Lads, the Speech-Transmitting Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens, and the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans—thirty-six of each—who, upon emerging, shall attire themselves in full regalia. Notify the local earth deities and territorial spirits to attend. Then, burn incense beneath the open sky at the altar, present the yellow silk memorial, and pray that the Most High’s ten directions of true and perfect qi enter the bodies of so-and-so, so that their petition may swiftly ascend to the presence of the Most High, the Boundless Dao, the Perfect and True Jade Emperor of the Supreme Ultimate.

**Method for Reading the Yellow Silk Memorial:**
The Most High Numinous Treasure Supreme Three Caverns Perfected, the Master of Such-and-Such Mountain, so-and-so, bows twice and respectfully addresses:

To the Primordial Origin Five Venerable Emperors, the Perfect and True Great Sage Honored Deities, the Jade August Thearch: I, of humble essence born into this world, have encountered karmic conditions. Through the kalpas of the Nine Heavens, the wheel of rebirth has not ceased. By the grace of accumulated blessings and felicitous destiny flowing into this present life, I have been able to enter the Dharma Gate. Formerly, on such-and-such a year, month, day, and cyclical sign, I received from my late master, the Three Caverns Perfected of Such-and-Such Mountain, so-and-so, the transmission of the Numinous Treasure Cavernous Mystery Scripture, Talismans, and Jade Characters, which I have cultivated and worn upon my person.

Now, the Daoist disciple so-and-so, aged such-and-such, along with so-and-so and others, has brought tokens of faith and pledged devotion, seeking to receive the Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture, Talismans, and Jade Characters of the Kingly Script in five fascicles. If there are additional scripture fascicles, they shall be listed according to their number. They vow to cultivate, uphold, and treasure these forever as their personal treasure.

Having observed their sincere diligence, noble aspirations, and the accumulated blessings of past lives that have enabled them to partake of these sacred texts and peruse their chapters and verses, it is fitting that they attain the perfection of the Dao. Yet I fear that so-and-so may lack a transcendent name or meritorious deeds, that the Three Realms do not record them, and that the Five Emperors do not recognize them. Therefore, in accordance with the Bright Statutes and the revealed texts of the central altar, I prostrate myself and humbly memorialize, that this may ascend to the Nine Heavens. May the August and Holy Honored Deities deign to illuminate the matters herein presented, take pity on this sincere heart, and, in their boundless compassion, the Perfect and True Great Dao of the Nine Heavens and the Supreme Honored Deities, discern and show mercy. I await your decree and response. With utmost reverence and trepidation, I bow twice and submit this.

Your servant, of such-and-such surname, from such-and-such commandery and county,
To the Supreme Primordial Origin Great Dao Lord, the Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Five Venerable Ones, and the Jade Emperor Great Sage, the Jade August Thearch,
Respectfully presented on such-and-such a cyclical year, month, and day, from such-and-such commandery, county, village, and hamlet.

*(From the* Scripture of Illuminating the Perfected.*)*

**Method for Sealing the Incense Burner:**

Let the Incense Officials and Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all the attendant spirit-officials of incense ensure that within this hallowed chamber, golden liquid elixir, cinnabar mushrooms, and azure lingzhi spontaneously arise. May the host of perfected beings and the hundred spirits convene before this incense flame, and may we, your servants, be swiftly enveloped by divine guardianship to attain transcendence and perfection. May the August Thearch enjoy ten thousand blessings, and may the realm receive boundless grace.

The jade lads and jade maidens of the ten directions, who attend the incense smoke, shall convey these words directly before the Supreme and Boundless Dao of the Most High.

*(From the* Scripture of Illuminating the Perfected.*)*

**Next, the Precepts and Hymn of Praise:**

The Dao is the heartless origin,
The field where all merit is sown.
No fixed master claims the work,
For each vow springs from the self alone.
Empty the self to respond to all beings,
Focus the mind without partiality.
The Great Sage expounds the supreme teaching,
As rain descends from the heavens—
Lofty peaks are not left untouched,
Yet the humble become profound.
The sea is king of a hundred rivers,
For it contains dragons and scaled creatures.
Through ten thousand kalpas, wisdom endures,
Not merely for a fleeting span of years.
Uphold the precepts without lapse,
And life after life, good affinities shall form.
With concentrated thought, contemplate the Great Vehicle,
And you shall embody the true Dao.

*(From the* Scripture of Questions and Answers, Lower Scroll.*)*

**Next, the Esoteric Incantation for the Ritual Altar:**

Upon the Mysterious Upper Yin,
The eight windows open bright.
When there is something to be declared,
The Maiden transmits the numinous.
Once the matter is complete,
The myriad spirits withdraw in silence.

*(From the* Scripture of the Golden Register.*)*

**Next, the Esoteric Incantation at Dawn Outside the Door:**

O Luminous Officers of the Four Brightnesses, Envoys of Numinous Communication, Jade Lads Who Transmit Words, and Jade Maidens Who Attend in Stillness—convey my plea to the presiding deities of this Daoist chamber, that the primordial qi of the Upper Origin may enter my body.

*(From the* Scripture of the Golden Register.*)*

**Next, the Method for Kindling the Incense Burner:**

O Most High Three Heavens, Mysterious Primordial Origin, Three Qi, Supreme Lord Lao—summon forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Envoys, the Left and Right Incense-Bearing Dragon Couriers, the Jade Lads Who Attend the Incense, the Jade Maidens Who Scatter Flowers, and the Direct Attendants of the Five Thearchs, thirty-six of each, to emerge and prepare in solemn array. Awaken the true officials and numinous deities governing this land and domain. As we now kindle this incense for the sake of such-and-such a matter, may the primordial qi of the Ten Directions’ perfected and true beings enter our bodies, that our supplication may swiftly ascend before the Supreme and Boundless Dao of the Most High, the Perfected □, and the Jade Emperor’s throne.

**Next, the Veneration of the Three Treasures:**

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Supreme and Boundless Great Dao.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Next, the Master faces west, kneels, and recites the Covenant Text:**

The disciple, prostrate in faith...

In the year of the Great Year-Star [Tai Sui], the such-and-such month, the such-and-such day of the new moon, on the jia-yi day, Master of the Sacred Peak [Yue], so-and-so,
born in the jia-yi year, the such-and-such month of his destiny,
whose qi-lineage is registered under the Celestial Lord of such-and-such Heaven,
now in such-and-such Qi-Heaven, from Master of the Sacred Peak, so-and-so,
receives the forty-three chapters of talismanic diagrams and the nine hundred twenty-four characters of jade script,
seven numinous powers to guard the true,
golden silk to pledge the heart,
proclaiming before the spirits and swearing alliance to Heaven,
binding them as treasures of the body,
to uphold the Great Dharma,
to reverently follow the true canon,
and to report above to the thirty-two heavens’ overseers of the true register of deliverance.

The attendant Immortal Scribe, the Director of Records Han,
the Flying Celestial Perfected,
and the Divine Kings of the Three Realms
are commanded to strike his name from the register of death
and inscribe it upon the golden tablets and jade records of the Three Primes,
that in accordance with the majestic rites of the Great Pardon,
the qi of the true immortals may descend and enter his body.

The Celestial Marshal of the thirty-three heavens’ supervisory immortals,
the Feathered Scribe of the canon,
each according to their rank dispatch one measure of jade lads and jade maidens,
and one portion of the qi of the divine perfected,
to descend and attend the numinous script,
bestowing it upon the body of so-and-so,
universally informing all heavens and all earths,
the boundless worlds,
the sun, moon, and stellar lodges,
the officials of the Three Realms,
the famed mountains of the Five Peaks,
the water palaces of the Nine Rivers,
the bureaus of the Three Officials,
and the long night of the Nine Dark Springs,
where there is no shadow, no color,
no form, no name,
no sound, no echo,
no origin, no greatness,
no height, no depth,
no honor, no humility—
that all spirits and numina may clearly recognize so-and-so’s body,
upholding the Great Dharma,
bearing the celestial script,
whose name is entered in the immortal register of the Three Primes.

In going out and coming in, in wandering and journeying,
he shall be received according to the proper offices,
paying homage thrice monthly,
as in the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace.
The earthly writs shall be erased,
the records of the Nine Darks expunged,
karmic adversaries annihilated,
evil roots severed and silenced,
so that none may pursue or seize him,
and through countless kalpas he shall remain unentangled.
Seven generations of ancestors shall share in this blessing,
all ascending together,
roaming freely in the Seven Jeweled Groves of the Mysterious Capital,
where souls receive refinement and deliverance,
and in due time attain rebirth.

So-and-so pledges to uphold the Great Dharma,
in all things conforming to the luminous perfected,
examining himself and following the precepts,
to achieve immortality in life and death,
to befriend the Five Thearchs,
and to sport among the heavens.

Should he break this covenant or betray this oath,
reveal the celestial script,
or transmit it beyond the proper time,
he shall answer in life and death,
bear eternal debt at the River’s source,
suffer the wind-knives for ten thousand kalpas,
and be crushed beneath the mountain of eternal night.
Thus shall retribution for sin and blessing for merit
be meted out exactly as this covenant declares.

Next, the Master sounds the Dharma drum thirty-six times,
while master and disciples each visualize the five viscera and their five colors,
fully arrayed to form a canopy of jeweled clouds,
covering the scripture master and the assembly of disciples.

The above is from the *Scripture of Illuminating the Perfected*.

Next, perform the Transmission of the Scripture with a hymn.

The celestial writ is not cumbersome,
for the Dao and its virtue are self-sufficient.
Cultivate it, and you shall surely become an immortal—
what more could you desire?
Its radiance shines in the Great Void,
brilliant and resplendent.
Transmission must follow the proper method;
leakage or negligence leads to the hells of earth.

Next, the disciple kneels before the master,
receiving the scripture, the divine staff, and the ritual tablet.
When this is done, each returns to their place
and bows three times to the master.
As for the placement of the talisman within the staff and the method for the ritual tablet:
if few are present, follow the later incantation rites for arrangement.
If many are present, it is fitting to seal all talismans within the fast
and confer them along with the scripture at the time of transmission.

This is from the *Scripture of Hidden Annotations*.

Next, pay homage by the Ten Directions:

I devote myself to all the Heavenly Worthies:
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Mystic Prime, Jade Dawn, of the North.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Upper Sage, Deliverer of Immortals, of the Northeast.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Treasure Sovereign, of the East.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Good Life and Deliverance, of the Southeast.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Mystic Truth and Myriad Blessings, of the South.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Great Numinous and Empty Sovereign, of the Southwest.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Supreme Mystery, of the West.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Boundless Great Splendor, of the Northwest.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Void and Luminous Sovereign, of the Above.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the True Sovereign and Grotto Spirits, of the Below.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Highest Jade Sovereign of the Past.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Present.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Heavenly Worthy of the Supreme Ultimate of the Future.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to the Jade Capital, Mystic Terrace, and Purple Tenuity Upper Palace.
With utmost sincerity, I devote myself to all perfected immortals and realized sages.

This is from the *Numinous Treasure Scripture*.

Next, chant the Hymn of the Three Perfected Ones:

The Great Dao Lord of the Supreme,
revealed these Numinous Treasure scriptures.
Lofty and wondrous, beyond compare,
like the mystery within the mystery.
The ten directions’ lands, all as one,
revere the supreme immortal.
Vast is the *Scripture of the Cavernous Void*,
as he sits in audience with the heavens.
Above, the Purple Tenuity Terrace;
below, the myriad named mountains.
Resplendent with dragon and phoenix script,
its brilliance shines in the boundless.
Wondrous is the Supreme Dao,
ever-natural in non-action.
Kings, lords, and common folk—
all esteem only loyalty and worth.
Those with karmic fortune from past lives
stand out from former causes.
Masters pass it on in turn,
treasured through kalpas of years.
Vastly mindful, deliver all beings—
great fortune shall be your reward.
Those who make offerings shall attain the Dao;
those who uphold it become perfected.
The Great Dao knows no self or other;
transmit it only to the worthy.
The Void and Constant are ever-natural—
forcedly named the Great Dao.
Vast and boundless, without limit,
all wonders return to the Numinous Treasure.
With eyes closed, visualize the Perfected;
with focused thought, summon the Ten Elders.
Ascend as an immortal, forever in non-action,
your numinous countenance ever wondrous and fair.
Thirst quenched by the jade pool’s nectar,
hunger sated by golden radiance herbs.
With pure wisdom, transcend the eight difficulties,
relieving the world’s myriad sufferings.
All wonders emerge from the Cavernous Mystery,
brilliant and shining in the Great Clarity.
Those who uphold it are called immortals,
their bodies eternal, everlasting.
Carefree, they play in the Mystic Void,
palaces arrayed in formless splendor.
Resplendent, the seven-jeweled groves,
radiant as the sun and moon’s essence.
Dragons and unicorns race in crisscross,
phoenixes soar with mournful cries.
The Supreme rules the Purple Terrace,
while the host of perfected chant the Cavern scriptures.
Offering incense, they bow in reverence,
circumambulating the palace walls.
Three circuits return to the high seat,
the jade of the Dao answering their voices.
Should the lord of men propagate the Supreme Dao,
the world shall know universal peace.

Next, the master kneels facing east and returns the immortal offices.

The Supreme Numinous Treasure, Unsurpassed Three Caverns disciples [names] respectfully address:
The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Natural,
the Supreme Ultimate Great Dao Lord of the Limitless,
the Highest Jade Sovereign,
the perfected and realized great sages,
the Lords and Elders,
the Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors,
the Jade Void Emperor,
the Jade Emperor,
the Great Emperor,
Eastern Florescence,
Southern Culmen,
Western Numinous,
Northern Perfected,
Mystic Capital,
Jade Capital,
Golden Watchtower,
Seven Treasures,
Mystic Terrace,
Purple Tenuity Upper Palace,
Numinous Treasure Perfected,
Luminous Sovereign Lord—
we, by karmic causes from past lives,
were born to encounter the transformative power of the Dao.
The Mystic Perfected initiated and guided us,
enabling us to enter the root of faith.
Our former masters transmitted the Three Treasures’ divine scriptures,
and we made offerings and revered them,
placing merit-making first.
On this day of such-and-such month,
we respectfully transmitted the scriptures and practiced the Dao
with [names], establishing the fast and vigil,
burning incense and making repentant vows.
Now that the transmission is complete,
we invoke the Heavenly Immortals,
Earthly Immortals,
Flying Immortals,
Perfected Ones,
Divine Humans,
Sages,
Overseers of the Fast and Vigil,
Incense-Attending Golden Lads,
Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens,
Jade Emperor’s Direct Talismans,
Flying Dragon Couriers who transmit and memorialize—
all who have overseen this fast,
labored in its defense,
and shall be rewarded according to their merit,
advancing in rank and grade,
restoring their celestial positions.
We respectfully address this memorial.

This is from the *Scripture of Natural Principles*.

Next, restore the incense burner:

Incense Officials and Envoys,
Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger,
and all spirit officials attending the incense,
may the altar’s purity naturally generate
golden liquid cinnabar and azure mushrooms.
May the host of perfected and myriad spirits
gather here before this incense fire altar.
We pray that after receiving the Dao,
all gods shall protect and guard us,
hastening our attainment of immortal perfection.
May the emperor enjoy myriad blessings,
and the world receive grace.

The Jade Lads and Jade Maidens of the Ten Directions,
attending the incense smoke,
transmit this memorial
directly to the presence of the Supreme Limitless Dao.

This is from the *Scripture of Illuminating the Perfected*.

Next, the Hymn of Offering the Precepts:

The Dao is the school of no-mind,
All acts become fields of merit.
Establishing merit has no fixed master,
Each person’s original vow depends on themselves.
Empty the self to respond to all beings,
Focus the mind without partiality.
The Great Sage expounds the supreme teaching,
Like rain descending from heaven.
High peaks are all encompassed,
Yet the lowly become profound as abysses.
The sea is king of a hundred rivers,
Thus it contains dragons and unicorns.
Through ten thousand kalpas, wisdom is preserved,
Not merely for one’s own years.
Upholding the precepts without momentary lapse,
Life after life, good affinities are formed.
With concentrated thought, contemplate the Great Vehicle,
And you shall embody the true Dao.

This is from the *Scripture of Questions and Answers, Lower Volume*.

Next, the Method of Secret Invocations in the Daoist Altar:

Mysterious and supreme, the Great Yin,
Eight windows open to clarity.
When there is something to report,
The Maiden transmits the numinous.
When the matter is complete, return to your station,
And the myriad spirits shall silently rest.

This is from the *Scripture of the Golden Register*.

---

*Supreme Mystery and Essential Secrets, Scroll Thirty-Nine* concludes.

*Supreme Mystery and Essential Secrets, Scroll Forty*

**Ritual of Transmitting the Cavern-Real Upper Clarity**

**Method of Setting Up the Altar:**
First, set up an altar measuring twenty-four feet in length and width, or thirty-two feet, with height and size adjusted according to the number of participants. Adorn the four sides with tassels and establish gates at the four corners, each gate four feet wide, not aligned directly with the Heavenly Gate.

Next, prepare the golden dragons, bright mirrors, stabilizing silks, and the life-destiny silk.

**Method of Arrangement:**
Nine taels of gold, one dragon per tael.
Place them on the central table.
Five bright mirrors.
Place them on the tables of the five directions.
Forty feet of five-colored silk for each direction.
Place them on the tables of the five directions.
The life-destiny silk, its color corresponding to the year’s direction, measured in bolts for the Son of Heaven, in zhang for princes and dukes, and in chi for commoners. The Son of Heaven and nobles use damask, while commoners use plain silk, placed on the table according to the life-destiny color.

**Method of Placing the Tables:**
One table holds the scriptures, covered with red and blue cloths, placed in the center of the altar.
One table is placed in the center, holding the nine dragons.
Five tables, each with incense and the colored mirrors, are placed in the five directions.

**Next, the Ritual of Vigil at the Exposed Altar at Night:**
After arranging the altar at night, the master and disciples enter through the northwest Heavenly Gate. They knock their teeth thirty-six times, visualizing purple qi covering the crown of the altar and the Five Thearchs’ divine soldiers—one hundred thousand in number—coming to welcome the disciple’s body. Then they invoke:

The divine perfected depart on their journey,
The myriad thearchs are startled and alarmed.
The Mysterious Guardians of the Jade Void,
The celestial lodges overturn in reverence.
The officials of the Five Peaks,
All assist with numinous power.
Commanding the ten directions,
Driving and directing the celestial soldiers,
Leading all below heaven,
To assemble at the imperial court.
Grant that I ascend as an immortal,
And penetrate the essence of the Dao.
Discerning what is inauspicious,
Communicating with the hidden and exploring the obscure.
All that is directed and declared,
Shall accord with the Jade Clarity.

Next, enter the altar, circumambulate once, face east, and knock the teeth thirty-six times.

**Method of Invoking the Incense Burner:**
Supreme Three Heavens,
Primordial Origin, Beginning Three Qi,
Most High Dao Lord,
Summon forth from within the bodies of so-and-so
The Flying Immortal Merit Officers of the Void and Natural,
Divine Immortal Envoys,
Left and Right Flying Dragons,
Great Perfected Jade Maidens,
Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans,
Thirty-six of each,
And the local earth deities and true spirits of this place.
We now properly burn incense and keep vigil,
May what we report swiftly reach
The presence of the Jade Emperor of the Limitless,
Before the lofty assembly of the myriad sages.

Next, face north, knock the teeth thirty-six times, and recite the **Method of Subduing Demons:**

Heavenly demons ride the void,
Myriad spirits startle the divine court.
Assuming transformations, they chant deceptive songs,
Shifting forms to enter the nameless.
How clamorous is their chaotic qi,
Defiling the Dao, arising along the path.
In the clouds, they dwell in vermilion palaces,
The Brave Divine Soldiers of the Northern Thearch.
The drum resounds, and they know themselves,
The mysterious movement comes to summon them.
The upper luminaries feast with flying reins,
Swift chariots inspect the cloud camps.
Hastening to consult the Northern Thearch’s register,
Seizing and capturing the names of the demonic hordes.
The Fallen Ones spread the celestial net,
Unleashing power, casting flowing bells.
Golden perfected capture the empty cavern,
Jade radiance illuminates the eight darknesses.
Golden mystery guards the upper palace,
Divine tigers slay celestial spirits.
Severing and extinguishing the myriad demonic qi,
Countless billions are all pacified.
Receiving the trust of the Nine Heavens,
Whistling commands, none dare disobey.
Summoning the perfected, exploring the Three Caverns,
Wisdom recitation shines at dawn’s clarity.
Gazing at the

To all myriad spirits, proclaim upon the floating imperial altar.
Guard and protect, dispel trials—proceed as the great perfected.
At tomorrow’s dawn, command the transmission of the revealed writ.
Then expose the writ’s text upward.

Next, face east, stand level, strike the teeth three times, and perform the incense-burning invocation:
Five Marchmounts, Five Thearchs, divine transcendents and messengers,
Three Origins’ true perfected, left and right Dragon-Tiger,
Heavenly transcendents, earthly transcendents, flying transcendents,
Five Numinous Fragrance Officials—
Summon now the ten directions’ true qi,
The spontaneous golden liquid, cinnabar-green mushroom blossoms,
Nine Mysteries’ jade perfected,
To gather and meet within the altar,
To thoroughly irrigate our bodies,
That we who seek the Dao may attain the Dao,
Those who seek transcendence may attain transcendence,
Soaring through the Great Void,
Ascending in radiance to the Nine Heavens.
Jade lads and jade maidens,
Attend the incense smoke,
Conveying the revealed petition
To the august presence of the Highest, Boundless, Great Dao Jade Emperor.

Next, circumambulate while chanting once:
The Great Dao pervades the subtle and mysterious,
The lofty void encompasses the Three Wheels.
Golden transcendents open the numinous fan,
Resplendent as the Nine Heavens divided.
Patterned splendor scatters from the Purple Palace,
Eight Perfected shine upon the plain clouds.
The Mysterious Mother binds the supreme vow,
The eight gates lie between the ranks.
Myriad blessings converge in the numinous assembly,
Incense smoke rises as the Lower Origin is sung.
Wondrous recitation moves the layered void,
Attaining union with the exalted transcendent host.
Circumambulating, bow to the empty cavern,
Kowtow to the Lord Emperor.

Then exit through the southeastern earth gate to ascend the altar and perform the ritual of transmission:
Once the overnight exposure is complete, perform the rite again at dawn.
If wind or rain arises at daybreak, as the scripture says, perform it within the chamber.

Master and disciples together proceed to the northwestern Heavenly Gate,
Strike the teeth thirty-two times,
Visualize purple qi covering the altar and crown,
A hundred thousand divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs come to welcome the disciple’s body.
Then secretly invoke:
Divine perfected emerge on their journey,
Myriad thearchs are startled and alarmed.
Jade Void’s mysterious guards,
Celestial lodgings overturn.
Officials of the Five Marchmounts,
All assist with numinous power.
Commanding the ten directions,
Driving and dispatching heavenly soldiers.
From the heavens downward,
All assemble at the imperial court.
Grant that I ascend as transcendent,
Thoroughly attain the essence of the Dao,
Discern what is inauspicious,
Penetrate the obscure, fathom the hidden.
Wherever I turn, whatever I declare,
All accord with the Jade Clarity.

Next, enter the altar, face east,
Strike the teeth thirty-six times,
Perform the incense-burning invocation:
Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Origin, Three Qi, Most High Dao Lord,
Summon forth from our bodies
The void-and-spontaneous flying transcendent messengers,
Divine transcendent envoys,
Left and right flying dragons, great perfected,
Jade maidens, Five Thearchs’ direct talismans—
Thirty-six each—
To notify the true officials and numinous spirits of this land,
That as we now burn incense and transmit scriptures,
Our petition swiftly ascend,
Directly to the august presence of the Boundless Jade Emperor,
Before the lofty and perfected myriad sages.

Next, face north,
Strike the teeth thirty-six times,
Recite the demon-subduing invocation:
Heavenly demons surge through the void,
Myriad spirits startle the divine court.
Assuming transformations, they chant deceptive verses,
Shifting forms to enter namelessness.
Clamorous qi—how chaotic!
Defiled ways arise along the path.
Within clouds lies the Crimson Palace,
The Northern Thearch’s valiant divine soldiers.
The drum’s resonance knows itself,
The mysterious movement comes to summon them.
Upper luminaries feast with flying reins,
Swift chariots inspect the cloud camps.
Hastening to consult the Northern Thearch’s register,
Seizing and capturing the names of the demonic hordes.
The Fallen Ones spread the celestial net,
Unleashing power, casting flowing bells.
Golden perfected capture the empty cavern,
Jade radiance illuminates the eight darknesses.
Golden mystery guards the upper palace,
Divine tigers slay celestial spirits.
Severing and extinguishing the myriad demonic qi,
Countless billions are all pacified.
Receiving the trust of the Nine Heavens,
Whistling commands, none dare disobey.
Summoning the perfected, exploring the Three Caverns,
Wisdom recitation shines at dawn’s clarity.
Gazing at the eight ways of the mysterious rosy clouds,
Seven revolutions weave the heavenly scriptures.
Merging with the Thearch’s singular truth,
Delivering the seven generations of ancestors.
Eradicating the roots of the five sufferings,
Returning souls to receive glory anew.
Golden light illumines the silent chamber,
Divine candles spontaneously ignite.
Floral incense scatters through the jade script,
Smoke and qi penetrate the Jade Capital.
The Thearch dispatches the lingering chariot,
Three Origins descend in green wheels.
Swift chariots ascend the Nine Mysteries,
Attending our Jade Emperor’s court.

Next, bow nine times toward the upper direction as before.

Next, kneel lengthwise, strike the teeth nine times, and petition:
I now transmit to disciples [Name] and others
The precious scriptures of the Nine Heavens, the supreme jade-hidden clarity of the lofty constellation,
To present qi and command the union of perfected,
Praying that the Jade Transcendents who oversee truth,
The Registrar Attendants,
The Guardian Marshal of Numinous Might,
Descend to witness the covenant writ,
That all we reveal and entrust
May assuredly ascend.
Next, face the lower direction, bow twice, kneel, and again petition:
Highest Primordial Origin Heaven,
We now present our vows on this auspicious day of the Eight Assemblies,
Pure and reverent at the numinous...

The *Supreme Mystery Essentials*, Scroll Forty, concludes.
**Scroll Forty-One: The Staff-Brandishing Chapter, the Tablet-Brandishing Chapter, the Petition-Tablet Chapter, the Memorial-Tablet Text Chapter**

**The Staff-Brandishing Chapter**
From the *Upper Scripture of Jade Secrets of the Cavernous Mystery*:

The Primordial Five Elders emerge,
The Five Thearchs’ true talismans,
To deliver the people of the Five Thearchs.
The Celestial Radiance opens the Yang-light, revealing this text,
From the Mysterious Capital Palace.

The Primordial Azure Thearch’s true talisman summons the Direct Talisman Officer Gengsheng to guard the Celestial Writs of Numinous Treasure.
When the Daoist ingests it, numinous *qi* stabilizes the liver,
Generating nine petals of azure essence’s precious blossom.
Spirits are commanded as servants,
Enabling communion with the numinous to attain transcendence.

The above *Primordial Celestial Radiance Text* derives from the *Azure Thearch’s True Writ Chapter*,
To pacify the Nine *Qi* Heavens of the eastern direction.
The Azure Thearch receives this text to guard the Eastern Marchmount,
Sealing one passage to the Nine Numinous Cavern Chamber,
Which opens once every forty thousand kalpas.
Daoists whose destiny belongs to the Eastern Marchmount
Should inscribe azure talismans on crimson silk and wear them on the body.
They must also inscribe azure talismans on crimson silk,
Place them within the uppermost node of the spirit staff,
Clothe it in divine robes,
And have nine Jade Maidens of Azure Waist attend as guardians,
Lest they fail in reverence and incur the scrutiny of inspecting officers.

The Primordial Vermilion Thearch’s true talisman summons the Direct Talisman Officer Changzhong to guard the Celestial Writs of Numinous Treasure.
When the Daoist ingests it, numinous *qi* stabilizes the heart,
Generating three petals of cinnabar essence’s precious blossom.
Spirits are commanded as servants,
Enabling communion with the numinous to attain transcendence.

The above *Yang Brightness Text* derives from the *Vermilion Thearch’s True Writ Chapter*,
To pacify the Three *Qi* Heavens of the southern direction.
The Vermilion Thearch receives this text to guard the Southern Marchmount,
Sealing one passage to the Southern Huo Peak’s slopes,
Which opens once every forty thousand kalpas.
Daoists whose destiny belongs to the Southern Marchmount
Should inscribe vermilion talismans on yellow silk and wear them on the body.
They must also inscribe vermilion talismans on yellow silk,
Place them within the node below the Azure Thearch’s on the spirit staff,
