When reciting the great characters of the *Celestial Sovereign*, *Earthly Sovereign*, and *Human Sovereign* and practicing their Dao, one must face south, bow twice, knock the teeth twelve times, and swallow qi twelve times. Visualize the Celestial Sovereign, nine inches in height, draped in a cyan mantle, clad in a cyan brocade skirt, wearing a nine-rayed jewel crown, and holding in the left hand a jade tablet of flying transcendence. The Human Sovereign, nine inches in height, draped in a yellow mantle, clad in a yellow brocade skirt, wearing a seven-colored jewel crown, and holding in the right hand the jade tablet of life-preservation of the Highest Sovereign. The Earthly Sovereign, nine inches in height, draped in a white brocade mantle, clad in a plain brocade skirt, wearing a three-dawn jade crown, and holding in the rear the jade tablet of primordial record-settling. The Three Sovereigns stand to the left and right of the practitioner. Only then may one unfurl the scroll and perform the rites. In practicing this Dao, one may not engage in yin-yang union, tread upon defilement, or profane the celestial texts, lest one offend the true numina and incur punishment by the Left and Right Officials.

**Scripture Categories**
*The Scripture of the Cavern Profundity’s Empty Cavern Numinous Chapters:*

Devout faithful men and women, with incense and lamps as offerings, shall in this life attain radiant illumination, enter the realm of non-action, and receive blessings as a natural endowment. Should one maintain long-term abstinence, recite the numinous chapters of the scriptures, and complete ten thousand repetitions, the Dao will be perfected, the body shall generate water and fire, and one shall immediately attain flight.

This Dao is lofty and wondrous; it must not be leaked or divulged.

*The Scripture of the Cavern Profundity’s Jade Capital Mountain:*
Should the practitioner maintain long-term abstinence and deep contemplation, chant and recite the *Dao and Virtue Cavern Scripture*, while knocking the teeth and swallowing saliva, exhaling and inhaling the Great Harmony, the body shall turn golden, the nape shall bear a halo of radiance, the head shall be adorned with the brilliance of the sun, and the hands shall grasp the ten-jade-streamer banner of the Dark Effulgence Numinous Talisman. Such virtue is majestic, the Dao’s utmost honor. Boundless and wondrous transformations shall ensue, and one shall become a Perfected of the Most High.

This shall move the Great Non-Being, stir the Heavenly Elder, summon flying dragons, and descend celestial immortals.

*The Scripture of the Cavern Profundity’s Nine Heavens Divine Chapters:*
*The Celestial Birth Divine Chapter* is formed from the coalesced qi of the Three Caverns’ soaring mystery, its sacred sounds structuring numinous script. It unites the hundred spirits, concealing their inner names within its hidden rhymes, shaping life and death—an innate chapter.

When the *Celestial Treasure* is recited, it opens the light of heaven and earth.
When the *Numinous Treasure* is recited, it awakens the souls of the Nine Dark Realms from eternal night.
When the *Divine Treasure* is recited, it commands the myriad spirits.
When the *Great One* is recited, it completes the body’s gods.
When the *Imperial Lord* is recited, it shapes the form.
When the *Nine Heavens* is recited, it gives birth to humanity.
When scholars recite it, they ascend to heaven.
When ghosts and spirits hear it, they ascend and advance.
When ordinary folk hear it, they attain longevity.
When imprisoned souls hear it, they are liberated.
When withered bones hear it, they emit smoke.
When infants hear it, they gain speech.
When the dead hear it, they return to life.

The Three Treasures’ divine mysteries are the root of all existence; thus, they are beyond the knowledge of ghosts and spirits or the perception of ordinary folk.

Those in the Three Primordials’ Palace who bear golden names and purple characters, inscribed for future lives, destined to become Perfected Immortals of the Three Clarities, shall receive this text.

Reciting it once, the sound ascends to the Nine Heavens.
Reciting it twice, heaven and earth display reverence.
Reciting it thrice, the Three Realms offer homage.
Reciting it four times, the Heavenly Kings descend as immortals.
Reciting it five times, the Five Emperors attend the Perfected.
Reciting it six times, the Demon Kings bind themselves.
Reciting it seven times, the stellar lodges halt their gates.
Reciting it eight times, the dark nights become luminous.
Reciting it nine times, all heavens descend, and every spirit without exception guards the practitioner’s chariot.

One recitation pierces the heavens, unblocking the source of the womb.
Two recitations resound through the earth, dissolving the roots of the fetal bond.
Three recitations invoke divine homage, refining the soul at the Gate of Spirits.
Four recitations summon the Heavenly Kings to witness, opening the gates of the dark nights.
Five recitations bring the Five Emperors to attend the Perfected, cooling the viscera.
Six recitations subdue the Demon Kings to obedience, generating fluids in the stomach channel.
Seven recitations brighten the stellar lodges, opening the orifices to wisdom.
Eight recitations illuminate the dark nights, perfecting the Three Sections and Eight Effulgences in body and spirit.
Nine recitations bring the descent of all heavens, where the Three Passes, Five Viscera, Six Bowels, Nine Palaces, Golden Towers, Jade Chambers, Twelve-Layered Gates, Purple Portals, Jade Enclosures, and thirty-six thousand joints—all roots and origins—simultaneously generate gods.

Nine recitations make one full cycle. Upon completing one cycle, the Three Realms record one’s name, the Five Emperors acknowledge kinship, and one is called a Perfected.
Ten cycles harmonize qi, commanding the myriad spirits. The Demon Kings act as guarantors, and one is listed among the heavens.
A hundred cycles harmonize the spirit, enabling spontaneous attainment. The Great One bestows talismans, and the Primordial Lord grants rebirth.
A thousand cycles harmonize the numinous, allowing one to sit or stand at will in life or death. Immortal youths and jade maidens serve at one’s command.
Ten thousand cycles complete the Dao, enabling one to ride a dragon-drawn chariot and ascend in broad daylight.

*The Scripture of the Cavern Profundity’s Five Praises:*
The Perfected of the Great One and Primordial Unity states: The *Five Thousand Characters of the Dao and Virtue* are the subtlest of scriptures, expounding the intent of the Dao and the teachings of true correctness—brilliant and wondrous script. Reciting it for a thousand days with an empty mind and focused contemplation, one shall ascend to immortality in broad daylight and become a Perfected of the Western Florescence. This is the lineage of the highest immortals, and it may also bring blessings to the seven generations of ancestors.

*The Scripture of the Cavern Profundity’s Limitless Salvation of Humanity:*
The Dao states: Those of superior learning who cultivate and recite this scripture shall immediately receive deliverance and ascend to the Southern Palace. Those in the world who recite it shall extend their years and longevity, and afterward, all shall attain the Dao of liberation through simulated death. The soul and spirit shall briefly vanish, bypassing the earthly peaks, and immediately regain form, roaming the Great Void. This scripture is subtle and wondrous, universally delivering boundless beings. All celestial and human beings receive its blessings, immeasurable fortune, and grace in life and death.

On the day of one’s life-destiny, reciting and chanting this scripture shall purify the soul and spirit, perpetuating the myriad qi, sparing one from suffering and affliction. The body shall radiate light, the Three Realms shall serve as guards, the Five Emperors shall receive one, the myriad spirits shall pay homage, and one’s name shall be inscribed in the heavens.

The Dao states: If one’s Daoist learning is shallow, or the immortal rank incomplete, and the time of demise arrives, passing through the Great Yin, at the moment of transition, fellow practitioners and perfected beings shall burn incense and recite the scripture ten times to deliver the corpse-form according to the method. The soul and spirit shall ascend directly to the Southern Palace, and based on the merit of one’s studies, one shall be reborn after a calculated period, escaping the wheel of rebirth and attaining immortality.

The Dao states: When the cycles of heaven and earth reach their end, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When the stellar lodges deviate from their courses and the sun and moon lose their clarity, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When the four seasons lose their order and yin and yang fall out of harmony, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When the ruler faces calamity and warfare erupts on all sides, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When pestilence spreads and the people suffer death and injury, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When masters and friends pass away, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture.

Purification rites and scripture recitation carry immense merit: above, they dispel celestial disasters and protect the emperor; below, they ward off poison and harm, delivering the people. In life and death, all rely upon it, its blessings beyond measure. Thus, it is called the *Limitless Universal Deliverance of Celestial and Human Beings*.

The Dao states: Whoever possesses this scripture may serve as the lord of heaven, earth, and the emperor.

When the myriad people perform these meritorious deeds—on days of calamity, resolving in their hearts to perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture ten times—all the heavens record their names, and ten thousand spirits stand guard in attendance.

The Dao states: These are the great Brahma-hidden words among the heavens, the sounds of the Limitless. The ancient script was a full *zhang* in length. The Celestial Perfected Sovereign of Old transcribed its text to establish the correct intonation. Those who know its sound, perform purification rites, and recite it will have the Heavenly Kings of Flying Spirits descend to observe their persons, record their diligent merit, and submit it to the heavens. Ten thousand spirits will pay homage, earth deities will attend at their gates, and their great merit will be acknowledged. Demon kings will protect and recommend them as ascended immortals. Once their Dao is complete and they attain perfection, they may roam the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Gate.

The *Scripture of the Golden Chamber of the Cavern-Real for Deliverance and Life* states: This scripture is the supreme jade chapter, the numinous篇 of the Great Cavern, arrayed within the singular form. Reciting it once, the wondrous principle is naturally understood; reciting it ten times, one’s countenance reverts to youthful radiance; reciting it a hundred times, the inner embryo transforms into an immortal; reciting it a thousand times, one may sit in death or stand in dissolution; after ten thousand recitations, with the Dao complete, one ascends at dawn in broad daylight. Abiding in perpetual purification and tranquil seclusion, untouched by the dust of the world, the Dao descends without fail, and ascension to immortality is but a matter of days.

Each ten recitations count as one *bian*. With each *bian*, one ingests one *Golden Chamber Life-Preserving Talisman*. After ten *bian*, having ingested ten talismans, one achieves communion with the divine and attains truth, sitting in vision of the eight directions. The hundred passages are ordered, the nodes of spirit are regulated, and the myriad *qi* converge in harmony. Thus, one may attain longevity, their lifespan matching heaven and earth, their years equal to the Three Luminaries.

The *Scripture of the Cavern-Real, Crimson Writ of the Dragon’s Radiance and Purple Phoenix* states: The Crimson Writ of ninety-one words is the secret excerpted text received by the Perfected of the Western Citadel, the foundation of cultivation for immortality, the hidden sound of the phoenix’s *qi*. Those who obtain and wear it become immortals; those who practice it attain perfection. For ordinary people who uphold it, it wards off afflictions.

Should one maintain unwavering fasting and ascetic practice, dwelling in secluded mountains, reciting and chanting ten thousand times, they shall summon dragons to mount the void, ascend to Jade Clarity, and remain concealed among mortals. Wearing the script and intoning its sounds, divine officials will come to pay homage. With each recitation, the spirit brightens and *qi* clears; a thousand demons bind themselves, and ten thousand *mara* dissolve their forms.

*The Wondrous Scripture of the Cavern-Real, Plain and Numinous* states:
The Perfected of the Great Ultimate declares: *The Cavern-Mystery Wondrous Scripture of the Supreme Plain and Numinous* was born coeval with the Primordial Beginning. As its numinous text exists, all Perfected Ones approach the seat, burn incense, and venerate the scripture, reciting and chanting its twenty-one chapters to celebrate in the divine court. The jade tones ring clear, resounding through the Nine Heavens. Its phrases are subtle and profound, its wondrous essence branching in all directions. With a single recitation, the myriad spirits awaken to numinosity. One must constantly study and practice it to unite with the Emperor in perfection, resolve the heavy retributions of past transgressions, extricate the seven mysteries from the dark palace, release the five sufferings from sorrowful souls, and ascend one’s body to the Three Heavens. How wondrous and subtle is this numinous text!

*The Scripture of the Cavern-Real, Orthodox Dharma of the Three Heavens* states:
The hymns of the Three Heavens—when one receives this text and recites it in a separate chamber, a thousand recitations commune with the divine, and ten thousand recitations commune with perfection. To commune with the divine is to converse with spirits and foreknow fortune and misfortune; to commune with perfection is to behold the countenance of the Primordial Beginning, enter water without sinking, enter fire without burning, pass through calamities and perils, and soar through the Three Clarities.

*The Scripture of the Cavern-Real, Jade Chapters of the Azure Empyrean’s Resplendent Writ* states:
Among all scriptures for cultivation, the Jade Chapters take precedence. Recite and chant them in a quiet chamber, and stillness will bring forth radiant clouds. All *mara* submit and serve; no trial dares approach. As one practices according to their will, they attain the perfection of the Dao. After ten thousand recitations, the Dao is complete, and the body ascends to the Grand Clarity.

*The Scripture of the Cavern-Real, Wisdom and Insight: The Great Precepts of Observing the Body* states:
The Lord Emperor of the Heavenly August Microcosm declares: Those who study the Dao yet do not uphold the Great Precepts of Observing the Body, though they recite scriptures ten thousand times and dwell in secluded mountains, may still find the hope of ascending as immortals elusive!

*The Scripture of the Cavern-Real, Dispensing Salvation to Foreign Realms* states:
One should burn incense in a quiet chamber, make vows, and cultivate practice. With a single recitation, the myriad Perfected Ones gather, the Five Elders descend in form, heavenly *mara* bow in submission, and immortals and Perfected Ones are summoned.

*The Scripture of the Cavern-Real, Jade Tallies of the Three Primes* states:
The ethereal chants of the Jade Clarity’s Upper Palace, resplendent and desolate, comprise ninety chapters governed by the Lords of the Three Primes. The Lords constantly chant these verses to harmonize the *qi* of form and soul, celebrating the Perfected Ones of the Nine Palaces. Those who practice the Dao of the Three Primes must intone these chants to seek the advent of the supremely numinous, summoning them from the mysterious void and guiding them along the ford’s path.

*The Scripture of the Cavern-Real, Talismans of the Cinnabar Numinosity of the Six Jia* states:
In the Jade Palace of the Upper Clarity, the Jade Maidens inscribe golden tablets with the hymns of the Upper Palace, their voices blending in song. Their tones ascend to Jade Clarity, celebrating the divine Perfected Ones and dissolving stagnation in the eternal yang. Those who obtain this text will have the Six Jia descend in form. By maintaining constant purity and fasting, chanting the numinous sounds, they may ride the white simurgh to ascend to the Jade Palace. Those who study yet lose this Dao waste their form and spirit in vain; the heavenly Perfected will not descend, and they shall have no means to attain immortality. For those cultivating the Dao of the Six Jia, on each *jia* day, they must enter the chamber, ingest the talisman, and recite the hymns of the Six Palaces. After six years of communion, the Jade Maidens will descend to the chamber, converse face-to-face, and convey the practitioner on dragons to soar through the empyrean, ascending in bodily form. Secrecy ensures numinous descent; leakage invites calamity.

*The Scripture of the Cavern-Real, Hidden Writ of Jade Clarity* states:
*The Hidden Incantations of the Great Cavern of Jade Clarity* are the celestial texts of the Nine Heavens, issuing from the oral instructions of the Most High, dissolving stagnation and dispersing its source. The thirty-nine chapters of the *True Scripture of the Great Cavern* reach their ultimate principle here. Above, they summon the radiance of the loftiest numinous clouds; below, they extinguish the misfortunes of the myriad *mara*. With a single recitation, the dark barriers open, and the thirty-nine portals receive the jade nectar. The *qi* of death sinks and obstructs no more, and the hundred spirits rejoice within. Once the hundred spirits flow freely, their voices reach the Nine Mysteries, their *qi* brightens the Purple Empyrean, their echoes resound in the Jade Dawn. The Five Emperors gird their sashes, the myriad spirits attend the chamber, the living generations return in homage, the seven ancestors ascend, and the body gains feathered wings. Mounting the radiance and riding the clouds, one flies to Jade Clarity and takes one’s place among the Purple Retinue. This is the wondrous Dao of the Lofty Mystery, the secret chapters of Jade Clarity.

*End of Scroll Forty-Three of the Supreme Secret Essentials*

**Precepts of the Lower Primordial of Jade Purity**

The Dao student must not kill living, wriggling creatures;
The Dao student must not teach others to kill living, wriggling creatures;
The Dao student must not consume alcohol;
The Dao student must not teach others to consume alcohol;
The Dao student must not engage in frivolous speech, double-tongued deceit, or breach of trust;
The Dao student must not teach others to engage in frivolous speech, double-tongued deceit, or breach of trust;
The Dao student must not violate or seduce common women;
The Dao student must not teach others to violate or seduce common women;
The Dao student must not steal others’ property;
The Dao student must not teach others to steal others’ property;
The Dao student must not envy the worthy or resent the capable;
The Dao student must not teach others to envy the worthy or resent the capable;
The Dao student must not betray their teacher’s kindness and affection;
The Dao student must not teach others to betray their teacher’s kindness and affection;
The Dao student must not be disloyal to their superiors;
The Dao student must not teach others to be disloyal to their superiors;
The Dao student must not deceive their subordinates;
The Dao student must not teach others to deceive their subordinates;
The Dao student must not deceive or delude fellow students who lack understanding;
The Dao student must not teach others to deceive or delude fellow students who lack understanding;
The Dao student must not treat disciples with contempt;
The Dao student must not teach others to treat disciples with contempt;
The Dao student must not speak kindly while harboring hidden malice;
The Dao student must not teach others to speak kindly while harboring hidden malice;
The Dao student must not speak of others’ faults and transgressions;
The Dao student must not teach others to speak of others’ faults and transgressions;
The Dao student must not hoard the seven treasures without bestowing them upon the four assemblies;
The Dao student must not teach others to hoard the seven treasures without bestowing them upon the four assemblies;
The Dao student must not covet others’ wealth, goods, or possessions for personal extravagance;
The Dao student must not teach others to covet others’ wealth, goods, or possessions for personal extravagance;
The Dao student must not keep blades, staves, or weapons;
The Dao student must not teach others to keep blades, staves, or weapons;
The Dao student must not raise the six livestock;
The Dao student must not teach others to raise the six livestock;
The Dao student must not use gold or silver vessels for eating or drinking, nor bury bones in lavish funerals;
The Dao student must not teach others to use gold or silver vessels for eating or drinking, nor bury bones in lavish funerals;
The Dao student must not crave or delight in honor, emolument, or royal rank;
The Dao student must not teach others to crave or delight in honor, emolument, or royal rank;
The Dao student must not burn or destroy even an inch of earthly things;
The Dao student must not teach others to burn or destroy even an inch of earthly things;
The Dao student must not cast edible things into water or fire;
The Dao student must not teach others to cast edible things into water or fire;
The Dao student must not indulge in worldly flavors;
The Dao student must not teach others to indulge in worldly flavors;
The Dao student must not crave the five pungent foods;
The Dao student must not teach others to crave the five pungent foods;
The Dao student must not write in cursive script;
The Dao student must not teach others to write in cursive script;
The Dao student must not exchange coarse items for others’ fine goods;
The Dao student must not teach others to exchange coarse items for others’ fine goods;
The Dao student must not know or involve themselves in military or state affairs;
The Dao student must not teach others to know or involve themselves in military or state affairs;
