The local earth deities and territorial spirits of this place, we now burn incense and practice the Dao, praying that the true qi of the Ten Directions from the Most High may descend and flow into our bodies, so that our entreaties swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme Peerless Great Dao, the Most Perfect Jade Emperor of the Most High.

**After the incense offering is completed**, all officials kneel in reverence. Strike the celestial drum twenty-four times, then the officials present their reports.

We respectfully summon the Five Body True Officials and Merit Officers within our bodies, the Twelve Officers of the Upper Three Heavens who enforce the law and transform yin and yang, the Lords and Officers who deliver the Dao and dispel disasters, disperse misfortunes, and resolve calamities, and the Twelve Officers who govern our duties. The Great Generals of the Central Establishment who monitor merit in our domain, the vanguard who effect merit, the rearguard who execute punishments, the Post Station Commanders and Deputies, the Four Division Inspectors of Merit, the Petitioners, the Immortal Envoys within our bodies, the Orthodox Unity Merit Officers, the Healing Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Yin-Yang Spirit Decision Officers, the Chariot and Vermilion Talisman Officers, the Gale Courier Officers, the Post Horse Memorial Officers, the Flying Dragon Courier Officers—let two of each emerge.

Let them emerge in solemn attire, adorned with caps and sashes, their regalia impeccable. The Direct Merit Officers wear the Heaven-Piercing Crown and black single-layered robes. The Orthodox Unity Merit Officers wear the Vermilion Yang Cap and crimson robes. The Memorial Officers wear the Nine Virtues Crown, five-colored longevity robes, tiger talisman belts, and hold jade tablets. The Direct Merit Officers stand at the four directions, the Orthodox Unity Merit Officers stand at the center, and the Healing Merit Officers guard our bodies. The Left Attendant Envoys hold the standard in front, the Right Attendant Envoys hold the banners behind. The Yang Spirit Decision Officers stand to the left, the Yin Spirit Decision Officers to the right. The Upper Division Merit Officers stand above, the Middle Division Merit Officers stand within our bodies, and the Qi-Urging Merit Officers hasten the qi of the ten directions. The Upper Division Envoys gaze toward the heavens, the Middle Division Envoys survey the eight directions, and the General Envoys encircle our bodies with rain. The Tiger-Rushing Officials inspect for deceit, the Hook-Riding Generals and Palace Attendants, the Celestial Soldiers gather qi, the Qi-Consuming Officers gather spirits, the Spirit-Consuming Officers gather ghosts, the Ghost-Consuming Officers gather evil, the Evil-Consuming Officers gather essences, the Essence-Consuming Officers gather toxins, the Toxin-Consuming Officers execute talismans, the Temple-Destroying Officers and Chariot Officers, the Vermilion Talisman Officers and Gale Couriers, the Post Horse Memorial Officers and Flying Dragon Couriers—let them assemble before, behind, to the left, and right of us. The Merit Officers array themselves in solemn formation, and when the matter is concluded, the ceremonial guards open the gates.

The Numinous Treasure Officials, the Supervising Fasting Lords, the Twenty-Four Governances established by the Heavenly Master, the Thirty-Six Quiet Retreats, the Seventy-Two Blessed Lands, the Three Hundred Sixty Sacred Mountains, the Upper Palaces of Kunlun and the thirty-six thousand gods, the sun, moon, and stars, the Jade Armillary Sphere, the Five Thearchs of Heaven and Earth, the officials and generals of the Three Realms, the Two Mysteries, the Three Origins, the Four Beginnings, the Four Directions, the winds and qi, the Officers of the Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches, the Summoning Lords, the Nine Yi Hu Lords of the East, the Eight Man Yue Lords of the South, the Six Rong Shi Lords of the West, the Five Di Qiang Lords of the North, the Three Qin Cang Lords of the Center, the Lords of the Five Peaks and Four Waterways, the marsh and pond spirits, the local deities of mountains, rivers, streams, valleys, forests, and groves, the Root-Source Land Deities of the Two Streams, the Earth and Grain Generals—let all array themselves in solemn attire.

At this moment, the Merit Officers and Flying Dragon Couriers within our bodies, together with the aforementioned, ascend to report to the Supreme Peerless Great Dao, the Most High Great Dao Lord, the Most High Venerable One, the Supreme Mysterious Elder, the Ten Directions’ Peerless Great Dao, the Host of Perfected and Celestial Worthies, the Most Perfect Great Emperor, the Celestial Emperor and Heavenly Master Lords, the Numinous Treasure Supervising Fasting Great Dharma Masters, and all the officials and lords. Born and raised in the mortal world, we have sunk into the degenerate age, indulging in fleeting pleasures and transient glory, blessed with a thousand-year gathering. By misfortune, we have been selected to receive the great transformation, the Three Treasures and divine scriptures bestowed by the Three Masters through covenant. We offer reverent worship, seeking our desires, bearing the weight of profound grace, our hearts filled with both joy and trepidation.

On the day we received the Dharma, we must exhaust our foolish limitations, offering even the hairs of our bodies, to uphold and cultivate the scriptural teachings, proclaiming the numinous sounds to nurture compassion for all beings and deliver both heaven-dwellers and humans. Herewith, a certain man or woman, official or commoner, named so-and-so, from such-and-such prefecture, county, township, and village, has submitted a petition, presenting their case before us with a sincere and trembling heart, beseeching redress and review. We hereby submit this petition on their behalf, humbly reciting the words of their plea.

*Recitation of the petition.*

As we have examined the words of this petition, the matters described are urgent and truly pitiable. Unable to bear what we have witnessed, we respectfully join together, following the instructions of the Heavenly Master, to advocate for those mired in suffering. We expose ourselves upon the altar, binding our bodies and tying our limbs, scattering our hair to cover our foreheads, suspending our heads by our hair beneath the altar railings. In accordance with the *Great Rite of Atonement* of the *Lower Prime* of the *Numinous Treasure*, we establish rectitude, burning incense and lighting lamps to illuminate the myriad heavens. For three days and three nights, in each of the six periods, we perform the ritual circumambulation, repenting and atoning for the transgressions and offenses of so-and-so’s ancestors—countless generations of fathers and mothers, uncles and brothers, the departed and the long-dead, spanning innumerable kalpas and lineages—along with the sins and faults of so-and-so’s own person, whether living or deceased. We lay bare our innermost hearts, prostrating ourselves in utmost sincerity, and vow to invoke the celestial immortal armies of nine hundred million riders, the terrestrial immortal armies of nine hundred million riders, the flying immortal armies of nine hundred million riders, the divine immortal armies of nine hundred million riders, the stellar constellation armies of nine hundred million riders, the Nine Palaces’ armies of nine hundred million riders, the Five Marchmounts’ armies of nine hundred million riders each, the Three Rivers and Four Seas’ armies of nine hundred million riders each, the thirty-two *Celestial Overseers of the Fast*, the thirty-two *Golden Lads of Incense*, the thirty-two *Jade Maidens of Flower Scattering*, the thirty-two *Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors* each, and the *Flying Dragon Couriers of Memorials*. May they all descend together to oversee the ritual hall. As we hold the incense and make our vows, may our words ascend without obstruction. When the circumambulation is complete, may the diligent *Immortals of Merit* and the *Officials of Merit*, along with their subordinates, the *Merit Couriers* and *Flying Dragon Couriers*, distinguish and transmit our memorials, reporting them in due time. Once the matters are presented, may they return to our bodies and resume their places within our palaces. When summoned again, may they arrive as before, in accordance with established protocol.

*Three rolls of the drum.*

**First Offering of Incense:**
We, the *Festive Masters of the Heavenly Master’s* such-and-such *Orthodox Lineage*, the *Most Supreme Numinous Treasure Three Caverns Dharma Masters*, and the *Perfected of* such-and-such *Marchmount*, humbly address the *Celestial Worthy of Primordial Non-Being*, the *Most High Lord Lao, the Supreme Jade Emperor*, the *Perfected and Celestial Worthies of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao*, the *Lords and Venerable Ones*, the *Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors*, the *Jade Void Supreme Emperor*, the *Jade Emperor and Great Emperor*, *Donghua*, *Nanji*, *Xiling*, *Beizhen*, the *Jade Capital of Xuandu*, the *Golden Watchtower*, the *Seven-Treasured Mystic Terrace*, the *Purple Tenuity Upper Palace*, the *Perfected of the Numinous Treasure*, the *Radiant August Dao Lord*, the *Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Center*, and the *Heavenly Master Lords*. By karmic affinity from past lives, we were born into this age of the Dao’s teaching. Through the misguided favor of our masters and perfected ones, we were uplifted, our decayed bodies opened to the Dao, and we were instructed in the scriptures and Dharma. The boundless grace of this surpassing kindness leaves us indebted beyond measure. On the day we received the Dharma, we swore an oath with the Three Officials to devote our very lives and bones, to propagate the great transformation, to confront the unseen realms, to assist our masters and elders, and to deliver all beings.

*Recitation of the petition follows.*

We humbly join together, following the Heavenly Master’s instructions, to advocate for those mired in suffering. We bind our bodies, tie our limbs, and press our foreheads to the earth, prostrating with all five limbs beneath the altar railings. In accordance with the *Great Rite of Atonement* of the *Lower Prime* of the *Numinous Treasure*, we burn incense and perform the fast, circumambulating in the six periods of day and night. On behalf of so-and-so, we repent for the transgressions of their ancestors—countless generations of fathers and mothers, uncles and brothers, spanning innumerable kalpas and lineages—along with the faults of so-and-so’s household, great and small, from past lives to the present, including all offenses unforgiven by Heaven, unabsolved by Earth, unpardoned by humans, and unreleased by ghosts: the myriad sins and countless transgressions that violate the *Three Primes’ One Hundred Eighty Precepts*, the *Three Officials’ Nine Bureaus and One Hundred Twenty Offices*, and the judgments of the *Yin-Yang, Water-Fire, Left-Right, and Central Palace Examiners*. Today, we burn incense and dedicate these merits so that so-and-so’s ancestors—forefathers and foremothers, the departed and the long-dead—may be freed from suffering, ascend to the Heavenly Palace, receive blessings in the Southern Palace, and return their bodies, spirits, and lives to the Great Dao.

We prostrate ourselves, returning our lives to the *Three Celestial Worthies of the Most High*, and dedicate these merits to so-and-so’s ancestors—countless generations of fathers and mothers, the departed and the long-dead—praying they may be spared the Ten Sufferings and Eight Difficulties, ascend to the Heavenly Palace, be clothed and fed by nature, and dwell forever in non-action.

Today, we burn incense and return ourselves to the virtue of our masters, the *Great Sages and Perfected Ones*, that after attaining the Dao, we may ascend into non-being and unite with the Dao as true.

**Second Offering of Incense:**
We humbly offer incense once more, dedicating these merits to the emperor and lords of the realm, to their ministers and officials, to the common people, to our Dharma-teaching masters, to our parents and honored kin, to our fellow disciples and students, to the reclusive Daoists dwelling in mountains and forests to cultivate the true Dao, and to all worthy ones. May each attain the Dao, returning their bodies, spirits, and lives to the Great Dao.

We prostrate ourselves, returning our lives to the *Three Celestial Worthies of the Most High*, and dedicate these merits to the emperor and lords of the realm, their ministers and officials, the common people, our Dharma-teaching masters, our parents and honored kin, our fellow Daoist disciples and worthy ones. May they be spared the Ten Sufferings and Eight Difficulties, each preserving their blessings and destinies, and ultimately enter non-action.

Today, we burn incense and return ourselves to the virtue of our masters, the *Great Sages and Perfected Ones*, that after attaining the Dao, we may ascend into formlessness and unite with the Dao as true.

**Third Offering of Incense:**
We humbly offer incense once more, dedicating these merits to so-and-so’s own person, their household and lineage, their ninefold kin and in-laws, the officials and commoners of the realm, all *Festive Masters* and *Libationers*, the people of the world, and all creatures—whether crawling, wriggling, creeping, or gasping—every living being. May they return their bodies, spirits, and lives to the Great Dao.

We prostrate ourselves, bodies pressed to the earth, and surrender our lives to the *Most High Three Venerables*. May these merits flow to the household of so-and-so, dispersing calamities and scattering misfortunes, bringing blessings and joy in life, ensuring peace and prosperity for their dwelling, and flourishing for their gates. May so-and-so attain transcendence and ascension, enter non-action, and unite in virtue with the Four Great Elements. May all in their household, young and old, and all people under heaven—every crawling, wriggling, creeping, and gasping being—be spared the Ten Sufferings and Eight Difficulties, the Five Poisons, water and fire, bandits, plagues, demonic harms, and all afflictions. May each preserve their blessings and destinies, dwelling in peace and non-action.

Today, we burn incense and return ourselves to the virtue of our masters, the *Great Sages and Perfected Ones*, that after attaining the Dao, we may ascend into formlessness and unite with the Dao as true.

**Next: Repentance Text to the Ten Directions**
East, South, West, North, Northeast, Southeast, Southwest, Northwest, Above, Below.

We, the male official *Libationer* so-and-so of such-and-such parish, humbly present this inked petition, declaring: For years past, our dwelling has been inauspicious, our endeavors thwarted, illnesses unrelenting, and fears of life and death pressing. Misfortunes and transgressions have accumulated, celestial administrations have met with adversity, and our prayers for deliverance have gone unanswered. Thus, we reverently follow the *Lingbao* Rite of *Lower Prime* for repentance amid the ashes, prostrating ourselves in the central altar, bowing our heads in supplication, and beseeching the great mercy of pardon and absolution. We implore forgiveness for ourselves, our ancestors of myriad generations, our parents, uncles, brothers, and all in our household—young and old—for all transgressions committed from past lives to this day: disrespect toward the *Great Sages and Venerable Deities*, the sun, moon, and stars, the four seasons and five phases, our masters and elders, the Five Peaks and Four Waterways, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, all *Perfected Ones*, *Divine Immortals*, *Jade Maidens*, deities of the Three Realms and Earth, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, and all divine beings. Our offenses are innumerable and vile, our sins boundless: deceiving our masters and betraying the Dao, defiling the celestial scriptures, greed corrupting our bodies, illicit teachings, failing to pledge to the Five Emperors, plotting rebellion, acting with disloyalty, lacking compassion and filial piety, devoid of love and benevolence, rebelling against rulers and fathers, slaughtering living beings, seizing others’ possessions, adultery, envy of those superior, contending for fame and rank, hypocrisy, slandering the worthy, consuming wine and meat, polluting the five spirits, cursing and reviling, wanton misconduct, violating the Eight Precepts and auspicious days with erratic joy and anger, oppressing orphans and widows, abandoning the elderly, trampling the poor, favoring the powerful—such sins are beyond count.

We beseech that through the burning of incense and repentance, all may be absolved and dispersed, granting us a fresh beginning. May the dark paths of our ancestors’ wandering souls be illuminated, all liberated and transformed into roots of faith, freed from the Five Paths. May the karmic bonds of the deceased be severed, granting them eternal bliss, while the living receive grace. May their karmic debts be dissolved, their punishments erased. We implore the erasure of our names from the Black Registers of the Right Palace and their inscription in the Azure Records of the Left Bureau. May the *qi* of the Dao overshadow us, divine beings protect us, misfortunes turn to blessings, peril to fortune, calamities averted, and harm expelled. May demonic bandits be vanquished, true *qi* descend and flow, warming and nourishing our bones and joints, harmonizing the five viscera, regulating the hundred meridians. May all suffering cease, all treatments take effect, our radiance enhanced, our spirits settled, our lives preserved, and the grace of the Dao eternally borne.

**Next: Repentance Text to the Four Directions**
West, North, East, South.

We, the male official *Libationer* so-and-so of such-and-such household, establish this fast and perform the Dao, praying for blessings and the dissolution of calamities, repenting for the sins of the living and the dead, that all may be harmonized and released. May the *qi* of the Dao overshadow us, the hidden and manifest be delivered, our households find peace, superiors and inferiors enjoy myriad blessings, our gates flourish, and fortune be our constant guest. May we dwell in perpetual auspiciousness, all good affinities converge, and we avoid the Three Evil Realms. May our wishes be fulfilled.

**Next:** Visualize, command the demons, and circumambulate thrice while reciting the scriptures as prescribed.

**Next:** By day, face west; by night, face north. Dishevel your hair and cover your head with mud. All officials resume their positions and declare their titles.

We, the *Celestial Master* of such-and-such parish, *Libationer* and *Supreme Lingbao* disciple of the *Three Caverns*, performing the *Lingbao* rites, now reverently address the *Most High, Non-Action Great Dao* of the central, upper, lower, and four cardinal directions, the *August and Venerable*, the *Supreme, Unsurpassed, Boundless, Infinite*, the *Universally Illuminating and All-Seeing*, the *Limitless, Radiantly Luminous, Most High and Perfected*, the *Innumerable, Profound Qi of the Dao*, the *Primordial, Vast, and Unbounded*, the *Chaotic and Formless*, the *Void and Spontaneous*, the *Most High, Rootless, and Profoundly Serene*, the *Mysteriously Penetrating*, the *Great Source of Wisdom*, the *Orthodox Unity and Alliance of Might*, the *Non-Action Great Dao*, the *Dao within the Dao*, the *Divine Sovereign of the Dao*—
the *Supreme, Beginningless, Myriad, Innumerable Host of Dao and Virtue Lords and Venerable Ones*;
the *Most High Lord of Dao and Virtue*, the *Venerable One of Dao and Virtue*;
the *Supreme Lord of the Primordial Yuan*, the *Venerable One of the Primordial Yuan*;
the *Supreme Lord of Myriad Blessings*, the *Venerable One of Myriad Blessings*;
the *Supreme Lord of Myriad Qi*, the *Venerable One of Myriad Qi*;
the *Lords and Venerable Ones of the Primordial Chaos*;
the *Most High Lord Lao*, the *Supreme Three Heavens of the Boundless Dao*, the *Supreme Venerable One*;
the *Most High Lord of the Three Qi*, the *Venerable One of the Three Qi*;
the *Most High Lord Lao*, the *Most High Venerable One*;
the *Supreme Lord of the Great Mystery*, the *Venerable One of the Great Mystery*;
the *Central Yellow Lord of Orthodox Unity*, the *Central Yellow Venerable One*;
the *Lord of the Great Yuan*, the *Venerable One of the Great Yuan*;
the *Lord of the Great Beginning*, the *Venerable One of the Great Beginning*;
the *Lord of the Great Primordial*, the *Venerable One of the Great Primordial*;
the *Lord of the Great Simplicity*, the *Venerable One of the Great Simplicity*;
the *Lord of the Great Void*, the *Venerable One of the Great Void*;
the *Lord of the Great Perfected*, the *Venerable One of the Great Perfected*;
the *Lord of the Great One*, the *Venerable One of the Great One*;
the *Lord of the Great Harmony*, the *Venerable One of the Great Harmony*;
the *Lord of the Great Peace*, the *Venerable One of the Great Peace*;
the *Lord of the Great Abyss*, the *Venerable One of the Great Abyss*;
the *Lord of the Celestial Emperor*, the *Venerable One of the Celestial Emperor*;
the *Lord of the Nine Elders of the Immortal Capital*, the *Venerable One of the Nine Heavens’ Immortal Capital*;
the *Lord of the Jade Calendar*, the *Venerable One of the Jade Calendar*;
the *Lord of the Nine Qi*, the *Venerable One of the Nine Qi*;
and the *Hundreds of Thousands of Myriad Billions of Innumerable Lords and Venerable Ones of the Myriad Layers of Dao Qi*;
the *Twelve Hundred Official Lords*, the *Twelve Hundred Official Venerable Ones*;
the *Most High Jade Sovereign beneath the Great Clarity*, the *Jade Perfected Venerable One*;
the *Five Immortal Lords*, the *Five Immortal Venerable Ones*;
the *Nine Numinous Lords*, the *Nine Numinous Venerable Ones*;
the *Twelve Perfected Lords of the Great Clarity*, the *Twelve Perfected Venerable Ones*;
the *Twenty-Four Divine Lords*, the *Twenty-Four Divine Venerable Ones*;
the *Thirty-Six Perfected Lords of the Great Clarity*, the *Thirty-Six Perfected Venerable Ones*;
the *Five Qi Lords*, the *Five Qi Venerable Ones*;
the *Lords of Yin-Yang Generative Qi*, the *Venerable Ones of Yin-Yang Generative Qi*;
the *Lords and Venerable Ones of the Five Qi Talismans*;
the *Compassionate Father and Holy Mother*, the *Supreme Lords of the Great One*, the *Supreme Venerable Ones of the Great One*;
the *August Celestial Supreme Emperor of the Boundless*, the *Most High Lord of the Primordial Yuan*, the *Venerable One of the Primordial Yuan*;
the *Lord of the Great One*, the *Venerable One of the Great One*;
the *Lord of the Divine Treasure*, the *Venerable One of the Divine Treasure*;
the *Lord of the True Treasure*, the *Venerable One of the True Treasure*;
the *Lord of the Celestial Treasure*, the *Venerable One of the Celestial Treasure*;
the *Lord of the Numinous Treasure*, the *Venerable One of the Numinous Treasure*;
the *Lord of the Primordial Spirit*, the *Venerable One of the Primordial Spirit*;
the *Lord of the Primordial Perfected*, the *Venerable One of the Primordial Perfected*;
the *Lord of the Primordial Numinous*, the *Venerable One of the Primordial Numinous*;
the *Most High August Emperor Kings of the Divine Qi*, the *Officials of Merit and Conduct*, the *Six Substances*, *Six Integrities*, *Six Loyalties*, *Six Sincerities*, *Six Uprightnesses*, *Six Duties*, and the *Twenty-Four Officials and Thirty-Six Spirits*;
the *Celestial August Lord Lao*, the *Celestial August Venerable One*;
the *Southern Culmen Lord Lao*, the *Southern Culmen Venerable One*;
the *Yellow Divine Lord Lao*, the *Yellow Divine Venerable One*;
the *Yellow Lord Lao*, the *Yellow Venerable One*;
the *Lord of the Great Harmony*, the *Venerable One of the Great Harmony*;
the *Most High August Perfected Lord of the True Dao*, and all Lords and Venerable Ones;
the *Celestial Masters*, *Female Masters*, *Heiresses*, *Female Heiresses*, *Lineage Masters*, *Female Lineage Masters*—the *Three Masters* and their attendants. All officials.

The Lords and Officers, the *Inspectors of the Five Qi*, the *Parents of the Myriad Dao*, the *Parents of the Myriad Qi*, the *Parents of the Myriad Virtues*, the *Parents of Heaven and Earth*, from whom gods and immortals emerge and where immortals and sages gather;
the *Eastern King Father*, the *Western Queen Mother*, the *Lord of the Sun*, the *Lady of the Moon*, and all the great gods among the celestial officials of the immortals—

We, your servants, by karmic affinity from past lives, have encountered the transformation of the Dao. Through the mistaken grace of our masters and perfected ones, we have been uplifted and guided, our decayed remains enlightened, and our understanding deepened by the scriptures and their teachings. The boundless kindness of this surpassing grace is beyond measure. On the day we received the precepts, we swore an oath before the *Three Officials* to exhaust our bodies and lives, offering our sinews and bones in service, to propagate the great transformation and answer in the unseen realms. We assist our masters and elders, delivering and aiding all beings.

With reverence, we now recite these words. According to the petition of [so-and-so], the sincerity of their plea and the urgency of their plight are truly pitiable. As we have presumptuously partaken in the great vehicle and hold the duty of salvation, we cannot bear what we have witnessed. Humbly joining together, we act on the command of the Celestial Master to relieve those mired in suffering. Binding our bones and prostrating ourselves, we press our hair into the mud and our foreheads to the earth, our five centers smeared with dust beneath the altar rails. Following the *Great Thanksgiving Fast of the Lower Prime* from the *Numinous Treasure* scriptures, we burn incense and perform the Dao day and night in the six periods. For [so-and-so], we first repent on behalf of their countless ancestors—fathers, mothers, uncles, brothers—across innumerable kalpas and myriad generations, down to their own person, household, and all within, for the transgressions of past lives and present existence. These are offenses that Heaven does not pardon, Earth does not absolve, humanity does not pity, and ghosts do not release: ten thousand sins and a million transgressions, violations of the *Three Primes’* one hundred eighty statutes, the crimes recorded by the *Three Officials*, *Nine Bureaus*, one hundred twenty courts, and the yin-yang, water-fire, left-right, and central palace examiners.

We beseech the release from tribulation, the passage through calamity, baring our hearts and exposing our livers, daring not to offer falsehood. May the Most High, the august perfected ones, and the exalted gods deign to look upon us with compassion, opening the vast mercy of their grace and returning the boundless kindness of their favor. Deliver and remove the transgressions of [so-and-so]’s ancestors across innumerable kalpas and myriad generations, down to their own person and all present beings—all the countless sins, evils, and offenses they have committed, the punishments and debts they bear. Pity, pardon, and absolve their grievances, reconcile their trials, and restore all that has been recorded. Sever the flow of accumulated misfortune, and may all be extinguished. Grant peace to their tombs, that no disasters arise. May the suffering souls of the long-departed and recently dead receive blessings and joy. May their karmic punishments be dispersed, their banishments erased. We beg that their names be stricken from the black registers of the right palace and inscribed in the green records of the left bureau. May the Dao’s qi cover them, and the divine spirits protect them. Turn misfortune into fortune, reverse calamity into good fortune. Ward off disasters, repel harm, deliver them from tribulation, and eliminate their shortened lifespans. Inscribe their names in the registers of long life. May their households and kin pass through hardships, recover from illness, and all be preserved in myriad blessings. Drive the pestilences, demonic plagues, poisons, and thousand disasters to the eight directions. May their gates and households flourish, drawing all goodness to them. May the living and dead alike enjoy peace and prosperity, and may we look up in gratitude to the grace of the Dao.

The ritual concludes. The Dharma Master offers incense and stands facing east. Next, the *Twelve Aspirations* are recited, and the incense is offered again.

The Incense Official Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all attending spirit officials of the incense—may golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushroom blossoms spontaneously arise upon this open-air altar. May the hundred spirits gather here before this fragrant flame. We pray that the Emperor be blessed with myriad fortunes, that the realm receive grace, and that the golden lads and jade maidens of the ten directions attend the incense smoke to transmit our words directly to the throne of the Supreme Non-Ultimate Dao, the Jade Emperor.

When the retreat concludes, the High Merit Dharma Master faces east and strikes the celestial drum twenty-four times, each declaring his name and rank.

The disciple of the Supreme Numinous Treasure, the peerless Cavern Mystery, the Dharma Master of the Numinous Treasure, your servant [Name], bows twice with reverence and respectfully addresses the Supreme Non-Ultimate Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Supreme Elder, the Peerless Mysterious Ancient, the Celestial Worthies of the Ten Directions, the Non-Ultimate Great Dao, the hosts of sagely Perfected Ones, the Heavenly Emperor, the Celestial Master, the Lord of the Numinous Treasure, and the Great Dharma Master overseeing this retreat. Though born of common ignorance, unworthy and base, we delight in the Dao and rejoice in immortality. Unjustly entrusted with the Dharma office, we ascend through the nine mysteries of the luminous realm, dedicating our meager efforts as if offering even our hair and down. We now humbly present our fellow Dharma practitioners, male and female officials [Names], who submit their words in sincerity, pledging their lives and making this petition.

We beseech your salvation and governance. Together, we have ascended at the hour of *yin* on this day of the present month to this [Prefecture, County, Village], where, by the decree and teaching of the Celestial Master, we establish this retreat of repentance and renewal. Exposed upon the central altar, we perform the Great Retreat of Repentance for the Lower Prime, burning incense, reciting scriptures, contemplating the spirits, and invoking the Perfected Ones. For three days and nights, in six periods each day, we perform the ritual circumambulation. The rites conclude at the hour of *chou* on this day of the present month.

We hereby invoke and beseech the Heavenly Immortals, Earthly Immortals, Flying Immortals, Perfected Ones, Divine Beings, the constellations of the sun, moon, and stars, the Nine Palaces and Five Emperors, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the Five Peaks and Four Waterways, the divine armies of immortals—nine hundred million cavalry in all. We summon the overseers of the retreat, the attendants of scriptures and incense, the golden lads and jade maidens, the Perfected Ones supervising the retreat, the officials of the Numinous Treasure, the messengers who transmit and memorialize, the flying dragon riders, and the Perfected Immortals of the four directions who inspect and verify. May the Perfected Officials return, the advanced immortals be promoted, ranks and imperial titles be conferred, and appointments to Perfected offices be made according to the rites of the Great Perfected.

May we who perform the Dao attain the Dao, and those who seek immortality attain immortality. May we transform and divide our forms, descending in the seventy-four directions during the Three Primes, all arriving in green chariots to soar through the Highest Clarity, ascending the nine heavens of the luminous realm, where sun and moon shine together and the Three Treasures turn as one. We humbly beseech the Perfected Ones to witness our sincere devotion.

Yet our study of the Dharma remains incomplete, and the standards of our retreat and rituals fall short of perfection. Our conduct may violate the codes, transgressing the statutes scrutinized by the Four Offices and enforced by the Five Emperors. For our thousand transgressions and myriad faults, we beg your compassionate pardon, that we may return to our original state, unaware of punishment or blame.

May the Perfected Officials within our five bodies ascend according to merit to the Mysterious Capital to receive their ranks. When their tasks are complete, may they return to our bodies and ascend with us, soaring through the great void.

We respectfully submit this petition and await your response. Your servants [Names], trembling with awe, bow their heads to the ground, prostrate themselves, and reverently make this known.

The Fifty-First Scroll of the *Supreme Secret Essentials* Concludes
**Scroll Fifty-One: The Rite of the Covenant with the Perfected**

Before the Most High Lord of the Great Dao, the ritual master advances to make obeisance and addresses the Heavenly Worthy, saying: Today, as we attend in your august presence, we have witnessed the divine youths of the various heavens receiving their majestic radiance, their luminous brilliance universally illuminating the celestial halls of blessings and the boundless worlds within the hells. The retribution of good and evil differs in suffering and joy. Those who are good rejoice in boundless ease; those who are evil wallow in filth, drifting through the Eight Difficulties, their bodily forms lost forever—how grievous and lamentable! For all such beings who endure the causes of evil, facing eons of unending opposition, unaware of the root of their fate, we know not whether there exists any merit to redeem and deliver the souls of the dead from the eternal night of the Nine Dark Realms, guiding them into the light, reborn through the gate of blessings. If we might receive your compassionate mercy, both the living and the dead would bear this grace: the departed would rejoice, and the living would flourish, prosperous and flourishing, their lifespans long and enduring. Then clouds would shade the eight distant realms, and winds would sprinkle the forests of orchids. In future lives, their sons and daughters would hear the sounds of the Dao, and we only pray that the Heavenly Worthy will distinguish and expound upon these matters, bestowing upon us the decisive words, that all may see and understand.

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the Most High Lord of the Dao, saying: Listen carefully. Reflect deeply upon my words and inscribe them within your heart. Morning and night, hold them in mind, and take care never to forget them. I shall now expound for you the wondrous sounds, which you may follow and employ to redeem the sinful souls, liberating them from the eternal night of the Nine Dark Realms and the Eight Difficulties, dissolving their karmic bonds, turning them toward the root of faith, so that both the living and the dead may rejoice, their karmic connections spanning lifetimes. This method is most sublime, transmitted but once in forty thousand kalpas. Should there be one of wisdom and discernment who vows to receive it, keep it secret, and blessings shall descend; should it be divulged, blessings shall cease. The warning of the Wind and Blade arises from the Covenant with the Perfected—those who violate its precepts and transgress its statutes shall have no cause to resent the heavens.

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy commanded the Flying Celestial Beings to expound upon the karmic consequences of sin and merit, delivering the highest-grade souls. As the scripture was recited, the sun, moon, and stars of the various heavens shone brightly, universally illuminating the Nine Earths, the boundless worlds, the abodes of eternal night, and the Nine Dark Realms. The long-suffering hungry ghosts, the toiling dead souls, received the light and universally beheld the root of their fate. Thereupon, they awakened, all turning their hearts at once, each resolving to cultivate goodness, recalling the gate of blessings. The Five Sufferings were dissolved, the Three Wretched Realms received deliverance, karmic bonds were untangled, and the hells grew tranquil and still. At that time, men and women universally heard the sounds of the Dao, and those who had prepared their hearts all attained transcendence.

The Flying Celestial Beings declared: The Jade Casket of the Nine Dark Realms delivers the dead souls, resolving the highest-grade karmic bonds. This should be performed during the six fasting months of the year—the first, third, fifth, seventh, ninth, and eleventh months—on the following days: the first, eighth, fourteenth, fifteenth, eighteenth, twenty-third, twenty-fourth, twenty-eighth, twenty-ninth, and thirtieth of each month (ten days in total), as well as the Eight Seasonal Festivals, the days of *jiazi* and *gengshen*. Within the central courtyard of the home, set up a tall lamp, nine feet in height, and upon this single lamp, kindle nine flames. Let their light shine upward to illuminate the celestial halls of blessings in the Nine Mysterious Heavens and downward to illuminate the boundless worlds within the eternal night of the Nine Earths. In accordance with the ancient rites of solemn dignity, invoke and invite the Heavenly Immortals, Earthly Immortals, Perfected Ones, Flying Immortals, the sun, moon, and stars, the Nine Palaces and Five Emperors, the soldiers and cavalry of the Five Sacred Peaks, the Three Rivers, the Four Seas—each numbering ninety-nine million nine hundred ninety-nine thousand nine hundred ninety-nine—and thirty-two persons to scatter flowers, thirty-two Jade Maidens, thirty-two Direct Attendants of the Five Emperors, and a full assembly of messengers, heralds, and Flying Dragon Riders to descend, overseeing the ritual hall. Knead the incense, make vows, and recite the prayers aloud, their words ascending to the heavens. When the ritual circumambulation is complete, all shall be reported and sent back to their celestial palaces.

By day, burn incense; by night, kindle the lamps, ensuring the smoke of the incense never ceases. Display the scriptures in the courtyard beneath the nine lamps. Circumambulate the lamps, offer incense, make vows, and when finished, face east and bow nine times, saying:

Today, I, [Name], submit my life to the Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the East, the Great Sage Host of the Perfected Who Have Attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords, the Nine *Qi* Heavenly Lords, and the various divine officials of the Eastern Realm. Today, I establish this retreat, burn incense, and kindle lamps, dedicating these merits to illuminate the various heavens. May they universally benefit the Emperor, the lords of states, their ministers and officials, the people who receive the Dao, the Dharma Masters, parents and honored kin, fellow disciples, recluses in the mountains and forests who study the true Dao, all worthy ones, and all living beings—those that creep, crawl, walk, or breathe—so that all may escape the Ten Sufferings and Eight Difficulties, dwell perpetually in non-action, and universally receive the natural blessings. May the imprisoned souls of my family’s myriad ancestors, bound in the darkness, receive the light, all be liberated, turn toward the root of faith, depart the Five Paths, resolve their karmic bonds, and may the dead enjoy eternal joy while the living receive grace. May the world know great peace, and may the Dao and its virtue flourish.

Today, I burn incense and submit myself to the virtue of the Great Sage Host of the Perfected, that after attaining the Dao, I may ascend into formlessness and unite with the Dao as a Perfected One.

When finished, remove the headscarf, kowtow, and strike the cheeks eighty-one times.

Next, face south and bow three times, saying:

Today, I, [Name], submit my life to the Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the South, the Great Sage Host of the Perfected Who Have Attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords, the Three *Qi* Heavenly Lords, and the various divine officials of the Southern Realm. The vows are made as in the method above.

When finished, remove the headscarf, kowtow, and strike the cheeks twenty-seven times each.

Next, face west and bow seven times, saying:

Today, I, [Name], submit my life to the Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the West, the Great Sage Host of the Perfected Who Have Attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords, the Seven *Qi* Heavenly Lords, and the various divine officials of the Western Realm. The vows are made as in the method above.

When finished, kowtow and strike the cheeks sixty-three times each.

Next, face north and bow five times, saying:

Today, I, [Name], submit my life to the Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the North, the Great Sage Host of the Perfected Who Have Attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords, the Five *Qi* Heavenly Lords, and the various divine officials of the Northern Realm. The vows are made as in the method above.

When finished, kowtow and strike the cheeks forty-five times each.

Next, face northeast and bow once, saying:

Today, I, [Name], submit my life to the Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Northeast, the Great Sage Host of the Perfected Who Have Attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords, the *Fan Qi* Heavenly Lord, and the various divine officials of the Northeastern Realm. The vows are made as in the eastern method above.

When finished, kowtow and strike the cheeks nine times each.

Next, face southeast. Then southwest. Then northwest. For all four corners, bow once each, kowtow, and strike the cheeks nine times each, submitting the life as in the northeastern method.

When the four corners are completed, next face the northwest upper direction and bow thirty-two times, saying:

Today, I, [Name], submit my life to the Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Thirty-Two Heavens Above, the Great Sage Host of the Perfected Who Have Attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords, the Heavenly Lords of the Thirty-Two Heavens, the Perfected of the Jade Capital, Mysterious Metropolis, and Purple Tenuity Upper Palace, the Jade Maidens, Divine Immortals, and various divine officials. The vows are made as in the eastern method above.

When finished, kowtow and strike the cheeks two hundred eighty-eight times each.

Next, face the southeast lower direction and bow twelve times, saying:

Today, I, [Name], submit my life to the Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Lower Realm, the Great Sage Host of the Perfected Who Have Attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords, the August Sovereigns of the Nine Lands, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, the Twelve Immortal Ministers, the Perfected of the Five Marchmounts, Four Seas, and Nine Palaces, the Divine Immortals and Jade Maidens, and the various divine officials of the Nine Realms of the Boundless World below. Now, I establish this fast, burn incense, and light lamps, wishing that by this merit, the light may illumine the long-night repository of the Boundless World below and the Nine Dark Realms. May it universally benefit the emperors and kings, lords of states, ministers and officials, common people, Dharma-receiving masters, parents and honored kin, fellow students and disciples, reclusive scholars of the Dao in mountains and forests, and all worthy ones, as well as the long-night dead souls of my own ancestors through countless generations. May the transgressions they committed in former lives—violations of heavenly prohibitions and earthly taboos, sins and evils entangled, karmic retributions endured, suffering through cycles of rebirth, bound in the Five Pains, trapped in the long night without escape—be repented and redeemed through this burning of incense and lighting of lamps. May the radiant light universally illumine the long-night repository and the Nine Dark Hells, liberating the imprisoned souls, dissolving their karmic roots, so that the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus no longer detain them. May they be delivered, ascend, and enter the Hall of Blessings, depart from evil paths, and forever dwell in the gates of goodness, the households of marquises and kings, where they may be reborn in joy and the world enjoy peace. Now, I burn this incense and submit myself to the virtue of the Great Sage Host of the Perfected, that after attaining the Dao, I may ascend into the formless and unite with the Dao in truth.

When finished, kowtow and strike the cheeks one hundred twenty times each.

From the *Highest Scripture of the Luminous Perfected on the Jade Casket of the Nine Dark Realms: Karmic Retribution, Liberation, and the Upper Grade*.

Volume Fifty-One of the *Supreme Secret Essentials* concludes.
Volume Fifty-Two of the *Supreme Secret Essentials*: The Three Primes Fast, Altar Diagrams

Construct the altar with red clay in three tiers. Atop it, place five blue-green tables, each bearing an incense burner.

The Heavenly Worthy declares: On the fifteenth day of the first, seventh, and tenth months, at the three hours of dawn, noon, and midnight, bathe the body. Wash oneself with the Five Fragrances.

When preparing to bathe, face the southwest and ladle the fragrant water with a golden dipper, circling to the southeast thirty-two times. Close the eyes and visualize the sunlight above the left eye, moonlight above the right, the Five Stars entwining the head, and clouds of five colors raining around the body. The Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Black Tortoise, Lion, and White Crane array to left and right. Immortal youths hold towels; Jade Maidens scatter blossoms. Flying immortals ride mounts as attendants guard the body. Then, click the teeth thirty-two times.

Recite the incantation:
The heavens are limpid, the qi pure,
Five hues resplendent on high.
Sun and moon radiate brilliance,
Bathing my form in light.
Divine fluids inwardly cleanse;
Fragrant waters refine my essence.
Luminous splendor shines through,
Illumining the Supreme Clarity.
Qi remains unstained by dust;
The Five Viscera receive the numinous.
Sins vanish from the Three Paths,
Calamities disperse from the Nine Darks.
Evil roots are severed;
Fortune and blessings arise of themselves.
Today, I make this great vow,
And pledge it before all.
My body receives liberation,
Ascending to the Imperial Court.

Conclude by swallowing saliva upward twenty-two times, then bathe the Five Spirits.

After bathing, don the cap and robes, and click the teeth twelve times.

Recite the incantation:
The Five Turbidities are now clear,
The Eight Effulgences now bright.
Today, I undergo refinement—
Sins perish, fortune is born.
Ever with the Five Thearchs,
I join the perfected and upper spirits.

Then exit and enter the chamber to perform the Dao according to the method. Within the chamber, face east, burn incense, and click the teeth thirty-two times.

Recite the incantation:

Supreme Three Heavens, Primordial Origin, First Three Qi, Most High Lord Lao,

Summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendants, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, the Incense-Bearing Courier Dragon Riders, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Thirty-Two Direct Attendants of the Five Thearchs. Let all who emerge be arrayed in solemn attire. Open the gates and notify the local earth deities and true officials of this realm: this servant now burns incense and performs the Dao, presenting petitions for his wishes. May the qi of the ten directions’ true and perfected ones enter this servant’s body, so that his supplications swiftly ascend and are heard before the Limitless Heavenly Worthy, the Most High Great Dao, the Perfect and True Jade Emperor.

This disciple of the Supreme Cavernous Mystery, Numinous Treasure, named [so-and-so], styled Master of the Sacred Peak, [so-and-so], by karmic affinity of past lives, was born into the transformation of the Dao. Through the guidance of the Three Caverns’ Dharma Master, [so-and-so], I was uplifted and delivered, my decayed bones refined. Having received the scriptural teachings, the grace bestowed is boundless beyond measure. Yet, raised in the mundane world, my Five Spirits contend in strife; dust-laden sins and defilements have long gone unnoticed, growing with my transgressions. Like mountains and seas, they have amassed from past lives to the present—through how many kalpas, I know not. Even now, my sins bind heaven and earth, recorded in what ledgers, seized by the Three Officials, detained for earthly servitude. Though I have cultivated and disciplined myself, my efforts have not pierced through; true numina do not descend, and demonic hordes assail me. My thoughts scatter, my Five Spirits take flight. I constantly fear that one day I will return to the dark abyss, sinking for ten thousand kalpas, forever beyond deliverance.

On this auspicious day of the Three Origins’ great celebration, with pure fasting and burning incense, I first repent for the transgressions of past lives and those accumulated to this day—offenses unforgiven by heaven, unabsolved by earth, unpitied by spirits, unreleased by ghosts. My countless sins and myriad faults have violated the Three Origins’ one hundred eighty precepts, the Three Officials’ nine bureaus and one hundred twenty courts, the yin-yang, water-fire, left-right, and central palace inquisitors’ judgments. Today, I burn incense, returning body, spirit, and life to the Limitless Heavenly Worthy, the Most High Dao Lord, the Thirty-Two Heavens’ Emperors, the Ten Directions’ Great Sage Assemblies of Perfected Ones, the Lords and Venerable Ones, the Flying Heavenly Divine Kings, the Heavenly Immortals, Flying Immortals, Divine Immortals, Earthly Immortals, the True Persons of the Five Peaks, Jade Maidens, the celestial sun, moon, and stellar lodges, the Jade Armillary Sphere, and the earth’s ten directions’ limitless spirit officials, the Three Realms’ Five Thearchs, Three Officials, Nine Bureaus, One Hundred Twenty Courts, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the Nine Rivers and Eight Poles’ host of divine spirits. I beseech all officials to grant great mercy, absolving the sins of my past and present lives. Through the merit of this incense offering, may my sinful roots be uprooted. I pray that my name be erased from the earthly registers, my offenses stricken from the Black Ledgers of the Right Palace, and my record transferred to the Green Ledgers of Longevity in the Left Palace of the Southern Palace. May I attain transcendence and deliverance, eternally enjoying boundless existence. After achieving the Dao, may I ascend into formlessness, merging with the perfected.

First, facing east, bow nine times, then kneel and declare:

This servant, [so-and-so], now returns life to the Eastern Limitless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Great Sage Assemblies of Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao, the Most High Primordial Origin of the Three Heavens’ Supreme Great Dao, the Limitless and Mysterious Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Venerable One, the August Supreme Lord Lao, the August Supreme Venerable One, the Azure Spirit Supreme Perfected, the Heavenly Emperors, the Heavenly Emperor Venerable Ones, the Supreme Emperors, the Supreme Emperor Venerable Ones, the Nine Elders of the Immortal Capital, the Lords of the Nine Qi, the myriad layers of Dao qi, the one thousand two hundred officials, the Eastern Pole Elder beneath the Great Clarity’s Jade Palace, the Azure Radiance Great Spirit, the Grand Minister Sima Azure Lad, the Golden Watchtower Posterior Sage Emperor, the True Yang Primordial Azure Divine Person, the Nine Immortal Lords of the Numinous Treasure, their Azure Harmony Jade Maidens, the Jade Lords of the Immortal Hosts, and all divine spirits of the Eastern Limitless Realm. I beseech you to bestow great compassion and merciful pardon, absolving this servant’s sins from past lives, karmic affinities, and present existence—offenses including:

Disrespect toward the Ten Directions’ Great Sage Perfected Ones, the Eastern Limitless Realm’s divine spirits, the sun, moon, stellar lodges, four seasons, five phases, wind, rain, thunder, lightning, clouds, mist, and seasonal nodes; disrespect toward masters, elders, the Five Peaks, Four Waterways, Three Rivers, Four Seas, Nine Rivers, Eight Poles, True Persons, Divine Immortals, Jade Maidens, the Eastern Realm’s spirit officials, the Three Realms’ earth deities, the Three Officials’ nine bureaus, and all divine spirits; deceiving masters and betraying the Dao; defiling sacred scriptures; stealing holy texts; altering divine sounds; disseminating orthodox teachings for personal gain; privately transmitting teachings without the Five Thearchs’ covenant; plotting rebellion; acting disloyally; lacking compassion and filial piety; lacking love and benevolence; rebelling against rulers and fathers; slaughtering living beings; seizing others’ property; committing adultery with others’ wives; harming kin; colluding with clans; envying those superior to oneself; contending for fame and rank; duplicity in speech and intent; slandering the worthy; consuming alcohol and meat, polluting the Five Spirits; cursing and invoking maledictions; acting without cause; violating the Eight Precepts’ auspicious days; capricious joy and anger; disdaining orphans and widows; abandoning the elderly; oppressing the poor; favoring the powerful; and all such sins, too numerous to recount. These offenses, accumulated over lifetimes, have bound me inextricably.

Today, by burning incense and returning life to the Eastern Realm, I beseech your great compassion to absolve this servant’s sins from past kalpas to the present, as enumerated above. Grant me a fresh beginning; from this day forth, I vow to reform, obeying precepts and prohibitions without transgression. I pray that my name be erased from the earthly registers, the Three Officials’ sin records, the Right Palace’s Black Ledgers, and the roots of karmic adversity, transferring my record to the Green Ledgers of the Left Palace. On this day of great celebration, I humbly present my myriad wishes, repenting and returning life to the Heavenly Worthy. I beseech the divine and immortal, merging with the perfected, flourishing my household, cultivating good affinities for future lives, and eternally enjoying the natural state without end.

Having completed this, he loosens his headscarf and kowtows, striking his breast ninety times each. After concluding his thanks to the Eastern Realm, he rises and moves leftward, bowing once toward the southeast. Kneeling upright, he declares:

"I, servant Jia, now surrender my life to the Southeast, to the Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, to the perfected hosts of attained great sages and most true divine spirits, to the Southern Supreme Lord Lao, to the Cinnabar Spirit Lord Lao, to the Southern Culmen Supreme Primordial Perfected of Long Life, to the Life-Measuring, Life-Commanding, and Life-Recording Lords of Salvation, to the Lord Han of Good Life, to those who resurrect the dead and revive the living, refine bones to restore spirit, and to the great sage divine kings, to the Lord of Myriad Blessings, to the Venerable of Myriad Spirits, to the Jade Maidens of Supreme Harmony, and to all divine spirits of the Southeast’s boundless realm—I beseech and give thanks as in the Eastern method."

Having finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast twelve times each. After concluding his thanks to the Southeast, he rises and moves leftward, bowing three times toward the south. Kneeling upright, he declares:

"I, servant Jia, now surrender my life to the Southern Realm’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, to the perfected hosts of attained great sages and most true divine spirits, to the Boundless Great Dao’s Southern Vermilion Emperor Cinnabar Spirit Lord Lao, to the Jade Maidens of Supreme Harmony, to the Life-Measuring Lord of Long Life, to the Lord of Good Life, to the Life-Commanding and Life-Recording Lords, to the Southern Culmen Lord of Salvation, to the Flying Heavenly Perfected, to the divine immortals who initiate and receive life, to the Jade Calendar’s life-registering divine immortals, to the Lord of Salvation, to the Lord of Myriad Blessings, Myriad Salvations, Myriad Lives, and Myriad Qi, and to all divine spirits of the Southern Realm’s boundless world—I give thanks as in the method above."

Having finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast thirty times each. After concluding his thanks to the Southern Realm, he rises and moves leftward, bowing once toward the southwest. Kneeling upright, he declares:

"I, servant Jia, now surrender my life to the Southwest’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, to the perfected hosts of attained great sages and most true divine spirits, to the Heavenly August Elder, to the Southern Culmen Primordial Perfected Lord, to the Cavern Yang Great Numinous Spirit, to the Life Qi Flying Perfected Divine King, to the divine immortals and jade maidens, and to all divine spirits of the Southwest’s boundless realm—I beseech and give thanks as in the method above."

Having finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast twelve times each. After concluding his thanks to the Southwest, he rises and moves leftward, bowing seven times toward the west. Kneeling upright, he declares:

"I, servant Jia, now surrender my life to the Western Realm’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, to the perfected hosts of attained great sages and most true divine spirits, to the Boundless Great Dao’s Western Hua Supreme Mystery Ultimate Emperor, to the Golden Hall Jade Immortal True Mother, to the Golden Watchtower’s Posterior Sage Supreme Ministerial Emperor, to the Primordial Heavenly Master and Lord of Myriad Sages, to the Four Culmen Perfected, to the divine immortals and jade maidens, and to all divine spirits of the Western Realm’s boundless world—I beseech and give thanks as in the method above."

Having finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast seventy times each. After concluding his thanks to the Western Realm, he moves leftward, bowing twice toward the northwest. Kneeling upright, he declares:

"I, servant Jia, now surrender my life to the Northwest’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, to the perfected hosts of attained great sages and most true divine spirits, to the Boundless Great Dao’s Emperor, to the True August Elder, to the Flying Heavenly Divine King, to the Ascended Perfected and Supreme Sages, to the Supervising Spirit Perfected, to the divine immortals and jade maidens, and to all divine spirits of the Northwest’s boundless realm—I beseech and give thanks as in the method above."

Having finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast twelve times each. After concluding his thanks to the Northwest, he moves leftward, bowing five times toward the north. Kneeling upright, he declares:

"I, servant Jia, now surrender my life to the Northern Realm’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, to the perfected hosts of attained great sages and most true divine spirits, to the Boundless Great Dao’s Supreme Lord Lao, to the Supreme Venerable, to the Lofty Jade Dawn, to the Northern Culmen Perfected Duke, to the Lord of Myriad Sages, to the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, to the Supreme Yin Life-Commanding Lord, to the Death-Recording and Salvation-Measuring Controller, to the General Overseer of Slaughter, to the Divine August Supreme Perfected, to the divine immortals and jade maidens, and to all divine spirits of the Northern Realm’s boundless world—I beseech and give thanks as in the method above."

Having finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast fifty times each. After concluding his thanks to the Northern Realm, he moves leftward, bowing once toward the northeast. Kneeling upright, he declares:

"I, servant Jia, now surrender my life to the Northeast’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, to the perfected hosts of attained great sages and most true divine spirits, to the Boundless Great Dao’s Flying Heavenly Divine King, to the Divine Empyrean Demon King, to the Commanding Spirit Supervising Perfected and Marshal of Divine Persons, to the Myriad-Life Divine August, to the Supreme Mysterious Lord Lao, to the perfected and jade maidens, and to all divine spirits of the Northeast’s boundless realm—I beseech and give thanks as in the method above."

Having finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast twelve times each. After concluding his thanks to the Northeast, he moves leftward, bowing once toward the northwest upper realm. Kneeling upright, he declares:

"I, servant Jia, now surrender my life to the Upper Realm’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, to the perfected hosts of attained great sages and most true divine spirits, to the Supreme Clarity’s Mysterious Non-Being and Three Heavens’ Boundless Great Dao’s Supreme Mysterious Elder, to the Supreme Lord Lao, to the Supreme Venerable, to the August Supreme Lord Lao, to the August Supreme Venerable, to the Azure Spirit Supreme Perfected, to the Emperors of the Myriad Heavens, to the Venerables of the Myriad Heavens, to the Lords of the Nine Elder Immortal Capitals, to the Venerables of the Nine Qi, to the innumerable Lords of Myriad Layers of Dao Qi, to the Venerables of Dao Qi, to the Lords of the Twelve Hundred Offices, to the Venerables of the Twelve Hundred Offices, to the Supreme Clarity’s Jade Palace’s Supreme Jade Perfected Lord, to the Jade Perfected Venerable, to the Lords of the Five Immortals, to the Venerables of the Five Immortals, to the Lords of the Nine Spirits, to the Venerables of the Nine Spirits, to the Supreme Clarity’s Twelve Perfected Lords, to the Twelve Perfected Venerables, to the Twenty-Four Divine Persons, to the Twenty-Four Divine Venerables, to the Supreme Clarity’s Thirty-Six Perfected Lords, to the Thirty-Six Perfected Venerables, to the Lords of the Five Qi, to the Venerables of the Five Qi, to the Lord of Yin Intestine’s Life Qi, to the Venerable of Life Qi, to the Supreme Supreme Grand Unity Lord, to the Grand Unity Venerable, to the August Heavenly Supreme Emperor, to the Primordial Culmen Supreme Non-Lord, to the Supreme Non-Lord Venerable, to the Grand Unity Lord, to the Grand Unity Venerable, to the Divine Treasure Lord, to the Divine Treasure Venerable, to the True Treasure Lord, to the True Treasure Venerable, to the Heavenly Treasure Lord, to the Heavenly Treasure Venerable, to the Numinous Treasure Lord, to the Numinous Treasure Venerable, to the Primordial Spirit Lord, to the Primordial Spirit Venerable, to the Primordial Perfected Lord, to the Primordial Perfected Venerable, to the Primordial Numinous Lord, to the Primordial Numinous Venerable, to the Heavenly August Lord Lao, to the Heavenly August Venerable, to the Southern Culmen Lord, to the Southern Culmen Venerable, to the Yellow Spirit Lord Lao, to the Yellow Spirit Venerable, to the Yellow Elder Lord, to the Yellow Elder Venerable, to the Supreme Harmony Lord, to the Supreme Harmony Venerable, to the Supreme August Perfected Lord of the Dao, to the Lords and Venerables, to the Ancient Heavenly Master Lord, to the Heavenly Master Venerable, to the Three Masters Lord, to the Three Masters Venerable, to the Myriad Dao’s Father and Mother, to the Myriad Virtues’ Father and Mother, to the Heaven and Earth’s Father and Mother, to the divine immortals’ origin and divine immortals’ assembly, to the Eastern King Father, to the Western Queen Mother, to the Sun Lord, to the Moon Lady, to the Five Star Lords, to the Five Star August Consorts, to the Nine Star Perfected Lords of the Jade Armillary Sphere, to the hosts of divine immortals and perfected, to the sagely fathers and sagely mothers, to the divine immortals and jade maidens, and to all divine spirits of the Upper Realm’s boundless world of Miro— I beseech and give thanks as in the method above."

When finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast three hundred and twenty times each. Having given thanks to the Upper Realm, he then proceeds to the left and bows once toward the southeast, the Lower Realm, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Lower Realm’s infinite expanse, to the Perfected Divine Hosts of the Attained Dao, to the August Sovereigns of the Nine Lands, to the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, to the Twelve Immortal Officers, to the Perfected of the Nine Palaces, to the divine immortals and jade maidens, and to all divine spirits of the Lower Realm’s boundless world—I beseech and give thanks as in the method above." When finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast one hundred and twenty times each.

Having given thanks to the Lower Realm, he then proceeds to the left and bows three times toward the northeast, the Palace of the Sun, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Sun Lord and Lady, to the Radiant Youth of the Yellow Flower within the Sun, to the Jade Maidens of Scattered Splendor, and to all divine immortals within the Sun—I beseech that the transgressions and debts accrued in this servant’s past lives, which have offended the celestial radiance and brought karmic retribution in life and death, be pardoned and absolved, that this servant’s body may attain luminosity, share the same light as the Sun, and enjoy boundless longevity, receiving blessings as a natural endowment." When finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast thirty times each.

Having given thanks to the Sun Palace, he then rises and proceeds to the left, bowing seven times toward the southwest, the Palace of the Moon, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Moon Lord and Lady, to the Water Mother of Stone Radiance, to the Jade Maiden of Rounded Light, to the Youths of Scattered Splendor, and to all divine immortals within the Moon—I beseech that the transgressions and debts accrued in this servant’s past lives be absolved, that this servant may share the same light as the Moon, and enjoy boundless longevity, receiving blessings as a natural endowment." When finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast seventy times each.

Having given thanks to the Moon Palace, he then proceeds to the left and bows nine times toward the north, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the constellations of the various heavens, to the Seven Stars of the Jade Armillary Sphere, to the Nine August Ones of the Northern Dipper, to the Ladies of the Three Terraces and Five Stars, to the Twenty-Eight Constellations, to the Three Hundred Sixty-Five Degrees of the Circumpolar Heaven, to the Great Divine Star of the Center, to the August Consort and Divine Concubine of the Central Perfected Sovereign, and to the divine immortals and jade maidens—I beseech that the transgressions and debts accrued in this servant’s past lives, which have offended the celestial radiance and brought karmic retribution in life and death, be pardoned and absolved, that this servant’s body may attain luminosity, share the same light as the constellations, and enjoy boundless longevity, receiving blessings as a natural endowment." When finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast three hundred and sixty-five times each.

Having given thanks to the Star Palace, he then proceeds to the left and bows twice toward the Eastern Marchmount, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Great Divine Lord of the Azure Emperor of Mount Tai in the Eastern Marchmount, to the Flying Immortals and Perfected, to the divine officials and spirits of the various sacred peaks, and to all divine spirits of the great mountains and marshes—I beseech that the transgressions and debts accrued since this servant’s birth, which have offended the great divine lords of the Eastern Marchmount and the sacred peaks, be pardoned and absolved, that this servant’s name be inscribed in the registers of immortals, and that he may naturally befriend the great divine lords." When finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast twenty times each.

He then bows twice toward the south, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Great Divine Lord of the Vermilion Emperor of Mount Heng in the Southern Marchmount, to the Flying Immortals and Perfected, to the divine officials and spirits of the various sacred peaks, and to all divine spirits of the great mountains and marshes—I beseech as in the method for the Eastern Marchmount."

He then bows twice toward the southwest, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Great Divine Lord of the Yellow Emperor of Mount Song in the Central Marchmount, to the Flying Immortals and Perfected, to the divine officials and spirits of the various sacred peaks, and to all divine spirits of the great mountains and marshes—I beseech as in the method for the Eastern Marchmount."

He then bows twice toward the west, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Great Divine Lord of the White Emperor of Mount Hua in the Western Marchmount, to the Flying Immortals and Perfected, to the divine officials and spirits of the various sacred peaks, and to all divine spirits of the great mountains and marshes—I beseech as in the method for the Eastern Marchmount."

He then bows twice toward the north, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Great Divine Lord of the Dark Emperor of Mount Heng in the Northern Marchmount, to the Flying Immortals and Perfected, to the divine officials and spirits of the various sacred peaks, and to all divine spirits of the great mountains and marshes—I beseech as in the method for the Eastern Marchmount."

Having given thanks to the Five Marchmounts in the manner of the Eastern Marchmount—changing only the names of the respective marchmounts—he kowtows and strikes his breast twenty times each.

Having given thanks to the Five Marchmounts, he then proceeds to the left and bows twelve times toward the north, giving thanks to the Water Officials, saying: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Divine King of Bright Valley in Fusang, to the Great Divine Lords of the Pristine Cold of the Cavern Sources and Cavern Abysses, to the Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang, to the River Lords of the Twelve River Sources, to the River Earls, to the Two Thousand Stone Officials of the Rivers, to the Lady of the Clear River, and to all divine officials of the Water Palaces—I beseech that the countless transgressions and debts accrued from this servant’s past lives to the present day, which have offended the Water Officials, be pardoned and absolved. Today, as I burn incense and offer this first repentance, I surrender my fate to the great divine lords of the Water Palaces, beseeching life and deliverance from all karmic roots of transgression, that my name be inscribed in the registers of immortals and my life prolonged without end, merging with the Dao in perfection." He kowtows and strikes his breast two hundred and eighty times each.

Having given thanks to the Water Palaces, he then bows three times toward the north, giving thanks to the Three Treasures of the Divine Scriptures, kneeling to say: "Your servant so-and-so now surrenders his fate to the Supreme Boundless Dao of the Utmost Perfected, to the Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures, to the Three Treasures of the Numinous Texts, to the talismanic registers and divine charts of the immortals, to the natural celestial writings, to the golden and jade characters, to the jade lads and jade maidens who attend the scriptures, and to the majestic deities of the Three Divisions—I beseech and give thanks as in the method above for the Eastern Marchmount." When finished, he kowtows and strikes his breast three hundred and sixty times each.

Having given thanks, he proceeds to the left and, facing east, offers incense three times, praying: "To the Incense Officials and Envoys, to the Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, to those who bear the incense, to the courier dragon riders—may you now cause this pure chamber and fasting hall to naturally produce golden liquid, cinnabar essence, and mushroom efflorescence, and may the hundred spirits gather here before this incense fire. May I attain the Dao and achieve divine transcendence, may my household receive ten thousand blessings, may the world be graced with favor, and may the jade lads and jade maidens of the ten directions, who attend and guard the incense smoke, transmit this servant’s entreaty directly to the presence of the Supreme Dao of the Boundless."

The Heavenly Worthy spoke: The supreme method of repentance and absolution through the Three Primes’ precepts is concealed within the Three Prime Palaces. By concentrating one’s spirit and refining the roots of transgression, those who study the Dao and seek transcendence should practice this thrice yearly. In performing this, one must ensure that the cinnabar of the heart and the intent of the mind are fully devoted, that spirit and form endure hardship together, and that no weariness arises. Thus shall one move the myriad heavens, the Three Primes erase sins from the Black Register, the Northern Emperor remove death and restore life, the Three Officials endorse one’s merits, and the Supreme Mystery record them among the Perfected Transcendents.

*The Secret Essentials of the Most High, Scroll Fifty-Two concludes.*
