*The Rites of the Golden Register Retreat, from Scroll Fifty-Three of the* Supreme Mystery’s Secret Essentials.

The Most High Dao Lord bows his head and respectfully addresses the Heavenly Venerable One, saying: "Now having heard the Flying Celestial Divine Persons expound on the karmic retribution of sins and blessings, and the deliverance of the highest grade, I present my supplications, rites of gratitude, and petitions for absolution of past-life roots. May the men and women of future generations receive this grace, universally attain enlightenment, and enter into radiant illumination. Though this be so, there remain other methods. I do not know whether, when heaven sends down severe calamities, the nation’s mandate is unsettled, the stellar lodges deviate from their courses, the four qi lose their regularity, armies and bandits bring distress, the emperor finds no peace, pestilential toxins spread, and heavenly and human beings suffer death and injury—what methods should be employed to avert these disasters, deliver beings from peril, and resolve all inauspicious omens? I humbly beseech your divine instruction, that we may practice accordingly, harmonize heaven and stabilize the earth, and render service to the state. If we receive your teachings and commands, then grace will spread throughout the ten directions, the nation’s mandate will be securely established, the emperor will flourish, heavenly and human beings will rejoice in peace, and blessings will be boundless. In future generations, all will universally hear the sound of the Dharma."

Thereupon, the Heavenly Venerable One addressed the Flying Celestial Divine Persons, saying: "As for the karmic retribution of sins and blessings and the deliverance of the highest grade that you have expounded—whatever has not yet been fully set forth for the salvation of the nation and the relief of disasters, illnesses, and perils—you may now explain it all in detail to the Most High Dao Lord, so that those who have not seen may see, those who have not heard may hear, and all beings may be universally saved, enabling the multitude to attain clarity."

At this, the instructions were given, and the essential teachings were reverently received.

The Flying Celestial Divine Persons said: "In the *Luminous Statutes of the Jade Treasury of the Nine Dark Realms of the Long Night’s Repository*, when the lord of the nation and the land face disasters, illnesses, military threats, and perilous calamities, one should inscribe in cinnabar the five sections of the *Numinous Treasure True Writ* in the central courtyard. Five altars are arranged in the five directions, with one section of the True Writ placed upon each. Five *liang* of gold are used, one *liang* fashioned into one dragon, so that five *liang* form five dragons, to be placed above the five sections of the True Writ. Additionally, five-colored patterned silks are offered as tokens to pacify the Five Emperors. For those afflicted by calamity, according to their age, purple-patterned silk is presented to deliver their lives, stabilize the nation, secure the mandate, and avert heavenly disasters, while the bright stars and stellar lodges are set right.

In spring, nine lamps are lit, or ninety lamps, or nine hundred lamps. In summer, three lamps are lit, or thirty lamps, or three hundred lamps. In autumn, seven lamps are lit, or seventy lamps, or seven hundred lamps. In winter, five lamps are lit, or fifty lamps, or five hundred lamps. During the months of the four seasons, twelve lamps are lit, or one hundred twenty lamps, or one thousand two hundred lamps. Furthermore, a long lamp, nine feet in height, is installed above. Nine lamp flames are arranged in the center to illuminate the *Long Night’s Repository* of the Nine Dark Realms. The enlightened Great Dharma Master, standing in the center, loosens his hair and scatters ashes, following the instructions and performing the six-hour rites of supplication and gratitude. If devout men and women assist the state with prayers, they should loosen their hair, scatter ashes, and present their supplications outside the gate. In spring, this is done for nine days and nine nights; in summer, for three days and three nights..."

In autumn, this is done for seven days and seven nights; in winter, for five days and five nights; during the months of the four seasons, for twelve days and twelve nights. Arraying radiant light to illuminate the boundless worlds of the myriad heavens within the Long Night, the Nine Dark Realms are thus opened and illuminated, their light extending without end. The Three Luminaries shine brightly, heaven and earth are at peace, the stellar lodges return to their positions, the four seasons harmonize, all calamities dissolve, warfare and pestilence cease, heaven and humanity rejoice in prosperity, and the imperial destiny flourishes.

When the day’s ritual circuit is complete, the true writs are burned, and their ashes scattered upon the blue smoke. The flying celestial beings declare: The Dharma Master enters through the Earth Gate, circumambulates the incense and lamps three times, then stands facing east and strikes his teeth thirty-two times. This done, he recites the incense-lighting invocation, and the cantor intones the names and titles of all present.

The Great Dharma Master of the Three Caverns, the Lesser Manifestation Perfected Person, your subject So-and-so, respectfully addresses: the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Vacuity and Spontaneity, the Boundless Great Dao, the Most High Lord of the Dao, the August Jade Emperor, the Great Sage Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords and Elders, the Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors, the Jade Purity Lord of Heaven, the Great Jade Emperor, the Eastern Flower, the Southern Culmen, the Western Numinous, the Northern Perfected, the Jade Capital of the Dark Metropolis, the Seven Treasures of the Golden Watchtower, the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mystic Terrace, and the August Sovereign of the Numinous Treasure—Perfected and Radiant Lord of the Dao.

By the karmic conditions of my former lives, I was born into the Dharma Gate. Through the mysterious and true initiation, I entered the root of faith. My former masters transmitted to me the sacred scriptures of the Three Treasures, enabling me to deliver ninety-nine thousand nine hundred persons and ascend to the rank of Highest Perfection. From my ancestors through to my present existence, I have encountered the scriptural teachings and dwelt constantly within blessings. Yet my merits are slight, and I have not attained immortality. With my body and life, I dedicate myself to the service of the state. Now the land has lost its harmony, warfare and disease arise together, yin and yang are obstructed and clash, the stellar lodges move erratically, grave disasters and dire calamities press heavily—all as described in the petition.

Truly, the Emperor has received the celestial mandate to oversee the myriad people, yet he has not extended his beneficence to moisten the ten directions, causing heaven and humanity to lack abundance and the state to fail in great peace. Without songs of praise for his grace, the roads resound with lamentation, leading the Three Luminaries to darken and err, and celestial disasters to spread. The Emperor, anxious for the people’s unrest, now reverently follows the Great Dharma: he reveals the true writs, burns incense, and kindles lamps to illuminate the myriad heavens. With sincere vows, he performs the ritual circuit to express gratitude and dispel misfortune.

He respectfully summons:
- The celestial immortals’ troops and cavalry, ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The terrestrial immortals’ troops and cavalry, ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The Perfected Ones’ troops and cavalry, ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The flying immortals’ troops and cavalry, ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The divine immortals’ troops and cavalry, ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The sun and moon’s troops and cavalry, nine kinds, ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The stellar lodges’ troops and cavalry, ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The Nine Palaces’ troops and cavalry, ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The Five Emperors’ troops and cavalry, each ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The Five Marchmounts’ troops and cavalry, each ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The Three Rivers and Four Seas’ troops and cavalry, each ninety-nine billion nine hundred ninety-nine million strong;
- The thirty-two heavenly overseers of the fast, thirty-two in number;
- The thirty-two golden lads attending incense;
- The thirty-two jade maidens scattering flowers;
- The thirty-two direct talismans of the Five Emperors, each thirty-two in number;
- The flying dragon couriers and messengers, and all others—descend together to oversee the ritual hall, receive the incense vows, and transmit the spoken prayers upward. When the ritual circuit is complete, those who have rendered meritorious service may report to the immortal officials.

Then, facing east, he offers incense three times and prays:
The Great Dharma Master of the Three Caverns, the Lesser Manifestation Perfected Person, your subject So-and-so, now establishes this upright incense offering. May these merits extend to the Emperor, the lords of the state, the ministers, officials, and people, and to the seven generations of parents throughout the world, that they may depart from sorrow and suffering and ascend to the celestial halls. Now, offering this incense, I dedicate my body, spirit, and life to the Three Venerable Ones of the Most High. May these merits flow to the seven generations of parents throughout the world, that they may be delivered from the ten sufferings and eight difficulties, ascend to the celestial halls, be clothed and fed by spontaneity, and dwell forever in non-action.

Now, offering this incense, I dedicate myself to the virtue of the Great Sage Perfected Ones, the Masters and Venerables. After attaining the Dao, may I ascend into formlessness and unite with the true Dao.

Next, he takes incense three more times and prays:
Your subject now offers this incense. May these merits extend to the Emperor, the lords of the state, the ministers, officials, and people, the Dharma Masters who have received the teachings, parents and honored kin, fellow disciples, and all worthy Daoists dwelling in mountains and forests to study the true Way. May each attain the Dao. I dedicate my body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao.

Your subject prostrates body and head to the ground and dedicates his life to the Three Venerable Ones of the Most High. May these merits flow to the Emperor, the lords of the state, the ministers, officials, and people, the Dharma Masters who have received the teachings, parents and kin, fellow disciples, and all worthy Daoists dwelling in mountains and forests to study the true Way. May each attain the Dao, dwell in non-action, and long enjoy blessings and prosperity.

Now, offering this incense, I dedicate myself to the virtue of the Great Sage Perfected Ones, the Masters and Venerables. After attaining the Dao, may I ascend into formlessness and unite with the true Dao.

Next, he takes incense three more times and prays:
Your subject now establishes this upright incense offering. May these merits swiftly grant me the immortal Dao, and extend to my ninefold kin, fellow Dharma students within the state, all people under heaven, and all living beings—winged, creeping, slithering, or breathing—whether already born or yet to be born. May all be perfected. I dedicate my body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao.

Your subject prostrates body and head to the ground and dedicates his life to the Three Venerable Ones of the Most High. May these merits flow to my person, that I may attain immortal deliverance and ultimately enter non-action, uniting with the virtue of the Four Great Elements. May all people under heaven and all living beings be delivered from the ten sufferings and eight difficulties, the five poisons, water and fire, disease and pestilence, demonic harm, and dire calamities. May the land be at peace and the world flourish.

Now, offering this incense, I dedicate myself to the virtue of the Great Sage Perfected Ones, the Masters and Venerables. After attaining the Dao, may I ascend into formlessness and unite with the true Dao.

After completing the three incense offerings and vows, he faces east and bows nine times, saying:

When heaven and earth are obstructed and in turmoil, when yin and yang clash and punish one another, when the four seasons lose their harmony, when inauspicious disasters spread and arise, when the celestial bodies entangle in disorder to foretell misfortune—then the land knows no peace, war and disease rage together, the sovereign is filled with dread, and the myriad people find no rest. Reverently following the Great Law, I now reveal the true scripture, dedicating myself to the Limitless Heavenly Worthy of the East, the Great Sage Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords and Elders, the Nine Qi Heavenly Lords, and the spirit officials of the eastern quarter. Today, I establish this fast, baring my heart and revealing my form, prostrating myself in repentance. For the sake of the realm, I offer expiation for calamities, burning incense and kindling lamps to illuminate the heavens above and cast light into the boundless, eternal night of the Nine Dark Realms below, opening all paths to radiance.

May these merits extend to the emperor and lords of the land, to ministers, officials, and the common people, dispelling disasters and averting misfortune. May the Three Luminaries return to their proper places, the Five Phases flow in harmony, wars cease, diseases heal, the fortunes of the state flourish, and the myriad people rejoice in peace. May humans and spirits alike dwell in tranquility.

Now, I bare my heart and dedicate myself to the virtue of the Great Sage Perfected Ones, the Masters and Venerables. After attaining the Dao, may I ascend into formlessness and unite with the true Dao.

This done, he removes his headscarf, prostrates himself, and strikes his breast eighty-one times. Then, facing south, he bows three times, making vows as above. He now dedicates himself to the Limitless Heavenly Worthy of the South, the Great Sage Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords and Elders, the Three Qi Heavenly Lords, and the spirit officials of the southern quarter. After the vows, he prostrates himself and strikes his breast twenty-seven times. Next, facing west, he bows seven times, making vows as above. He now dedicates himself to the Limitless Heavenly Worthy of the West, the Great Sage Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords and Elders, the Seven Qi Heavenly Lords, and the spirit officials of the western quarter. After the vows, he prostrates himself and strikes his breast sixty-three times. Then, facing north, he bows five times, making vows as above. He now dedicates himself to the Limitless Heavenly Worthy of the North, the Great Sage Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords and Elders, the Five Qi Heavenly Lords, and the spirit officials of the northern quarter. After the vows, he prostrates himself and strikes his breast forty-five times. Next, facing northeast, he bows once, making vows as above. He now dedicates himself to the Limitless Heavenly Worthy of the Northeast, the Great Sage Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords and Elders, the Heavenly Lords of Pure Qi, and the spirit officials of the northeastern quarter. After the vows, he prostrates himself and strikes his breast nine times. Then, facing southeast, and then southwest...

Facing northwest, he bows once at each of the four corners, striking his breast and cheeks nine times each, making vows in the manner of the northeast. Next, facing the northwest upper quarter, he bows thirty-two times, making vows as above. He now dedicates himself to the Limitless Heavenly Worthies of the Thirty-Two Heavens above, the Great Sage Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords and Elders, the Lords Imperial of the Thirty-Two Heavens, the Perfected Ones of the Jade Capital, Mystic Metropolis, and Purple Tenuity Upper Palace, and the jade maidens, divine immortals, and spirit officials. After the vows, he prostrates himself and strikes his breast two hundred eighty times.

Next, facing the southeast lower quarter, he bows twelve times, making vows as above. He now dedicates himself to the Limitless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy below, the Great Sage Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao, the Venerable Lords and Elders, the Four Directors and Five Emperors of the Nine Lands, the Twelve Immortal Officials, the Perfected Ones of the Five Peaks, Four Waterways, and Nine Palaces, the divine immortals and jade maidens, and the spirit officials of the Nine Earths of the Limitless World. After the vows, he prostrates himself and strikes his breast one hundred twenty times.

When the vows and invocations to the ten directions are complete, he circumambulates three times, circling the incense and lamps, reciting the *Dongzhang* of the *Bu Xu* as he paces. When finished, he returns to face east and resumes the incense offering with a prayer.

The Flying Heavenly Divine Persons say: The number of days for performing the Dao may be adjusted as appropriate. Though human affairs follow the four seasons, the number of days accords with the five phases. Even three days and three nights of earnest supplication, with a sincere heart, may move the various heavens. Scholars may measure their capacity and act accordingly.

—From the *Scripture of Luminous Perfection and Clarity* as recorded in *The Supreme Secret Essentials*, Scroll Fifty-Three, concluded.

**Scroll Fifty-Four of *The Supreme Secret Essentials*: The Yellow Register Retreat Section**

**Establishing the Altar Platform – The Yellow Register Petition and the Numinous Immortals Section states:**

For the ritual of delivering souls from the roots of sin, an altar shall be opened in the central courtyard. The four cardinal directions, four corners, and the upper and lower realms together form ten gates. The central area shall be measured two *zhang* and four *chi* in length and breadth. On all four sides, banners shall be erected to mark the positions of the gates, with the upper and lower realms properly arranged.

Once the ten gates are complete, beyond them shall be opened the Heavenly Gate, Earthly Portal, Sun Gate, and Moon Gate at the four corners, together forming four gates. These shall measure three *zhang* and two *chi* in length and breadth, named the Four Boundary Grand Gates. The Eight Trigrams shall be installed as markers, with the upper and lower realms properly arranged.

One Dharma Master shall perform the pacing of the Dao within the central area.

**Erecting the Banners:**
The ten gates shall each be marked with a banner, three *cun* and two *fen* in width and two *cun* and four *fen* in length, each corresponding to the color of its direction.

- **Eastern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of Azure Florescence and Primordial Yang"* in vermilion on a blue-green banner.
- **Southern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of Cavernous Yang and Supreme Radiance"* in yellow on a red banner.
- **Western Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of Pervading Yin and Golden Palace"* in black on a white banner.
- **Northern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of Yin’s Generation and Vast Numinosity"* in blue-green on a black banner.
- **Northeastern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of Pervading the Numinous and Forbidden Heights."*
- **Southeastern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of Primordial Birth and Originating Essence."*
- **Southwestern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of Primordial Yellow and Lofty Dawn."*
- **Northwestern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of the Nine Immortals’ Brahman Conduct."* The four corners shall all be inscribed in white on yellow banners.
- **Upper Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of the Great Brahmā and Soaring Brahman"* in blue-green on a white banner, placed at the northwest corner.
- **Lower Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Gate of the Nine Numinous August Perfected"* in yellow on a blue-green banner, placed at the southeast corner.

The banners for the ten gates shall be nine *chi* in length, arranged in accordance with the celestial pattern.

Once the ten gate banners are complete, the Eight Trigrams banners for the Grand Gates shall be installed, their dimensions matching those of the ten-direction banners.

- **Eastern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Qi of the Cavernous Azure of the Zhen Palace"* in blue-green on a yellow banner.
- **Southern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Qi of the Cavernous Yang of the Li Palace"* in vermilion on a white banner.
- **Western Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Qi of Lesser Yin of the Dui Palace"* in white on a blue-green banner.
- **Northern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Qi of the Cavernous Yin of the Kan Palace"* in black on a vermilion banner.
- **Southeastern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Qi of Brahman Conduct of the Xun Palace."*
- **Southwestern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Qi of Brahman Yang of the Kun Palace."*
- **Northwestern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Qi of Brahman Pervasion of the Qian Palace."*
- **Northeastern Gate Banner:** Inscribed *"Qi of Primordial Brahman of the Gen Palace."* The four corners shall all be inscribed in yellow on black banners, each nine *chi* in length, arranged as above.

**Lamps:**
After the lamps are installed at the gate banners, nine lamps shall be placed in each of the ten directions, totaling ninety lamps, positioned outside the Grand Gates. For the Grand Year, the annual cyclical signs, the greater and lesser tombs, and the gate corresponding to the patron’s life destiny, lamps shall be arranged according to the patron’s means, ensuring their light shines brightly throughout the night without interruption.

**Incense:**
One incense burner shall be placed at each gate, totaling ten incense burners. Attendants shall tend the incense, ensuring its smoke rises uninterrupted to summon the divine *qi*.

**Dragon Talismans:**
Ten golden dragons shall be crafted to suppress the ten directions, delivering the sinful souls. One shall be placed in each direction.

**Life-Destiny Silks:**
The patron shall provide silks bearing the patterns of their life destiny according to their year of birth. Kings and princes shall use purple silks to emulate the celestial patterns, while commoners shall use the color corresponding to their life destiny’s proper direction, placing them at the center for the deliverance of their year and destiny.

**Directional Silks:**
The offerings of patterned silks for the ten directions of the retreat:

**Directional Silks:**
For the eastern direction: green-patterned silk, ninety feet (or nine feet as an alternative);
For the southern direction: crimson-patterned silk, thirty feet (or three feet as an alternative);
For the western direction: white-patterned silk, seventy feet (or seven feet as an alternative);
For the northern direction: black-patterned silk, fifty feet (or five feet as an alternative);
For the four corners: all shall use yellow-patterned silk, each corner requiring one hundred twenty feet (or twelve feet as an alternative);
For the upper direction: green-patterned silk, thirty-two feet;
For the lower direction: yellow-patterned silk, thirty-two feet.
According to each direction’s corresponding color, arrange them in the ten directions to deliver the souls of the eternal night.
The Son of Heaven shall use bolts of silk, princes and kings shall use zhang measures, and commoners shall use chi measures—rank determines the quantity, all in accordance with the established regulations.

**Assigning Roles:**
Once all arrangements are complete, invite one Dharma Master to perform the ritual at the center, accompanied by four fellow practitioners. According to rank, appoint one to oversee the retreat, one to manage affairs, one to tend the incense, and one to tend the lamps. At the main gate, they shall follow the master in procession as the patron kneels and prays for deliverance, mutually aiding in the salvation of sins.
The master enters through the Earth Gate, circling left to the center, then proceeds around the incense burners to the western side, facing east to offer incense thrice.
Next, to the southeast, offering incense thrice; then to the south, thrice; then to the southwest, thrice; then to the west, thrice; then to the northwest, thrice; then to the north, thrice; then to the northeast, thrice; then to the upper direction, thrice; and finally to the lower direction, thrice.
After completing the ten directions, return to the western side, standing and facing east.
The disciples also enter through the Earth Gate, circling left at the main gate, following the master to offer incense thrice in each of the ten directions. Upon completion, they return inside the main gate and stand facing east.

**Incense Invocation:**
The master stands at the center, striking the teeth twenty-four times, and invokes:
*"Incense Official Messengers, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, Fragrant-Bearing Courier Dragon Riders, Incense-Attending Golden Lads, Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendants—thirty-six each—summon the true officials of this land and domain to swiftly prepare. I now burn incense and perform the Dao, praying that the supreme *qi* of the Ten Directions’ true and orthodox beings enter my body, that my entreaties swiftly reach the presence of the Most High, Boundless, Great Dao, the Utmost True Jade Emperor of the Heavenly Thearchs."*

**Inviting the Immortals:**
*"I now invoke the celestial immortals’ troops and horses, earthly immortals’ troops and horses, flying immortals’ troops and horses, perfected beings’ troops and horses, divine beings’ troops and horses, sun and moon troops and horses, stellar constellations’ troops and horses, Nine Palaces’ troops and horses, Five Thearchs’ troops and horses, Three Rivers and Four Seas’ troops and horses, Five Peaks and Four Waterways’ troops and horses—each with ninety million myriad riders. I summon thirty-two overseers of the retreat, thirty-two attendants for affairs, Incense-Attending Golden Lads, Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens, Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendants—thirty-two each—along with message-bearing officials, flying dragon couriers, and all others to descend and oversee this retreat hall. Together with my fellow practitioners, I perform this ritual for the patron [Name], delivering the nine generations of their ancestors’ departed souls from the eternal night. The patron now offers this retreat in sincerity, pledging devotion to the boundless worlds’ perfected and sagely hosts, the venerable masters, and the divine officials of the Ten Directions. Today, I burn incense and take refuge in the virtue of the great sagely hosts, the Utmost True. May I, upon attaining the Dao, ascend into formlessness and unite with the true Dao."*

**Threefold Incense Offering:**
Master and disciples circle left together, offering incense thrice to each of the ten directions, beginning in the east and proceeding through the lower direction.

Facing west with the east at their backs, the master recites the invocation for the first incense offering:

*"This first incense is offered for the deliverance of the nine generations of ancestors of fellow practitioner [Name], releasing the departed souls from the Nine Dark Vaults of the Jade Repository, the eternal night’s abode—dispelling their karmic adversaries and the deep-rooted sins of past lives. Through the merit of this retreat and incense offering, we beseech and give thanks to the Ten Directions. May the nine generations of ancestors be freed from the depths of suffering, ascend to the Heavenly Palace, and abide in the natural abundance of the Dao. Now, we burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life to the Great Way.*

*We prostrate ourselves, body and head to the earth, taking refuge in the Three Supreme Ones of the Most High. May this merit flow to the nine generations of ancestors, delivering them from the ten sufferings, the eight hardships, and the long night’s bondage. May they behold the radiant light and ascend to the Heavenly Palace, where clothing and sustenance arise spontaneously, and they dwell forever in non-action.*

*Now, we burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the great sagely hosts, the Utmost True. Upon attaining the Dao, may we ascend into formlessness and unite with the true Dao."*

After the second incense offering, master and disciples circle left together, offering incense thrice to each of the ten directions, beginning in the east and proceeding through the lower direction.

Facing west with the east at their backs, the master recites the invocation:

*"We now perform this rite for the deliverance of the nine generations of ancestors of fellow practitioner [Name], releasing the departed souls from the Nine Dark Vaults of the Jade Repository, the eternal night’s abode—dispelling their karmic adversaries and the deep-rooted sins of past lives. Through the merit of this retreat and incense offering, we beseech and give thanks to the Ten Directions. May the nine generations of ancestors be freed from sorrow and suffering, ascend to the Heavenly Palace, and surrender body, spirit, and life to the Great Way.*

*We prostrate ourselves, body and head to the earth, taking refuge in the Three Supreme Ones of the Most High. May this merit flow to the emperors and kings of the realm, to ministers and officials, to those who receive the Dao and its teachings, to parents and revered kin, to fellow disciples, to reclusive scholars in the mountains and forests who study the true Way, and to all worthy Daoists. May each attain their Dao and dwell in peace, abiding in non-action.*

*Now, we burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the great sagely hosts, the Utmost True. Upon attaining the Dao, may we ascend into formlessness and unite with the true Dao."*

After the third incense offering, master and disciples circle left together, offering incense thrice to each of the ten directions, beginning in the east and proceeding through the lower direction.

Facing west with the east at their backs, the master recites the invocation:

*"We now perform this rite for the deliverance of the nine generations of ancestors of fellow practitioner [Name], releasing the departed souls from the Nine Dark Vaults of the Jade Repository, the eternal night’s abode—dispelling their karmic adversaries and the deep-rooted sins of past lives. Through the merit of this retreat and incense offering, we beseech and give thanks to the Ten Directions. May the nine generations of ancestors be freed from sorrow and suffering and ascend to the Heavenly Palace. May [Name] swiftly attain transcendence, and may their household, clan, and kin—along with the realm’s officials and people, all fellow students and teachers, those who have received grace, disciples, the people of the world, creatures that creep and crawl, those that fly and burrow, those that wriggle and breathe, all beings born and unborn—be delivered from the ten sufferings, the eight hardships, the five poisons, water and fire, the thousand calamities and myriad harms, demonic afflictions, ghostly qi, punishments, and misfortunes.*

*Now, we burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the great sagely hosts, the Utmost True. Upon attaining the Dao, may we ascend into formlessness and unite with the true Dao."*

After the three incense offerings are complete, they give thanks to the Ten Directions.

The master and disciples together bow nine times toward the east, then kneel and say: "Fellow practitioner, the nine generations of ancestors of so-and-so, for the transgressions they committed in their lifetimes, have had their sins bound in the Nine Dark Halls of the Long Night. Their souls endure flogging and torment, suffering every agony, their forms broken and withered, their pain unbearable. They have sunk into eternal kalpas, with no end in sight. Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Ones’ Jade Repository of the Azure Lad of the Upper Palace* and its rite of deliverance, we present nine bolts of azure silk, each ninety feet long—or nine feet—and one golden dragon. We take refuge in the *Limitless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the East*, the *Nine Qi Heavenly Lords*, and the *Spiritual Officials of the Eastern Quarter*, beseeching them to redeem the roots of evil and sin of our nine generations of ancestors, that the *Azure Lad of the Upper Palace* of the Three Realms may erase their names from the ledgers of transgression. May their destitute souls be delivered, their bodies enter into radiance, and ascend into the Heavenly Palace, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. May they swiftly attain the gate of rebirth and blessed fortune, and may I, so-and-so, attain the true Dao and unite with the divine."

This done, they untie the knots, kowtow, and strike their cheeks ninety times each.

Next, the master and disciples together turn left and bow twelve times toward the southeast, then kneel and say: "Fellow practitioner, the nine generations of ancestors of so-and-so, for the transgressions they committed in their lifetimes, have had their sins bound in the Nine Dark Halls of the Long Night. Their souls endure flogging and torment, suffering every agony, their forms broken and withered, their pain unbearable. They have sunk into eternal kalpas, with no end in sight. Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Ones’ Jade Repository of the Azure Lad of the Central Palace* and its rite of deliverance, we present one hundred twenty bolts of yellow silk—or twelve feet—and one golden dragon. We take refuge in the *Limitless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Southeast*, the *Brahma Qi Heavenly Lords*, and the *Spiritual Officials of the Southeastern Quarter*, beseeching them to redeem the roots of evil and sin of our nine generations of ancestors, that the *Azure Lad of the Central Palace* of the Three Realms may erase their names from the ledgers of transgression. May their destitute souls be delivered, their bodies enter into radiance, and ascend into the Heavenly Palace, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. May they swiftly attain the gate of rebirth and blessed fortune, and may I, so-and-so, attain the true Dao and unite with the divine."

This done, they untie the knots, kowtow, and strike their cheeks one hundred twenty times each.

Next, the master and disciples together turn left and bow three times toward the south, then kneel and say: "Fellow practitioner, the nine generations of ancestors of so-and-so, for the transgressions they committed in their lifetimes, have had their sins bound in the Nine Dark Halls of the Long Night. Their souls endure flogging and torment, suffering every agony, their forms broken and withered, their pain unbearable. They have sunk into eternal kalpas, with no end in sight. Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Ones’ Jade Repository of the Azure Lad of the Yang Palace* and its rite of deliverance, we present three thousand bolts of crimson silk—or three feet—and one golden dragon. We take refuge in the *Limitless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the South*, the *Three Qi Heavenly Lords*, and the *Spiritual Officials of the Southern Quarter*, beseeching them to redeem the roots of evil and sin of our nine generations of ancestors, that the *Azure Lad of the Yang Palace* of the Three Realms may erase their names from the ledgers of transgression. May their destitute souls be delivered, their bodies enter into radiance, and ascend into the Heavenly Palace, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. May they swiftly attain the gate of rebirth and blessed fortune, and may I, so-and-so, attain the true Dao and unite with the divine."

This done, they untie the knots, kowtow, and strike their cheeks thirty times each.

Next, the master and disciples together turn left and bow twelve times toward the southwest, then kneel and say: "Fellow practitioner, the nine generations of ancestors of so-and-so, for the transgressions they committed in their lifetimes, have had their sins bound in the Nine Dark Halls of the Long Night. Their souls endure flogging and torment, suffering every agony, their forms broken and withered, their pain unbearable. They have sunk into eternal kalpas, with no end in sight. Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Ones’ Jade Repository of the Azure Lad of the Lower Palace* and its rite of deliverance, we present one hundred twenty bolts of yellow silk—or twelve feet—and one golden dragon. We take refuge in the *Limitless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Southwest*, the *Brahma Qi Heavenly Lords*, and the *Spiritual Officials of the Southwestern Quarter*, beseeching them to redeem the roots of evil and sin of our nine generations of ancestors, that the *Azure Lad of the Lower Palace* and the *Right Officials* of the Three Realms may erase their names from the ledgers of transgression. May their destitute souls be delivered, their bodies enter into radiance, and ascend into the Heavenly Palace, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. May they swiftly attain the gate of rebirth and blessed fortune, and may I, so-and-so, attain the true Dao and unite with the divine."

This done, they kowtow and strike their cheeks one hundred twenty times each.

Their souls endure flogging and torment, suffering every agony, their forms broken and withered, their pain unbearable. They have sunk into eternal kalpas, with no end in sight. Now, in accordance with the *Alliance of Perfected Ones’ Jade Repository of the Azure Lad of the Right Palace and Yin Officials* and its rite of deliverance, we present seventy bolts of white silk—or seven feet—and one golden dragon. We take refuge in the *Limitless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the West*, the *Seven Qi Heavenly Lords*, and the *Spiritual Officials of the Western Quarter*, beseeching them to redeem the roots of evil and sin of our nine generations of ancestors, that the *Azure Lad of the Right Palace and Yin Officials* of the Three Realms may erase their names from the ledgers of transgression. We take refuge in the *Limitless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the North*, the *Five Qi Heavenly Lords*, and the *Spiritual Officials of the Northern Quarter*, beseeching them to redeem the roots of evil and sin of our nine generations of ancestors, that the *Fire Officials of the Supreme Yang Palace of the Azure Lad* of the Three Realms may erase their names from the ledgers of transgression. Then the master and disciples turn left in unison, facing the northeastern Palace of the Sun, and bow three times. Kneeling, they say:

"Our fellow practitioner, so-and-so, and our nine generations of ancestors, along with this disciple’s own transgressions accumulated since birth—innumerable sins and karmic entanglements—have bound our deceased souls in suffering. Adrift in the eternal night of the Nine Dark Realms, our spirits endure torment and lashing, every agony fully inflicted, sinking into endless kalpas with no deliverance. Today, we burn incense and surrender to the Lord of the Sun, the Lady of the Sun, the Divine Youths, and all immortals within the solar palace, beseeching them to absolve our transgressions, those that offend the celestial radiance and bind us in karmic retribution across life and death. May they redeem the imprisoned souls of our nine generations of ancestors, release them into light, ascend them to the Heavenly Palace where clothing and sustenance arise naturally, and may this disciple attain the Dao and unite in luminous harmony with the Lord of the Sun."

Upon completion, they kowtow and strike their cheeks thirty times each.

"Together with this disciple, our nine generations of ancestors—through the primordial evils and vile transgressions committed in life—have offended the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang Water Emperors; the Twelve River Sources; the River Lords, River Marquises, River Clerks; and all the numinous officials of the Water Palaces. "By the same Dharma, we, so-and-so, beseech that the heavy sins and transgressions committed by our nine generations of ancestors in past and present lives—all the accumulated offenses, the karmic bonds entangled across lifetimes—be absolved. May we dedicate this merit to deliver our nine generations of sinful souls, freeing them from the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, from the Knife Mountains, Sword Trees, long rivers, and cold courts. May their bodies emerge from the dark night into light, ascend to the Heavenly Palace, where clothing and sustenance arise naturally, and may we ourselves attain the Dao and unite in truth with the Perfected."

Upon completion, they kowtow and strike their cheeks three hundred and sixty times each.

Then the master and disciples move together to the left, circling the incense once, returning to face east from the west. They visualize and invoke:

"Fragrant Official Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, the Incense-Bearing Dragon Riders and Couriers—may the naturally arising golden liquid, cinnabar essence, and mushroom spirits of this purification site gather here before this incense, so that we may attain the Dao, achieve immortality, bring ten thousand blessings to our households, and bestow grace upon the world. May the Golden Lads and Jade Maidens of the ten directions attend the fragrant smoke, convey our entreaties, and ascend directly to the presence of the Boundless, Most High Great Dao."

The *Lingxian Section of the Yellow Register Writs of the Lower Prime* states: "When the rites of deliverance and the expression of gratitude to the divine majesties are complete, one should follow the jade instructions and cast a golden dragon, inscribing a jade tablet with cinnabar, binding it with blue silk, and sealing it as a token of ascent for the Five Emperors and the transcendent immortals, placing it within an abyssal cliff, strictly adhering to the ancient method."

The *Lingxian Section of the Yellow Register Writs of the Lower Prime* further states: "When the rites invoking the Five Emperors are complete, inscribe a jade tablet with cinnabar, cast a golden dragon, bind it with blue silk to a stone, and sink it into the Three Rivers to invoke the Water Emperors. This serves as the token of ascent, strictly following the jade instructions of the ancient text."

Here ends the excerpt from the *Dongxuan Yellow Register Writs*, corresponding to *Supreme Secret Essentials*, Scroll Fifty-Four.

**Supreme Secret Essentials, Scroll Fifty-Five**
**The Lower Prime Purification Rites of the Great Perfected**

For those who study the methods of the Great Perfected and seek to become flying immortals, achieve spiritual communion with the true, soar through the vast heavens, and ascend to the Nine Heavens, they must observe the purification rites of the Lower Prime on its third day. They should burn incense, recite scriptures, and deliver their seven generations of ancestors, allowing the deceased souls to be reborn, escape the Three Paths, ascend to the Southern Palace, release their karmic knots, dissolve their obstructions, sever their evil roots. When the seven generations rejoice, the practitioner themselves will attain immortality. This method is profound and wondrous; it must not be transmitted to the unworthy.

For the Lower Prime purification rites, one day prior, bathe the body and purify the mind with a night of fasting. The number of participants may range from nine down to three.

Upon entering the chamber at night, face north, click the teeth fourteen times, and offer incense three times. Kneeling, they invoke:

"Most High, Empty and Spontaneously Arising Ninefold Mystery Dao Lord; Void Sovereign Great Perfected; Lower Prime Purification Officials; Five Directions and Five Emperors; Flying Immortals of the Five Peaks—on this day of the present month, at such-and-such a place, we observe the purification vigil, burning incense and lighting lamps, reciting scriptures. We humbly request the Lower Prime Inspectors of the Perfected, the Purification Vigil Immortal Officials, and the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens—twelve each—to descend together, oversee our rites, and report above to the Nine Heavens. We respectfully prepare this night’s invocation to be conveyed directly for your enactment."

Upon completion, at dawn the next day, they enter the chamber, arranging themselves by rank. The purification master first clicks their teeth three times outside the chamber door, visualizing the chamber filled with spontaneously arising purple *qi* clouds, with Jade Lads and Jade Maidens arrayed to the left and right.

In a soft voice, they say: "As we now enter the chamber to burn incense and perform the Dao, may the Purification Vigil Immortal Officials protect our bodies, connect us to the mysterious void, and report our every movement."

They then enter, face east toward the incense burner, and invoke:

"Primal Spirits of the Lower Prime, Divine Perfected of the Five Emperors, Golden Immortals and Jade Lads, Pure Spirits and Jade Maidens, attendants of the left and right incense, Flying Immortal Divine Officials—we open the gates of the Nine Heavens to the Primordial Heavenly King, the Void Sovereign Jade Emperor, and the Most High Heavenly Worthies. As we now burn incense, circumambulate, and recite the scriptures, may the *qi* of the Boundless, Spontaneous, and Utmost True descend into our bodies, receive our secret words, and swiftly convey our entreaties to the presence of the August Jade Emperor on High."

Turning left to face north, they kneel, click their teeth twelve times, and visualize:

"From the four limbs, five constituents, and thirty-nine portals of our bodies, the Perfected Divine Officials, the Left and Right Flying Immortals, the Jade Void Attendants, the Five Emperors and Five-Colored Primal August Perfected, the Flying Dragon Merit Officers, and the Divine Immortal Messengers—thirty-six each—emerge. The Jade Void Attendants wield the nine-colored, radiant heavenly banners of the Flying Immortals’ feathered standards. The Five Emperors and Five-Colored Primal August Perfected hold the life-demon banners of the Five Emperors. The Flying Dragon Merit Officers wear feathered robes adorned with golden true phoenix emblems. The Divine Immortal Messengers interlace the Seven Primes and hold jade tablets, standing before us to receive our secret words. Mounting the golden-rooted, purple-canopied, cinnabar-axled, jade-charioted flying cloud wheels, accompanied by the Golden Immortals and Jade Lads, the Great Flower Jade Maidens—twelve each—and the left and right Dragon-Tiger soaring heavenly feathered riders, two hundred forty thousand in number, we fly to the Purple Canopy, ascending to the golden gates, jade halls, jeweled chambers, and cinnabar rooms of the Nine Heavens. There, we invoke the Most High, Boundless, and Inexhaustible Utmost True Ninefold Mystery Primal Father; the Great Void Primal Mother; the Primordial Heavenly King; the August Jade Void Lord of Myriad Paths; the King of the Highest Joyous Heaven; the King of the Immeasurable Lifespan Heaven of the Highest Meditation; the King of the Prolonged Heaven; the King of the Silent Heaven; the King of the Unarrogant Joyous Heaven; the King of the Responsive Heaven; the King of the Brahma Treasure Heaven; the King of the Brahma Kāmadeva Heaven; the King of the Parinirmitavaśavartin Heaven; the Nine Heavenly Chancellors; the Three Heavenly Jade Lads; the Thirty-Two August Emperors..."

Amidst the assembly of the Fourteen Perfected, the Primordial Ancient Master, the Venerable Lord of Myriad Beginnings, the August Jade Dawn Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Divine King of Fusang’s Sunrise Valley, the Four Directors and Five Emperors, the Western Numinous Tortoise Mother, the Supreme Clarity Grand Perfected Jade Treasure Prime Minister and Great Director of Destinies, High Dawn Preceptor, the Eastern Flowery Jade Gate Azure Flower Youth Lord, the Supreme Clarity Primordial Origin Utmost Three Heavens Boundless Great Dao Supreme Elder Lord, the Supreme Elder, the Heavenly Thearch Lord, the Nine Elder Immortal Capital Lords, the Nine Qi Venerable Lord, and the myriad layers of Dao-qi; the one thousand two hundred official lords; the innumerable Daoist August Perfected of the Supreme Clarity Jade Palace; and the boundless Heavenly Worthies of the Qi-lineage of the Spontaneous Mysterious Capital Primordial August Great Cavern Three Sovereigns’ disciples, the humble Perfected of this minor destiny—we, your subjects, the Master of the Sacred Peak and I, now reverently lead one another in establishing the fast, setting forth the vigil, reciting scriptures, and performing the Dao-circuits, burning incense and kindling lamps, erecting merit and virtue, redeeming the seven generations of ancestors, untying the knots of past roots, liberating from the dark paths, ascending to the Southern Palace, releasing the destitute souls, and conveying beings to rebirth in heaven. We specially beseech the Utmost Boundless Heavenly Worthy from the celestial furnace of the state to cast down divine illumination, oversee our supplications, and command the Supreme Clarity Highest Three Treasures’ Attendant Immortal Gentlemen, the Five Directions’ Five Emperors’ Supervising Numinous Lords, the Fast-Supervising Great Spirits, the Fast-Directing Messengers, the Vigil-Presiding Perfected, the Flying Immortals and Heavenly Immortals, the Five Sacred Peaks’ Divine Immortals, and the nine hundred million hosts of cavalry and chariots to descend as one, encamp and guard our bodies, extinguish demons and dissolve trials, dispel misfortune and avert calamities, summon the spontaneous upright qi of the Nine Heavens, the golden liquid elixir essence and mushroom blossoms, so that gods and immortals may gather in communion, and the fast hall be suffused with radiance.

May your subjects’ jade maidens and jade lads attend the incense smoke, so that in performing the Dao we attain the Dao, in seeking immortality we attain immortality, soaring through the great void and ascending in splendor to the Nine Heavens. May the aspirations of our hearts align, and with the Three Treasures’ fast vigil, may the seven generations of our fathers and mothers be redeemed and delivered from the Three Wretched Realms. May the dead souls be entreated to rebirth in heaven, and all manifold sufferings be universally delivered. May we receive the immeasurable grace of the Supreme Perfected. When the cultivation is complete, we shall report our return to the original palace, humbly awaiting your gracious acceptance. We shall requite this with devoted practice.

Next, dismiss the officers and troops.
Next, turn back to face east, and offer three incense sticks to the incense burner.

**First Offering of Incense.**
The humble disciple of the Three Radiant Ones of the Great Grotto of the Mysterious Capital of Supreme Purity, the Lesser Omen Perfected of [X] Peak, Master [Name], and your subjects [Names], now establish this fast and vigil, burning incense and kindling lamps, contemplating the Realized Ones and reciting scriptures, practicing the Dao to seek immortality. We dedicate these merits to deliver the seven generations of our ancestors’ destitute souls, severing karmic roots, redeeming them from the dark paths, entreating the dead to rebirth in heaven, sparing them the Five Sufferings, and granting them blessings in the Southern Palace. Now we offer our bodies, spirits, and lives to the Most High and Perfect, the Utmost and Supreme Nine Mysteries Primordial Jade Emperor; the Boundless Heavenly King of the Yūdāṇa Heaven; the Heavenly King of the Uppermost Meditative Bliss and Boundless Longevity; the Heavenly King of Sumeru; the Thirty-Nine Emperors; the Twenty-Four Perfected; the Nine Heavens’ Ministers; the Lofty Jade Dawn; the Most High Great Dao Lord; and the Myriad Immortals and Supreme Sages, the Limitless Heavenly Worthies. May these merits flow to us, allowing the seven generations of our ancestors’ vengeful souls to ascend to the Heavenly Halls, clothed and fed by nature, dwelling eternally in non-action. May our own bodies soar aloft. Thus we burn incense, surrendering ourselves to the Most High and Supreme Heavenly Worthies, that after attaining the Dao we may ascend into the formless and share the wheel of the Three Treasures.

**Second Offering of Incense.**
We pray: Your subjects [Names], now observing this fast and vigil, burn incense and kindle lamps, recite scriptures and contemplate the Realized Ones, practicing the Dao to seek immortality. We dedicate these merits to the boundless, innumerable, and measureless Dao of the Ten Directions and all heavens, and to the revered teachers, parents, and kin of the hidden scholars in the famous mountains, as well as to fellow disciples and worthy Daoists. May each attain the Dao, soaring into Supreme Purity, and may the seven generations of destitute souls escape the dark prisons and ascend to the Immortal Halls. Now we offer our bodies, spirits, and lives to the Most High and Supreme Nine Mysteries Primordial Jade Emperor; the Heavenly King of Stillness; the Heavenly King of Unarrogant Joy; the Heavenly King of Responsive Transformation; the Thirty-Nine Emperors; the Twenty-Four Perfected; the Nine Heavens’ Ministers; the Lofty Jade Dawn; the Most High Great Dao Lord; and the Myriad Immortals and Supreme Sages, the Limitless Heavenly Worthies. May these merits flow to the hidden scholars of the famous mountains, our fellow disciples, and worthy Daoists, allowing the seven generations of destitute souls to ascend to the Heavenly Halls, clothed and fed by nature, and our own bodies to soar aloft. Thus we burn incense, surrendering ourselves to the Most High and Supreme Heavenly Worthies, that after attaining the Dao we may ascend into the formless and share the wheel of the Three Treasures.

Wondrous recitation stirs the layered void,

When finished, bow twice, swallow qi three times, and cease.

The *Lower Prime Chapter* states: At this time, one should recite the Nine Heavens’ Verses from the *Tai Xiao Lang Shu* while circumambulating the incense three times. Facing north from the south, perform nine bows in total. When all is complete, depart without looking back. The observance of mealtimes, rest, recitation, and devotion during the three periods shall follow the method of the Upper Prime. When the three-day retreat concludes, report to the retreat officer, also in accordance with the Upper Prime’s protocol, but with the added merit of liberating the seven generations of ancestors.

The *Lower Prime Chapter* states: When conducting this retreat, one should inscribe the *Seven Primes’ August Sovereigns’ Mighty Talisman* and place it in the appropriate direction.

The *Three Primes Chapter* states: On the day of the retreat, select a person of high repute, spiritually attuned, adept in subtle teachings, and luminous in wisdom to serve as the retreat master. They shall ascend the high seat and expound the Dharma, while the next in rank shall harmonize. All participants in the retreat shall sit in silent attendance, reverently receiving the transformation of the Dao. None shall act with negligence, outwardly feigning retreat while inwardly harboring divergent thoughts, thus violating the celestial statutes. Those who do so shall be seized by the officers of the law and punished with the divine soldiers of the Five Emperors, their names transferred to the Northern Feng, and they shall not again ascend the retreat hall.

The *Three Primes Chapter* states: On the day of the retreat, men and women shall be arranged according to the depth of their learning. They shall walk with refined dignity, circumambulate the incense, and make vows in proper order. In sitting, rising, reclining, and resting, none shall mix indiscriminately or engage in jesting, disregarding seniority. Those who do so shall be mocked by the heavens and disdained by spirits. Such offenders shall be seized by the officers of the law and punished with the divine soldiers of the Five Emperors, their names transferred to the Northern Feng, and they shall not again ascend the retreat hall.

The *Three Primes Chapter* states: Whenever fellow students encounter misfortune, illness, official entanglements, slander, or unjust calamities, they shall practice the method of "nothing within." They should prepare incense and oil as offerings and make a petition. The retreat master shall then report their circumstances to the lofty void in accordance with the matter at hand.

The *Three Primes Chapter* states: In all undertakings of this Dao—whether studying the method, holding a retreat, compounding the elixir, entering the mountains, transmitting scriptures, observing the eight seasonal nodes, the days of *jiazi*, *gengshen*, the Grand Year-star, or one’s own fate-day—whether in wealth or poverty, joy or sorrow, illness or slander, distress or peril, or when one’s teacher is in distress, the nation is unsettled, one’s teacher is in peril, or a fellow practitioner is in sorrow—one must always hold a retreat. The merit of such practice is most profound. If one can persist in this method regularly, after three years, a True Person shall descend. By maintaining this practice for nine years, one shall attain the power to ride the void and fly. This Dao is secret and weighty; guard it well and do not transmit it recklessly.

The *Three Primes Chapter* states: The *Tai Zhen Canon*, received by the Most High Primordial Lord in the empty cavern before the Nine Mysteries, is to be employed during the retreat to practice the formulas of immortality. Thus, the True Persons of the Upper Chamber of the Mysterious Capital all observe the Upper Prime in the first ten-day period of the month, the Middle Prime in the middle ten-day period, and the Lower Prime in the last ten-day period. How much more should worldly students strive to practice the Dao of the Three Primes? Mere idle contemplation of its subtleties will never summon the True. Vain effort in practice will only distance one from immortality. If one is sincere, one should follow the luminous canon, present thirty feet of brocade silk and nine gold rings to one’s teacher, and take a vow to receive the ordination of a True Person. After nine years of practice, one shall attain the rank of Flying Immortal and ascend to the Jade Purity Palace. To lightly divulge these treasured texts is to invite the death of one’s seven generations of ancestors, the loss of one’s own life, and the forfeiture of immortality.

*Wushang Biyao*, Scroll Fifty-Five, concludes.
*Wushang Biyao*, Scroll Fifty-Six.

**The Rite of the Great Perfection’s Middle Prime Retreat**

The *Canon of the Great Perfection* is the foundation of study. One must first practice the method of the Middle Prime Retreat to atone for the accumulated transgressions of one’s body, resolve offenses before the Great Perfection, and seek absolution from the Three Primes. Once past sins are dispersed, the Most High shall descend the True, inscribe one’s name upon the Mysterious Chart, and enable attainment of Highest Immortality. Without this method, one’s efforts are vain and merit is lost, failing to move the spontaneous. Those who cultivate this Way shall ascend to the Nine Heavens; to lightly divulge its sacred texts is to forfeit one’s life to the Bureau of Ghosts.

**Method for Practicing the Middle Prime Retreat:**
On the eve of the rite, bathe and purify yourself. Enter the chamber, burn incense, face west, and knock the teeth twenty-four times. Pass the incense thrice through the flame, then kneel and invoke:

*To the August Jade Emperor of the Nine Mysteries, the Dao Lord of the Great Perfection, and the Most High Heavenly Worthy of the Boundless Middle Prime: Your servant, on this day of the present month, undertakes this retreat, burning incense and lighting lamps to repent transgressions and seek absolution. May the divine officials of the Middle Prime, the Five Directions, the Five Emperors, the Five Peaks, the Heavenly Immortals, Earthly Immortals, Flying Immortals, Inspecting Perfected Envoys, Retreat-Guarding Immortal Officials, Jade Lads, and Jade Maidens—twenty-four each—deign to descend and witness, shielding this servant’s body, conveying his arts to the True, and reporting his plea to the Nine Heavens.*

Having made this solemn invocation, await the dawn. At daybreak, enter the chamber, knock the teeth thrice outside the retreat hall, and visualize the hall filled with spontaneous purple *qi*, its essence brimming with divine mushrooms and cinnabar radiance, while Jade Lads and Jade Maidens array themselves to left and right.

Whisper:
*As I enter this chamber to burn incense and perform the Dao, may the Retreat-Guarding Immortal Officials shield this servant’s body, ensuring all movements and stillness reach the Mysterious Void.*

Proceed into the retreat hall, face east toward the incense burner, and pray:
*To the Five Numinous Ones, the Five Elders, the Divine Perfected, the Golden Immortals, the Jade Lads, the Jade Maidens of Mount Taihua, the Left and Right Dragon-Tigers, and the Incense-Attending Immortal Officials: I beseech the Nine Heavens’ Primordial Heavenly King of Original Commencement, the Jade Emperor of the Void Sovereign, and the Most High Heavenly Worthies. As I burn incense and circumambulate the scriptures, may the boundless, spontaneous, and true *qi* of the Middle Prime descend into my body, receive the secret words from my mouth, and swiftly convey my plea to the throne of the Most High Jade Emperor.*

Face east, kneel, and knock the teeth twenty-four times. Then solemnly summon:
*From within my body’s fivefold true officials, the Jade Gate’s Purple Portal, the thirty-nine passes’ Perfected Immortal Officials, the Left and Right Flying Immortals, the Jade Void Attendants, the Five Emperors of the Five Colored Primordial Perfection, the Flying Dragon Merit Clerks, and the thirty-six Divine Immortal Envoys—let them emerge!*

The Attendants shall bear the Nine Heavens’ Radiant Banners; the Five Emperors of the Five Colored Primordial Perfection shall wield the Five Emperors’ Commanding Demon Banners; the Flying Dragon Merit Clerks shall wear feathered robes adorned with golden phoenix insignia; the Divine Immortal Envoys shall hold the Seven Primes’ Interlocking Jade Tablets. Standing before me, they shall receive the secret words from my mouth, ascend upon a golden-rooted, purple-canopied, cinnabar-axled, jade-carved cloud chariot, accompanied by twelve Golden Immortals, twelve Jade Maidens of Mount Taihua, twenty-four thousand Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Feathered Cavalry, soaring through the Purple Void to the Golden Gates and Jade Halls, the Jasper Chambers and Cinnabar Sanctums of the Nine Heavens’ summit.

There, I prostrate and invoke:
*To the Utmost Supreme, Boundless, and Ineffable Most High Cavern-True Nine Mysteries Primordial Father; the Great Void Mysterious Mother; the Primordial Heavenly King of Original Commencement; the Most High Jade Void Ten-Thousand-Dao Elder; the Nine Heavens’ Perfected Kings; the Thirty-Six Heavenly Kings; the Ten-Thousand-Beginnings Master; the Three Heavens’ Jade Lads; the Nine Heavens’ Chancellors; the Great Perfection Heavenly Kings; the Most High Thirty-Nine Emperors; the Twenty-Four Jade Sovereigns; the Mysterious Ancient Master; the Ten-Thousand-Beginnings Elder; the Most High Jade Dawn; the Supreme Great Dao Lord; the Later Sage Golden Gates Emperor; the Divine King of Fusang’s Yang Valley; the Four Offices’ Five Emperors’ Southern Culmen Upper Prime Prohibiting Lords; the Western Terrace’s Tortoise Mother; the Highest Clarity’s Great Perfection Jade Guardian, Prime Minister, Grand Marshal, Life-Commanding High Dawn Master; the Eastern Sea’s Jade Gate Azure Florescence Youth Lord; the Great Clarity’s Primordial Three Heavens’ Boundless Great Dao Most High Lord Lao; the Most High Elder; the Heavenly Emperor Lord; the Nine Elders’ Immortal Capital Lords; the Nine *Qi* Elder; the hundred thousand myriad layers of Dao *qi*’s twelve hundred official lords; the Great Clarity’s Jade Palace’s Four Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate; the innumerable hosts of Highest August Perfected; the Boundless Heavenly Worthies; the spontaneously flowing *qi*’s Mysterious Capital Primordial Sovereign; and the Three Luminants’ Great Cavern disciples, the humble Perfected of this minor destiny, the Master of [Mount] Yue, your servant [Name], born of impure womb and defiled embryo, yet by karmic fortune and blessed affinity, revolving through the Dharma Gate, I attained human birth. Unworthily, I basked in the High Void’s residual radiance, awakening my dull ignorance, and was granted the sacred texts by my master [Name], who bestowed upon me thirty-one volumes of treasured scriptures. Yet my body remains stained by impurities, unable to ascend in splendor, drifting through the Nine Mysteries, sinking into the lower worlds. My cultivation falters, my conduct accumulates transgressions, and I am seized by the Four Offices, bound to karmic retribution. Daring to rely on the sacred canon, I pledge to receive the Middle Prime Retreat’s texts of the Great Perfection, redeeming past sins. Today, I enter the chamber, ascend the retreat, recite the scriptures, perform the Dao, contemplate the True, burn incense, light lamps, and pay homage to the Jade Heaven, repenting sins and seeking absolution. I aspire to immortality, and humbly beseech the Three Treasures’ Most High to dispatch the Attendant Perfected, the Five Directions’ Five Emperors’ Supervising Numinous Lords, the Retreat-Supervising Great Spirits, the Retreat-Directing Envoys, the Retreat-Guarding Highest Perfected, the Flying Immortals, Heavenly Immortals, Earthly Immortals, the Five Peaks’ Divine Immortals, and nine hundred million myriad hosts of cavalry—all to descend as one, shield my body, extinguish demons, dissolve trials, dispel evil, summon the Nine Heavens’ spontaneous true *qi*, the Golden Monad’s liquid cinnabar essence, and divine mushrooms. May the immortals gather in the retreat hall, illuminating my body, while Jade Lads and Jade Maidens attend the incense smoke, enabling my practice to attain the Dao, my quest for immortality to succeed, my flight through the Great Void, and my ascent to the Nine Heavens. May my vows align, merging with the Three Treasures’ truth. May the Middle Prime’s sins be erased, the Great Yin’s thousand transgressions and myriad faults be extinguished, and all be graciously absolved. May my seven ancestors be delivered, their dead souls reborn in heaven, and all the heavens’ beings spared the Ten Sufferings and Eight Difficulties, receiving the boundless, immeasurable grace of the Middle Prime’s deliverance.*

Upon the completion of the ritual practice, I petition to return to my original abode, humbly awaiting your swift decree, that it may be reverently carried out.

**Summon the ritual officers and soldiers.**

**First offering of incense before the censer:**
I, [Name], the humble Perfected of Lesser Illumination, Master of the [X] Sacred Peak, and servant of the Dao, now establish this fast and perform the vigil, burning incense and kindling lamps, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao, to absolve past transgressions and offer repentance to the Three Primes. In seeking the divine immortals, I dedicate these merits to deliver my seven generations of parents from sorrow and suffering, that their higher souls may ascend to heaven and dissolve the heavy karmic debts of my thousand ancestors and myriad forebears. Now, I surrender body, spirit, and fate to the Boundless Primordial, the Most High Jade Emperor, and the Supreme Perfected Heavenly Worthy. May these merits flow back to me and my seven ancestors, absolving our thousand sins and myriad faults, that all may graciously receive pardon, escape the Ten Sufferings, and ascend to the immortal palaces.

Thus, I burn this incense, taking refuge in the Most High and Unfathomable Heavenly Worthy, to attain the Dao, ascend as a flying immortal, soar through the Nine Heavens, wander freely in the Golden Towers, and unite with the Three Treasures in truth.

**Second offering of incense:**
I now establish this fast and perform the vigil, burning incense and kindling lamps, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao, to absolve past transgressions and offer repentance to the Three Primes. In seeking the divine immortals, I dedicate these merits to deliver my seven generations of parents from the darkness of suffering, that their higher souls may ascend to heaven and dissolve the heavy karmic debts of my thousand sins and myriad forebears. May these merits flow back to me and my seven generations of ancestors, absolving our thousand sins and myriad faults, that all may graciously receive pardon. May this great grace extend to all heavens, and may my masters in the Dao, my parents and revered kin, the reclusive scholars of the mountains and forests, and all worthy Daoists universally attain deliverance, escaping the gates of sin.

Thus, I burn this incense, taking refuge in the Most High and Boundless Heavenly Worthy, to attain the Dao, ascend as a flying immortal, soar through the Nine Heavens, wander freely in the Golden Towers, and unite with the Three Treasures in truth.

**Third offering of incense:**
I now establish this fast and perform the vigil, burning incense and kindling lamps, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao, to absolve past transgressions and offer repentance to the Three Primes. In seeking the divine immortals, I dedicate these merits to my household and clan, the nine lineages of kinship, emperors and kings, lords and ministers, officials and commoners, the frontier regions of the four directions, all celestial and earthly beings, and every creature—those that creep and crawl, breathe and sigh—all sentient beings. Now, I surrender body, spirit, and fate to the Boundless Primordial, the Most High Jade Emperor, and the Supreme Perfected Heavenly Worthy. May these merits flow back to me and my household, absolving our thousand sins and myriad faults, that all may graciously receive pardon. May this great grace extend to all heavens, the imperial clan, the nine lineages of kinship, emperors and kings, lords and ministers, officials and commoners, the frontier regions, the people of the world, and all creatures—those already born and yet to be born—universally attain deliverance, each preserving their natural state.

Thus, I burn this incense, taking refuge in the Most High and Boundless Heavenly Worthy, to attain the Dao, ascend as a flying immortal, soar through the Nine Heavens, wander freely in the Golden Towers, and unite with the Three Treasures in truth.

I now perform this fast and vigil, burning incense and kindling lamps, contemplating the true and reciting scriptures, to absolve past transgressions and offer repentance to the Three Primes. I surrender my fate to the Boundless Primordial, the Most High Jade Emperor, and the Supreme Perfected Heavenly Worthy of the East, beseeching your compassionate illumination and pardon for my supplications. Grant that I may study the Dao and attain it, seek immortality and achieve it, fly through the Great Void, and soar through the Nine Heavens. May my seven generations of parents escape the Three Wretched Realms and ascend to the Southern Palace, receiving the grace of the Heavenly Worthy’s deliverance.

Here, I perform three prostrations and three strikes to my cheeks.

**Next, face southeast and repeat the above ritual.**
**Then, face due south and repeat the above ritual.**

Next, face southwest and repeat the above ritual.
Then, face due west and repeat the above ritual.
Then, face northwest and repeat the above ritual.
Then, face due north and repeat the above ritual.
Then, face northeast and repeat the above ritual.
Then, face the northwest upper direction and repeat the above ritual.
Then, face the southeast lower direction and repeat the above ritual.
For all ten directions, follow the same vows as for the eastern direction, performing three prostrations and three strikes to the cheeks to repent for sins across the ten directions. Even if the officiant of the Great Perfection ritual grows weary from prolonged fasting, the heart must still bow in reverence; the prostrations and strikes to the cheeks must not be omitted.

Grant your compassionate illumination and special pardon, that I may study the Dao and attain it, seek immortality and achieve it, fly through the Great Void, and soar through the Nine Heavens. Grant your compassionate illumination and special pardon, that I may study the Dao and attain it, seek immortality and achieve it, fly through the Great Void, and soar through the Nine Heavens.
