After paying homage to the Five Emperors, return to face the east and recite the "Songs of Sorrow and Joy of the Five Emperors," circumambulating three times, concluding at the south and halting to the north. Simply recite the scriptures without further prostrations. Upon completing the circumambulation, face north and recite the "Three Eulogies of the Four Poles and Five Sufferings." Conclude with three bows, nine prostrations, and nine strikes to the cheeks to repent for sins across the Four Poles.

After repenting for the Four Poles, return to face the east, strike the teeth three times, and pinch incense three times. Pray:
May the Five Marchmounts and Five Emperors, the divine immortal envoys, the true and upright of the Two Qi, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, the Heavenly Immortals, Earthly Immortals, Flying Immortals, and the incense officials of the Five Marchmounts summon the true qi of the ten directions, the natural golden liquid elixir, the essence of mushrooms, and the Ninefold Mystic Jade Perfected Ones to gather in this fasting hall. Illuminate my body within, that I may study the Dao and attain it, seek immortality and achieve it, fly through the Great Void, and soar through the Nine Heavens. May jade lads and jade maidens attend the incense smoke, conveying my prayers to the presence of the Most High, Boundless, Supreme Great Dao, the Jade Emperor’s throne.

Strike the teeth nine times, swallow qi nine times, then cease. Exit the chamber without looking back.

The *Central Prime Scripture* states: When performing the Central Prime fast, inscribe the talismanic banners of the Five Emperors’ life-demons and place them in the five directions. This is because those who cultivate the Dao are tested by the Great Demon King, who disrupts concentration and prevents the descent of the true. Thus, the life-demons are commanded to restrain them. Upon completion, store the banners in a brocade pouch.

Perform morning and evening rites at the three periods, with meals and rest following the same method as the Upper Prime fast. Upon completion of the fast, all fast officers shall be reassigned, also in accordance with the Upper Prime’s protocol, with the sole addition of expressing gratitude at the outset for resolving past transgressions and absolving faults.

The *Three Primes Scripture* states: For the Upper Prime fast, light lamps to a maximum of ninety, with a middle grade of sixty, and a lower grade of thirty, arranging them to the left and right of the fast hall, at the gates, and above the positions of the Year-Star, the Monthly Stem-Branch, the day’s Stem-Branch, the natal destiny, and the current year. For the Middle Prime fast, light lamps to a maximum of sixty, with a middle grade of thirty-six, and a lower grade of twelve. For the Lower Prime fast, light lamps to a maximum of thirty-six, with a middle grade of twenty-four, and a lower grade of nine. It is also excellent to follow the lamp-lighting numbers of the Upper Prime in all cases. If resources are lacking, one may also adhere to the Lower Prime’s method.

The *Three Primes Scripture* further states: For the lamps at the Year-Star and the natal destiny, ensure they remain lit day and night, while the other lamps need not be lit during the day. If rain falls, it suffices to light only the lamps at the Year-Star and the natal destiny within the fast hall; the rest may be omitted.

The *Three Primes Scripture* concludes: When the fast’s participants and officers complete the incense offering, each shall bow twice before their respective natal destiny lamp and again before the Year-Star, making their petitions and expressing their wishes as they see fit.

*Supreme Mysteries*, Scroll Fifty-Six—end.
*Supreme Mysteries*, Scroll Fifty-Seven.

**The Supreme Perfected’s Upper Prime Fast**

The *Highest Cavern-True Three Primes Fast* governs the Upper Prime for Heaven, the Lower Prime for Earth, and the Middle Prime for Humanity. When the Three Primes unite with the True, they correspond above to the Nine Mysteries.

For the Upper Prime’s nine-day fast, one circumambulates while reciting scriptures, contemplates the True, and invokes the spirits to harmonize the elixir and secure life, thereby ascending to seek transcendence. For the Middle Prime’s six-day fast, one petitions for absolution of past transgressions, violations of precepts, and karmic entanglements. For the Lower Prime’s three-day fast, one delivers the seven ancestors and releases the Nine Yin, guiding the dead to rebirth in Heaven. This is the sublime method of the Highest, the root of transcendence. Those who cultivate it and attain the True must not lightly disclose or profane it, lest they incur the punishment of the Three Officials.

Those who wish to practice the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern-True Scripture*, the *Feminine One’s Jade Tallies of the Five Venerables Treasure Scripture*, the Eight Gates of the Mysterious Mother, the Twelve Supreme Vows, or chant the soaring and mysterious jade texts of the Highest—contemplating the True, performing the Dao, ascending to seek transcendence, or compounding the divine elixir—may proceed as they wish.

For the Upper Prime fast, one observes a nine-day pure fast. One day prior, bathe with the Five Fragrances, maintain a vigil of fasting and unifying the mind. The number of participants may range from nine down to three. Upon entering the chamber, face north, click the teeth thirty-six times, and offer incense three times. Kneeling, invoke:

*"To the Supreme Perfected August Elders of the Upper Prime, the Five Thearchs’ Numinous Officers of the Highest Transcendent Metropolis: Your servants, on such-and-such a day of this month, shall light lamps, burn incense, circumambulate while reciting scriptures, or compound the divine elixir as we see fit. We humbly request the presence of thirty-six Monitoring Perfected Envoys, Direct-Fast Transcendent Officers, Jade Lads, and Jade Maidens to oversee our cultivation of the True, that our deeds may ascend to the Celestial Throne of the Highest Jade Thearch of the Nine Heavens. Tomorrow, as we commence the fast and serve the Supreme Perfected, may our nocturnal petitions be heard and accepted."*

Upon concluding, at dawn the next day, enter the chamber with a fasting mind. First, outside the fast hall’s door, the fast’s host clicks the teeth three times, envisioning the chamber filled with a cloud of spontaneous purple *qi*. Jade Lads and Jade Maidens array themselves to the left and right. Whisper:

*"As your servant now enters the chamber to burn incense and perform the Dao, may the Direct-Fast Transcendent Officers oversee and protect us, and may the Supreme Perfected convey our deeds to the Mysterious Void, reporting all movements."*

Then enter the chamber, turn left, and face east toward the incense burner, praying:

*"To the Primordial Numinous Five Venerable Perfected, Golden Transcendents and Jade Lads, Pure Numinous Jade Maidens, attendants to the left and right of the incense, and Flying Transcendent Numinous Officers—we invoke the Primordial Thearch of the Nine Heavens, the Jade Thearch of the Void and August. As your servants now burn incense and recite scriptures, may the boundless upright *qi* descend into our bodies, receiving the secret words from our mouths, that our petitions swiftly ascend to the Celestial Throne of the Highest Jade Void."*

Next, turn left, face north, kneel, and click the teeth thirty-six times, praying:

*"We reverently summon the Perfected Numinous Officers within the four limbs, five constituents, three [palaces], and nineteen portals of our bodies—Flying Transcendents to the left and right, Jade Void Attendants, the Five Thearchs of the Five Colored Primordial August Perfected, Flying Dragon Merit Clerks, and Transcendent Envoys, thirty-six each—to emerge. The Jade Void Attendants and Flying Transcendents bear nine-hued, sky-radiant feathered standards; the Five Thearchs of the Five Colored Primordial August Perfected wield the Five Thearchs’ Mandate-Demon Numinous Banners; the Flying Dragon Merit Clerks wear feathered robes adorned with golden true phoenix insignia; the Transcendent Envoys, arrayed in the Seven Primes’ Interlocking Net, hold jade tablets and stand before us. They receive the secret words from our mouths, ascend upon golden-rooted, purple-canopied, cinnabar-axled, jade-carriaged flying-cloud chariots, accompanied by twelve Golden Transcendents and Jade Lads, twelve Supreme Flower Jade Maidens, and twenty-four myriad hosts of left and right dragon-tiger sky-soaring feathered riders. Together, they traverse the Purple Void, ascending to the towering jasper chambers, golden-splendored jade halls within the Purple Orchid of the Nine Heavens. They ascend to the boundless and infinite Highest Cavern-True, the Nine Mysteries’ Primordial Father, the Mysterious Void’s Primordial Mother, the Primordial Thearch, the Highest Jade Void’s Thirty-Nine Chapters, the Twenty-Four Perfected, the August Jade Dawn, the Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Four Administrations and Five Thearchs, the Boundless Heavenly Worthy, and the *qi*-linked Spontaneous Mysterious Metropolis’ Primordial August Great Cavern’s Three Luminaries’ disciples, the humble Perfected of Lesser Portent, your servants so-and-so, by virtue of karmic fortune, have turned the Wheel of Dharma to be born in the human realm, humbly serving the Highest Mystery. Inscribed in the Nine Heavens’ Dragon Script and the Supreme Clarity’s Treasure Texts, we covet the Dao and delight in the True, aspiring to transcendence. Today, we enter the chamber, commence the fast, recite scriptures, contemplate the True, perform the Dao, burn incense, light lamps, or compound the divine elixir as we see fit. We reverently lead one another, uniting our minds to pay homage to the Jade Heaven’s Supreme Clarity Highest, the Three Treasures’ Commanding Transcendent Attendants, the Five Directions’ Five Thearchs’ Monitoring Numinous Gentlemen, Direct-Fast Envoys, Flying Transcendents, Earthbound Transcendents, the Five Marchmounts’ Numinous Transcendents, and the nine hundred million myriad hosts of cavalry and chariots. May they descend as one to encamp around our bodies, dispelling demons, dissolving trials, averting misfortune, and warding off calamities. May they summon the spontaneous upright *qi*, the golden liquid’s elixir essence, and the numinous mushrooms, that transcendents may gather in the fast hall, illuminating our bodies. May Jade Lads and Jade Maidens attend the incense smoke, that our practice of the Dao may succeed, our quest for transcendence be fulfilled, and we soar through the Great Void, ascending to the Nine Heavens, aligning with our heart’s desires and unifying the Three Treasures as the True. Upon completing the practice, may our petitions return to their original abodes, and may our offerings be received and acknowledged."*

Then return to face east, turn toward the incense burner, offer incense three times, and declare:

*"Disciple of the Great Cavern’s Three Luminaries, humble Perfected of Lesser Portent, Master of the Such-and-Such Marchmount, your servant so-and-so, now establishes the fast, appoints the direct officers, lights lamps, recites scriptures, contemplates the spirits, invokes the True, performs the Dao to seek transcendence, and ascends to the Nine Heavens—or compounds the divine elixir as we see fit. May this merit absolve our transgressions, dissolve our sins, sever the roots of death, and summon the Nine Heavens’ spontaneous, upright, and perfected to inscribe our names on the Thearch’s register, recording us in the Supreme Clarity’s flying script. May we traverse the Mysterious Void, attain the Perfected’s rank, and return our spirits to the Primordial Jade Thearch of the Nine Mysteries’ Highest, the Thirty-Nine Thearchs, the Twenty-Four Perfected, the Highest Jade Dawn, the Supreme Great Dao Lord, the myriad transcendents and sagely hosts, and the Boundless Heavenly Worthy. May this merit flow back to refine and deliver our bodies, transforming us to traverse the empty and void, soaring to the Jade Clarity’s Golden Gates."*

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the Highest and Most Ultimate Heavenly Worthy, that after attaining the Dao we may ascend into the formless and share the wheel of the Three Treasures.

**Second Offering of Incense.**
May we, so-and-so and company, now in reverent fast and vigil, illuminating with lamps and reciting scriptures, contemplating the divine and invoking the Perfected, practicing the Dao to seek transcendence and soar through the Nine Heavens—or compounding the divine elixir as we see fit—dedicate this merit to the boundless and infinite realms of the four frontiers, the hidden learners in the renowned mountains, the dharma masters who have already attained the Dao, our parents and honored kin, and our fellow disciples and worthy Daoist companions. May each attain the Dao and ascend to the Supreme Clarity. We take refuge in the Great Perfected, the Upper Prime’s Nine Mysteries’ hosts of myriad transcendents, and the Jade Thearch Heavenly Worthy. May this merit of universal deliverance enable all to swiftly attain ascension and soar to the Supreme Clarity.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the Void and Supreme Perfected, the Upper Prime’s Highest and Sagely Most True Heavenly Worthy, that after attaining the Dao we may ascend into the formless and share the wheel of the Three Treasures.

**Third Offering of Incense.**
We pray:
May we, so-and-so and company, now in reverent fast and vigil, illuminating with lamps and reciting scriptures, contemplating the divine and invoking the Perfected, practicing the Dao to seek transcendence and soar through the Nine Heavens—or compounding the divine elixir as we see fit—dedicate this merit to our household, the nine clans of kin and marriage, all under heaven and upon earth, the lord of the realm and his sovereign, ministers, officials, and common folk, and all living beings—winged, creeping, crawling, or breathing—whether already born or yet to be born. We surrender body, spirit, and life to the Nine Heavens’ Highest host of Perfected and the Jade Void Heavenly Worthy. May this merit of universal deliverance enable all to escape the Ten Sufferings, Eight Difficulties, Five Calamities, Six Harms, Nine Tribulations, and Seven Injuries, each preserving their fortune and emolument, dwelling long in spontaneity.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the Highest and Boundless Heavenly Perfected, that after attaining the Dao we may ascend into the formless and share the wheel of the Three Treasures.

Turning to the northwest, we bow twice, facing the upper realm, and kneeling in prayer say:
We now burn incense in fast and vigil, illuminating with lamps and reciting scriptures, contemplating the divine and invoking the Perfected, practicing the Dao to seek transcendence and soar through the Nine Heavens. May the Great Perfected, the Primordial Heavenly King of the Upper Prime, the Primordial Father of the Nine Mysteries, the Highest Jade Thearch, the Myriad Sagely Thearchs, and the Most Ultimate Cavernous Prime and Grand Void Heavenly Worthy deign to bestow the qi of the Highest Dawn’s Jade Perfected, bending its light to illumine our bodies. May we, in practicing the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking transcendence, attain transcendence; in compounding the elixir, perfect the elixir; in refining gold, transmute gold; soaring through the Mysterious Void and ascending into the Grand Empyrean, attend and guard the Sagely Lords, and ascend to the Golden Gates of the Jade Clarity’s palace.

Next, turning to the southeast, we bow twice, facing the lower realm, and kneeling in prayer say:
We now burn incense in fast and vigil, illuminating with lamps and reciting scriptures, contemplating the divine and invoking the Perfected, practicing the Dao to seek transcendence and soar through the Nine Heavens. May the Great Perfected, the Primordial Heavenly King of the Upper Prime, the Mysterious Mother of the Nine Mysteries, the Primordial Venerable Master, the Purple Void’s Myriad Sagely Thearchs of the Highest August, and the Most Ultimate Cavernous Prime and Grand Void Heavenly Worthy deign to bestow the qi of the Luminous Dawn, bending its light to illumine our bodies. May we, in practicing the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking transcendence, attain transcendence; in compounding the elixir, perfect the elixir; in refining gold, transmute gold; soaring through the Mysterious Void and ascending into the Grand Empyrean, attend and guard the Sagely Lords, and ascend to the Golden Gates of the Jade Clarity’s palace.

Next, facing north, we bow twice, and kneeling in prayer say:
We now burn incense in fast and vigil, illuminating with lamps and reciting scriptures, contemplating the divine and invoking the Perfected, practicing the Dao to seek transcendence and soar through the Nine Heavens. May the Most High Grand Void’s Cavernous Purple Void Primordial Venerable, the Three Heavens’ Jade Lads, the Highest Jade Dawn, the Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Great Perfected Venerable, the Great Perfected Jade Thearch, the Northern Marquis of Central Perfection, and the Highest Mysterious Myriad Transcendent Sagely Heavenly Worthies deign to bestow the qi of the Luminous Dawn, bending its light to illumine our bodies. May we, in practicing the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking transcendence, attain transcendence; in compounding the elixir, perfect the elixir; in refining gold, transmute gold; soaring through the Mysterious Void and ascending into the Grand Empyrean, attend and guard the Sagely Lords, and ascend to the Golden Gates of the Jade Clarity’s palace.

Next, facing west, we bow twice, and kneeling in prayer say:
We now burn incense in fast and vigil, illuminating with lamps and reciting scriptures, contemplating the divine and invoking the Perfected, practicing the Dao to seek transcendence and soar through the Nine Heavens. May the Most High Primordial Void’s Cavernous Grand Prime’s Nine Mysteries’ Primordial Essence Jade Perfected Venerable, the Highest Sagely Transcendent of the Tortoise Terrace Jade Consort, and the Jade Void Grand Void Heavenly Worthy deign to bestow the qi of the Luminous Dawn, bending its light to illumine our bodies. May we, in practicing the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking transcendence, attain transcendence; in compounding the elixir, perfect the elixir; in refining gold, transmute gold; soaring through the Mysterious Void and ascending into the Grand Empyrean, attend and guard the Sagely Lords, and ascend to the Golden Gates of the Jade Clarity’s palace.

Next, facing east, we bow twice, and kneeling in prayer say:
We now burn incense in fast and vigil, illuminating with lamps and reciting scriptures, contemplating the divine and invoking the Perfected, practicing the Dao to seek transcendence and soar through the Nine Heavens. May the Highest Nine Mysteries’ Jade Void Thearch-Emperor, the Supreme Clarity’s Primordial Upper Three Heavens’ Boundless Great Dao’s Most High Lord Lao, the Venerable Masters, the Divine King of Yang Valley, the Great Thearch of Fusang, the Thearch of the Grand Tenuity, the Central Yellow Venerable, the Nine Elders of the Transcendent Metropolis, the Nine Qi Venerable, the Jade Emperor of the Supreme Clarity’s Most High Great Perfected Jade Treasure, the Highest Minister, the Jade Lad of the Eastern Sea’s Jade Gate and Azure Florescence, and the Myriad Sagely and Most Ultimate Heavenly Worthies deign to bestow the qi of the Luminous Dawn, bending its light to illumine our bodies. May we, in practicing the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking transcendence, attain transcendence; in compounding the elixir, perfect the elixir; in refining gold, transmute gold; soaring through the Mysterious Void and ascending into the Grand Empyrean, attend and guard the Sagely Lords, and ascend to the Golden Gates of the Jade Clarity’s palace.

May the Grand Void’s Nine Mysteries’ Primordial Cavernous Numinous Void Jade Thearch-Emperor, the Upper Prime’s Southern Culmen’s Prohibiting Lord, the Southern Prosperity’s Controller of Destiny and Lord of Longevity, and the Cavernous Yang’s Highest Sagely Transcendent Heavenly Worthies deign to bestow the qi of the Luminous Dawn, bending its light to illumine our bodies. May we, in practicing the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking transcendence, attain transcendence; in compounding the elixir, perfect the elixir; in refining gold, transmute gold; soaring through the Mysterious Void and ascending into the Grand Empyrean, and ascend to the Golden Gates of the Jade Clarity’s palace.

Next, facing the Central Tai Sui, bow twice again, kneel long, and pray, saying:

May the Primordial Venerable One of the Supreme Prime’s Apex, the Boundless and Ineffable Grand Void’s Cavernous Mysterious Dark, the Myriad Dao’s Father and Mother, the Purple Void’s Azure Essence Emperor-Lord, the Latter Sagely Nine Mysteries’ Golden Gates Emperor-Lord, the Great Flower’s Jade Numinous Central Mystery’s Four Perfected High Sages, and the Central August Highest Transcendent Heavenly Worthies deign to bestow grace and bend their light, taking pity on our humble origins, that we may, in practicing the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking transcendence, attain transcendence; in compounding the elixir, perfect the elixir; in refining gold, transmute gold; soaring through the Mysterious Void and ascending into the Grand Empyrean, and ascend to the Golden Gates of the Jade Clarity’s palace.

This done, return to stand in the West, facing East, knock the teeth nine times, and thrice offer incense, praying, saying:
We burn incense in fasting devotion and recite scriptures, practicing the Dao to seek transcendence. Now, at this felicitous convergence of celestial cycles, we lay forth our myriad prayers. May the Great Flower’s numinous power awaken, golden transcendents waft incense, the Four Controllers oversee and illumine, the Five Thearchs guard our chariots, the host of sages descend in turn, revolving through the Three Wheels, treading the Void in flight, and paying homage to the Jade Heaven. May we, in practicing the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking the Perfected, attain the Perfected; in seeking the Sagely, attain the Sagely; in seeking the divine, attain the divine; in seeking flight, attain flight; in seeking transcendence, attain transcendence. May the Six Prayers and Eight Convergences all deliver our bodies, that we may ride the flying radiance and ascend through the Nine Mysteries.

This done, swallow qi nine times and cease.

The Azure Lad says: At this time, one should rise in the West, circumambulate while offering incense, and recite the *Western Flower’s Pure Numinous Hymn*, circling the incense burner three times. Then, in the South, face North and bow nine times in total before ceasing.

The Azure Lad says: As for the rites of homage, one may simply perform them in the heart. For the Upper Prime’s ranks, at dawn, attire oneself with care. Once incense is burned at the first hour, sit and take congee. After another hour has passed in the heart, burn incense again and take food. Thereafter, recite scriptures, and as one pleases, take meals, rest, and sleep, nurturing the spirit and circulating qi until the midnight hour. Burn incense again at another hour—these three times are all occasions when the Upper Prime’s generative qi arises. Thus, in the assemblies for practicing the Dao and seeking transcendence, the world performs the three prayers of the hour, praying to inquire into the rites of the Nine Mysteries’ return to the Nine Heavens.

After nine days of burning incense are complete, at dawn, enter the chamber and perform the rites of homage as prescribed. Then, facing East, kneel long, knock the teeth nine times, and proclaim:
We, the humble disciples of the Three Radiant Ones of the Great Cavern of the Mysterious Capital, the Lesser Manifestations and True Persons of the Five Peaks, [Name] and others, bow our heads twice and reverently address the Supreme Upper Prime’s True Void of the Nine Mysteries’ Grand Loftiness Jade Thearch, the Thirty-Nine Thearchs, the Twenty-Four Perfected, the High Sagely Jade Dawn, the Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Four Controllers and Five Thearchs, the Myriad Dao’s Primordial Beginning’s Highest Sagely Most Exalted Heavenly Worthies. We, who delight in the Dao and rejoice in transcendence, aspire to soar through the Nine Mysteries and ascend to the Upper Perfected. On this day of the present month, in the [such-and-such] commandery, county, village, and hamlet, we have begun our fasting devotion, burning incense, reciting scriptures, meditating upon the divine, invoking the Perfected, and practicing the Dao to seek transcendence. Should we compound the divine elixir, we shall follow the dictates of our will. When the cultivation is complete, we humbly address the Upper Clarity’s Three Treasures’ Attendant Transcendent Lords, the Five Directions’ Five Thearchs’ Supervising Numinous Officers, the Masters of Ceremonial Offerings, the Flying Transcendents, Heavenly Transcendents, Earthly Transcendents, the Five Peaks’ and Four Waterways’ Four Directions’ Reclining Inspectors, and the Perfected Transcendents. May the Perfected Palaces advance our ranks and the Transcendent Ones ascend in grade, with titles and stipends conferred according to rank, in accordance with the rites of the Supreme Perfected. May we, in practicing the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking transcendence, attain transcendence; in compounding the elixir, perfect the elixir; in refining gold, transmute gold; dividing our bodies and transforming, descending in the seventy-four directions’ green chariots, soaring through the Upper Clarity, ascending in radiance through the Nine Heavens, the sun and moon shining together, the Three Treasures revolving as one. We humbly beseech the Most Exalted’s oversight and the redoubled grace of the cinnabar heart. Our study of the methods remains incomplete, and our bearing and conduct often fail to accord with the rites. In our comings and goings, we may transgress the statutes and be censured by the Four Controllers or seized by the Five Thearchs. For our thousand transgressions and myriad faults, we beseech pardon and mercy, taking pity on our unenlightened origins. May the True Transcendents of our five bodily components ascend to the Mysterious Capital in accordance with our merits, receive their ranks, and return to our bodies, that we may together ascend and soar through the Grand Empyrean.

On the day of establishing the fast, one should arrange the Nine Heavens’ tokens of gold and jade radiance in the five directions to summon the divine and attract the numinous.

*Secret Essentials of the Supreme, Scroll Fifty-Seven Concludes*
*(Scrolls Fifty-Eight to Sixty-Four Originally Missing)*

**Supreme Secret Essentials, Scroll Sixty-Five**
**Chapter on Single-Minded Devotion**

The Perfected Lord said: Those who lodge their essence in the Mysterious and Nest in the Transcendent, though mountains and rivers collapse, do not waver in resolve. Those in whom the Dao abides in truth, though assailed by cold and heat, hunger and thirst, do not abandon their practice—this is the utmost of single-minded devotion.

Some seize upon the wind to exploit an opening; some cling to demons to bind themselves to affliction. Yet if one resolutely casts all aside and does not grasp at them, the Dao of old is not the Dao of today. If spiritual awakening differs by a hundred gaps, what can such things do to me?

Let others hear of this and take heed.

The Perfected Lord said: In his youth, Master Zhuang Bo was fond of the Dao of life. He would always, at the proper hour, face the northwest, close his eyes, clench his fists, and visualize Mount Kunlun. He maintained this practice for twenty-one years. Later, he consumed elixirs and entered the mountains to study the Dao, yet still preserved this method. After another decade or so, he closed his eyes and suddenly beheld Mount Kunlun, visualizing it without cease. Thereupon he encountered an immortal, who transmitted to him the formula for the Golden Liquid. Thus he attained the Dao—all through the power of concentrated devotion to evoke the Dao’s response.

The Lord of Determined Records said: Once there was a man who loved the Dao but did not know the method for seeking it. He did nothing but prostrate himself morning and evening before a withered tree, beseeching: “Grant me long life.” He persisted thus for twenty-eight years without weariness. One day, the withered tree suddenly burst into bloom, and the blossoms exuded a sap sweet as honey. Someone instructed him to consume it, so he ate both the flowers and the sap. Upon finishing, he became an immortal. Such was the utmost of his concentrated devotion—even a withered tree could produce these purple blossoms and sweet nectar. How much more, then, the numinous peaks of the Three Radiant Ones, the Five Mushrooms sown and cultivated? Yet those who dwell in reverent mountain grottoes, purifying themselves of filth and defilement, are truly pitiable.

There was once Master Fu, who from his youth loved the Dao. He entered a stone chamber in Mount Huo and remained there for seven years. The Supreme Venerable Lord came to him and gave him a wooden drill, instructing him to bore through a stone disk five feet thick, saying: “When you have pierced this disk, you will attain the Dao.” The man drilled day and night for forty-seven years, until the stone was fully penetrated. Thereupon he was granted the divine elixir and ascended to the Grand Purity, becoming the Perfected Man of the Southern Marchmount. Such was a man of true resolve.

Take note of this.

Once there was Liu Shaoweng, who repeatedly entered Mount Hua to pay homage and bow toward the mountain, doing so for twenty years. Suddenly one day, he beheld the Venerable Elder of the Western Marchmount, who bestowed upon him the immortal Dao.

There was also a man who, for ten years, went at dawn to the riverbank to bow to the river. The River Earl and the River Spirit then appeared to him, presenting him with ten pairs of white jade disks and teaching him the method of walking upon water without sinking. This man later attained the Dao on the Central Marchmount.

Zuo Ci, when he first arrived, also devoted himself earnestly to bowing in reverence to the numinous mountains. After five years, he deeply penetrated the mysteries of the Cavernous Darkness.

From the *True Reports*:

At that time, in the southern garden near the cinnabar slopes of Mount Huo, within a neighboring chamber, there lived a diligent and worthy man named Wang Fudu, who had a daughter named Aqiu Zeng. When she was sixteen, while bathing in fragrant waters in the bathhouse, she saw a radiant glow curving and illuminating the space, suspecting something extraordinary. She stepped outside, climbed a tree, and faced south, where she beheld the luminous splendor of a perfected divine spirit, his countenance resplendent as the sun. Overjoyed, the girl clasped her hands in reverence and called out her name from afar: "Aqiu Zeng, having now encountered this blessed meeting and beheld the Heavenly Venerable, I dedicate myself to the Heaven within the Ten Directions. I beseech you to grant me the precepts, that I may uphold the scriptural teachings, eradicate all evil roots, swiftly attain rebirth, and transform this female form into a male one. After ten thousand kalpas, I hope to become a flying immortal."

The Five Thearchs and the Demon Kings, seeing the girl’s great vow and resolve, feared she might transcend the demonic realms. Thus, they transformed into five elderly emperors and approached her, saying: "We have received the command of the Venerable Divinities of the Ten Directions to impart to you the scriptures of the Numinous Treasure. Our Dao is now propagating its teachings, with benevolence, compassion, and filial piety as its foundation. We have heard that your father intends to marry you off, having already accepted another’s proposal, and this cannot be refused. You should first comply with his wishes. To defy your father’s instruction would leave no path to attaining immortality."

The girl replied to the demonic words: "In my past life, I was unfortunate, lacking karmic affinity and merit, which led me to be born in this female form. I regret this day and night, vowing to maintain a single heart, my resolve firm and natural. Though my life comes from my parents, my destiny lies with the Heaven of the Ten Directions. To truly defy my father’s teaching would be unlike your counsel."

Seeing the girl’s steadfast heart and upright bearing, the demons could not sway her and thus retreated.

Aqiu Zeng then declared: "The Dao is lofty and remote, and I have no means to fully realize it. I shall gather firewood, ascend the wall, and burn my body, hoping that my form may dissolve into the Heaven within the Ten Directions, that I may attain timely liberation and scatter like dust." She then cast herself into the fire, and in an instant, her body vanished without trace, as if flung into the void. In that brief moment, her female form transformed into that of a man, who proceeded directly before the Dao.

From the *Scripture of the Cavernous Darkness and Jade Instructions*

**The Chapter on Softness and Weakness**

Laozi said: In all under heaven, nothing is softer or weaker than *qi*. Of the softness and weakness of *qi*, nothing surpasses the Dao. The reason the Dao is soft and weak is that it embraces the past and present heavens and earth, penetrating all things. For softness gives rise to hardness, and weakness gives rise to strength—yet none in the world know from whence their root arises!

Thus, being arises from non-being as its mother; non-being arises from emptiness as its mother; emptiness arises from the Dao as its mother. That which is natural is the root of the Dao.

*From the* Scripture of Western Ascent

Water, as a thing, is soft and weak, yet all-pervading. Serene, tranquil, and harmonious, its mind holds nothing; its virtue aligns with heaven and earth, its blessings extend to the ten thousand things. Vast, it encompasses all; minute, it enters all. Neither metal nor stone can obstruct it, nor can ruined mountains and mounds dam its flow. It shuns the solid and returns to the void, turns from heights to seek the low. Vast and boundless, it flows without end, breaking through barriers and drifting stones—swifter than the wind. Limitless and without bounds, it follows the long and distant Dao, beginning without form and ending in rivers and seas. Rising, it becomes clouds; descending, it becomes rain. Flowing above and below, it bestows without cease, vanishing only to return, dying only to live again.

Thus, the sage abandons ear and eye, returning the mind to water. Embodying softness, they guard the feminine; forsaking the high, they descend to the low; forsaking beauty, they embrace the ugly. They endure disgrace like the earth, contain filth like the sea. Serene and indifferent, without intent, they drift as if without end. Ever-changing and without constancy, they alone endure with heaven and earth from beginning to end.

*From the* Scripture of Wondrous Perfection

Know the masculine, yet guard the feminine, and become the world’s valley.
As the world’s valley, constant virtue never departs, returning to the state of infancy.

Know the bright, yet guard the dark, and become the world’s model.
As the world’s model, constant virtue never falters, returning to the boundless.

Know glory, yet guard disgrace, and become the world’s valley.
As the world’s valley, constant virtue is fulfilled, returning to the uncarved block.
When the uncarved block is scattered, it becomes vessels; when the sage employs it, it becomes a leader of officials. Thus, the great system is not divided.

*From the* Dao Scripture *of Laozi*

The softest thing in the world gallops through the hardest. Without substance, it enters where there is no gap. Thus do I know the benefit of non-action. The teaching without words, the benefit of non-action—few in the world attain them.

Reversion is the movement of the Dao; weakness is the function of the Dao. The things of heaven and earth are born of being; being is born of non-being.

In all under heaven, nothing is softer or weaker than water, yet nothing conquers the hard and strong as it does—nothing can replace it. Thus, the soft overcomes the hard, the weak overcomes the strong. None in the world do not know this, yet none can practice it. Therefore, the sage says: He who bears the world’s disgrace is called the lord of the altars of soil and grain; he who bears the world’s misfortune is called the king of all under heaven. True words seem contradictory.

When people are born, they are soft and weak; when they die, they are hard and stiff. When the ten thousand things and grasses and trees are born, they are soft and fragile; when they die, they are withered and dry. Thus, the hard and strong are followers of death; the soft and weak are followers of life. Therefore, when an army is strong, it will not prevail; when a tree is strong, it will be felled. The strong and great dwell below; the soft and weak dwell above.

*From the* Virtue Scripture *of Laozi*

**The Chapter on Emptiness and Tranquility**

Attain utmost emptiness, guard perfect stillness—then the ten thousand things arise together. I observe their return. Though things flourish in abundance, each returns to its root. Returning to the root is called stillness; stillness is called returning to life. Returning to life is called constancy; knowing constancy is called illumination. Not knowing constancy, one acts recklessly and invites misfortune. Knowing constancy, one is all-embracing; being all-embracing, one is impartial; being impartial, one is kingly; being kingly, one is heavenly; being heavenly, one is of the Dao; being of the Dao, one endures. Even in death, one is not imperiled.

*From the* Dao Scripture *of Laozi*

Laozi said: First, abandon form and forget the body, drifting as if nothing—this is called emptiness. Second, diminish the mind and discard intent, casting off falsity and forsaking desire—this is called nothingness. Third, concentrate the essence and accumulate spirit, not mingling with things—this is called purity. Fourth, return the spirit and serve *qi*, calm and unmoving—this is called stillness. Fifth, dwell in seclusion, keeping merit and fame concealed—this is called subtlety. Sixth, leave wife and children, wandering alone with the Dao—this is called solitude. Seventh, breathe in harmony, smooth and fine—this is called softness. Eighth, relax the body and extend the limbs, attending to all affairs—this is called weakness. Ninth, detest honor and glory, content with poverty and delighting in disgrace—this is called humility. Tenth, flee from fullness and escape excess, wearing coarse clothes and eating simple food—this is called reduction. Eleventh, act in accord with yang, responding to change and repelling evil—this is called timeliness. Twelfth, neither hungry nor cold, neither joyful nor angry, neither sorrowful nor delighted, neither slow nor hasty—this is called harmony. Thirteenth, cherish seeing, cherish speaking, cherish hearing, cherish thinking, firm and unspent, with spirit and clarity inwardly guarded—this is called frugality.

These thirteen merge into one emptiness and nothingness, forming the great essential. Self-exhausting and self-extreme, the Dao of non-action is complete. If one thing is not mastered, only emptiness is good.

When accomplishment is embodied, the spirit naturally rests. Harmonious *qi* flows, entering the sinews and bones. *Qi* refines and transforms the form, uniting with the portents. Light and soaring, one roams afar, and at life’s end, one’s destiny is fulfilled in heaven. This is not only for governing the self but for bringing peace to the myriad states.

*From the* Scripture of Emptiness and Nothingness

**The Chapter on Mountain Dwelling**

The Most High said: Dwelling in the mountains entails ten precepts:
First, one must not lead households to transform the people.
Second, one must not associate with the noble and eminent to seek fame and profit.

**Third,** one must not again practice heterodox incantations, prohibitions, or arts.

**Fourth,** one must not sell medicines or practice medicine to take others’ money or goods.

**Fifth,** one should maintain separation from others; one must not share bed or seat with worldly men, women, or those who preside over libation rites with yellow and red offerings.

**Sixth,** at dawn, noon, sunset, the hour of human rest, midnight, and cockcrow, one should pay reverence to the Heavenly Worthies of the ten directions, repent transgressions, and eradicate evil.

**Seventh,** after midday, one must not consume grains or *qi*-laden foods; anything containing grain-*qi* must not be brought near the mouth. Water jade, *zhi* stones, pine wood, Solomon’s seal, cloud essence, *lingfei* powder, wolfberry, and the like are always forbidden.

**Eighth,** when traversing the mountains to gather herbs, one should snap the fingers once every three steps and utter a chant every ten steps. With every step taken or set down, one must constantly meditate on the Dao, imagining divine beings upon the cliffs or by the path bestowing upon one the arts of immortality.

**Ninth,** if one has attained but a small measure of the Dao and has yet to achieve mastery, one must not display it ostentatiously or treat others with arrogance or disdain.

**Tenth,** one should remember the kindness of one’s parents in giving and sustaining life, never forgetting their grace.

These are the ten precepts for dwelling in the mountains, the essentials of cultivating the Dao.

*From the* Scripture of Ascending Mystery

---

For all who study the scriptures of the Six Heavens and the orthodox methods of the Three Heavens, who wander the Five Peaks and traverse rivers and marshes, one must perform the invocations of the Three Heavens’ Orthodox Unity, the rites for dispelling misfortune and trials, and the arts for summoning spirits and attaining immortality.

At the outset of ascending a mountain, one should first strike the teeth nine times outside the mountain, close the eyes, and visualize five-colored clouds surging forth to envelop the entire mountain and oneself within their *qi*. After a long while, one will see the immortals of the Five Peaks, the mountain’s forms, forests, grasses, marshes, birds, beasts, and the myriad things all coming to pay homage. Then, one should raise one’s voice in invocation:

The Supreme Emperor sets forth,
Auspicious day, propitious hour.
Jade radiance covers me,
The Great One attends as escort.
To my left, White Prime assists;
To my right, Primordial Splendor aids.
The Eight Emperors and Nine Perfected,
I meet with fortune and thrive.
The Dao guides me, the Dao sends me,
Sharing its light with me.
Treading the Five Peaks,
Immortals welcome me in throngs.
Entering rivers and seas,
Myriad paths open wide.
Commanding the Six Dings,
Revolving and seizing the Five Phases.
The Three Heavens issue decree,
Sweeping away all misfortune.
Severing and sweeping away filth,
Molten metal dispels calamity.
The orthodox method flows clearly,
Stern as frost in its might.
Luminous essence shimmers,
Dragon chariots rise proud.
Verdant plumes stream,
Flying brocade robes flutter.
Wherever I go,
All is auspicious and flourishing.
The myriad perfected come to pay homage,
Together ascending Jade Capital.

Having finished, draw in *qi* thirty-six times and swallow.

*From the* Orthodox Scripture of the Three Heavens’ True Methods *of the Cavern Realms*

---

The Perfected of the Great Ultimate said: If a Daoist wishes to dwell in secluded mountain places, one should first receive the scriptural teachings, serve one’s master with reverence, and cultivate all meritorious deeds to subdue the mountain spirits. Mountains, great or small, all possess divine spirits. If a mountain is great, its spirit is great; if a mountain is small, its spirit is small. If the mountain spirit harms a person, that person will not stand firm. If one does not comprehend the supreme method and does not know how to cultivate goodness and establish merit, how can one dwell in the mountains?

*From the* Scripture of Questions to the Cavern Mystery *(Lower Scroll)*

---

In ancient times: Those who study the supreme methods, contemplate the divine, meditate on the Dao, dwell in the mountains with tranquil resolve, perform purification rites, recite scriptures, liberate the seven generations of ancestors, and seek immortality for themselves must practice the supreme methods of the Five Elders’ Red Writ of the True Script. Following the established texts, one should first strike the teeth twelve times and invoke:

Supreme and lofty numina,
Primordial and honored spirits.
Great sages linger,
Myriad perfected descend to the hall.
Three luminaries spread their radiance,
Auspicious clouds array on all sides.
The most auspicious charts are examined,
The reckonings of the Nine Heavens are calculated.
Today I make my vow,
Presenting my petition to the numinous mountain.
Cinnabar script in red characters,
The natural true writ.
I report above to the Five Emperors,
Recording my name in the Jade Register.
The myriad spirits bear witness,
Sun and moon clearly proclaim my words.
I vow to attain the Dao, I vow to become an immortal.
Heaven and earth, stars and constellations,
Mysteriously illuminate my body.
The Three Officials and Nine Bureaus,
The great spirits of the Five Peaks,
I universally proclaim without end,
Eradicating the roots of my transgressions.
The Primordial Beginning opens wide,
None do not receive my words.
The hidden souls of my seven ancestors
Receive blessings naturally.
The three paths and five sufferings,
Forever depart from the eight difficulties.
May I share the radiance of the Three Luminaries with the purple dawn,
Turn the wheel without ceasing,
And attain the flying immortality of the body.

Having finished the petition, cast it into the abyss, then scatter incense upon the numinous mountain. Again, strike the teeth three times and face the direction of your life’s origin, invoking:

The Primordial Beginning bears witness,
My immortal name is already inscribed.
The Three Officials and Nine Bureaus,
No transgressions remain unabsolved.
Scatter incense to the Five Emperors,
Pledge alliance with the Great Void.
All that has been stated,
Shall endure for ten thousand kalpas.

Having finished, raise the head and swallow *qi* nine times.

*From the* Jade Instructions of the Red Writ of the Cavern Mystery

---

Master Lü’s oral instructions: On the day of entering the mountains, before reaching a hundred paces, first step backward seven steps, then turn and ascend the mountain. Mountain spirits will not offend one, all demons will submit and flee, and the hundred poisons will hide away.

*From the* Declarations of the Perfected

---

The Perfected of the Great Origin said: If one can remain aloof from the present age, then what one values is only oneself. Those who guard against external difficulties will have no deadly terrain. Thus, the scholars of old concealed the jade tally in the mountains, hid the luminous mirror amidst the swirling mists, composed their spirits in the courts of mountain crags, and nurtured their true nature by the banks of secluded valleys. Thereupon, they let their hair loose upon the high peaks, weaving the warp and weft of their lives, absorbing the five numina in radiant splendor. They roamed the nine paths, ascended the formless, cast their thoughts into the void, abandoned worldly affairs, preserved the three *qi*, and refined the wondrous essences. Thus, they could reverse the years of the sun’s decline, return to infancy, and enter the Dao. Entering the Dao, one attains immortality; attaining the Dao, one becomes a perfected being.

*From the* Scripture of True Traces

---

**The Chapter on Departing from the Worldly**

Laozi said: Beyond heaven and earth, there is heaven and earth; beyond the self, there is preservation of life and destiny. Thus, the noble person excels in what others do not excel in, prolongs life where others do not, delights in what others do not delight in, does what others do not do, believes what others do not believe, and walks paths others do not walk. Thus, the Dao and its virtue are complete.

Laozi said: What the scriptures and precepts declare, what dharma and principle expound—however resplendent and flourishing—is not as good as the subtle and minute. Truly, to know the void is better than to know the full; abundance is not as good as scarcity. The swift results of the crooked are not as good as the slow. What rises must fall; what flourishes must decline. The sage cuts off knowledge and acts as though not acting, speaks as though not speaking, and conducts affairs as though not conducting them. Who can understand this? The even is not as good as the odd; the many are not as good as the few. Who is wise is difficult to follow; who is benevolent is difficult to emulate. With few dependencies, one may know what is beyond knowing—the pivot of the Dao. Emptiness, annihilation, and nothingness—what need is there for immortal flight? The Great Dao is vast and boundless, unrestrained by any enclosure. If one can illuminate this, what was once deemed right becomes wrong. The scriptures speak with careful truth—who can pursue it?

*From the* Scripture of Western Ascent

The multitude bustle and rejoice, as though feasting on grand sacrifices, as though ascending springtime terraces. I alone am tranquil, showing no sign, like an infant who has not yet learned to smile. Adrift, as though with no place to return. The multitude all have more than enough, while I alone seem bereft. Ah, my heart is that of a fool! So dull! The common folk are bright and clear, while I alone seem dim. The common folk are sharp and discerning, while I alone am muddled. Vast and boundless, as though without end. The multitude all have their uses, while I alone am stubborn and coarse. I alone differ from others, cherishing the nourishment of the Mother.

*From the* Daoist Scripture of Laozi

The Perfected of the Great Ultimate said: The learning of the utmost person in cultivating the Dao consists in taking what others cannot take, enduring what others cannot endure, severing what others cannot sever, studying what others cannot study, dwelling where others cannot dwell, achieving success without seeking fame, and aiding beings without limit. Departing and returning, they guard their root, discard the ornamental and embrace the uncarved, hold fast to their resolve with single-mindedness—this may be called the practice of the Great Dao.

*From the* Scripture of the Numinous Treasure’s Naturalness

The Perfected of the Great Ultimate said: Endure what others cannot endure, sever what others cannot sever, practice what others cannot practice, dwell where others cannot dwell, wear what others cannot wear, eat what others cannot eat, guard what others cannot guard, and study what others cannot study. Then, stabilize with numinous medicines, feast upon cloud-teeth, and the corpse-worms will sink and fall, foul impurities will vanish and dissolve, the Three Palaces will be harmonized and smooth, and the Five Viscera will be at peace and ease. Engage in prolonged fasting and deep contemplation, silently chant the cavernous scriptures, delight in the wondrous flavors, and supplement with the elixir-fluid. How could one not attain the Dao of ascending as an immortal?

*From the* Scripture of the Cavernous Mystery’s Peaceful Aspiration

All people possess eyes, ears, nose, mouth, heart, and intent, yet their conduct differs. Only the foolish fix their gaze on profit and beauty, their ears crave sounds and music, their thoughts are impure, their minds are unclear, and their hands carry out deeds. Evil accumulates over time, and sins bind the celestial spirit. Only the worthy differ entirely from the common folk: their eyes do not wander excessively, and they are not startled by what they see; their ears do not trust slander, nor do they listen to chaotic sounds; their noses do not sniff fragrant and foul scents; their mouths do not taste sweetness, nor do they consume living beings; their hearts do not desire wealth, beauty, or fleeting glory; their hands do no wrong, and their feet take no evil paths—this is the conduct of the Daoist.

*From the* Scripture of Ascending Mystery

*Thus concludes* Volume Sixty-Five of the *Supreme Secret Essentials*

**Volume Sixty-Six of the Supreme Secret Essentials: The Chapter on Ritual Bathing**

The Heavenly Worthy said: For those who pursue the study [of the Dao], on the three most auspicious days of the Three Primes, refine the self with fragrant water, bathe the Five Spirits, and thus qi becomes clear and form upright, spirit bright and true essence conjoined. The body does not receive filth, qi does not receive dust; the Three Passes are pure and void, and the myriad evils do not encroach. The Three Fields and Eight Luminaries shine resplendently within the body. Through ingestion, adornment, and guiding-and-pulling, the Five Palaces are suffused with warmth, filling inner and outer, and one naturally becomes an immortal.

The Heavenly Worthy said: Always on the fifteenth day of the first, seventh, and tenth months, at the three times of dawn, noon, and midnight, bathe the bodily form and wash the self with the Five Fragrances. When about to bathe, face south and, with a golden ladle, pour fennel-scented water thirty-two times in a leftward circle toward the southeast. Open the eyes and visualize the sunlight above the left eye, moonlight above the right eye, the Five Stars’ tassels adorning the head, and five-colored clouds swirling around the body. Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, lion, and white crane array themselves to left and right. Immortal youths hold towels, jade maidens scatter blossoms, flying immortals ride mounts, and divine guardians protect the body. Then knock the teeth thirty-two times and recite the prayer:

*"Heaven’s qi is clear, the Five Colors radiant on high.*
*Sun and moon pour forth their splendor, bathing my form.*
*Divine fluids within, fragrant water refines my essence.*
*Light and brilliance shine through, illuminating the Upper Clarity.*
*Qi does not receive dust; the Five Palaces admit the numinous.*
*Sins vanish from the Three Paths; misfortunes disperse in the Nine Darknesses.*
*Evil roots are severed; blessings arise of themselves.*
*Today I make this great vow, pledging all before the covenant.*
*My body receives liberation and ascends to the Imperial Court."*

When finished, swallow saliva thirty-two times and cease. After bathing, don cap and robes, knock the teeth thirteen times, and recite the incantation:

*"The Five Turbidities are now pure; the Eight Luminaries are now bright.*
*Today I undergo refinement: sins perish and blessings arise.*
*Ever shall I join the Five Thearchs, equal in truth to the Upper Spirits."*

Then enter the chamber and practice the Dao according to the method.

*From the* Scripture of the Three Primes’ Precepts of the Cavernous Mystery

The Azure Lad and Lord said: Those who establish resolve in inner cultivation and nurture the spirit to seek immortality must bathe frequently to summon the numinous qi, so that jade maidens descend. Those who do not bathe leave the Three Palaces defiled and polluted.

*From the* Transmission of the Lady of Southern Marchmount

The Lady of Purple Tenuity said: The *Scripture of the Nine Transformations and Ten Transmutations for Renewal* of the Most High states: If one treads upon filth or any unclean place, one should first bathe and wash the body to remove it. The method uses ten ounces of bamboo leaves and four ounces of peeled white peach bark, boiled in one *hu* and two *dou* of clear water in a cauldron, not allowing it to boil over. Bathe the body with the water at a suitable temperature, and all impurities will vanish. This not only removes filth but also wards off damp impediment, sores, and itching. Moreover, bamboo is green outside and white within, and peach repels evil and breaks filth—thus these two substances are used to purge the body’s turbidity. When celestial beings descend to the mortal realm and return, they never fail to use this water to cleanse themselves. Even the common talismanic waters and incantations for rinsing and external application in the world cannot compare to this method. Bathing in it is entirely beneficial.

The Lady of Southern Marchmount said: One cannot bathe too often; the fault lies in people’s inability to do so. Frequent bathing washes away the stench of the corpse and invites the true qi to enter.

The Perfected of Pure Emptiness said: On every *jiazi* day, one must bathe.

The Lady of Purple Tenuity said: Infrequent bathing is the nature of the *po*. To oppose the *po* and reverse this is to refine its turbidity and filth, so that the *po* naturally perishes.

*From the* Declarations of the Perfected

Whenever one contemplates the Upper Dao and prays to expel the Three Worms, one should gather the roots of *bai zhi* and *qing mu xiang*, boil them in east-flowing water, and bathe the body with the decoction to repel all blood corpses and malevolent qi. It may also be blended into incense and burned to summon the divine luminaries. If *qing mu xiang* is unavailable, *bai zhi* alone may be used.

*From the* Scripture of the Yellow Writ of the Great Cavern in Forty-Four Methods

The Yellow Thearch said: Celestial Elder, seeing that the lesser omens did not know the celestial qi, received the *Scripture of the Five Numinous Talismans of the Numinous Treasure* and, according to the prognostication of the Eastern Well, bathed and purified himself on an auspicious day to receive the Numinous Treasure talismans in fasting and stillness. The times are:
- The *rending* hour of the tenth day of the first month,
- The dusk hour of the eighth day of the second month,

The times are further:
- The sunset hour of the sixth day of the third month,
- The sun’s glow hour of the fourth day of the fourth month,
- The midday hour of the fifth month,
- The *si* hour of the twenty-ninth day of the fifth month,
- The breakfast hour of the twenty-seventh day of the sixth month,
- The early breakfast hour of the twenty-fifth day of the seventh month,
- The sunrise hour of the twenty-second day of the eighth month,
- The third cockcrow hour of the twentieth day of the ninth month,
- The first cockcrow hour of the eighteenth day of the tenth month,
- The hour past midnight of the fifteenth day of the eleventh month,
- The midnight hour of the twelfth day of the twelfth month.

On these days, the celestial *qi* and the lunar lodgings of the Eastern Well converge with the incense of divine immortals; bathing on these days ensures the descent of the gods.

*From the* Scripture of the True One of the Cavern Mystery in Five Numinous Talismans

The Heavenly River irrigates the Eastern Well,
Stone radiance, the essence of the Water Mother.
Round light sweeps the numinous luminaries,
Mysterious brilliance gleams in the heights.

The Primordial Beginning parts the layered night,
Heavenly beings follow the moon’s birth.
Bathing by the rippling pool,
Dragons bear the long-rope jar.

Golden youths sprinkle fragrant blossoms,
Jade maidens stream the Five Stars.
Crowns and sashes laved in jade rhythms,
Refining and transmuting the forms of the Five Immortals.

The body perfumed, myriad gods descend,
Riding the light to ascend the heights.

*From the* Scripture of the Twenty-Four Birth Diagrams of the Cavern Mystery

Use three *hu* of water, four *liang* of *qing mu xiang*, seven *liang* of true sandalwood, and two *liang* of *xuan shen*. Combine and boil until one bubbling. When done, allow to settle and adjust to a suitable temperature for self-bathing. This is the method of the Heavenly Perfected Jade Maidens’ Mystic Water, called the *Refining the Womb Spirit Water*.

*From the* Scripture of the Cavern Spirits, *Entering the Chamber Chapter*

The Lady of the Southern Marchmount says: When entering a quiet chamber, first step forward with the right foot, then bring the left foot forward to align with the right. Once done, proceed as usual, so that one’s announcement may be presented and reach the ears above.

*From the* Declarations of the Perfected, *Lamp-Lighting Chapter*

The Lord Emperor constantly dwells within the Radiant Jasper Terrace and the Golden Chamber of Purple Doors, illuminating himself with the Luminous Mystic Lamp, extending its distant light through the eight windows. He contemplates the Great Perfected within the Five Forms, unfolds the Three Vows in the Imperial Chamber, and with emptiness above descends beneath the Purple Canopy. In the midst of nothingness, Golden Youths attend him. Naturally, he is hailed as the Lord of the Imperial Seat, governing the Mystic Palace in its entirety. The Great Scripture arises from the beginning; the wondrous Dao resides in the faintest glimmer. Now I reveal this to you—diligently uphold it.

He addressed the Upper Prime Lady of the Southern Marchmount, saying: You study the Way of the Divine Perfected and dwell above the Void Palace within the Jasper Chamber, yet you do not know to illuminate yourself with the Luminous Lamp, nor to extend the Mystic Light within the Five Viscera. Through this, you may attain clarity, and the spirits of your form and body may thereby return.

If you can light a lamp at dusk for your Original Destiny, light a lamp at dawn for your Active Year, and constantly light a lamp for the Grand Year-Star, then in these three places, your vows and contemplations will cause your body to become serene and your qi upright. The true light will shine within, and the myriad spirits will become radiantly clear.

If the Prime Lady upholds this method and practices it for three years, she will summon the Twenty-Four Night-Light Youths, whose Mystic Light will naturally illuminate, and she will no longer need to light lamps to extend her light.

If you obtain this Way and practice it for nine years, your body will become luminous, allowing you to see clearly for ten thousand miles. At dawn, you will observe the natural world, and at night, the Night-Light Youths will descend to your chamber.

Constantly light a lamp above your Original Destiny in the quiet chamber where you reside. At dusk, enter the chamber, face the lamp, and kneel. Strike your teeth twelve times and pray:

The Mystic Light illumines the Great Yin,
Eight directions shine with dawn’s clarity.
Within the secluded chamber, the body becomes serene,
Gazing upward, the radiance pierces the Highest Clarity.
The Five Clarities arise from the Luminous Terrace,
Jade Mushrooms naturally grow.
The penetrating light connects to the Great Perfected,
The myriad spirits oversee my form.
Dispelling the Nine Yin qi,
Inscribe my name in the Eastern Flower.
Preserve me without end,
Ever parallel to the sun and moon.
Deliverance from the Seven Dark Perils,
In the Southern Palace, receive renewed glory.
The Luminous Light invokes the Jade Emperor,
To receive the Scripture of Inner Contemplation.
Heaven sends the Flying Cloud Chariot,
Ascending through space, drawn by the Green Carriage.
Attaining audience in the Palace of the Great Emperor,
Advancing to bow in the Jade Emperor’s court.

Afterward, bow twice, face your Original Destiny, raise your head, and swallow saliva seven times.

Constantly light a lamp above your Active Year. At dawn, face the lamp, strike your teeth twelve times, and pray:

The bright lamp illumines my Active Year,
Scattering light that gleams in eight directions.
The radiant countenance becomes serene,
Inner contemplation shines through the empty cavern.
Unfastening the divine sash of the Spirit Child,
I commune above with the Jade Perfected.
Gazing upward to the Highest Dao,
Its cultivation vast, without trace or track.
I aspire to the descent of the Mystic Numinous,
To rein in and ride the flying dragon.
Reversing my hundred-year span,
Restoring the visage of an infant.
Bestow upon me the Western Flower Maiden,
Grant me the Golden Dawn Youth.
Attending the incense, tending to my years and destiny,
I bow my head in the Jade Emperor’s chamber.
The spirits arrive, the Way flows smoothly,
Delighted and at ease amidst the fragrant smoke.
Composing the heart, I focus on the Great Mysterious,
My essence moves the Cavernous Void.
The chamber summons the descent of Divine Aurora,
My eyes behold the Lords of the Immortal Capital.
Delivering my seven ancestors from peril,
Transforming my form to return to the Southern Palace.

Afterward, bow twice, face the lamp, and swallow qi twenty-seven times.

Constantly light a lamp above the Grand Year-Star to commune with the spirits and seek the Perfected. After three years, the Mystic Light will shine within, and the Divine Perfected will descend to bestow upon you the formula of immortality. At that time, there will naturally be a response.

Morning and evening, burn incense, strike your teeth twelve times, face the lamp, and pray:

The lamp’s flame illumines the Great Perfected,
The bright light pierces the Mystic Void.
Unfolding the Radiant Supreme Dao,
The heart focuses on the Jade Emperor’s abode.
Penetrating the empty vastness within,
The spirit beholds the body at ease.
Accumulated resonance summons the numinous descent,
The heart tranquil, the principles subtly unfold.
At dawn, I pay homage in the Great Emperor’s hall,
At dusk, I recite the Golden Perfected’s scripture.
Carefree within the Mystic Cavern,
For ten thousand years, I return to infancy.
A heavenly crown of purple aurora,
The Emperor grants a green jasper carriage.
Roaming the peaks of the Five Marchmounts,
At ease, attaining what the heart desires.
The seven ancestors escape the Three Wretched Paths,
Blessings and joy overflow in abundance.

Afterward, bow twice and swallow saliva fourteen times.

If you can constantly keep lamps lit in these three places without extinguishing them, the ancestors of the Seven Darks will escape the Ten Sufferings, ascend to the Southern Immortals, and your body will become serene and upright. The Divine Perfected will descend, the Night-Light will naturally shine, and the light will extend within and without.

*From the* Scripture of the Three Celestial Passes of the Cavern Perfection, *Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny*

**Hymn of the Luminous Lamp:**

The Most High scatters light in ten directions,
Flowering lamps convey sincerity and essence.
All heavens are likewise,
All earths become radiantly clear.
My body, too, shines through,
The Five Viscera flourish with splendor.
The blazing light illumines the Great Void,
Distant thoughts flourish in the Jade Clarity.
Cinnabar essence lodges in the Great Void,
The Mystic Yang resounds in the empty midst.
Embracing form, eradicating the roots of suffering,
Profound and wondrous, the contemplation of the True.
Dangling blossoms, unseen in substance,
Causal conditions manifest as light and image.
My body is likewise,
Riding transformation, entrusting to the flowing radiance.
The Night-Light reveals the Yang Elixir,
Shining afar into the numinous chamber.
All heavens universally display their light,
All yin is extinguished.
My spirit, too, becomes keen and bright,
Delighting in wisdom and insight.
Carefree, adapting to the Dao’s movement,
Changing and fading, following heaven’s power.
Grasping form, treading the empty cavern,
The night candle gleams with flowing splendor.

Whenever you see a lit lamp, you should gently strike your teeth three times and recite this text.

The Celestial Emperor of the Great Tenuity says: Lighting lamps without knowing this recitation allows the demonic palaces of the Six Heavens to pass over people, bringing death and fate from eight directions. The heavens will not send Jade Youths or Principal Maidens, nor will Flying Heavenly Spirits descend to you. The Ten Directions and Three Realms will not inscribe your immortal name in the Eastern Flower, and the Southern Palace will not receive the transformative Way of your seven ancestors and parents.

*From the* Scripture of the Cavern Perfection’s Great Precepts of Wisdom and Virtue

**Method for Crafting Mystic Nourishing Incense:**

Combine one *hu* of sesame paste, one *jin* of true sandalwood, one *jin* of *qingmuxiang*, one *liang* of *xuanshen*, and three *liang* of fragrant beads. Pound them to pieces and place them into the paste, seal tightly, and simmer over a low flame for half a day until ready for use as lamp oil.

*From the* Scripture of the Cavern Spirit

**Incense Varieties**
**Method for Crafting Supreme Primordial Fragrant Beads:**
Use three *jin* of *chenxiang*, two *jin* of *xunluxiang*, nine *liang* of *qingmuxiang*, five *liang* of *jishexiang*, three *liang* of *xuanshen*, six *liang* of *quetoixiang*, two *liang* of *Zhanchengxiang*, two *liang* of *baizhi*, four *liang* of true sandalwood, three *liang* of *aixiang*, four *liang* of *anxijiao*, and three *liang* of *mulan*. Pound each of the twelve ingredients separately and sift through silk. Once done, add ten *liang* of jujubes and pound thirty thousand times. Place the mixture into a vessel, seal tightly, and steam for one day. Afterward, blend with honey, pound again, and form into beads the size of *wutong* seeds. Thread them with green cord and dry in the sun. These are the Three Sovereigns’ True Primordial Fragrant Beads; burning them perfumes the Nine Heavens.

*From the* Scripture of the Cavern Spirit

The Lady of Southern Marchmount says: When burning incense, do not look back. Looking back disrupts the true *qi* and invites demonic responses.

*From the* Declarations of the Perfected

The Lord Azure Lad says: Those who engage in concentrated meditation should first burn incense to their left and right.

*From the* Scripture of Daoist Traces

**Section on Striking the Teeth**

**Section on Striking the Teeth**

The method of striking the teeth: striking the left against the left is called "Breaking the Heavenly Bell." Striking the right against the right is called "Breaking the Heavenly Chime." Striking the upper and lower teeth together at the center is called "Sounding the Heavenly Drum." If suddenly encountering inauspicious omens or malevolence, one should strike the Heavenly Bell thirty times. When traversing mountains to ward off evil, invoking mighty spirits with solemn incantations, one should strike the Heavenly Chime. When meditating upon the Dao, summoning the true and beckoning the numinous, one should sound the Heavenly Drum. Though the act of striking the teeth is singular, in truth it distinguishes left and right, upper and lower. Thus, malevolence fears the resonance of the Heavenly Bell; mountain spirits dread the motion of the Heavenly Chime; and the summoning of spirits is solemnized by the thunder of the Heavenly Drum. The notes of *gong* and *shang* follow their rhythms, subtly stirring inner resonance—one cannot seek uniformity in all things. In myriad affairs and countless matters, this principle holds. The art of striking the teeth unfolds thus, and the sounds of bell and drum differ. Therefore, the methods of the Dao must not be transgressed or confused; techniques must not be jumbled or disordered. Transgression and confusion lead to obscurity and failure; disorder brings clamor and ruin. It is not that the profound lacks coherence, but that practicing coherence without order prevents the Dao from being realized and affairs from being verified. The true path to seeking the real cannot be trodden by following tracks that lead to many faults. Striking the Heavenly Bell thirty times is not for other invocations but merely to dispel inauspiciousness. If there is a specific case at hand, follow the appropriate method; the number of strikes need not be limited to thirty.

*From the* Scripture of the Cavern Realms’ Hidden Writings of the Supreme Lord

All methods of invoking the upper realms through striking the teeth and swallowing saliva follow specific directions, with a proper sequence that must not be disordered or mixed, lest the true spirits become confused.

Striking the teeth commands the spirits; swallowing *qi* harmonizes the true. Inhaling harmony and swallowing the six fluids to circulate them, one governs the spirits by sounding the drum to set them in order. Whenever practicing the upper methods, performing rites, or making invocations, first tap the upper and lower teeth together, without striking left or right. With each breath, let there be three strikes—this is best. After completing the rites and invocations, strike the teeth again before swallowing the various *qi* and fluids. This is called "calling the spirits and harmonizing the true" to seek ascent as an immortal.

*From the* Declarations of the Perfected

**Section on Incantations and Invocations**

Whenever Daoists retreat into mountain forests to meditate and seek communion with the numinous, or when reciting cavern scriptures and emitting resonant sounds, they are often tested and thwarted by the Great Demon of the Northern Emperor. At dusk and night, one should strike the teeth thirty-six times, then recite the following incantation:

Great Demon King of the Northern Emperor,
Before the Lord who receives your service,
Ghosts of the Yellow Springs, the Four Brightnesses, and Mount Feng.
A thousand demons with jumbled forms, nine heads sharing one body.
Divine tigers spewing venom, beheading with thunderous might.
Divine Lords uttering curses, slaying without partiality.
By the command of the Grand Tenuity, mountains and rivers are subdued.
Ringing bells cast as one, radiance flows through the Nine Heavens.
Wind and fire launch expeditions, divine blades arrayed in thousands.
Malevolent spirits are subdued and destroyed, myriad demons annihilated.
Should any demonic toxin dare arise, it shall be sealed within the Three Passes.
I invoke the cavern law—let none disobey these words.

After reciting, strike the teeth another thirty-six times. This is the correct method of the Three Heavens for invoking and subduing demonic spirits. Practicing it regularly ensures that divine soldiers stand guard, mountain and river spirits are subdued, a thousand demons are sealed away, and myriad evils cannot intrude.

Whenever Daoists travel alone and lodge in mountain forests or temple precincts—places teeming with demonic spirits and malevolent ghosts—first strike the teeth thirty-six times, hold the breath, and softly recite:

Yang *qi* of the Great Emperor,
Four Netherworld Gates and hidden passes,
A thousand demons and myriad toxins—
Dare any confront me?
Divine beasts with layered jaws, rending bellies and devouring livers.
Divine envoys of efficacious power, guarding and defending the encampment.
Soldiers of the Yellow Prime Master, slaying and vanquishing demonic ghosts.
Sincerity destroys a thousand demons, crushing and casting down the wicked.
Extinguishing their kind, severing their lineage, seizing their lives and annihilating them.
Jade Emperor and Supreme Lord, purify and sweep the Three Origins.

After reciting, strike the teeth another thirty-six times. This is called the "Inner Invocation of the Supreme Emperor to Brandish the Divine," the method for sealing and destroying myriad demons. Regular recitation ensures that divine soldiers appear for protection, myriad ghosts submit to service, and a thousand demons remain eternally subdued.

*From the* Scripture of the Yellow Simplicities of the Cavern Realms’ Forty-Four Methods

For all who make vows, seek the Dao, present petitions, or conduct affairs, first face east, strike the teeth three times, hold incense, and recite the incantation:

Supreme Three Heavens,
Primordial Three *Qi* of the Mysterious Origin,
Most High Lord Lao,
Summon forth the Three and Five Merit Officers of my body,
Left and right official envoys,
Left and right incense-bearers,
Courier dragon riders,
Incense-attending Golden Lads,
Jade Maidens who transmit words,
Direct talismans of the Five Emperors—
Let thirty-six of each emerge.
Open the local earth gods and the true officials of the four directions.
As I now burn incense and make this invocation,
May the *qi* of the ten directions’ true and correct ones enter my body,
So that what I invoke may ascend directly to the presence of the Most High, Perfect, and Great Sage, the Jade Emperor.

Whenever those who study the Dao make vows, seek something, or practice the upper methods, failure to first make this invocation allows demonic and evil forces to intrude, preventing their efforts from reaching the upper realms. Their practices will lack resonance, the divine will not witness them, and their labor will be in vain.

The Dao states: Those who study the upper methods, meditate upon spirits, contemplate the Dao, dwell in mountains with tranquil minds, practice purification rites, recite scriptures, deliver the seven ancestors, and seek immortality for themselves—when performing the upper methods of the Five Elders’ Red Writ of the True Text, they must follow the ancient texts. First strike the teeth eleven times and recite the incantation:

Mysterious and exalted numinous ones,
Venerable Divine Origin.
Great Sage who lingers, myriad perfected ones who attend.
Three luminaries spread their radiance, auspicious clouds arrayed on four sides.
Above, the auspicious charts are examined, the Nine Heavens calculated.
Today I make my vow and present my petition to the numinous mountain.
Cinnabar script in red characters, the natural true text.
Report to the Five Emperors, inscribe my name in the Jade Register.
Myriad spirits witness and reflect, sun and moon clearly attest.
May I attain deliverance, may I attain life, may I attain spirit, may I attain immortality.
Heaven and earth, stars and constellations, mystically illuminate my body.
Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, great spirits of the Five Marchmounts.
Universally proclaim without end, erase the roots of my sins.

The Primordial Beginning unfurls, none dare withhold their words.
Seven generations of shadowed souls receive blessings by nature’s grace.
Three paths and five sufferings, forever parted from eight perils.
Attaining union with the Three Luminaries, together they shine in the purple dawn.
Revolving without end, the body ascends as a flying immortal.

When finished, read the petition aloud and cast it into the abyss of sheer cliffs,
then scatter incense upon the numinous mountain.
Again, knock the teeth three times and pray toward one’s life-destiny, saying:
May the Primordial Beginning witness and reflect—my immortal name is inscribed.
Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, no sin remains unabsolved.
Scatter incense to the Five Emperors, pledge alliance with the Great Void.
Let what has been petitioned stand, dwelling through ten thousand kalpas.

When done, raise the head and swallow the ninefold qi to conclude.
