The Rite of Presenting Aspirations to the Imperial Lord’s Five Vows for Ascension

On the ninth day of the ninth month, the fifth day of the tenth month,
the third day of the third month, the eighth day of the fourth month,
and the seventh day of the seventh month—these are the five vows and ten assemblies of the year.
Ascend to the Jade Terrace of the Great Ultimate, within the golden chamber of the Jade Palace,
and meditate upon the Five Vows in the secluded sanctuary.
Yearn for the Mysterious True One to descend of their own accord,
and with emptiness and non-being, present a jade missive.
Let the golden sound resound through the Great Void,
summon the Five Emperors to guard the numinous,
and celebrate the myriad assemblies in the cinnabar chamber.
Thus, through devotion, the true ones are moved to respond,
and the true ones, stirred by devotion, descend.

On that day, bathe in purity and fast,
enter the chamber to burn incense,
bow in reverence to the four directions,
and sit upright facing east.
East is the direction of eternal yang and the first radiance.

Knock the teeth thirty-six times.

First Vow: May I be born of the qi of nature,
may qi coalesce to form my body,
may my body turn in unison with the Three Luminaries,
and may I eternally partake of the root of boundless existence.

Second Vow: May my body ever dwell above the Great Void,
within the jade palace and gemstone chamber,
feasting with the Jade Emperor by day,
sharing a table with the Mysterious Mother by night.
When thirsty, may I drink from the vast wellspring and jade mushrooms;
when hungry, may I consume dragon embryos, jade-rich fat, and the red fruits of the descending tree.

Third Vow: May my body bear ten thousand marvels,
seventy-two radiant lights, wondrous fur and extraordinary bones.
May I don feathered robes and soar,
riding the void and mounting the sky,
entering and exiting the imperial palace,
with myriad blessings converging,
and boundless longevity.

Fourth Vow: May I be born with the non-existent,
may I die with the non-existent,
dying yet living again,
and in life becoming lord of the empire.
May I govern the Ten Heavens,
overseeing all living beings.

Fifth Vow: May all sentient beings, born and unborn,
together preserve the Three Luminaries of sun, moon, and stars.
May those of the Dao and the sevenfold ancestors of the Mysterious ascend to the Southern Palace.
May the world’s blessings be without exception,
and may the Five Vows of the four directions converge in the Jade Hall.

Next, present the Nine Mysteries to uphold and nurture my body,
so that the hun-soul, po-soul, and true spirit eternally dwell within my palace,
communing above with the celestial immortals,
and below with the abyssal depths.
Vow to Heaven, vow to Earth,
vow to Wind, vow to Cloud,
vow to Spirit—
the Five Vows unite as one,
inscribing my name in the register of eternal life.
Purple mists descend from Heaven,
the Five Numinous Ones guard the Earth.
Riding clouds and mounting the void,
ascending in a jade-green chariot,
I arrive at the Golden Gate,
advance to the Jade Purity,
and extend blessings to the seven generations of ancestors,
reborn into womb-existence.

The Middle Vows, also five in number, attain the root of the Dao.
Vow to Yin, vow to Yang,
vow to the Great Void, vow to the Great Non-Being,
vow to the Great Mystery.
Feasting in the Jade Chamber,
bound by destiny to the Emperor,
I roam the Gate of Life,
traverse the Nine Heavens,
recorded without a father in the register,
my years inscribed by the Mysterious Mother.
Peaches of well-being and essence congeal,
fortifying the cinnabar field.
My body ascends to the Golden Gate,
my name inscribed in the Jade Register.
Seven generations of ancestors are liberated,
and blessings converge.

The Lower Vows, also five in number:
vow to the Great Void, vow to the Great Existence,
vow to the Great True, vow to the Divine Immortals.
May I traverse the summits of the Five Marchmounts,
drift among the ninefold skies,
enter and exit the Gates of Opening,
and escape the portals of death.
Beyond these, vow that Heaven and Earth be my parents,
the Three Luminaries guard my body and years,
the myriad spirits protect the nine apertures of my source,
and true numina descend the qi of nature.
May the Five Vows of the eight directions converge as one.

When the Five Vows are complete, knock the teeth fourteen times and recite the incantation:
Supreme Emperor of the Upper Origin,
Scripture of the Imperial Unity and the Mysterious.
Five clouds scatter radiance,
pervading the Three Purities.
Jade lads and jade maidens
burn incense and attend the numinous.
The vows presented unfold,
uniting with my form,
enabling me to become a divine immortal
and ascend to the imperial court.
The Northern Emperor severs death,
the Southern Culmen inscribes life.
The Golden Register of the Eastern Florescence
records my name.
Boundless vows
unite with me as one.

When the incantation is finished, knock the teeth twenty-one times.
Raise the head and swallow qi five times to conclude.

This is the method by which the Imperial Lord presents vows and unites form with the numinous.
Those who regularly practice this will be attended by jade blossoms and guards,
jade lads scattering incense,
their ascent reaching the Nine Heavens,
moving the Emperor to respond.
After five years of such practice,
the true spirits will manifest,
and the vows of the ten directions and those of the Dao
will descend without fail.

From the *Scripture of the Three Charts of the Heavenly Pass and the Seven Stars’ Transference of Degrees*:

The Twelve Vows of the Imperial Lord are titled:
Vow to Heaven, Vow to Earth,
Vow to Wind, Vow to Cloud,
Vow to Yin, Vow to Yang,
Vow to the Great Void, Vow to the Great Non-Being,
Vow to the Great Existence, Vow to Self-Generation,
Vow to Spirit-Generation.

From the *Eight Interstices of the Mysterious Mother*:
May the Mysterious Mother be born with me in the space of generative qi,
dwell with me between the sun and moon,
preserve me within the Nine Heavens,
feed with me from the natural bounty,
drink with me from the Gourd River,
rest with me in the Jade Truth,
sleep with me in the Immortal Hall,
and roam with me among the Three Mysteries.

The adept, in a separate chamber, should constantly recite this scripture,
never forgetting it for even a moment.
This is the method by which the Imperial Lord presents the Eight Interstices of Inner Vows.

Now, the immortals of the Five Marchmounts and the divine women of the Divine Continent
still partake of jade cups and sip unicorn jerky,
reciting great vows,
presenting the Eight Interstices,
awaiting the Primal Simplicity,
honoring the Three Origins,
aspiring to the Dawn of the Empyrean,
becoming Jade Perfected,
liberating seven generations,
and entering the Broad Cold Palace.
How much more so for those of the mundane world—
the base and the fivefold defilements of the humble!

How then could one dare to neglect cultivation or hesitate to practice? Though the body and spirit be refined, if one suffers through endless rebirths with seven generations of unabsolved sins, there can be no hope of immortality. One must therefore invoke the Great Vows, present the Eight Interstices, and thereby dissolve the accumulated knots of karma. Once the Seven Trials bestow their blessings, the adept shall not die; non-death is the root of attaining the Dao and the origin of becoming an immortal. Those who dedicate themselves to this practice—how could they fail to join the ranks of the eternally abiding?

The Twelve Vows of the Nine Heavens’ Imperial Lord are titled thus:

**First Vow:** To the Nine Numinous Mysterious Mother, the Eight Gate Spirit Tablets, the Five Penetrations of Primordial Return, and the dispelling of worldly calamities; to bestow blessings upon the seven ancestors, to attain immortality in one’s own person, to meditate in the secluded chamber, to scatter incense and rectify the smoke, and to recite the *Scripture of the Golden Flower of the Great Cavern*, saying:

*To the Northern Culmen Heavenly Sovereign, the Supreme Unity Imperial Lord; to the Two Radiant Circles of Jade Purity and Purple Void; to the Supreme Great Dao; to the Three Origins of Primal Simplicity; to the Four Directions and Five Elders; to the Six Canopies and Seven Dawns; to the Eight Superiors and Nine Numinous Ones; to the Hidden Dao and Returning Origin; to the Mysterious Mother and Five Penetrations; to the Golden Flower High Immortals; to the Celestial Master Who Oversees Life; to the Heavenly Spirits Who Govern Birth; to the Qi of the Supreme Subtlety Heaven—by virtue of this offering, may the Nine Mysterious Ones protect my soul and sustain my spirit, may the luminous primordial qi converge within me. I raise my gaze to summon the Five Penetrations of the Supreme Immortals above, and bow to invoke the Hidden Dao and Returning Origin below. May the accumulated sins of seven generations, measured by the Dipper, now be dispersed. May I receive blessings in the Southern Palace, where incense is sprinkled and the Eight Gates open.*

**Vow to Heaven, Vow to Earth, Vow to Wind, Vow to Clouds—**
when these four vows unite, the register of longevity is secured.
Heaven nurtures the root of the embryo,
Earth aids the radiant spirit.
The divine wind fans with eight wings,
the luminous clouds flow and fill.
I and the Imperial Lord
ascend together to the Upper Clarity.
Gazing toward the Northern Mystery,
untying my sash in the Jade Court,
I celebrate the seven ancestors,
and the Mysterious Trials yield their blessings.

**Second Set of Four Vows:**
May the four directions be illuminated,
and my lifespan rival the sun’s decline.
The middle vows, also four, govern the administration of the Imperial Scriptures:
**Vow to Yin, Vow to Yang, Vow to the Great Void, Vow to the Supreme Non-Being.**
Here dwell the Three and Five Luminous Spirits,
the abodes of the Seven and Nine.
The Imperial Lord has no father,
for he was born at the dawn of fixed life.
The Jade Emperor’s chariot congeals,
ever present at my dwelling.
I abide in the Purple Chamber,
where the Mud-Pellet Palace flourishes.
Yin congeals and blood is fortified,
the soul is born in the Great Yang.
The numinous void reflects its radiance,
the Supreme Origin strides onward.
The Nine Qi of the Void
clothe me in yellow robes.
The Seven Trials confer blessings,
and I receive immortality in the Southern Palace.

**Third Set of Four Vows:**
For a life eternal in the Immortal Palace,
**Vow to the Great Void, Vow to the Great Possession.**
May the spirit dwell in the Nine Heavens,
the form wander the true realm.
The Imperial Lord merges and harmonizes,
revolving through the Seven and Nine.
Misfortune departs my chamber,
fortune comes to me.
Evil words vanish and are forgotten,
while compliant words and good deeds flourish.
**Further Vow:** May I be born of Heaven and Earth as my father.
**Further Vow:** May my spirit be born of harmonious qi as my mother.
The Five Penetrations of Returning Origin
dispel the stains of sin.
Blessings crown seven generations,
transcending life after life.
May my vows ascend to the August Emperor,
may the Imperial Lord join in the chant.
The chant’s tones soar to the empyrean,
eight echoes resound ten thousandfold.
The numinous brush reverses the balance,
a thousand perfected ones share the reward.
From kalpa to kalpa,
we shall forever celebrate the Twelve Joys.
Great is the Imperial Lord’s grace—
ten thousand blessings return in the Mirror of Origin.

**Further Vows:** The Mysterious Mother of the Eight Interstices composes the divine chant of the Eight Interstices, her gaze profound as the Nine Numinous Cavern.

**First Vow:** May the Mysterious Mother be born with me amid the qi of life, that the Purple Radiance may illumine the void and the celestial and human realms unite in accord; may flying immortals bathe in feathers, and I join them; may heavenly music delight the heart, freeing me from a hundred sorrows; may the Seven Mysterious Ones construct blessings, upheld by the Supreme Spirits.

**Second Vow:** May the Mysterious Mother abide with me amid the sun and moon, at the juncture of the Three Luminaries, where the Great Emperor’s chariots run parallel, where azure banners and emerald canopies, embroidered carriages and brocade robes, jade belts and jeweled sashes accompany the Five Elders, joining the Four Great Ones as guests, entering the banquet of the Flowery Canopy, gazing beyond the Eight Extremities.

**Third Vow:** May the Mysterious Mother guard me amid the Nine Heavens, where the True Perfection congeals and leaps, the mind is inwardly refined, and qi overflows the Cloud Hall, summoning myriad spirits. May my body ascend to the Nine Empyreans, the Trials bestow layered blessings, the sash loosen into the Void, the wheels stack to the heavens. May seven generations prosper, and I, reborn as a human, safeguard the Supreme Perfected, sharing the sun’s longevity.

**Fourth Vow:** May the Mysterious Mother dine with me amid the natural, forever departing the Three Wretched Realms, eternally joining the natural. May the Seven Treasures and jade nectar, the golden elixir and purple effulgence, the hidden mushrooms plucked right and left, the night-glowing pearls, phoenix brain, and tiger foam, the cloud jades and frost of langgan, and rare delicacies be my sustenance, my body brushing the Great Void.

**Fifth Vow:** May the Mysterious Mother drink with me amid the Gourd River, where the flowing springs cascade a myriad cliffs, pure and sweet. May the returning waters and jade essence, the numinous moisture and azure blue, pour upward to the remotest empyrean, streaming into the divine hall. May the waves surge and swell, stirring the Great Void, floating and roaming the vast clarity. Drinking and rinsing at the Eastern Peak, I bow to the Dawn of the Empyrean, entrusting my joy to the azure waves. May the Seven Trials attain immortality, blessings overflowing, the body pledged to the Nine Rivers, all directions prospering.

**Sixth Vow:** May the Mysterious Mother rest with me amid the Jade Truth, where the exalted seat stretches vast, the abyss profound and the empyrean clear. May the Five Elders array the chamber, the Jade Flower proclaim the numinous, the Queen Mother’s flying carriage and feathered banners stream past. May I rest with her in the courtyard of the Nine Mysterious Ones, the Seven Trials celebrated, the embryo received and reborn, the body coiled in the jade realm, the spirit nesting in perfect clarity.

**Seventh Vow:** May the Mysterious Mother sleep with me amid the Immortal Hall, where the secluded chamber is numinous and remote, the Mysterious Flower arrayed on four sides. The vermilion hall is phoenix-wrought, radiant light illuminating the carriage. The golden bed and jade couch, the purple curtains and dragon gates, the exalted seat of the Mysterious Emperor, the central mat of the Heavenly Perfected—I occupy the right, entwined in sashes. May the Seven Trials receive great blessings, the scriptures bestowed, and immortality attained.

**Eighth Vow:** May the Mysterious Mother roam with me amid the Three Mysteries, where the reins are loosed in the Great Desert, the carriage turns through the Three Mysterious Realms. May the Five Numinous Ones support my bones, the Queen Mother stand shoulder to shoulder with me. Dancing carriages on the divine mound, halting the chariot in the Nine Heavens, the scriptures of the Supreme inscribed, the rank of Perfected received. The feminine and primordial unite, from billions to thousands. The *Cavern Scripture* resounds with eight echoes, the seven ancestors attain immortality. From kalpa to kalpa, we forever gather at the Eight Interstices—where do the Eight Interstices reside?

Everlasting are the karmic conditions. The Five Elders descend with blessings, the Dao and virtue flourish abundantly, the myriad qi ascend and thrive, firmly guarding the Mud-Pill Palace. Once the vows are spoken, sun and moon share the same span. O vast and empty Primordial Mother, moving and still amid the Eight Gates.

—Excerpted from the *Scripture of the Five Mornings of Concealed Primordial Gold-Flowered Jade of the Cavern Reality*

The eight nodal days of the year are all days when the immortals of the Three Heavens gather for audience and ritual assembly. When the adept performs the rites, makes vows, and pays homage to the deities, they should always choose these days. As for the rites performed at the new and full moons, these are not of the highest method.

On any of these days when one wishes to perform the rites and make vows, at the time of presenting the prayers, one should first knock the teeth seven times, bow in the heart to the four directions, and softly pray:

Supreme Clarity Jade Emperor, Three Primordial Sovereign Ladies of the Plain,
Most High and Lofty Spirits, Great Divinities of the Immortal Capital.
On this auspicious day, the Eight Vows are declared.
The highest vow: to soar through the clouds, attaining long life as a divine immortal.
The middle vow: for heaven and earth to unite in radiant winds and clouds.
The lower vow: for the five viscera to remain with the body forever.
Next vow: for the seven ancestors to be released from nets and freed from transgressions.
Further vow: for the Lord Emperor to sever the roots of the womb’s bonds.
Sixth vow: for generation after generation, wisdom to unfold.
Seventh vow: to extinguish demons, beheading the gods of the Six Heavens.
Eighth vow: for numinous descent, perceiving clearly east and west.
May the highest vow be fulfilled, and none fail to come to pass.
Vows to the spirits, vows to the immortals, ascending to pay homage to the Three Origins.

After the prayer, bow again as before. One may also express one’s intentions freely, seeking liberation for the seven ancestors’ transgressions, the sins of the head and body, to be appended to the conclusion of the ritual. This is called the *Concealed Prayer of the Three Origins and Eight Audiences*, the essential method of the highest vows to the immortals. Practicing this for three years will dissolve the sins of the seven generations of ancestors, parents, and oneself. Thereafter, the Jade Flower will descend to guard, and the spirits will respond in resonance. When the Eight Vows are declared, one will surely obtain the essential契 of the numinous.

—Excerpted from the *Scripture of the Yellow Plain and Forty-Four Directions of the Cavern Reality*

The Dao speaks: Upon seeing those dwelling at home with wives and children, one should vow that all may swiftly escape the prison of love, restraining the mind and upholding the precepts. Upon seeing those drinking wine, one should vow that all may restrain themselves at the Gate of Life, distancing themselves from calamity and chaos. Upon seeing beauties, one should vow that all may guard their passions and endure desire, aspiring to virtue. Upon seeing the licentious, one should vow that all may cast aside impure thoughts, lifting their hearts to the prohibitions. Upon seeing women, one should vow that all may tread the path of trust and proper transformation, entering daily into the Dharma gate. Upon seeing sentient beings, one should vow that all may yield to others without contention, embracing the Dao and bringing peace to the world. Upon seeing the virtuous, one should vow that all may constantly hold them in mind, emulating their Way. Upon seeing the wicked, one should vow that all may abandon evil and turn to good, not transgressing the king’s law. Upon seeing the poor, one should vow that all may diminish their own bodies to bestow kindness, later receiving great blessings. Upon seeing the wealthy, one should vow that all may save and relieve the myriad beings, receiving emoluments for generations. Upon seeing the noble, one should vow that all may heed their teachings, fully conforming to the canonical instructions. Upon seeing the lowly, one should vow that all may diligently cultivate without remiss, each attaining their aspirations. Upon seeing the emperor, one should vow that all may revere and uphold the kingly Way, filial as to parents. Upon seeing ministers and chancellors, one should vow that all may receive their teachings and governance, with the four directions returning to benevolence. Upon seeing soldiers and armor, one should vow that all may each cherish a heart of benevolence, yielding the world to the worthy. Upon seeing princes, one should vow that all may daily sing of great peace, sustaining the state and inheriting the household. Upon seeing the worthy, one should vow that all may follow their virtue, the Dao becoming the world’s model. Upon seeing those of heterodox teachings, one should vow that all may clearly understand the roots of the teachings, attaining the Dao like spirits. Upon seeing Daoist recluses in the mountains, one should vow that all may fully enter the gates of the Dao, swiftly ascending as immortals. Upon seeing education and transformation, one should vow that all may personally receive the sagely teachings, becoming vast and profound. Upon seeing sages, one should vow that all may honor and attend them, with all nations gazing upon them universally. Upon seeing immortals, one should vow that all may perfect the true Dao, flying and ascending to the heavens. Upon seeing city walls, one should vow that all may be strictly ordered and well-maintained, taking the Dao as their foundation. Upon seeing great nations, one should vow that all may return to reverence and admiration of virtue, like waters flowing to the sea. Upon seeing small nations, one should vow that all may know restraint and emptiness, content in their abodes. Upon seeing markets and courts, one should vow that all may gather the worthy like clouds, fully propagating the proper Dao. Upon seeing quiet contemplation, one should vow that all may accumulate towering merit, with gods and humans attaining their aspirations. Upon seeing purification rites and incense offerings, one should vow that all may daily renew their virtue and power, with academies refined and upright. Upon seeing scripture recitation, one should vow that all may ascend the high seats, all heeding the sagely decrees. Upon seeing towers and observatories, one should vow that all may penetrate and perceive the ten directions, with nothing hidden. Upon seeing high mountains, one should vow that all may establish virtue like them, never regressing. Upon seeing the great sea, one should vow that all may possess boundless wisdom and thought, aiding in the completion of family and state. Upon seeing repose in lush forests, one should vow that all may complete their studies as Confucian masters, nurturing disciples and spreading teachings. Upon seeing clean hands, one should vow that all may constantly hold scriptures, never ceasing for a moment. Upon seeing eloquent speech, one should vow that all may delight in chanting the Cavern Scriptures, daily renewed without weariness. Upon seeing moving feet, one should vow that all may transcend the Three Realms, flying to the Supreme Clarity. Upon seeing stillness, one should vow that all may extinguish their luminous traces and halt their perfection, resting in tranquil emptiness. Upon seeing food and drink, one should vow that all may cast off burdens and enter purity, preserving the flavor of the Dao. Upon seeing great storehouses, one should vow that all may eliminate disasters and calamities, acting as fields of blessing. Upon seeing illness and disease, one should vow that all may rely on the Dao for protection, avoiding these bitter afflictions. Upon seeing death and mourning, one should vow that all may study the Dao and abide forever, delivering beings from the Three Wretched Paths. Upon seeing fishing and hunting, one should vow that all may not commit sins, ultimately entering non-action. Upon seeing barbarians, one should vow that all may become guests within the central kingdom, not born in borderlands.

Upon seeing the young, one should vow that all may study diligently in their time, achieving noble renown. Upon seeing the aged and infirm, one should vow that all may nurture life through the Dao, avoiding further decline and senility.

Upon seeing the Three Luminaries, one should vow that all may shine with radiant brilliance, dispelling darkness and obscurity. Upon seeing clouds and rain, one should vow that all may be filled with beneficent moisture, lacking nothing in abundance.

Upon seeing pristine snow, one should vow that all may dwell in purity and whiteness, carefree and at ease. Upon seeing the numinous wind, one should vow that all may open their hearts and scatter their cares, their virtue flowing far and wide.

Upon seeing deep waters, one should vow that all may wash away filth and attain clarity, their minds equanimous. Upon seeing fragrant incense, one should vow that all may receive beauty and flourishing fragrance, while all impurities vanish.

Upon seeing fine blossoms, one should vow that all may delight in scattering offerings to the sages, their marks of excellence complete. Upon seeing carriages and horses, one should vow that all may attain the Dao and embrace non-action, riding phoenixes and driving dragons.

Upon hearing stringed music and song, one should vow that all may recite and expound the scriptures, finding joy in the Dao. Upon seeing blessed food, one should vow that all may be sated and fulfilled, enjoying the celestial kitchens of the world, their virtue flowing to their hosts like water to the sea, their ancestral lines enduring, ever dwelling in nobility and prosperity, born with the four assemblies into royal households.

Upon seeing repentance offered, one should vow that all may have their misfortunes extinguished in the Nine Yin, their blessings arising in the Ten Directions, their virtue like mountains and seas, all flourishing without exception, their seven generations ascending to heaven, their descendants wise and loyal, their wealth and honor towering, their desires all fulfilled, studying the Dao to become flying immortals, riding clouds and mounting dragons.

Daoists, whether sitting or lying down, should constantly vow that their four great elements harmonize in virtue, their bodies in unity with the true Dao.

—From the *Dongxuan Dingzhi Jing*

The study of the Dao begins with a sincere heart,
Honoring one’s teacher as one’s closest kin.
Drawing in the luminous and aligning with clarity,
Diligently progressing with each new day.
While others remain undelivered,
One must not seek deliverance for oneself alone.
Great vows bear weighty recompense,
And profound virtue is surely thus.

Deep-rooted sins of hidden evil
Return like a turning wheel.

—From the *Dongxuan Yinzhu Jing*

The Immortal Duke inquired of the Supreme Master of the Great Ultimate Perfected One: "What cultivation of fundamental conduct allows one to receive blessings in this life, ensuring one’s family and lineage are upright, descendants prosperous, and good karmic connections unbroken across generations, ascending to the heavenly halls above or being reborn among humans in the households of marquises and kings, endowed with wisdom, benevolence, and reverence for the scriptures, delighting in mountains and rivers, constantly reciting subtle teachings, and ultimately attaining the Dao of immortality?"

The Master replied: "Excellent is your question! Each person’s life has its fundamental conduct, the roots of destiny from past causes, with myriad interconnections, vows following one another, like attracting like, unfolding in succession, fortune and misfortune drawing one another—thus their continuity across lifetimes. Their preferences differ, their intentions vary, all stemming from prior vows.

To cultivate the Dao and forge bonds with the worthy and sagely, one must uphold the great precepts, widely establish fields of blessing, and vastly initiate meritorious deeds. Some may thereby attain the rank of flying immortals, some celestial immortals, and some earthbound immortals."

Some may thereby attain rebirth in heavenly realms through the transcendence of their allotted lifespan; some may become spirits and deities; some may ascend as officials under the Six Heavenly Demon Kings; some may directly attain rebirth in the households of marquises and kings, honored among men; some may become objects of universal reverence, possessing all under heaven in abundance; some may attain keen intelligence and wisdom; some may acquire dignified bearing, resonant voice, and fragrant qi; some may be beloved for their loyalty, filial piety, chastity, and simplicity; some may excel in literary composition, their every movement a model of propriety; some may command awe and reverence, even from the most generous patrons; some may devote themselves to the Three Treasures, offering unwavering reverence, delighting in mountains and rivers, cherishing the purity of scriptures, burning incense, and observing fasts; some may venerate the Mysterious Origin; some may have their female form transformed into male, their appearance refined and elegant; some may ensure their household’s solemn purity, their karmic bonds spanning generations, their original vows fulfilled, and virtuous sages reborn as their descendants, bringing boundless peace and nobility; some may reap blessings in this life and receive their due reward at life’s end; some may inherit blessings in future lives, receiving the merit of their past deeds.

What, then, is the purpose of the Dao? It is to respond to all beings without deliberate intent. The four assemblies cultivate blessings and virtue, each according to their original vows. The rewards of blessings all stem from the vows one establishes in due time. Once meritorious deeds are performed and aspirations are set, their recompense is as certain as the coming of dawn after dusk.

Yet the people of the world, shallow and faithless, dismiss the Dharma’s teachings as mere "ghostly marks," following their own whims, scorning past karma as fabrication, mocking the sacred scriptures as falsehoods. They glut themselves on desires, expecting immediate rewards for their meager offerings, demanding swift returns while the Way’s response remains distant. Thus, the profound teachings grow dim, the world’s moral order collapses, and heaven and humanity suffer—all due to their own misguided conduct. The Supreme One laments this deeply.

The Heavenly Lord of the Southern Culmen said: "Those who seek the Dao of immortality must first establish their vows before pursuing their goal. The numinous responds to the sincerity of vows—such is the greatness of vows. Vows encompass all, blessings cover all, and felicity flows to all. Truly, they are the touchstone of goodness. If one’s heart is wholly devoted to vows, they will invariably evoke a response."

*From the* **Scripture of Questions Posed to the Mysterious** *(Dongxuan Qingwen Jing), excerpted in* **The Supreme Secret Essentials** *(Wushang Biyao), Scroll 74.*

**Scroll 76 of *The Supreme Secret Essentials*: The Chapter on Ingesting the Five Qi**

The Five True Writings of the Primordial Vermilion Script emerged within the Great Void. Before heaven and earth bore light, before the dawn of creation, the primordial root coalesced, the Three Radiances formed the Mysterious, and the five qi flowed forth. The five colors divided their brilliance, illuminating the five directions. The Five Thearchs were established, yin and yang guided their course, the pivot of the Nine Heavens turned, and the luminosity of the Five Stars revolved. The Five Marchmounts were planted to secure and pacify, while the Five Palaces were nourished to cultivate the spirit. Thus, those of utmost perfection constantly rely upon the first glimmer of yang’s light: above, they guide the primordial qi of the Origin; below, they draw the fragrant flow of Jade Spring. They direct the primordial essence to the Supreme Ultimate, summon the Five Thearchs within the numinous youth. Those who irrigate with it do not decay; those who preserve it know no end. They reverse the myriad kalpas to renew themselves, safeguarding the Five Sprouts within their countenance. Truly, this is the wondrous secret of the Numinous Treasure, the profound teaching of the myriad sages.

**Method for Cultivating the Azure Sprout: Guiding and Drawing the Nine Qi of the Azure Heaven in the East**

On the day of *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face east, and bow nine times. Sit upright, click the teeth nine times, and visualize the Azure Numinous Origin Elder Lord of the Peaceful Treasure Flower Grove in the East—surnamed Yan, named *Kaiming*, styled *Lingweiyang*—his form nine inches tall, wearing a crown of azure essence-jade, clad in a flying robe of nine qi azure feathers. He rides a chariot drawn by a green dragon, bearing a [missing character] banner, attended by the nine hundred thousand officials of the *Jiayi* Hu Elder from the Nine Qi Azure Heaven, descending into the chamber. In an instant, azure qi transforms and arises, dense as layered clouds of mist, enveloping one’s form. It enters through the mouth and descends directly into the Liver Palace.

Next, visualize Jupiter shining brilliantly in the east, its light illuminating one’s body, all made vivid and clear. Then open the eyes and recite the incantation while looking upward:

> Nine Qi Azure Heaven,
> Primordial essence of the Origin,
> August Elder, revered spirit,
> Clad in azure-feathered robes.
> Commanding the celestial officials,
> Jupiter shines resplendent,
> Scattering radiance and flowing fragrance,
> Nurturing and irrigating my form.
> Feasting on morning clouds above,
> Drawing and ingesting the essence of wood,
> Fortifying and nourishing the Azure Sprout,
> Preserving and securing decay.
> The Liver Palace overflows,
> Jade mushrooms grow spontaneously,
> Reversing years and kalpas,
> Complexion restored to youthful freshness.
> The five qi merge as one,
> Heaven and earth endure together.

Upon completion, draw in the azure qi nine times and swallow it. Then ingest the twelve characters of the Vermilion Script Jade Writ of the East.

These twelve characters are the names of the Nine Qi Azure Heaven. To guide the nine qi of the Azure Thearch and ingest the Azure Sprout, write them in vermilion on white paper. After visualization, swallow them whole. Then the qi will descend unbidden, and the Azure Thearch will manifest in response. The Five Sprouts will be fortified within the Liver Palace of the Eastern Marchmount, and jade mushrooms will spontaneously grow within the numinous youth. Keep the true writ beside your sleeping place, and the Azure Essentials will assist and command. After nine years of accumulated resonance, transformation will be swiftly accomplished. As an immortal transcending the world, you will endure for ten thousand kalpas without decline.

At cock’s crow, when yang light first divides, face east, click the teeth nine times, rub the palms until warm, and wipe the face and eyes nine times with the hands. Recite the incantation while looking upward:

> Nine Flowers of the East,
> Ingesting the Azure Sprout,
> Extending my lifespan,
> Drinking the morning clouds.

Upon completion, use the tongue to stroke the inner sides of the upper teeth, lick the lips three times, allowing Jade Spring to fill the mouth, and swallow it three times. Then draw in the azure qi nine times, allowing it to settle within the Liver Palace. The method is complete.

**Method for Cultivating the Cinnabar Sprout: Guiding and Drawing the Three Qi of the Cinnabar Heaven in the South**

On the day of *Lixia* (Beginning of Summer), at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face south, and bow three times. Sit upright, click the teeth three times, and visualize the Vermilion Numinous True Elder Lord of the Flourishing Treasure and Prosperous Yang in the South—surnamed *Dongfu*, named *Jiyan*, styled *Chibiaonu*—his form three inches tall, wearing a crown of vermilion essence-jade, clad in a flying robe of three qi cinnabar feathers. He rides a chariot drawn by a vermilion dragon, bearing a red banner, attended by the three hundred thousand officials of the *Bingding* Yue Elder from the Three Qi Cinnabar Heaven, descending into the chamber. In an instant, vermilion qi transforms and arises, glowing like the brilliance of fire, enveloping one’s form. It enters through the mouth and descends directly into the Heart Palace.

Next, visualize Mars shining brilliantly in the south, its light illuminating one’s body, all made vivid and clear. Then open the eyes and recite the incantation while looking upward:

> Three Qi Cinnabar Heaven,
> Numinous youth of the Vermilion Palace,
> Primordial Elder of the Origin,
> Triply riding the red dragon,
> Cinnabar-feathered flying robe,
> Brocade sash radiating light,
> Driving and directing the celestial officials,
> Revolving and guiding yin and yang.
> The three qi exhale radiance,
> Irrigating my Crimson Palace.
> Preserve and secure the child,
> Tempering the Sprout and adorning the countenance.
> Feasting on the vermilion dawn,
> Jade mushrooms fill and overflow,
> Reversing the kalpas’ years,
> Withered bones restored to youth.
> Longevity matching heaven and earth,
> Eternally enjoying boundless bliss,
> Body generating water and fire,
> Transforming in a hundred ways.

Upon completion, draw in the vermilion qi three times and swallow it. Then ingest the twelve characters of the Vermilion Script Jade Writ of the South.

These twelve characters are the names of the Three Qi Cinnabar Heaven. To guide the three qi of the Vermilion Thearch and ingest the Cinnabar Sprout, write them in vermilion on white paper. After visualization, swallow them whole. Then draw in the vermilion qi, causing fragrant mushrooms to flow and overflow, infusing the Crimson Palace with the Vermilion Thearch. Bind the true writ to your visualization, receive the vermilion script from the numinous youth. Preserve the Cinnabar Sprout to ensure permanence, ingest the three qi of *Zhurong*. Wield the vermilion jade tablet to communicate with the numinous, employ the Five Writs to summon the spirits. Through prolonged fasting, resonate with the Great Stillness; inscribe your name in the Southern Palace of Heaven. Truly, this is effortlessly attained and eternally enjoyed without end.

At cock’s crow, when yang light first divides, face south, click the teeth three times, rub the palms until warm, and wipe the face and eyes three times with the hands. Recite the incantation while looking upward:

> Vermilion of the South,
> Ingesting it enhances the complexion.
> Drinking from the Cinnabar Pool,
> Eternally preserving peace.

Upon completion, use the tongue to stroke the outer sides of the lower teeth, lick the lips, rinse the mouth, allowing jade mushrooms to fill the mouth, and swallow three times. Then draw in the vermilion qi three times, allowing it to settle within the Heart Palace. The method is complete.

Cultivating the Yellow Teeth: The Method of Guiding and Drawing the Twelve Qi of Wu-Earth from the Central Yellow Heaven

Regularly at cock’s crow on the days of the Spring Equinox, Summer Solstice, Autumn Equinox, and Winter Solstice, enter the chamber, face the sovereign, and bow twelve times. Sit upright, click the teeth twelve times, and visualize the Central Jade Treasure Primordial Numinous Mysterious Elder Lord—surnamed Tongban, named Yuanshi, styled Han Shuniu—whose form is one foot and two inches tall. He wears a crown of yellow essence-jade, robes of five-colored feathered garments, and rides a jade chariot drawn by a yellow dragon, bearing a yellow banner. Twelve myriad officers of the Wu-Earth Venerable Elder follow him, descending from the Twelve Qi of the Central Yellow Heaven into the chamber. In an instant, they transform and generate yellow qi, billowing like radiant clouds casting their glow, enveloping one’s body and entering through the mouth to descend directly into the Spleen Palace.

Next, visualize the Earth Star blazing brightly in the center, its light illuminating one’s body with perfect clarity. Open the eyes and recite the incantation while looking upward:

> Central Yellow Great Mountain,
> Primordial qi meanders in cycles.
> Above resides the Primordial Elder,
> Governing the four directions.
> Mounting the yellow dragon,
> Clad in five-colored feathered robes,
> Guiding and conducting the Nine Heavens,
> Turning the wheel of the celestial sphere.
> The Earth Star blazes resplendent,
> Streaming forth its radiant glow.
> Jade blossoms and fragrant mushrooms
> Fill and overflow the four quarters.
> Do they refine and irrigate my body?
> The Spleen Palace unfolds in fresh brilliance,
> Nurturing the teeth and consuming essence.
> The ten thousand spirits assemble in return,
> Binding the hun and restraining the po.
> Forging the Eight Potencies of immortality,
> Illuminating within and without.
> Ever-living and unwaning,
> Communing with the numinous and attaining the real,
> Ascending into the Grand Tenuity.

Upon completion, draw in the yellow qi twelve times and swallow. Then ingest the sixteen-character vermilion-script Jade Text of the Central Realm.

These sixteen characters are the name of the Central Yellow Heaven. To guide and draw the Twelve Qi of the Yellow Emperor and consume the Yellow Teeth, write them in vermilion on white paper, visualize them, and then ingest. This will draw primordial qi from the Nine Heavens above and pour it into the Mysterious Gate below; the Great Granary will fill of itself without root, and the Spleen Palace will be permeated without steaming. The Yellow Elder responds in resonance with mysterious harmony, and the numinous youth opens his robe to proclaim the scripture. The Yellow Simplicity circulates and moves, bestowing life east and west. Wondrous indeed is this Jade Formula, the origin of the ten thousand immortals.

Regularly at cock’s crow, when yang light first divides, face the sovereign, click the teeth twelve times, rub the palms until warm, and wipe the face and eyes twelve times with the hands. Recite the incantation while looking upward:

> Central Wu-Earth,
> Towering and majestic, the Great Mountain.
> Consuming essence and qi,
> Drinking from the Sweet Spring.

Upon completion, use the tongue to stroke the upper Mysterious Throat to gather Jade Spring, lick the lips three times, and swallow. Then draw in the yellow qi twelve times, allowing it to settle within the Liver Palace. The method is complete.

Cultivating the White Teeth: The Method of Guiding and Drawing the Seven Qi of the Western White Heaven

Regularly at cock’s crow on the day of the Beginning of Autumn, enter the chamber and bow seven times facing west. Upon completion, sit upright and click the teeth seven times. Visualize the Western Seven Treasures Golden Gate Radiant Numinous August Elder Lord—surnamed Shangjin, named Changkai, styled Bobao—whose form is seven inches tall. He wears a crown of white essence-jade, robes of sevenfold white feathered flying garments, and rides a white dragon, bearing a white banner. Seventy myriad officers of the Geng-Xin Venerable Elder follow him, descending from the Seven Qi of the Western White Heaven into the chamber. In an instant, they transform and generate white qi, vast and boundless like autumn clouds veiling the sky, enveloping one’s form and entering through the mouth to descend directly into the Lung Palace.

Next, visualize the Metal Star blazing brightly in the west, its light illuminating one’s body with perfect clarity. Open the eyes and recite the incantation while looking upward:

> Golden Numinous Seven Gates,
> Radiant and luminous, the Western Flower.
> Within resides the White August One,
> The abode of the Primordial Beginning.
> Mounting three white dragons,
> The Seven Qi towering and majestic,
> Wandering the Jade Gate,
> Scattering essence like crimson clouds.
> The Metal Star emits its glow,
> Fragrant mushrooms cascading in abundance.
> The Mysterious Grotto irrigates my body,
> Nurturing my White Teeth.
> The Bright Stone gleams with fresh light,
> Undecaying through ten thousand kalpas.
> Drinking from the Flowing Spring,
> Feasting on Grand Harmony.
> The Emperor of the Nine Heavens
> Bestows Jade Blossoms,
> Preserving years and maintaining countenance,
> The Three Luminaries unfurling their radiance.
> Abiding long between Heaven and Earth,
> The Three Lights sharing the same glow.

Upon completion, draw in the white qi seven times and swallow. Then ingest the twelve-character vermilion-script Jade Text of the Western Realm.

These twelve characters are the name of the Seven Qi of the Western White Heaven. To guide and draw the Seven Qi of the White Emperor and consume the White Teeth, write them in vermilion on white paper, visualize them, and then ingest. The gods of the Seven Qi Heaven mystically pour forth their white radiance to irrigate the Bright Stone, spontaneously generating Jade Mushrooms that permeate the Lung Palace, opening its clarity to receive the real. The Great Granary steams of itself without feeding; white clouds respond in resonance to drive and command.

Ascend the gates of the Nine Heavens in tripartite procession, and ceaselessly partake—thus shall your years equal those of the Primordial Beginning.

At cock’s crow, when yang radiance first divides, face west and strike the teeth seven times. Rub both palms until hot, then wipe the face and eyes seven times. Look upward and recite the incantation:

*"Western Bright Stone,
Consumed to extend the years.
Imbibed with numinous liquid,
One may aspire to transcendence as an immortal."*

Then, with the tongue, gather the upper teeth and lick the lips, rinsing the mouth until Jade Mushrooms fill it, and swallow thrice. Next, draw in the white qi seven times and swallow, allowing it to settle within the Lung Palace. Thus is the Dao complete.

**Method for Cultivating the Mystic Teeth and Guiding the Five Qi of the Northern Dark Heaven**

On the day of the Winter Solstice, at cock’s crow, enter the chamber and bow five times toward the north. Then, sit upright and strike the teeth five times. Visualize the Dark Lord of the Northern Cavernous Yin, the Solitary and Profound Five Numinous Mystic Elder, whose surname is Black Node, personal name Spirit Convergence, and style Hidden Marquis Bureau. His form stands five inches tall, crowned with a coronet of Mystic Essence Jade, clad in a flying robe woven of the Five Qi Dark Coral. He rides a jade chariot drawn by a black dragon, bearing a black banner, attended by fifty myriad officials of the Ren and Gui divisions, the Qiang and Elder spirits. Descending from the midst of the Five Qi Dark Heaven, he enters the chamber, where in an instant he transforms and generates black qi, its luminosity layered and shimmering like the brilliance of shooting stars. This radiance envelops your form, then enters through the mouth and descends directly into the Palace of the Sages.

Next, visualize the Water Star blazing in the north, its light illuminating your body, making all distinct. Then, open your eyes, look upward, and recite the incantation:

*"Northern Dark Heaven,
Five Qi disperse their numinosity.
Above dwells the Great Spirit,
Primordial Elder without flaw.
Riding dragons, bearing banners,
Roaming and feasting in the Upper Capital.
This day is supremely auspicious,
Auspicious clouds spread their glory.
Flying mushrooms stream and scatter,
Jade pools brim on all sides.
Jade maidens of the Mystic Spring
Irrigate my form.
The Kidney Palace is filled and settled,
Rotten teeth grow firm anew.
The palace receives true qi,
Ascending to commune with the divine.
The Five Elders descend to welcome,
The immortal Dao swiftly achieved.
Transforming water and fire,
Clad in feathered azure.
Soaring through the Great Void,
Wandering to the Purple Court.
Lifespan equal to the Three Luminaries,
Eternal through ten thousand kalpas."*

Then, draw in the black qi five times and swallow. Next, ingest the twelve-character vermilion-script Jade Text of the Northern Realm.

These twelve characters are the name of the Five Qi of the Northern Dark Heaven. To guide and draw the Five Qi of the Black Emperor and consume the Mystic Teeth, write them in vermilion on white paper, visualize them, and then ingest. Thus, the Mystic Elder records your name in the Vermilion Numinance, and the Spirit Youth inscribes your register in the Crimson Script. The Five Qi flow with mushrooms to moisten the withered abode, and Jade Springs surge forth at the Central Gate. The spirit settles the numinous chamber, and the Kidney Palace steams of itself. The Great Mystic Jade Maidens are commanded to serve east and west. Through ten thousand kalpas, you shall not decline, and the Mystic Elder shall abide with you.

At cock’s crow, when yang radiance first divides, face north and strike the teeth five times. Rub both palms until hot, then wipe the face and eyes five times. Look upward and recite the incantation:

*"Northern Mystic Essence,
Consumed to dispel the corpse.
Imbibed with Jade Nectar,
The body soars into the Great Void."*

Then, with the tongue, gather the lower teeth and lick the lips, rinsing the mouth until Jade Mushrooms fill it, and swallow thrice. Next, draw in the black qi five times and swallow, allowing it to settle within the Kidney Palace. Thus is the Dao complete.

From the *Scripture of the Vermilion Writ of the Primordial Beginning from the Cavernous Mystery*, "Chapter on Swallowing Clouds and Teeth."

The Perfected of the Great Ultimate ingests the Cloud Teeth of the Four Poles from the Upper Realm of the Immortals. The Lady of the Southern Marchmount receives the method from the Perfected of Pure Emptiness. Regularly at cock’s crow or at dawn’s repose, sit or lie as you wish and strike the teeth nine times. Then recite the incantation in silence:

*"Eastern Azure Teeth,
Purple clouds stream with rosy dawn.
The Three Primes drift in cycles,
Mystic frost and jade gauze.
Consume the morning radiance,
Imbibe the dawn’s blossom."*

When the incantation is complete, lick the outside of the upper lip with the tongue, gather the saliva, and swallow thirty times. Practicing this for ten years, the Elder of the Eastern Pole shall arrive and bestow upon you the Vermilion and Azure True Writ.

Next, recite the incantation in silence:

*"Southern Vermilion Cinnabar,
Rosy dawn illumines the Great Tenuity.
Ninefold crimson mists,
Scatter and spread their luminous splendor.
Consume the numinous dawn,
Imbibe from the Cinnabar Pool."*

When the incantation is complete, lick the outside of the lower lip with the tongue, gather the saliva, and swallow thirty times. Practicing this for ten years, the Elder of the Southern Pole shall arrive and bestow upon you the Vermilion Effulgence.

Next, recite the incantation in silence:

*"Wash the fragrant luminous stone,
Flying rosy auroras and golden liquor;
Consume the White Prime and the Great Second Luminance,
The essence of the numinous;
Imbibe the Jade Wine,
Divine blossoms awaken the spirit;
Enable me to ascend the Void,
Rising into the lofty purity."*

When the incantation is complete, lick the inside of the upper lip with the tongue, gather the saliva, and swallow thirty times. Practicing this for ten years, the Elder of the Western Pole shall arrive and bestow upon you the White Talisman of Potent Spirit.

Next, recite the incantation in silence:

*"Northern Mystic Essence,
Auspicious clouds unfold the embryo;
Verdant auroras spread the dawn,
Purple canopies and azure banners;
Consume the moon’s radiance,
Imbibe the Jade Nectar."*

When the incantation is complete, lick the inside of the lower lip with the tongue, gather the saliva, and swallow thirty times. Practicing this for ten years, the Elder of the Northern Pole shall arrive and bestow upon you the Mystic Record of Precious Luminance.

Next, recite the incantation in silence:

*"The origin of Wu and Ji,
Yellow and plain, the five clouds;
Four auroras in purple contemplation,
Eight luminaries and nine dawns;
The two hours penetrate the radiance,
Seven luminaries of the numinous honored ones;
Harmonize essence and irrigate with qi,
Consume the Central Prime;
Jade blossoms and the Dragon Embryo,
Desire the sweet spring of the divine liquor."*

When the incantation is complete, rinse the mouth with the tongue, filling it entirely—within the Mystic Breast, inside and out, between teeth and tongue, above and below—circulating and gathering the saliva, then swallowing thirty times. Practicing this for ten years, the Central Prime Lord and the Supreme August Yellow Elder shall descend, bestowing upon you the Yellow Qi of Yang Essence, the Hidden Moon within Heaven, the Green Chapter of Lingering Radiance, and the Azure Tiger Script of the Blue Waist, all uniting with the Four Elders to ascend together.

This is the supreme method of the Jade Scripture for attaining the Way of the Five Elders, cutting off grain and shedding the corpse, the face blooming with youth, transcending cold and heat, immune to calamity and suffering. The spirit becomes luminous and clear, years extend and epochs advance, life spans lengthen by ten thousand years. When the term of ten thousand cycles is reached, one shall obtain the Nine Jade Liquors and Eight Flying Essences of the Jade, then merge with the Two Luminaries, attaining a fate equal to Heaven and Earth.

For all five silent incantations, knock the teeth nine times. They may be practiced constantly, not necessarily at cock’s crow or dawn. At midnight, when all is still and the body is pure, the spirit at ease, one may proceed accordingly.

In cultivating this Way, one may consume jujubes. If hunger arises, eat wheat-based foods to gradually dispense with grain. Do not abandon it all at once—this is what is meant by "diminishing and diminishing again, until reaching non-action." This is the Way of the Void’s reflection, the natural method, what is called "drawing afar from the essence of Heaven and Earth, and drawing near from within oneself."

The Cloud Teeth are the essence and qi of the Five Elders, the auroras of the Supreme Ultimate. Thus, one gathers the radiant brilliance of the dawn to replenish the harmony of the Six Liquids. Through profound and obscure resonance, the myriad spirits descend; in the mutual seeking of the hidden and the luminous, response arises without call.

Therefore, when the dragon intones over the abyss, rosy clouds descend from the heavens; when the tiger roars on the numinous hill, the surging winds shake the four directions. The yang burning-mirror summons light, and crimson fire blazes forth; the fang-zhu vessel employs yin, and the dark stream overflows abundantly. Such is the natural course, unfathomable and unperceived.

Moreover, when the scholar anchors the heart in the mysterious and focuses on the root of the Dao, impurities dissolve from the breast, and true correctness abides in the Three Palaces. One gathers the scattered radiance of the Five Dawns and consumes the auroral nectar of the Six Divine Liquors. One recites the rare treasures of the Nine Heavens and utters the secret words of wondrous numinosity. The dragon leaps and bounds, sevenfold brilliance shines forth. One savors the Three Blossoms upon the white teeth and draws the divine liquor from the edge of the lips. Within, the Six Palaces are refined, opening wisdom and penetrating clarity. One breathes the Primordial of Heaven, tempering the hun and po to refine the form. At dawn, one summons the Primordial to serve the Mysterious, progressing toward the numinous. After ten tranquil years, the Five Spirits shall descend—what need is there for further praise!

---

From the *Dao Ji Jing*, "Feeding on the Mystic Root" Chapter:

Feeding on the qi of the Mystic Root renders the body luminous and clear within, the spirit bright and the eight senses keen. The body shines like the sun, the face gleams with jade-like luster, the eyes emit radiant light, and the teeth are suffused with purple qi, granting immortality and eternal life.

Absorbing the morning liquid, suspending the root and cutting off grain, the essentials of the Way lie in the Golden Liquor, its wonders in the Water Jade. This is what is called "exhaling and inhaling the Great Harmony of the natural, and harnessing the numinous qi of the Nine Essences."

The functioning of the Heavenly Dao values the natural; the stillness of virtue honors tranquility and joy. Embracing the natural to refine the true, and holding fast to serenity to repel the perverse—thus, transgressions do not arise, and flying harms vanish of themselves. This is the meaning of the Three, Five, Seven, and Nine, the essence of the essential Way.

At the time of rising from sleep at dawn, visualize within the mouth a white qi as large as a chicken’s yolk, and beyond the two yolks, five colors. The five-colored qi swirls and generates itself, coiling outside, and in a moment fills the heart and mouth—this is called the qi of the Three, Five, Seven, and Nine, the essence of the Mystic Root.

Further, visualize within the heart and stomach a woman in the form of an infant, unclothed, standing upright within the stomach tube, her mouth open toward the entrance of the stomach tube. She is called the Mystic Woman of the Nine Heavens, who pours and infuses the liquid of the hun. Inhale the five qi of the chicken’s yolk from the mouth above. Constantly rinse the mouth inside and out, above and below, and with the tongue, draw in the five-colored qi of the sun. When the saliva fills the mouth, swallow it, visualizing the saliva descending into the mouth of the Mystic Woman. Do this five times, then knock the teeth three times and softly recite:

*"Supreme Jade Clarity,
Nine Heavens, Nine Numinous Ones,
Govern and abide in the Mysterious Center,
The human stomach, pure and cool;
Gold harmonizes with jade’s radiance,
First born from the Void,
Named ‘Cyclic Cessation,’
Styled ‘Primordial Essence,’
Tempering the hun and restraining the po,
The heart opens, the spirit brightens;
Feeding on the Solar Essence,
Golden blossoms fill and flourish."*

After a long while, when all is complete, wipe the eyes fourteen times with the hands, then rub the hands together vigorously, massaging the face between the brows, around the doors and windows, until slightly warm, imparting a lustrous hue. This is the Way of the Supreme One for consuming the Solar Essence of the Three, Five, Seven, and Nine, the Mystic Root.

The *Supreme Secret Essentials*, Scroll Seventy-Six, concludes.
Scroll Seventy-Seven is missing.

*The Supreme Secret Essentials, Scroll Seventy-Eight: Earthbound Immortals’ Medicinal Ingredients*

The Supreme Daoist Lord said: The lesser medicines include:
Pine and cypress, yin marrow, mountain ginger, hidden essence, sweet flag, asparagus root, sesame, Solomon’s seal, chrysanthemum blossoms, wolfberry, cliff honey, poria, peach bark, alisma, Solomon’s seal root, coptis, pepper and hemp, rehmannia, red cinnabar, cinnabar powder, numinous flight, and water cassia.

The varieties are numerous; these are but a brief selection. Consuming them may yield modest benefits, yet they cannot confer eternal extension. At best, one may attain seven hundred years; at least, three or four hundred. Still, they do not permit boundless enjoyment or ascension to the Pure Heavens. Yet they can restore the body’s radiance, return the complexion to youthful whiteness, command a thousand spirits, and secure the rank of Earthbound Immortal—traversing the Five Peaks on land, roaming the famed mountains at will. Thus, one need not avoid them if they prove efficacious.

One may then gradually seek the superior medicines to renew oneself, thereby ascending step by step. Why cling to the old and refuse advancement? Yet one must accept the limits of their span.

This path demands gentleness, warmth, and benevolence, wholehearted sincerity, bodily purity, and harmonization of the five viscera. One must stabilize the form and align with the luminous, preserve the hundred spirits, guard the *hun* and refine the *po*, and purge all filth and defilement. The mind wanders in the profound mystery, free from the desires of fleeting splendor; embracing the One in solitary pursuit, unburdened by worldly dust. Pungent and acrid flavors never pass the lips; rich, bloody tastes never enter the intestines. Dwelling in mountain seclusion, detached from worldly affairs, one may above delve into the profound and preserve the true, summoning spirits and wielding numinous talismans, or below ingest the Eight Minerals and practice breath and fluid refinement.

Further categories include:
The thirty-six *zhi* mushrooms, flying furnaces and refined smoke, solar waters and lunar essences, and the rich essences of the Five Lords.

Filling the five viscera to nurture life, refining the countenance to transform the body, with resplendent blossoms like cloud-scattered fragments, golden powders and jade grains—these too can prolong years and extend lifespan, reaching ten thousand years.

Further categories include:
The nectar of Mysterious Water and Cloud Essence, the Five Yellows and Dark Spirits, the Central Essence and Dry Stones, □-grain and Multitudinous Greens, Vermilion Petals and White Chariots, the fruits of Flying Nodes, and Flowing Steeds of Purple Wood. Consuming these instantly grants one a lifespan of a thousand epochs. With each day’s ingestion, years extend; life advances with the medicine, shifting in tandem with its potency. These are the wondrous substances of boundless efficacy, the extraordinary formulas of immortality.

To attain a lifespan of a thousand epochs, one need only ingest a single dose.

**Celestial Immortal Medicinal Substances:**
Eastern Ying’s White Fragrance, Azure Coins of Canglang, Remnant Roots of High Mounds, Flying Fields of Accumulated Stones, Returning Cinnabar of the Great Void, Dark Firmness of Greater Qin, Flowing Light of Everlasting Grass, and Flying Stalks of Cloud Lads—these too enable one to ascend lightly, soaring beyond the corporeal to join the celestial perfected.

These are what celestial immortals consume, what flying spirits refine—unheard of by earthbound wanderers, unseen by mountain recluses.

One must further master the Nine Transformations and Ten Changes, the Eight Arts of Concealed Earth, only then can one roam the profound void, stride backward upon Heaven’s Edge, ride clouds and mount dragons, and ascend to soar through the heavens.

The fifth *zhi* is named White Branch Jade *Zhi*; consuming its core bestows the rank of Perfected Straightforward Censor of the Three Offices.

*(From the* Wondrous Scripture of Supreme Wisdom of the Cavernous Realms*)*

**Supreme Clarity Medicinal Substances**

**Supreme Clarity Medicinal Substances**

Ninefold-Refined Elixir of Supreme Clarity, Five-Clouds Nectar, Dark Frost and Crimson Snow, Leaping Three Yellows.

The third *zhi* is named Swallow-Embryo *Zhi*; its hue is purple, its form like a sunflower leaf, with a pair of lovebirds atop as if poised to take flight, its radiance luminous and penetrating. Consuming one stalk bestows the rank of Supreme Clarity Dragon-Tiger Immortal Lord, Rectifier of the Orthodox Unity.

It is also said: The fourth *zhi* is named Moonlight Cavern-Grass *Zhi*; its color is azure, its fruit pure white, the size of a plum, standing three to four feet tall, its leaves resembling cypress. At night, its fruit shines like moonlight illuminating an entire chamber. Each stalk bears nine fruits; when they fall to the ground, they swiftly grow to the size of a seven-inch mirror-disk, one or two inches thick upon the earth, glowing at night like the shifting gaze of an ox’s eye. One who consumes a single fruit is appointed Left Censor of the Supreme Clarity Immortal Offices.

**Grand Ultimate Medicinal Substances**
The next are the treasures of the Grand Ultimate:
Four Perfected Constant Jewels—namely, Nine-Stone Smelted Mist, Elixir-Liquid Jade Essence, Flowing Pearls of the Crown, Radiant Stone Quintessence, Golden Liquid of the Cinnabar Furnace, Purple Blossoms and Rainbow Petals.

The first *zhi* is named Dragon Immortal *Zhi*, resembling intertwined dragons bearing one another, its leaves as scales, its roots like a coiled dragon. Consuming it bestows the rank of Grand Ultimate Immortal Minister.

It is also said: The third *zhi* is named Ginseng-Perfected *Zhi*, crimson in color, with a vermilion glow like flickering flames. Striking its branches and leaves produces a sound like metal or stone; if broken, it instantly mends as before. Consuming it bestows the rank of Grand Ultimate Perfected.

**Upper Clarity Medicinal Substances**
The next are the secluded *zhi* of Upper Clarity:
Supreme Nine Seasons...

Eight Radiant Supreme Harmony, Mottled-Dragon Black Embryo, Patterned-Tiger White Foam—born of the Western Mound;
Seven Dark Flying Nodes, Nine-Aperture Jade Pearls, Cloud-Liquid Jade Wine, Dark Garden Jade Fat;
Bell Mountain White Glue, Gold-Born Green Spread, Langfeng Stone Brain, Black River Coral;
Meng Mountain White Phoenix, Jade Membrane Spirit Mound, Granary Simurgh Golden Blood, Eastern Blossom Vermilion Greens;
Nine Ministers’ Intertwining, Supreme Tenuity Purple Hemp, Jade Blossom Jade Fruit, Flowing Abyss Whale Pearl;
Crimson River Crimson Jasper, Northern Dipper’s Well of the Grand Ultimate, Central Mechanism’s Great Vermilion Pulse, Cloud Court Divine Peach;
Kun Garden Level Sparrow, Night Essence Sun Herb, Azure Nectar Blue Di, True Palace Fragrant Altar, Dark Capital Three Canopies;
To the left, imbibe the radiance of the Jade Lads; to the right, draw the qi of the Jade Maidens;
Above, summon the divine radiance; below, drink from the Dark Rapids;
Bend to pluck the Jade Essence of Orchid Garden; reach to gather the Purple □ of Round Mound;
White Water Spirit Clam, Eight Heavens’ Crimson ( ), Once-in-Ten-Thousand-Years, Flowing Radiance Nine Ranks.
Those who obtain and consume these transcend mortality after death.

These are what the Heavenly Thearch consumes, the treasures of the Supreme Lord—beyond the ken of Grand Ultimate, beyond the reach of Median Perfected.
Recite their stanzas, and the extraordinary stream may attain eternal life; intone their names, and one may dispel illness and sever demonic essences.

**Jade Clarity Medicinal Substances**
Sixfold Purity Flourishing Glory, Dark Radiance Eight Corners, Wind Fruit Cloud Seeds, Imperial Enclosure Jade Portal...

Golden Splendor in Full Bloom, Vast Heaven’s Yellow Timber, Prosperous Jade Blossoms, Night Mountain’s Fire Jade—
Then comes Phoenix Grove’s Singing Vinegar, Western Jasper Nectar, Central Land’s Purple Honey, Northern Mound’s Green Sward.
Crimson Ford’s Golden Marrow, Sun Essence Moon Radiance, Vermilion River’s Lang Stones, Peng Mountain’s Patterned Seeds.
Seven Stalks of Lustral Water, Thunder Willows of Crumbling Peaks, Northern Gatherings of Mystic Enclosure’s Verdant Onions, Upward Sips of Cloud Mountain’s Vermilion Honey.
Night Ox’s Hidden Bones, Divine Wu’s Yellow Sap, Hollow Cavern’s Spirit Melon, One Fruit in Four Kalpas.
Nether Realm’s Scaled Gall, Flame Mountain’s Midnight Sun, Eastward Pluckings from Fusang’s Cinnabar Mulberries, Downward Gleanings from Long Abyss’s Patterned Algae.
Above, harmonize the Ninefold Flying Jade; below, swallow the Azure Mystery’s Rosy Treasures.
Great Void’s Coiled Rings, Plain Maiden’s Embrace—
Purple Dragon Lads, Nine-Hued Phoenix Brains, Grand Ultimate’s Concealed Mushrooms, Descending Tree’s Solar Dao.
Supreme Lord’s Rainbow Plums, Celestial Han’s Great Herbs, Southern Palace’s Giant Pearls, Western March’s Elder Supports.
Three-Beamed Dragon Flower, sought by the Spirit Consort—

Those who obtain and consume these age beyond mortality.
These are what Jade Clarity consumes, what the Supreme Lord treasures—
by which one may ascend to soar the Scenic Empyrean, divide the dawn into myriad paths,
guard and stabilize the August Essence, infuse the Nine Brains at court.

Yet this Dao is most vast, its wondrous numen resplendent and remote—
not for those who feed on blood and flesh to fully comprehend.
But hearing the Mystic Tone scatters the turbid; listening to the wind’s qi dispels the foul.
Above, one may float beyond the Primal Simplicity; below, one may exorcise demons and dispel illness.

From the *Scripture of Daoist Traces*
Thus concludes Scroll Seventy-Eight of the *Supreme Secret Essentials*.
