—Excerpted from *The Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected from the Cavern of Perfection*
**On Longevity**

The Heavenly Worthy accomplished the five directional lands and delivered all people. At that time, he returned to the Palace of Eternal Joy, where from all the various lands—great and small—people came in throngs, an entire nation’s worth, beyond any means to restrain them. The Heavenly Worthy then closed his three eyes for three nights, obscuring the celestial radiance so that no light shone. He gathered firewood upon a high mound some two hundred *zhang* in height. The Heavenly Worthy sat atop the pyre and set himself ablaze. The flames blazed, illuminating the four directions with brilliance. The men and women of the lands, seeing from afar the Heavenly Worthy seated within the fire, could find no way to approach and could only bare their hearts from afar. The Heavenly Worthy, wishing to observe their sincerity, addressed those who had come: “If you desire long life, you must enter the fire and receive the Dharma from me.” Those truly devoted and yearning for the Great Dharma numbered seventy-two thousand four hundred and fifty; they cast themselves into the flames and all reached the presence of the Dao. The Heavenly Worthy then bestowed upon them the scriptures and methods within the fire, conferring them as each entered. Their bodies all attained deliverance, and they departed in transformed form. The remainder, numbering three hundred thousand, seeing from afar that those who entered did not emerge, believed them to have perished in the flames. Thereupon, they withdrew and returned to their homelands. Those who had entered the fire to receive deliverance arrived home first, while those who had not entered arrived later. Upon reuniting, they lamented and sighed with regret, their remorse beyond remedy. Those whose bodies had received deliverance all attained long life.

—Excerpted from *The Scripture of the Numinous Writings of the Cavern Mystery*

The Dao declares: All received the boundless, supreme deliverance of the Primordial Beginning in the Great Floating Li Land within the Azure Heavens of the Beginning, where the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounded this scripture. He circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions, then ascended his seat. Heavenly Perfected Spirits, lofty sages, and perfected ones of wondrous practice—innumerable hosts—descended from the void, riding vermilion clouds through the cinnabar firmament, their jade wheels and green chariots shaded by feathered canopies. Jade light streamed forth in five resplendent hues, suffusing the Great Void with radiance for seven days and seven nights. The sun, moon, and stars of the celestial realms, along with the jade mechanisms of the heavens, halted their revolutions. Divine winds stilled, mountains and seas concealed their clouds, the heavens were free of drifting veils, and the four *qi* shone clear. Throughout the land, mountains, rivers, forests, and groves leveled to uniformity, no longer high or low, the earth transformed into azure jade, devoid of any other hue. The assembled perfected ones attended the seat as the Primordial Heavenly Worthy floated upon a dark throne above five-colored lions. After the first recitation of the scripture, the great sages of the heavens simultaneously proclaimed its excellence, and all the deaf and ailing in the land regained their hearing. After the second recitation, the blind regained their sight. After the third, the mute could speak. After the fourth, the lame and those afflicted with chronic ailments could all rise and walk. After the fifth, those suffering from long-standing, intractable illnesses regained their forms. After the sixth, white hair turned black again, and fallen teeth regrew. After the seventh, the old reverted to youth, and the young grew strong. After the eighth, pregnant women and creatures—whether their offspring were born or unborn—all saw their young brought to completion. After the ninth, the earth’s treasuries were revealed, and gold and jade emerged. After the tenth, withered bones revived, all rising as living beings. At that time, every man and woman in the land turned their hearts wholly toward the Dao, all received its protection and deliverance, and together attained long life.

—Excerpted from *The Cavern Mystery Scripture of Boundless Deliverance*

The cloud-nectar is called Mystic Water Jade Liquid, also known as Flying Dragon Cloud-Nectar or the Refined Essence of the Five Stones. Ingesting it for fifteen years, the body emits jade-like radiance, transparent within and without, and one attains long life coeval with heaven and earth.

—Excerpted from *The Cavern Perfection Scripture on Filling and Nourishing the Five Viscera*

The Daoist who charts the course of life does so not for the sake of fame.

The raiment tattered, the sandals worn—yet no longing for honor or glory.
The heart immaculate and white, the mind free from partiality.
The will flows like water, dwelling amid the city’s throng.
Accumulating and abiding in non-action, only then can one attain long life.

—Excerpted from *The Scripture of Wondrous Perfection*

In governing people and serving heaven, nothing surpasses frugality.
Only through frugality can one return early.
Early return is called the repeated accumulation of virtue.
With virtue amassed, there is nothing one cannot overcome.
Having nothing one cannot overcome, none can fathom its limit—
and with this, one may possess the state.
Possessing the state’s foundational power,
one may endure long.
This is called deep roots and firm stem,
the Dao of long life and enduring vision.

—Excerpted from *The Virtue Scripture of Laozi*

The Lady of Purple Tenuity addressed the Divine Mother, saying:
At dawn, ingest the qi of the sun;
at midnight, gather the essence of the moon.
Visualize it nine inches before your face,
letting its radiance illuminate the Mud-Pill Palace,
descending to the five viscera,
permeating the entire form.
Draw the qi into the mouth,
its luminous hue resplendent and bright—
after a long while, the practice is complete.
By this constant practice, one attains long life.

—Excerpted from *The Cavern Perfection Scripture of the Great One, the Celestial Lord, and the Grand Elixir of Myriad Writings*

The Perfected One said:
To consume the essence of the sun is to surely attain long life.
Thereby ascending to heaven to pay homage to the Primordial Lord,
always on the first, third, fifth, seventh, ninth, and fifteenth days of the lunar month,
from sunrise to noon, ingest it.
First visualize the sun within the heart,
with a dark canopy within the sun,
and beneath the canopy, a youth.
The upright qi pervades the body,
ninefold within and without.
Envision crimson qi filling the head,
rising from the crown to ascend to heaven,
circling the sun ninefold.
Recite the incantation:
*"Sun Lord, Primordial Yang,
return to the Crimson Palace,
unite with my virtue,
together nourishing the youth."*
Then visualize the solar essence descending
into the nostrils and mouth,
swallowing it twenty-seven times until the heart is full.
Within the heart are three figures:
to the left, the Father of the Great One;
to the right, the Mother of the Mysterious Origin;
and at the center, the Crimson Child.
Seated upon a golden bed and jade couch,
holding jade ladles and jade cups,
they drink the divine wine of jade blossoms
and the celestial zhi herbs,
partaking in this feast—
thus never hungering or thirsting, attaining long life.

To consume the essence of the moon is to attain long life,
thereby ascending to heaven.
Always on the fifteenth night at midnight,
face the moon and bow twice.
Recite the incantation:
*"Moon Lord, Radiant Child,
return to the Cinnabar Field,
unite with my virtue,
together nourishing the youth."*
Then visualize the white qi of the moon and the yellow essence descending
into the nostrils and mouth,
swallowing it twenty-one times before ceasing.
The lunar essence anchors in the root of the kidneys,
and one attains long life.

To consume the essence of the stars is to ascend to the Great Clarity.
Always at sunrise, dusk, noon, and midnight,
visualize the Great Yellow Star of the Northern Culmen.
Recite the incantation:
*"August Heavenly Thearch,
Supreme Dao Lord,
your humble descendant, so-and-so,
loves the Dao of immortality
and wishes to attain long life.
Thus, I visualize the stellar essence descending
between my brows,
flowing into my nostrils and mouth.
I swallow it fifteen times,
envisioning the qi filling my heart, gallbladder, and spleen.
The Dao Mother presides, nursing the Crimson Child—
thus never hungering or thirsting, attaining long life."*

—Excerpted from *The Cavern Mystery Scripture of the Five Talismans*

The Perfected One of the Great Ultimate said:
Accomplishing three hundred acts of goodness,
one may attain long life as an earthbound immortal.
If even one act remains incomplete,
one must begin anew,
and all previous merits are lost.
Only by constantly holding this intention in mind and body
can it be so.
To guide others in doing good is itself a meritorious act.

—Excerpted from *The Cavern Mystery Scripture on Stabilizing the Will*

The Dao declares:
The lesser adept cultivates the body by severing passions and restraining desire;
adorns the spirit through plain attire and frugal nourishment,
rejecting glory and splendor;
dwells in secluded groves, loving mountains and delighting in waters;
indulges in the serenity of the true, abiding in simplicity and steadfastness;
abstains from grains and ceases eating,
maintaining long fasts and contemplating the Dao;
after noon, takes no food,
sitting upright in the presence of the master’s sacred treasures.
In going out and coming in, one mingles with birds and beasts;
a solitary traveler in rocky caves,
alone amid the empty mountains.
Thoughts do not yearn for home,
sorrow does not grieve the body.
Roaming the forests and ravines,
the spirit is joyful as if feasting.
Though the face bears the look of hunger,
the heart holds a cinnabar elixir.
Enduring hardships with equanimity,
the countenance remains serene.
Facing trials without fear,
the heart is tranquil and reverent.
Through such conduct,
one moves the Sovereign of the Void.
Nine deaths are extinguished, nine lives are preserved—
unwavering in resolve, holding fast with extraordinary firmness,
one succeeds in transformation:
riding the void to soar,
roaming and feasting upon the Five Peaks.

—Excerpted from *The Cavern Mystery Scripture of the Dharma Wheel*

To traverse the great kalpa and transcend calamity, preserving the precious life:
The essence of the Nine Mysteries of the Primordial Beginning,
passing through the Nine Conjunctions of the Great Yang,
when the floodwaters surge to the heavens—
inscribe in green on white silk and wear it upon the head,
floating upon the clear waves.
Disaster cannot harm you, and the body is preserved for long life.
Wearing for a long time the talisman of the immortal’s "Small Kalpa Transcending Calamity, Preserving the Precious Life,"
and the Nine Heavens’ Talisman of the Great Perfected,
passing through the cycles of the Small Yang’s Nine Conjunctions,
when water and fire cross paths and myriad disasters arise—
inscribe in vermilion on white silk and wear it upon the left elbow.
Entering the abyss, you will not sink;
entering fire, you will not burn.
No harm can assail you,
the body is preserved for long life,
and you attain a lifespan coeval with heaven.
Wear it long, O immortal.

—Excerpted from *The Cavern Perfection Scripture of the Azure Waist and Purple Writings*

The Great Characters of the Heavenly Sovereign, Earthly Sovereign, and Human Sovereign
all possess the wondrous methods of pure emptiness
and the precious texts of the Cavern Mystery,
originating from the Golden Names of the Primordial,
residing in the Azure Palace of the Square Cauldron—
none may know or hear of them.
Those who possess these texts become earthbound immortals.

—Excerpted from *The Cavern Perfection Canon of the Four Poles’ Luminous Regulations*

**Rank of Heavenly Immortals**
The texts of the Middle True and Lower Primordial Purple Primordial Great Immortals,
the Cavern Qi Yang Spirit Writings—
these are the jade texts transformed from the essence of the Cavern Qi Yang Spirit’s generation,
aiding the transformation of the Eight Directions’ qi by the Perfected Lords of the Upper Clarity,
communicating with spirits and summoning the Perfected,
preserving life for long endurance.
After ingesting them for eight years,
nine Jade Lads of the Purple Primordial Terrace attend you,
communicating with the numinous.
They summon the cloud chariots and feathered canopies of the Eight Effulgences’ spirit officials,
enabling you to soar in flight.

The Upper Perfected and Lower Primordial Yang Spirit True Writings and Transformative Numinous Talismans—
these are the jade texts transformed from the essence of the Cavern Yang’s evolved spirit,
revolving the Eight Directions’ qi of the transformation of the Perfected Lords of the Upper Perfected,
communicating with spirits and summoning the Perfected,
preserving life for long endurance.

After ingesting them for eight years,
nine Jade Lads of the Great Yang attend you,
communicating with the numinous.
They summon the spirit officials of the Eight Effulgences,
commanding cloud chariots and feathered canopies to enable your flight.

The Middle Perfected and Middle Primordial Yang Spirit True Writings and Transformative Numinous Talismans—
these are the jade texts transformed from the essence of the Great Numinous Yang’s evolved spirit,
revolving the Eight Directions’ qi of the transformation of the Perfected Lords of the Upper Perfected,
communicating with spirits and summoning the Perfected,
preserving life for long endurance.
After ingesting them for eight years,
nine Jade Lads of the Southern Culmen attend you,
communicating with the numinous.
They summon the spirit palaces of the Eight Effulgences,
commanding cloud chariots and feathered canopies to enable your flight.

The Middle Perfected and Middle Primordial Cavern Yin Great Mystery Transformative Numinous Talismans—
these are the jade texts transformed from the essence of the Northern Portal’s Yin Culmen,
assisting the Middle Primordial and Middle Perfected Eight Effulgences’ spirit palaces,
communicating upward with the qi of Heaven,
and guarding below those who study the true,
summoning the numinous and drawing forth the Perfected,
with spirit officials of a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders.
After ingesting them for eight years,
eight Jade Maidens of the Mysterious Palace descend in form,
bringing the Nine Heavens’ phoenix robes and the writs of the Perfected’s command,
to summon the chariots of the Eight Effulgences,
bearing you aloft in flight.

From the *Scripture of the Seventy-Four Cavern Realms’ Transformations*

The Heavenly Worthy said:
If good men and good women can arouse the natural intention of the Dao,
enter the Dharma gate,
receive my Ten Precepts,
and practice the Twelve Permissible Deeds,
they shall become the pure and faithful disciples of the Great Dao.
The pure and faithful disciples shall equal the merit of the Brave Flying Devas.
The Flying Devas are those who have not yet attained the Dao;
they are the ten-times-turned disciples of the Dao,
flying through the empty void,
serving as the pure and faithful charioteers of the various heavens.
While still in the world,
disciples may be freed from sorrow and distress,
delivered from manifold sufferings;
their bodies enter radiance,
their forms within become clear and upright,
summoning ghosts and commanding spirits,
subduing demonic essences.
After ten turns, they may ascend to become Flying Devas.
If, within a single turn, they practice with diligence,
their hearts unwavering and unretreatant,
performing all meritorious deeds,
maintaining strict fasting and austerities,
unwearied from dawn to dusk,
they shall equal the merit of the Flying Devas.

The Heavenly Worthy said:
Those who uphold the Six Precepts
all possess the wisdom of the Six Penetrations,
able to bestow their virtue,
their conduct aligning with the natural.
Blessings and felicity ever abide with them,
their bodies ever distant from calamity and harm,
their households’ treasures and delights unceasing.
Through lifetimes of karmic conditions,
after one turn they receive their reward,
equaling the merit of the Flying Devas,
transcending the nine turns of the wheel,
attaining the rank of the Great Dao.
The names of the ten-times-turned disciples are inscribed throughout the heavens,
and their seven ancestors together ascend to be reborn in the heavenly halls.

The Heavenly Worthy said:
As for the Ten Wholesome Exhortations and Precepts,
none but the ten-times-turned disciples of the Great Dao can practice them,
equaling the merit of the Flying Devas.
Their hearts merge with the wisdom of the Six Penetrations,
penetrating the empty and non-substantial.
After death, they all attain flight amidst the clouds,
with the host of sages as their charioteers,
roaming the ten directions.

From the *Scripture of the Cavern Mystery’s Great Precepts*

The *Luminous Perfected Regulations* states:
Those who cultivate and uphold the wisdom of the Upper Grade’s Ten Precepts,
accumulate manifold good deeds,
make offerings to Dharma masters,
burn incense and light lamps,
assisting the radiance of Heaven,
illuminating the ten directions,
bestowing kindness and spreading virtue,
mindful of delivering sentient beings—
after death, they ascend to the Eastern Florescence,
receiving the title of Flying Deva,
their rank equal to the ten-times-turned disciples of the Most High,
serving as the charioteers of the host of sages,
roaming amidst the clouds.

It further states:
Reverently uphold the Ten Precepts,
burn incense and keep lamps ever bright.
When merit is fulfilled after ten turns,
their reward and rank shall attain the Flying Devas.

From the *Scripture of the Cavern Realms’ Luminous Perfected*

**Chapter on Ascending the Moon’s Courtyard**

For those who seek the Dao of gathering the moon’s yellow essence,
on the day when the moon approaches the Eastern Well,
at dawn take a jar of well-flower water,
expose it in the central courtyard,
and at midnight inscribe the Yang Essence Jade Womb Refined Immortal Talisman,
placing it in the water.
Face east, knock the teeth twenty-four times,
and recite the incantation over the water:

*Yellow qi, Yin essence,*
*Yang spirit, cavern-bright.*
*Bathe the nine souls,*
*adorn with the golden dawn.*
*Round and luminous, I declare,*
*jade womb refines the immortal.*
*Flowering radiance intermingles,*
*flowing fragrance steeps the ford.*
*Nine Yangs transform as one,*
*mysterious rosy clouds disperse the mist.*
*Primal effulgence returns the numinous,*
*curved reflections adorn my form.*
*Ascend in flight to the Upper Palace,*
*gaze upon the cavern’s jasper eaves.*

When finished, take a *dou* of the water,
face the moon, and ingest it.
Then clench the fists and visualize the five-colored flowing essence of the moon,
all coming to crown and connect with the body.
Within the five colors, there is also the moon’s yellow qi,
large as the pupil of the eye,
layered in dozens,
within the moon’s essence of five colors,
all entering through the mouth,
pervading the five viscera.
Then face the moon and swallow the essence fifty times,
swallowing the saliva ten times.
Knock the teeth ten times and softly recite the incantation:

*Yellow qi flows essence,*
*threefold congeals the radiance.*
*Mysterious splendor returns to uprightness,*
*adorned with the eight rays’ brilliance.*
*Refine the soul at the Eastern Well,*
*receive the luminous flying sovereign.*
*Golden efflorescence scatters the numinous,*
*the Five Lords diffuse fragrance.*
*The Lady descends sweet wine,*
*moistening and sprinkling the ten directions.*
*Vast mushrooms pour downward,*
*the six palaces overflow and fill.*
*Golden essence transforms ninefold,*
*exchanging scenes, returning countenance.*
*Riding the void, descending mist,*
*roaming and feasting in the great emptiness.*
*Ascend to the moon’s courtyard,*
*equal in pair with the Perfected.*
*Transforming through the eight paths,*
*exiting existence, entering non-existence.*
*Three dawns’ cavern radiance,*
*eternally preserved without end.*

When finished, bathe with the remaining water,
return to the chamber facing east,
and ingest the Yang Essence Jade Womb Refined Immortal Talisman.
Knock the teeth twelve times and softly recite the incantation:

*Concealing Heaven’s colored radiance,*
*yellow qi thickly disperses.*
*Congealing essence, condensing splendor,*
*eight rays brightly shine.*
*Polishing and adorning the yellow efflorescence,*
*stone scenes steep and irrigate.*
*Jade mushrooms overflow and fill,*
*moistening and filling the great Han.*
*All under Heaven receives refinement,*
*dawn’s luminous morning begins.*
*Driving the scene, ascending the void,*
*attaining flight to the imperial palace.*
*The Eternal Separation descends to the world,*
*transcending the eight difficulties.*
*Equal in radiance with the sun,*
*one in stem with the moon.*

When finished, swallow the qi fifty times and stop.

This is the Dao of ingesting the moon’s essence,
the wondrous Dharma of the Primordial Beginning.
Practicing it for one year, the face takes on a jade-like luster;
after seven years, the numinous descends,
the body emits golden light;
after nine years, one flies aloft,
ascending to the moon’s homeland.

The Yin Essence Flying Scene Jade Talisman
is inscribed in yellow on bamboo membrane on the day of the Great Year Star,
and ingested facing the Great Year Star.
After three years, flowing light descends and shines below,
illuminating through the six palaces,
the five viscera become luminous,
and the face bears a jade-like radiance.

After nine years of flight, one ascends to the Moon’s Courtyard.

The Three Pure Ones’ Flying Essence Summoning Immortal Upper Talisman is inscribed in yellow on bamboo membrane on the Autumn Equinox day and ingested at dawn facing west. After three years, the immortals of the Five Peaks arrive; the superior adept’s true form appears, the middling adept becomes misty and indistinct—now visible, now vanished—while the inferior adept dreams in slumber, conversing with immortals. After nine years, immortal officials arrive in cloud chariots to welcome the adept, who ascends to the Sun’s Courtyard.

The Yellow Flower Stone Radiance Internal Transformation Numinous Talisman is inscribed in blue on bamboo membrane on one’s natal day and ingested facing that day. After three years, golden light emerges from the crown, its mysterious glow illuminating a li around. After nine years, one converses with the Moon Lady, soars through the Great Void, and ascends to the Moon’s Courtyard.

The above is from the *Eight Essences of the Cavernous Perfection Scripture*.

The Sun’s Soul Refining Essence Yin Talisman is inscribed in qi on blue paper at midnight on the Winter Solstice, then cast into water to bathe the entire body, refining both blood and essence. It draws the sun’s essence into the Purple Radiance, descends flying blossoms upon the Eight Celestial Steeds, refines the five palaces in the Jade Pool, and transports the adept’s body to the Broad Cold. Additionally, inscribe in black on blue silk and wear it on the body. After eight years, the body emits golden light, a circular brilliance appears at the nape, and perfected beings descend to bestow the adept with true scriptures, enabling flight through the Great Void and ascent to the Broad Cold Palace.

The above is from the *Cavernous Perfection Scripture of the Yellow Qi and Yang Essence*.

**Ascending the Sun Gate Section**

The Flying Blossom Sun Radiance Jade Embryo Numinous Talisman is inscribed in vermilion on bamboo membrane on one’s natal day and ingested facing that day. After three years, flowing essence and purple light illuminate the body’s form, and the face takes on a golden countenance. After nine years, one soars through the Great Void and ascends to the Sun Gate.

The Yang Essence Flying Radiance Jade Talisman is inscribed in vermilion on bamboo membrane on the day of the Great Year Star and ingested facing it. After three years, the stomach duct becomes luminous, true radiance overflows, filling the numinous jade chamber, and the face emits sunlight. After seven years, one flies aloft and ascends to the Sun Gate.

The above is from the *Eight Essences of the Cavernous Perfection Scripture*.

The Eight Refining Gold Transformation Perfected Immortal Talisman is inscribed in yellow on blue paper on the day of the Beginning of Spring and cast into water; bathing in it refines the entire body, summoning the mysterious radiance of the sun and moon and descending perfected beings to the Jade Courtyard. Additionally, inscribe in yellow on blue silk and wear it on the body. After eight years, one converses with perfected beings, who arrive in cloud chariots to welcome the adept, ascending above the Golden Gate.

The Eight Refining Transformation Perfected Immortal Talisman is inscribed in cinnabar on yellow paper at noon on the Beginning of Summer and cast into water; bathing in it refines both inner and outer, summoning the immortal root from the yang essence, drawing yellow qi into the Yellow Flower, revolving the sun and moon to reflect mysteriously, and attracting perfected beings to the Jade Palace. Additionally, inscribe in cinnabar on yellow silk and wear it on the body. After eight years, perfected beings descend to bestow the adept with true scriptures, enabling flight through the Empty Mystery and ascent to the Cavernous Yang Palace.

The Dragon Radiance Nine Refining Talisman is inscribed in blue on white paper at the *bu* hour on the Beginning of Autumn and cast into water; bathing in it refines the bones and marrow, summoning the mysterious radiance of the Purple Radiance, drawing yang essence into the Flying Root, gathering yellow qi into the Water Mother, and descending perfected beings to the Purple Pavilion. Additionally, inscribe in blue on white silk and wear it on the body. After eight years, a solar orb of light appears above the head, enabling flight through the Great Void and ascent to the Hall of Broad Numinosity.

The Dao of seeking immortality: On the Summer Solstice at midnight, enter a chamber, lie or sit facing south, close the eyes at will, and inwardly visualize the Lady of the Moon’s Cinnabar Radiance, whose surname and given name are [to be filled in], standing eight inches and eight fen tall. She wears her hair in a cloud-like topknot, dons a cinnabar brocade flying skirt, and holds moonbeams in her mouth, which descend into the adept’s Crimson Palace within the heart. Soon, the moonbeams scatter into yellow qi, raining down upon the adept’s form. The Lady stands at the moon’s center, gathering the blossoms of empty azure and scattering them amidst the yellow qi. She exhales yang essence and red qi to irrigate the adept’s form, raining from within to without. The yellow and red qi intertwine, illuminating the entire body. The Lady bestows upon the adept six cinnabar-written characters in purple script, then guides the adept to swallow the yellow qi twenty-four times and the yang essence twelve times, then knock the teeth twenty-four times. Looking upward, recite the incantation:

Flowing fire spans ten thousand *qing*,
the essence of the Cavernous Yang.
The Yang Peace Pavilion,
the Three Blossoms Jade City.
Golden immortals shine within,
the Eight Essences and Four Lights.
The Nine Luminaries descend their qi,
the Primordial Upper Numinous Ones.
The Lady rinses with fragrance,
scattering blossoms in the Jade Clarity.
Cinnabar writes purple characters,
binding sounds to empty azure.
Orchid Pool’s jade moisture
flows and washes the Eight Darknesses.
Crimson light streams through the canopy,
fresh glory suffuses all under heaven.
Revolving morning’s curved luminaries,
they oversee and illuminate my form.
My form and the crimson sun
share death and share life.
Riding the empty, driving the void,
harnessing flying chariots.
Jade maidens assist in position,
golden lads aid the numinous.
Beneath a light canopy of kingfisher feathers,
ascend to the Emperor’s Courtyard.

Afterward, swallow qi twenty-four times and saliva twelve times, then ingest the cinnabar-written purple characters. Practicing this Dao for eight years, the Lady bestows upon the adept cinnabar-written true scriptures and a jade pendant for the sun’s center, enabling flight and ascent to the Cavernous Yang Palace.

The above is from the *Cavernous Perfection Scripture of the Yellow Qi and Yang Essence*.

*End of the Eighty-Eighth Scroll of the Supreme Secret Essentials.*

**Scrolls Eighty-Nine to Ninety Originally Missing**
*[Note: The character 年 was originally written as 中; amended according to context.]*

**Scroll Ninety-One: Ascending to the Grand Ultimate Palace and Ascending to the Supreme Tenuity Palace**
*End of the Ninety-First Scroll of the Supreme Secret Essentials.*

**Ascending to the Grand Ultimate Palace**

The *True Numinous Life Talisman of Grand Ultimate Refinement and Transformation* was originally recorded in the *First Jade Radiance Chapter of the Supreme Transformation and Cavernous Void*, concealed within the Grand Ultimate Great Palace. Those who practice the Dao in pursuit of immortality, contemplating the divine and preserving the true, repenting sins and dissolving transgressions, and aspiring to the grace of communion with the numinous, shall on the day of the Beginning of Spring inscribe the text with green ink, face east, and ingest one talisman. Thereby, all past offenses disperse, and the Grand Ultimate inscribes their name upon the jade tablet. After eight years of practice without deviation, the Grand Ultimate grants eight jade lads. Through meditative communion, the celestial perfected descend, and the adept beholds their divine forms, attaining the chariot of the Eight Radiant Ones to ascend to the Grand Ultimate Palace.

*Excerpted from the* Cavernous Perfection Eight Dao Jade Radiance Hidden Talismans.

**The Supreme Perfected Middle Prime Six Jia Yang-Generated Transformation Numinous Talisman**
This talisman arises from the essence of the Supreme Jia Yang Spirit, transforming into jade script to assist the Supreme Perfected of the Lofty Dawn in transmuting the qi of the eight directions, communicating with the divine, summoning the perfected, preserving life, and ensuring longevity. After eight years of ingestion, nine jade lads from the Grand Ultimate Upper Palace are bestowed to the adept, enabling communion with the numinous. They summon the cloud chariot of the Eight Radiant Ones to welcome the adept in flight, ascending to the Grand Ultimate Crimson Palace.

The Supreme Perfected transform, and the Lower Prime generates life. The Eight Radiant Divine Palaces assist the practitioner’s body. Those who know the precious names of the Supreme Perfected’s palaces, abodes, and the talismans of their attire and conveyance may summon the qi of the Eight Radiant Ones, causing the forms of the Supreme Perfected to descend and illuminate their own body, invoking the numinous and commanding the qi to employ the officials of a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders. After eight years of talisman ingestion and practice, the Lofty Supreme is moved to joy, and the true numinous descend to appear. They bestow the Eight Radiant Divine Officials, flying clouds, and feathered canopies to transport the adept upward into the pure, transforming the eight directions and ascending to the Grand Ultimate Palace.

These nine celestial numinous texts are conferred upon those whose names are inscribed on golden tablets and jade registers within the Grand Ultimate. Those who behold their contents transcend life and death to attain immortality. To recklessly divulge these most sacred prohibitions is to incur the Nine Heavens’ punishment of piercing treachery, and one’s body shall be conscripted into the labor of Mount Meng.

*Excerpted from the* Cavernous Perfection Scripture of the Seventy-Four Methods of Transformation.

The Dao states: The wheel of fortune and blessings neither perishes nor arises anew. Those who diligently study, revere their masters’ treasures, and form karmic bonds with the Dao remain unbroken across lifetimes—all due to the accumulated practices of past existences. Such is this Dharma-wheel: superior adepts strive earnestly, widely opening the gates of the Dao. They place others before themselves, deliver kings from suffering, restrain their speech to aid the destitute, and bare their forms to clothe the cold.

The virtue extends to birds and beasts, and kindness reaches all living beings. Revering the master and upholding the Dharma is ever as if standing before the gods. Perpetual fasting, earnest contemplation, and profound study of the Cavernous Mystery—exhaling and inhaling qi and fluids, the heart ashen and the will diligent. Severing the burdens of sensual desire, all myriad thoughts dissolve. With harmonious emotions and gentle qi, both humans and spirits rejoice. Such conduct, though it entails one death and one rebirth, ensures the will never falters, and one attains the rank of superior immortal.

When the Three Masters are fully attained, the body ascends to the Great Ultimate, the rank of Immortal Minister is conferred, and boundless wondrous penetrations arise, thoughts transforming into spirit.

*Gatha:*
Wondrous penetrations turn my spirit,
Vast and universal, measureless merit.
The Dao accomplished through kalpas of heaven and earth,
Transformations unfold across the Nine Heavens.
Extinction and rebirth transcend life and death,
Each karmic encounter has its own origin.
Who deeply awakens to the toil of past and future,
Finds form and soul without beginning or end.
Accumulated blessings inscribe the foundation of fortune,
The body escapes the Five Peaks of Tribulation.
Liberated from the Three Evil Paths,
Serenely one enters the Hall of Leisure.
Thoughts ferry boundless realms,
Meditation stabilizes and invokes divine penetrations.
The Dharma-wheel turns thrice,
Assisting the attainment of High Immortal Lords.
Turning my steps like the great *chun* tree,
I soar aloft to the Palace of the Great Ultimate.

The Supreme Mystery of the Primordial One addressed the Immortal Lord, saying: "By command of the Supreme, I am sent to bestow upon you this wondrous scripture of admonitions, expounding the Dharma and teaching the doctrine—its subtlety reaches this utmost perfection. This text is secretly preserved within the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Supreme; were it not for one worthy of the rank of Immortal Lord, its words could not be seen. Now I impart its precepts to perfect your immortality. You should treasure this record, diligently practice the Dao, and attain its fruition—then shall I welcome you to the Palace of the Great Ultimate." The Immortal Lord bowed deeply, received the precepts, and departed.

*Excerpted from the* Cavernous Mystery of the Primordial One’s Dharma-Wheel of Admonitions.

---

**Chapter on Ascending to the Palace of Grand Tenuity**

The Supreme stated: The reason the Realized One values the One as the True One is simply this: the One alone. What the One conjoins, the Great Void responds and transforms; the One’s transformations adapt, and heaven and earth darkly harmonize. Thus, the Upper One is the Celestial Emperor of the body, the Middle One is the Cinnabar Sovereign of the Crimson Palace, and the Lower One is the Primal King of the Yellow Court. The true essence of these Three Ones collectively oversees the twenty-four qi within the body. Qi receives life, and life establishes the body, corresponding above to the twenty-four Perfected Ones of Grand Tenuity. When the true qi circulates in harmony, the myriad beings take form; spirit and qi intermingle and separate, dwelling in the dim and distant Purple Chamber.

Now, qi coalesces from empty mist to become spirit. Spirit relies on the Three Ones to self-generate. Transformations are the creations of the Three Ones. Those who attain transformation all conceal themselves through spirit, merging the Yellow to achieve the ultimate mystery. The Three Ones and Primordial Lords each possess true qi. When true qi coalesces, it spontaneously forms a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, cloud-borne carriages and feathered canopies. Constantly they enter the Purple Palace within, ascending to Jade Purity, where they are arrayed in the Primordial Chart, transforming the womb to protect the embryo.

By nurturing the body with the Three Ones, one becomes a Realized One, soaring through the Nine Empyreans to serve the Most High. Thus, what the One accomplishes gives rise to heaven and earth—it is not merely the trivial affairs of crawling insects and wriggling creatures. If you can guard it with unwavering firmness, then essence will respond and flow unimpeded. When essence responds and flows unimpeded, the Three Primes become visible; when the Three Primes become visible, white qi thickens and transforms. As white qi thickens and transforms, the Yellow merges and spontaneously generates—then the thousand chariots and ten thousand riders suddenly arrive. Feathered canopies may be steered, cloud-borne carriages may be ridden, and thus you ascend to heaven in broad daylight, reaching the Palace of Grand Tenuity.

Within the Heaven of Grand Tenuity are twenty-four qi, the Yellow intermingling and coalescing, qi transforming and changing. At times, they suddenly separate, and in a flash, life arises within a single qi of transformation. From this, twenty-four Perfected Ones are born, coalescing from emptiness, not through womb or embryo—all are the qi of the Three Ones, the Imperial Sovereigns, which divide and transform the Dao, entrusting the mysterious to establish their forms. If you can guard the Three Ones within the body, then the true lords of the Three Primes and Imperial Sovereigns of the Heaven of Grand Tenuity will descend and appear externally, even conversing with you face to face.

Within the body are also twenty-four Perfected Ones, likewise formed from the body’s mysterious qi and refined spirits, dividing and transforming to create the myriad beings. When the cloud-borne carriage arrives, harmonize qi and dawn’s radiance to ascend to Grand Tenuity. The twenty-four Perfected Ones of Grand Tenuity will all feast in harmony with the spirits within your body amidst the merging Yellow, sharing their radiance within the Purple Chamber, entrusting their forms and qi to a thousand paths. Those who return transform like moxa back into infancy, altering the register of death in the Northern Feng, receiving eternal abiding in the Imperial Homeland, entering and exiting Jade Purity, resting in Grand Tenuity.

If one attains only a single Dao, the Three Primes remain incomplete. By focusing the mind solely on the One, one may still attain longevity and immortality, entering the Grand Clarity alone, yet cannot roam the northern heavens of Grand Tenuity’s radiance or ascend to the Palace of Highest Clarity.

*Excerpted from the* Cavernous Perfection Scripture of the Great Elixir’s Hidden Writings.

---

The **Mysterious Talisman of Grand Tenuity’s Hidden Ascent**, an ancient text from the Supreme’s *Transformations of the Cavernous Void, Sixth Jade Radiance Chapter*, is preserved in the Abbey of Grand Tenuity. Those who practice the Dao and seek immortality, contemplate the spirit and preserve the true, repent sins and resolve transgressions, and aspire to the Great Emperor and Most Sagely Revered Deities—imploring the pardon of past sins—should, on the autumnal equinox, write the text in white ink, face northwest, and ingest six talismans. Then the host of spirits will erase their names from the ledger of sins, inscribe their lifespans on jade tablets, and the Bureau of Destiny will deliver them to life, safeguarding their destiny as immortals. After eight years of practice, without missing a single step, the Supreme Emperor will grant twelve Jade Maidens to communicate with the true and summon the numinous. Divine beings will descend, all wishes will be fulfilled, and the six radiant chariots will arrive, enabling flight to ascend to the Palace of Highest Clarity and Grand Tenuity.

*Excerpted from the* Cavernous Perfection Eightfold Dao’s Jade Radiance Hidden Talismans.

---

The **Two Talismans of the Upper Perfected’s Birth and the Lower Prime’s Yin-Yang Transformations**: inscribe the upper talisman in blue and the lower in white. On the day of the beginning of spring, first ingest the lower talisman, then the upper. On the autumnal equinox, first ingest the upper talisman, then the lower. When about to ingest the talismans, knock the teeth twelve times and softly recite: "The two essences ascend as numinous spirits, communicating with the divine and summoning the true. They summon the eight qi of radiance to descend into my body."

A thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, their breath coalescing into mist, the jade radiance lingers in cycles as the Three Palaces array their spirits. Within and without align in harmony, soaring to ascend the Nine Heavens. Transforming into the imperial aurora, they pay homage to the Jade Venerable. Conclude by lifting the head to swallow the eight qi eight times. Practicing this for eight years, the Upper Perfected’s hidden radiance curves to reflect, the Eight Radiant Forms appear, and the ten thousand riders of the divine officials manifest, bearing one aloft to ascend into the Palace of Grand Tenuity.

*Excerpted from the* Cavernous Perfection’s Seventy-Four Methods of Transformation Scripture.

The Upper Perfected and Middle Prime’s Yin-Extremity Transformation Numinous Talisman—this is the essence of the Supreme Yi’s Cavernous Yin-Extremity, aiding the Upper Prime’s Middle Perfected Eight Radiant Divine Officials to ascend and commune with the celestial perfected, descending into the human body to summon numinous spirits and summon qi, the officials of a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders. Ingesting it for eight years, eight jade maidens of numinous flight will manifest, bestowing the arts of summoning spirit elixirs, divine mushrooms, and transformative techniques, calling forth the Eight Radiant Chariots to bear one aloft in flight, ascending to the Palace of Grand Tenuity.

The Upper Perfected and Middle Prime’s Yin-Yang Transformation Two Talismans: inscribe the upper talisman in blue and the lower in white. On the day of the beginning of spring, first ingest the lower talisman, then the upper. On the autumnal equinox, first ingest the upper talisman, then the lower. When about to ingest the talismans, knock the teeth twelve times and softly recite: "Supreme Yi, true father and true mother, unite the two numinous qi to irrigate the Six Primes, transforming and giving birth to the Eight Radiant Forms. Cavernously divine, ever-changing, the Upper Clarity’s hidden truth curves to descend, coming to witness my form. May I be enabled to ride the Eight Radiant Chariots and ascend to the Cloud Court of the Grand Ultimate." Conclude by lifting the head to swallow the qi eight times. Practicing this for eight years, one will perceive the Eight Radiant Forms, divine officials will descend and manifest, and one will ascend to the Palace of Grand Tenuity.

*Excerpted from the* Cavernous Perfection’s Azure Essentials and Purple Writings of the Golden Root Upper Scripture.

Scholars must clarify the precious names of the Middle Perfected, their palaces, bureaus, and dwelling places, ingesting and employing the numinous talismans to summon the qi of the Eight Radiant Forms. These ascend to manifest the forms of the Middle Perfected and descend to illuminate one’s chamber, summoning numinous spirits to attain immortality and command the officials of a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders. Practicing the talismans for eight years, the Most High will be moved to joy, and the divine officials of the Three Divisions and Eight Radiant Forms will descend to manifest upon one’s body, bestowing the Eight Radiant Cloud Chariots to bear one aloft to the Purple Tenuity Palace and the Eastern Flowery Realm of Fangzhu.

These methods and texts are transmitted only to those whose names are inscribed on the Eastern Flowery’s golden tablets and jade characters. Without such predestined affinity, one may not partake or inquire. To see even the titles of these scriptures without proper transmission brings the calamity of nine generations ascending as immortals. Reckless disclosure or negligence incurs the punishment of the wind-blade’s trial, and the Nine Heavens’ piercing of treachery, forfeiting one’s years of life.

The Middle Prime’s transformations of the Lower Prime give birth to the Eight Radiant Divine Officials to assist the scholar’s body. Scholars should know the precious names of the Middle Perfected, their palaces, bureaus, and dwelling places, employing the numinous talismans to summon the qi of the Eight Radiant Forms, descending to manifest the forms of the Upper Perfected and illuminating one’s body below, summoning numinous qi and commanding the officials of a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders. Practicing the talismans for eight years, the Most High will be moved to joy, and true numinous spirits will descend, bestowing the Eight Radiant Divine Officials and jade cloud chariots to welcome and bear one aloft to the Palace of Purple Tenuity. This Dao is lofty and wondrous, not circulated in the lower world. Those who attain it transcend life and death. To recklessly disclose its numinous texts incurs the punishment of the wind-blade’s trial, consigning one to servitude at the River Source.

The Middle Prime disperses the twenty-four qi, transforming and giving birth to the Three Qi, Eight Radiant Forms, and Cavernous Perfection’s twenty-four divine officials, who govern the scholar’s body below. The Middle Prime’s Palace’s crimson primordial qi transforms, arising from the void, each accompanied by a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders to guard and protect one’s form. If one contemplates the celestial perfected within the heart, naturally summoning numinous countenances within the secluded chamber, then the divine officials of the Three Eights will manifest without delay, and jade lads and jade maidens will instantly obey commands. Within eight years, the thousand chariots and ten thousand riders will bring forth the Eight Radiant Jade Chariots to bear one aloft to the Palace of Purple Tenuity.

Those who cultivate the Nine Perfected and Eightfold Dao without these texts should still direct their thoughts toward the mysterious and exalted, lest they waste their efforts in vain speech and sight. Thus, the twenty-four spirits reside within the human body, summoning the twenty-four perfected above, stabilizing the twenty-four palaces in the middle, and communicating with the twenty-four qi below. If one spirit is not settled, then the myriad spirits will not be at peace; the palaces and dwellings will lie empty and abandoned, the red child will take flight, malevolent demons will enter, and the myriad illnesses will arise together. Without knowing this, how can one attain immortality? How can one summon the thousand chariots and ten thousand riders? How can one ride the Eight Radiant Chariots?

The Supreme Perfected and the Lower Origin’s Yin generate the numinous talismans of transformation—these are the numinous scripts born of the Dark Yin essence of the Northern Quarter, aiding the Eight Radiant Divine Officials of the Upper Origin and Lower Perfected. Above, they connect with celestial qi; below, they assist the adept’s body, summoning the perfected and attracting the numinous, the officials of a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders. Ingesting them for eight years, the Eight Jade Women of the Great Mystery will descend in form. They will dispatch commands to obtain the True Scriptures of the Nine Heavens and the Divine Charts of the Jade Peaks, summoning the Eight Radiant Jade Chariots to ascend and soar into the Upper Clarity. This script is concealed within the Supreme Tenuity’s Upper Observatory, emerging once every forty thousand kalpas in accordance with the Mysterious Canon.

—From the *Scripture of the Seventy-Four Methods of Cavern Perfection’s Transformations*

**Illuminating the Numinous: The Eight Sages’ Chart**
Upper Section: Third True Qi

The Three Radiant Spout Numinous Flowers,
Resplendent, the Eight Gates open.
Within dwells the Spirit of Wisdom,
Clad in raiment to soar through the heavens.

The Eight Sages channel the numinous qi,
Jade talismans penetrate the subtle and profound.
Precious clouds reflect the jade characters,
Mighty beasts shake the heavens with their might.

Brilliant, the Eight Assemblies’ Palaces,
In profusion, the numinous beings take flight.
With concentrated thought, summon the true qi—
The Five Talismans radiate luminous splendor.
The Eight Radiant urge the Jade Chariot,
Ascending the void to enter the Purple Tenuity.

—From the *Scripture of the Twenty-Four Birth Charts of the Cavern Origin’s Numinous Treasure*

Thus concludes *Supreme Mystery Essentials*, Scroll Ninety-One
*Supreme Mystery Essentials*, Scroll Ninety-Two

To Ascend the Supreme Clarity Grade

Those who wish to soar through the Nine Clarities, to feast their vision at the Southern Pavilion, to turn their jade pendants in the Hall of Light, to draw golden earrings to the Muddy Pellet, to summon the true soul at the morning lamp, and to invoke the flying radiance from the Imperial Lord—when practicing this Way, at dusk lie down with both hands resting upon the heart, close the eyes, and inwardly visualize the jade pendant’s azure yang qi. Its light and hue are dimly luminous, like the roundness of sun and moon, suffusing the body with emptiness and penetrating the soul’s essence.

The Imperial Lord’s surname is Kaiyuan, his given name Xu Ming. His form is nine inches tall, his head crowned with a purple cap, draped in a beaded embroidered robe, wearing a flying brocade azure skirt. He bears the moon at his waist and the sun in his mouth, riding a green crow. Within the azure light, he descends into the body, settling and stabilizing the Muddy Pellet. The practitioner should knock the teeth nine times, swallow saliva twenty-nine times, and recite the yin incantation:

*"Mystic Origin, Great Void,
Nine Heavens’ soul essence.
Morning lamp shines bright,
Qi congeals in dim clarity.
Named Jade Pendant,
Illuminating the Great Luminance.
Bearing the moon, holding the sun,
Inscribing talismans, grasping bells.
Radiant splendor flows,
Pervading heaven’s gloom.
Riding azure wings,
Crimson shafts and purple carriage.
First feasting the Three Origins,
Descending to my mystery.
Anchored in the Muddy Pellet,
Flowing into the Yellow Court.
Governing soul and spirit,
All gods at peace.
Five viscera knit and bind,
Nine apertures flourish in bloom.
Eight Radiant ascend in flight,
Rising into Jade Clarity."*

Afterward, press the hands to the hairline nine times, wipe the eyes fourteen times, swallow qi three times, and then lie down. Thus, the soul is at peace, the spirit settled, all gods stabilize the palace, inner numinous qi is fortified, outer demonic sources are sealed, the Eight Radiant transform, and true refinement transfigures into immortality. In nine years, one may fathom the hidden depths, trace the yet-unmanifest, sit and vanish at will, and with the gods reverse aging. After eighteen years, the Dao is perfected, the true descends, and one soars into Supreme Clarity.

—From the *Supreme Scripture of the Jade Pendant and Golden Earrings of the Great Ultimate Golden Writ*

Written in cinnabar on purple script, the Moon’s Soul conceals its sounds—all inscribed in the western groves of the Moon’s *Qian* Trees, forming a natural script. The august lords of all heavens gather on the vernal equinox to harvest the purple script’s cinnabar characters and ingest them. By consuming these six characters, the radiant blaze suffuses the body. The seven treasures of the Moon’s Jade Pendant may be perceived clearly. On the vernal equinox at dusk, write them in white on yellow paper and ingest them, knocking the teeth twelve times while softly reciting:

*"Great brilliance gleams in central heaven,
Bright rosy clouds adorn the golden chamber.
Jade characters array in auspicious clouds,
Cinnabar script forms clustered groves.
Flying songs scatter the vermilion groves,
In the vast desert’s depths.
Numinous sounds sing naturally,
Subtle words of the Eight Pure Palaces.
All heavens sip golden incense,
Flowing nectar bathes my countenance.
Virtue shared with heaven’s people,
August lords descend with purple youths.
Bearing me beyond the Nine Voids,
Ascending to the Vermilion Moon Palace."*

Afterward, swallow qi twenty-four times and cease. Further, inscribe the cinnabar characters of the purple pendant upon the head. In three years, a natural purple light will arise, suffusing the body’s form, enabling flight into Supreme Clarity.

The Way of seeking immortality: on the vernal equinox at dusk, enter the chamber, face west, recline or sit as desired, close the eyes, and inwardly visualize the Lady of Azure Light within the Moon. Her surname and given name are [omitted], her form nine inches tall, her hair bound in a cloud-like bun, wearing a brocade cloud-feather skirt. She holds the sun’s light in her mouth and descends into the practitioner’s eyes. Presently, the moonlight scatters into yellow qi, flowing throughout the body. The Lady gathers blossoms from the *Qian* Grove in the Moon’s center, scattering them amidst the yellow qi. From her mouth, she exhales the yang essence’s crimson qi, pouring it into the body, from within to without. The yellow and crimson qi intertwine, illuminating the entire form. The Lady bestows the six sounds of the cinnabar characters of the purple script upon the body, then draws in the yellow qi twenty-four times and the yang essence sixteen times, ceasing afterward. Knock the teeth twenty-four times and recite while looking upward:

*"Golden governance refines eightfold,
Cinnabar pools vast and deep.
Jade nectar cascades,
Flowing through the Eight *Qian*.
Yellow qi rises in abundance,
Yang essence congeals as mist.
Gathering blossoms in the Orchid Court,
Flying skirts converse.
The Lady sips fragrance,
August lords pour nectar.
Gentle radiance melts in time,
Intercalary rains of all heavens.
Cinnabar brilliance eightfold bright,
Luminous and resplendent.
Turning and reflecting,
Descending into my body,
To long preserve the soul’s years with the Moon’s essence.
Riding the void, steering the floating,
Reaching the boundless."*

Swallow qi twenty-four times, swallow saliva sixteen times, then ingest the cinnabar characters of the purple script. Practicing this Way for eight years, the Lady will bestow the true sounds of the cinnabar characters and the Moon’s flying blossoms upon the body, brushing the form. The face will assume a golden countenance, enabling flight into Supreme Clarity.

—From the *Scripture of the Yellow Qi and Yang Essence of Supreme Clarity*

The Highest Sage and Imperial Lord said: The method for inscribing one’s name on the Mystic Tablet and soaring into Supreme Clarity—on the third day of the third month at the hour of *Shanghe*, bathe, purify, and fast. At mealtime, enter the chamber, burn incense, face north, and bow nine times to worship the Jade Heaven. Afterward, face north, knock the teeth twelve times, and visualize within the fasting hall a cloud of purple qi, arising in abundance and crowning the chamber. Envision the Five Elder Immortals within the purple cloud, draped in flying azure feathered robes, crowned with *Tongtian* jade coronets, holding green-script registers. The Jade Lads of the Immortals wear cloud-brocade robes, seven-jeweled jade coronets, and hold silver tablets. Visualize the two perfected ones inscribing the name upon the white tablet, recording it in the green-script register, and entrusting the tablet to the Inspector of the Perfected. The name is then recorded among the Left Immortals, memorialized to the Seven Sage Emperors of the Nine Heavens. Once the tablet is inscribed and the name fixed, the Five Elder Immortals and the Jade Lads merge into the body’s Grotto Chamber. Softly recite:

*"Heavenly Origin, auspicious fortune,
*Shanghe* of the Six Chen."*

The Nine Emperors command the numinous, the Seven Sages unfold the true. The Void Mystery records the register, Donghua compiles the scroll. The name is engraved upon the imperial tablet, eternally preserving the Upper Immortal. Sounds and tones harmonize, my body naturally aligns. The purple womb jade-bright, inner radiance like fine jade. The face shines with golden splendor, the bones transform like silver. Rare hairs of wondrous hues entwine above and below. The mysterious descends from the Nine Heavens, turning the purple chariot of heaven. Six dragons and five serpents ascend to the imperial court. The Three Origins converge in celebration, achieving as spoken.

Conclude by bowing seven times to the Seven Sages, swallowing seven breaths to finish. Practice this for seven years, and the Perfected One will manifest, personally inscribing the register, descending to bestow the Three Origins. Riding the void, stepping through emptiness, ascending to the Upper Clarity.

The Most High Sage Lord says: To inscribe your name in the Great Ultimate, on the white tablet with green script, and soar to the Palace of the Great Ultimate, you must on the third day of the third month write in green on a white tablet with green script, face the Chen direction while ingesting it, knock the teeth twelve times, and softly recite:

*"Threefold union forms the covenant,
The mysterious net governs the stars.
The fivefold body follows the diagram,
The mysterious tablet bears green script.
The name is inscribed in the Great Ultimate,
Rank aligned with the Upper Immortal.
The Three Origins are arrayed,
The Six Qi spread forth.
Golden tones and jade characters,
I desire to be naturally so.
To ride the flying radiance,
Ascend to the imperial dawn."*

Conclude by swallowing breath ten times, bowing four times toward the Chen direction. Cease after paying homage to the Four Perfected Ones of the Great Ultimate. Practice this for nine years, and the Great Ultimate will inscribe your name. The Four Perfected Ones will descend to bestow upon you the true script, spontaneously unraveling the luminous tones, soaring to the Upper Clarity.

The Most High Sage Lord says: To inscribe your name in the Upper Origin of the Mysterious Palace, with green-gold and red-script hidden texts, and soar above the Mysterious Palace, you must on the eighth day of the eighth month write in green, green-gold, and red script with ten tones, face west while ingesting it, knock the teeth nine times, and softly recite:

*"Heaven turns, qi spreads to rectify the four cardinal directions,
Three and five intertwine, the nine paths form a cluster.
Green-gold and red script,
Script radiant in the great void.
The mysterious diagram suspends its tones,
Eight reachings, fourfold penetration.
Profound subtleties are fathomed,
Brilliant vision knows no bounds.
To pay homage to the Three Origins,
Advance to the Purple Chamber.
Entering and exiting the Three Clarities,
Eternally preserving the flourishing origin."*

Conclude by swallowing breath six times, bowing six times to pay homage to the Upper Perfected Ones of the Mysterious Palace. Practice this for nine years, and the Upper Origin will engrave the script. The green-gold and red-script hidden texts will naturally become clear, delving into the profound and exhausting the subtle. Communing with spirits, riding the void in flight, ascending to the Upper Clarity.

—From the *Scripture of the Primal Record of the Seven Sage Lords of the Cavern Realms*

The Yellow Emperor’s Talisman for Summoning the Numinous and Attracting the True to Subdue Demons: write in vermilion on a yellow wooden tablet, nine inches wide and twelve inches long, and place it in the center of the chamber. Practice reciting the scripture and enter the chamber for a hundred days, conversing with divine beings. After three years, the chamber will naturally generate the numinous yellow mist. To summon celestial immortals, inscribe according to the method, place the talisman facing south, and meditate with focused intent for a hundred days. The Perfected One will manifest, and immortals will visit your chamber to bestow upon you the Way of the Divine Perfected One. To subdue demons, inscribe according to the method and place it facing north. Recite the chapter of the Great Void once, and the Northern Emperor will wield his troops. Heavenly demons will lose their forms, myriad spirits vanish without trace, and all within and without will be purified and clear. Also, write in vermilion on a nine-inch yellow silk sash and wear it on the body. After eight years, the Emperor will dispatch the wandering chariot to welcome your body, ascending to the Upper Clarity.

—From the *Scripture of the Talisman for Attracting the True and Subduing Demons of the Cavern Realms*

The Two Talismans of the Middle Perfected and the Lower Origin’s Yin-Yang Transformations: write the upper in vermilion and the lower in black. On the day of the Beginning of Summer, first ingest the lower talisman, then the upper. On the Winter Solstice, first ingest the upper talisman, then the lower. When ingesting the talismans, knock the teeth twelve times and softly recite:

*"The Purple Origin intermingles in harmony,
The two qi unite in numinosity.
The Great One transforms the spirit,
The Cavern Origin opens life.
Yin and Yang guide and nurture,
Cultivating and refining luminosity.
Above irrigates, below irrigates,
The Six Perfections exhale essence.
Turning the true, curving reflections,
Descend to my court.
Penetrating the profound, perceiving clearly,
Brilliantly beholding the divine form.
The Eight Radiant Ones assist the immortal,
Enabling my Dao to be fulfilled.
Transforming and responding mysteriously,
Sitting to transcend the Three Clarities.
Eternally equal to heaven and earth,
Unshaken for ten thousand kalpas."*

Conclude by looking up and swallowing eight breaths. Practice this for eight years, and the Upper Perfected Eight Radiant Ones will descend to your body, soaring to the Upper Clarity.

—From the *Upper Scripture of the Golden Root of the Azure Essentials and Purple Writ of the Cavern Realms*

The Upper Perfected and Lower Origin’s Yin-Generated Numinous Talisman: this is the essence of the mysterious yin of the northern upper heavens, transformed into numinous script to assist the Eight Radiant Divine Palaces of the Upper Origin and Lower Perfected. Above, it connects with heavenly qi; below, it descends into the practitioner’s body, summoning the true and attracting the numinous, with officials of a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders. Ingest it for eight years, and the Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery will manifest, dispatching you to obtain the true script of the Nine Heavens and the divine diagrams of the Five Peaks, summoning the Eight Radiant Jade Chariot to soar to the Upper Clarity.

—From the *Scripture of the Seventy-Four Methods of Transformation of the Cavern Realms*

The Secret Name-Tab of the Jade Pendant of the Mysterious Yang of the Inner Hidden Sound of the Heavenly Soul Essence of Brahmā-Kāśyapa: this is the qi of the Mysterious Yang of Brahmā-Kāśyapa Heaven, governing the inner spirits of the Perfected Ones in the Grotto Valley Palace. Write in yellow on white silk and wear it on the body. Also, write on white paper and ingest it on the eight solar terms of your life’s destiny. Internally visualize the Perfected Ones of the Grotto Valley Palace for three years, carefully determining and clearly seeing their true forms. After eighteen years, you will ride the Eight Radiant Cloud Chariot, soaring to the Upper Clarity.

—From the *Nine Yang Talismans of the Perfected Ones of the Cavern Realms*

To receive the qi of the Boundless Heaven of Yuddaṇḍa: on the ninth day of the sixth month at dawn, the nineteenth day at noon, and the twenty-ninth day at midnight—three days and three times in one month—bathe in fragrant water, enter the chamber, burn incense, bow nine times to the northwest toward the Primordial Father, bow three times to the southeast toward the Mysterious Mother, then face the lunar station and sit upright. Knock the teeth thirty-six times, close your eyes, and envision the Heavenly King of the Boundless Heaven of Yuddaṇḍa, whose surname is *Hun* and whose hidden name is *Shuangniancuo*, wearing a nine-colored, seamless, naturally patterned fur robe, crowned with a radiant solar circlet. He rides a nine-scaled jade wheel, accompanied by twenty-four jade immortals, descending into the Crimson Palace of your body. Visualize the crimson cloud qi, dense and luxuriant, crowning and enveloping your form.

After a long while, draw in the cloud qi nine times and swallow it, then softly recite the incantation:

The qi of the Nine Heavens,
now fills and suffuses me.
It settles the Eight Radiant Forms,
arraying them through the Three Palaces.
The ten thousand spirits take their places,
the numinous and the true commune.
The Director of Destinies fixes my record,
the Great One lends support.
The Three and the Five align in harmony,
I behold the Great Yang in motion.
Three transformations, nine revolutions—
return me to the Imperial Homeland.
Golden chariot and jade canopy,
flanked by jade radiance descending,
come to my body,
settle my Golden Chamber.
Guard me in unity,
soar with me in flight.
Ascend to the Great Mystery,
feast in the Imperial Chamber.

When finished, swallow the qi nine times and cease. After three years of this practice, five blossoms arise in the heart, the ten thousand qi transform, and one perceives the hidden and examines the obscure, speaking with spirits as with equals. After nine years, one rides the Eight Radiant Forms and flies to the Upper Clarity.

—From *The Wondrous Record of the Upper Refinement of the Nine Elixirs and the Transformation of Embryonic Essence*

On the first day of the tenth, eleventh, fourth, and eighth months at dawn, face the king and bow twice. Ingest one *liang* of *langgan* blossom elixir with east-flowing water. Then the seven-colored qi will crown your head, your face will gleam with golden blossoms and jade radiance. Holding the breath summons the chariot of the Eight Mysteries; spitting on the ground transforms it into a flying dragon. A whistle to the left brings immortals to court; a gesture to the right unites the Three Purities with the wind. A thousand chariots and ten thousand riders ascend to the Upper Clarity.

—From *The Purple Text of the Wondrous Scripture of the Great Tenuity*

The Central Great Yellow Myriad-Beginning Jade Talisman: To summon the Jade Director of the Yellow Emperor, on the day of one’s natal year-star, face the year-star and ingest the talisman inscribed in red on yellow paper, then wear it inscribed in red on yellow silk. After nine years, if the Jade Director erases your death from the records, he will transfer your life to the Palace of Birth and dispatch a flying chariot of yellow mist to welcome your body, ascending to the Palace of Upper Clarity.

—From *The Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Wondrous Scripture*

Forty-five contemplations align with the number of heaven and earth, accord with the Dao of nature, and generate boundless, revolving blessings. The spirit enters wondrous communion, delves into the profound, and unites with the Dao in true thought. Once the contemplation is settled, one sits as cloud-dragons and the Eight Radiant Forms descend, and the jade chariot ascends to Upper Clarity.

—From *The Scripture of the Wheel of the Wondrous Origin*

The *Jade Clarity’s Joyous Grove and Prosperous Jade Terrace: The Nine Radiant Dawns of the Hidden Writ of the Golden Mystery*: For those cultivating the Dao of divine transcendence, inscribe in white on green tablets and place them in the east to dispel the great demon kings and their retinues under the Azure Emperor and summon the immortal officials of the east. After nine years of practice, the Azure Perfected, the Supreme Sage, and the Royal Elder of the Upper Zhang will manifest in your body, command immortal officials, and gather natural numinous medicines. Also, wear white inscriptions on green silk on your person; when traveling east, you will arrive in the world of the Great Hall of Peace and the Realm of Goodness, where the great demon kings of the east bow their heads in reverence, welcoming and escorting the immortal officials. Entering the Eastern Marchmount, you will obtain a feathered canopy of azure clouds. After nine years, you will fly to Upper Clarity.

—From *The Hidden Writ of Jade Clarity: The Golden Origin and Feathered Chapters of the Highest Wondrous Scripture*

The Six Pure Flying Essence Communicating Numinous Jade Talisman: On the day of the Beginning of Summer, inscribe in vermilion on bamboo membrane and ingest it at dawn facing southeast. After one year, the midday youth will appear in your travels. After three years, your spirit and form will speak with you as one.

After nine years, the Nine Aperture Perfected bestows upon you the true scripture, enabling transformation in the eight directions, sitting and standing at will in life and death, and ascending to Upper Clarity by flight.

The Eight Pure Flying Essence Jade Talisman: On the day of the Beginning of Spring, inscribe in azure on bamboo membrane and ingest it at dawn facing due northeast. After two years, the nine apertures will become luminous. After three years, the radiance of the spirit will shine within. After nine years, you will unite with the Perfected in numinosity and ascend to Upper Clarity by flight.

To ascend the path of the Flying Wood Star: The Year Star is a round mirror, its Wood essence darkly radiant in the eastern pass of the Yang. Within the star are nine gates, from which emanate blades of light, their brilliance extending nine million *zhang*. Each gate is guarded by a Green Thearch, and together the nine Green Thearchs stand ready at the gates, attending the Central Green August Perfected Lord.

At the star’s center resides the Primordial Yang Upper Perfected Green August Dao Lord, whose taboo name is Chenglan and whose style is Qingning. His consort’s taboo name is Baorong and her style is Feiling. They govern within the Wood Star, guarding the nine gates and directing the flow of green light and streaming blades to illumine the Perfected above and below.

The method for ascending in flight: Constantly visualize the Year Star, fixing your mind upon it. With your right hand, press your heart and bow in reverence. Cover both eyes with your left hand, then hold your breath nine times. Next, click your teeth twenty-seven times and swallow saliva nine times. Keeping your eyes closed beneath your hand, silently invoke the names and styles of the true August Lord and Lady of the Year Star’s center three times. Then say:

*"May I be granted to ride the Eight Radiance Azure Chariot with the Primordial Yang Green August Perfected Lord and Lady, ascending to the Supreme Palace."*

When finished, open your eyes beneath your hand and face the star, softly reciting the incantation:

*"Heavenly light intermingles in harmony,
Essence flows to the eastern quarter.
I gaze upward to the nine gates,
Where flying auroras scatter their blades.
Like the Azure Terrace of Yang,
Within dwells the Green August One.
Azure fangs hang in splendor,
Illumining the nine directions.
The Lady gathers in majesty,
Her style is Flying Cloud.
Together they don robes of cloud-brocade,
Dragon-scarves and tiger-skirts.
At their waists hang phoenix talismans,
Upon their heads, flowered crowns."*

Emerging from the formless, entering the void, one roams the Great Primordium. Ahead, the Green Thearch is urged forward; behind, a thousand spirits follow. Welcomed and received, one attains the rank of Flying Perfected. Ascending to Jade Purity, to the chambers of the Most High.

When the invocation is complete, remove the hand and face the star with eyes open, absorbing the star’s light twenty-seven times, visualizing the star’s nine rays entering fully into the throat. Once finished, knock the teeth together three times.

Practicing this for fourteen years, the Green August Supreme Lord of the Year Star’s center petitions the Most High Jade Purity Palace, inscribing the name upon the Microcosmic Flower Register, establishing it in the Jade Book, and conferring the rank of Perfected of Highest Purity.

The Year Star has nine gates, and within each gate resides a Green Thearch. Each Thearch oversees one gate, serving and attending the Central Green August Supreme Perfected Great Lord. The Green August One is the supreme Perfected of the eastern quarter, the revered spirit of Primordial Essence, who enters and exits Jade Purity and befriends the Most High.

Within these gates, the Green Thearchs may also be called the Green Numinous Duke, the Green Spirit, or the Green Thearch.

---

The method for ascending to the Fire Star: the Fire Star’s Dark Mirror and Cinnabar Essence reflect and illuminate the southern balcony. Within the star are three gates, from which three blades of radiance emerge, their light extending three million leagues. Each gate is guarded by a Red Thearch, and together the three Red Thearchs attend and protect the Southern Perfected August Supreme Lord.

At the star’s center resides the Cinnabar Fire Vermilion Yang Red August Supreme Perfected Dao Lord, whose taboo name is *Weichun* and style *Sanyong*. His Lady’s taboo name is *Huaping* and style *Xuanluo*. They govern within the Fire Star, guarding the three gates and dispatching the red light’s flying radiance to illumine the Perfected of the world below.

The method for ascending: visualize the Fire Star, focus the mind upon it, and with the left hand pay homage while the right hand covers the mouth. Hold the breath three times, knock the teeth twenty-seven times, and swallow saliva nine times. Closing the eyes, inwardly recite the taboo names and styles of the Fire Star’s True August Lord and Lady three times. When finished, say:

*"May I be granted to ride the Eight Radiance Vermilion Chariot with the Cinnabar Fire Red August Lord and Lady, ascending to the Jade Purity Palace."*

Then face the star and softly recite the incantation:

*"Dark constellations flow and reflect,
Cinnabar light illumines the southern darkness.
I gaze upward to the three gates,
Where vermilion clouds form crimson walls.
Within dwells the Cinnabar August One,
Whose name is Weichun.
His Lady shines within,
She is Huaping.
Together they don robes of cloud-frost,
Phoenix flowers and dragon bells.
At their waists hang tiger-script talismans,
Upon their heads, flying-green crowns.
Emerging from the Primordial, entering the Mysterious,
They soar and roam the Five Citadels.
Ahead, the Red Thearch leads;
Behind, the Six Dings follow.
Welcomed and received,
One attains the name of Perfected.
Ascending to the Void and Mysterious,
Inscribed in gold upon Jade Purity."*

When the invocation is complete, remove the hand and no longer cover the mouth. Face the star with eyes open, absorbing its light twenty-seven times, visualizing the star’s three rays entering fully into the throat. Once finished, knock the teeth together three times.

Practicing this for four years, the Red August Supreme Perfected Dao Lord of the Fire Star petitions the Three Primordials’ Mysterious Highest Palace, inscribing the name upon the Jasper Register of the Dark Garden, establishing it in the Gold Book, and conferring the rank of Perfected of Highest Purity.

The Fire Star has three gates, within which reside three Red Thearchs. Each Thearch oversees one gate, attending the Central Red August Lord. The Red August One is the supreme Perfected of the southern quarter, the noble spirit of the Cinnabar Palace, who enters and exits Jade Purity and befriends the Three Primordials’ August Supreme Lord.

Within it, the Red Thearch Lords may also be called the Red Numinous Duke, the Red Spirit, the Red Essence, or the Red Thearch, all of whom serve the Central Red August Supreme Perfected Great Lord.

---

The method for ascending to the Metal Star: the Metal Star’s Round Mirror and Golden Essence gleam and shine upon the western celestial station. Within the Metal Star are seven gates, from which seven blades of radiance emerge, their light extending seven million leagues. Each gate is guarded by a White Thearch, and together the seven White Thearchs attend and protect the Western Perfected August Supreme Dao Lord.

At the star’s center resides the Grand Simplicity Lesser Yang White August Supreme Perfected Dao Lord, whose taboo name is *Liaoling* and style *Zhenxun*. His Lady’s taboo name is *Biaoying* and style *Lingen*. They govern within the Metal Star, guarding the seven gates and dispatching the white light’s flying essence to illumine the Perfected of the Upper Primordial.

The method for ascending: visualize the Metal Star, focus the mind upon it, and with the right hand press the heart while the left hand covers the nostrils. Hold the breath seven times, knock the teeth twenty-seven times, and swallow saliva nine times. Closing the eyes, inwardly recite the taboo names and styles of the Metal Star’s True August Lord and Lady three times. When finished, say:

*"May I be granted to ride the Eight Radiance Pristine Chariot with the Grand Simplicity Lesser Yang Lord and Lady, ascending to the Jade Purity Palace."*

Then face the star and softly recite the incantation:

*"Seven qi soar in splendor,
Light illumines the western quarter.
I gaze upward to the seven gates,
Where numinous towers gleam with blades.
Pristine radiance shines and reflects,
Virtue blazes in the Metal Clan.
Within dwells the Lesser Yang,
Called the White August One.
His Lady is Lingen,
Who governs in the Jade Chamber.
Together they don robes of luminous brocade,
Tiger emblems and flowing bells.
Upon their heads, dawn’s crowns;
At their waists, golden pendants.
Emerging from the Void, entering the Empty,
They wander the steps of Jade Firmness.
Ahead, the White Thearch leads;
Behind, the Six Gengs follow.
Descending to welcome,
Ascending to the Rampart Palace.
Inscribed in the Jade Book of Highest Purity,
One attains the rank of Perfected Duke."*

When the invocation is complete, remove the hand and no longer cover the nostrils. Face the star with eyes open, absorbing its radiant light twenty-seven times, visualizing the seven rays entering fully into the throat. Once finished, knock the teeth together three times.

Practicing this for fourteen years, the Lesser Yang White Perfected August Lord of the Metal Star petitions the Jade Thearch’s Palace of the Grand Thearch, inscribing the name upon the Jade Register of Highest Purity’s Golden Watchtower, establishing it in the Jade Tablet, and conferring the rank of Left Perfected Duke of Highest Purity.

The Metal Star has seven gates, within which reside seven White Thearchs. Each Thearch oversees one gate, attending the Central White August Dao Lord.

The White Thearch is the Supreme Perfected of the West, the August Lord of Grand Simplicity, who enters and exits the Mystic Clarity, befriending the Primordial Thearch of the August Beginning.
