**Cavern-Real Summoning Perfected and Subduing Demons Talismans**

**White Thearch’s Summoning Numinous and Subduing Demons Talisman**—inscribe in yellow on a white wooden tablet, nine inches wide and twelve inches long, and place it on the western wall of your chamber. Engage in scriptural recitation and enter the chamber for a hundred days, whereupon you will converse with divine beings. After three years, your chamber will naturally generate clouds of white mist. To summon Perfected Ones and Celestial Immortals, inscribe the talisman according to the method, place it at the center, and meditate with precision for a hundred days. The Perfected will manifest in form, and Immortals will visit your chamber to transmit the Way of Divine Perfection. To subdue demons, inscribe the talisman as above, place it on the eastern wall, and recite the *Chapter of the Great Void* once. The Northern Thearch will wield his troops, celestial demons will lose their forms, myriad spirits will extinguish their radiance, and all within and without will be purified. Additionally, inscribe in yellow on a nine-inch white silk sash and wear it on the body for eight years; the Thearch will dispatch the *Green Litter of Mysterious Radiance* to descend and welcome your body, ascending into the Grand Clarity.

**Black Thearch’s Summoning Numinous and Subduing Demons Talisman**—inscribe in white on a black wooden tablet, nine inches wide and twelve inches long, and place it on the northern wall of your chamber. Engage in scriptural recitation and enter the chamber for a hundred days, whereupon you will converse with divine beings. After three years, your chamber will naturally generate clouds of black mist. To summon Perfected Ones and Celestial Immortals, inscribe the talisman as above, place it on the western wall, and meditate with precision for a hundred days. The Perfected will manifest in form, and Immortals will visit your chamber to transmit the Way of Divine Perfection. To subdue demons, inscribe the talisman as above, place it on the southern wall, and recite the *Chapter of the Great Void* once. The Northern Thearch will wield his troops, celestial demons will lose their forms, myriad spirits will extinguish their radiance, and all within and without will be purified. Additionally, inscribe in white on a nine-inch black silk sash and wear it on the body for eight years; the Thearch will dispatch the *Litter of Eightfold Luminous Ways* to descend and welcome your body, ascending into the Grand Clarity.

*(From the* **Cavern-Real Nine Perfected Yang Talismans Scripture***)*

The **Golden Inscription Secret Characters of the Three Primes and Nine Perfected Yang Talismans**—the *Brahma-Treasure Celestial Soul Essence Secret-Sound Inner Taboo Jade Pendant Uniting Yang Talisman*—this is the *Brahma-Treasure Celestial Uniting Yang Qi*, governing the Perfected Inner Spirits of the Palace of Ultimate Yin. Inscribe it in yellow on white silk and wear it on the body; also transcribe it on white paper and ingest it on the eight solar nodes of your life-destiny. Inwardly contemplate the Perfected Ones within the Palace of Ultimate Yin for three years, and upon careful verification, you will behold the true spirits. The Mysterious Mother of the Nine Heavens will bestow upon you the *Nine Heavens’ Supreme Writ* and the *Eightfold Refined Mushroom Essence*, attaining the Way of Spontaneity. At noon, you will soar through the sky and ascend into the Grand Clarity.

*(From the* **Cavern-Real Jade Pendant Golden Bell Supreme-Pole Golden Writ Scripture***)*

**Great Hundred-Six Calamities’ Life-Preserving Longevity Talisman**—inscribe in vermilion on white silk and wear it on the head. It will shield you from floods, violent calamities, and harm, preserving your body and prolonging life to match the Three Luminaries. Wearing it for nine years, you will ascend into the Grand Clarity at noon.

**Lesser Hundred-Six Calamities’ Life-Preserving Longevity Talisman**—inscribe in yellow on white silk and wear it on the left elbow. It will protect you from the thousand demons, myriad spirits, epidemics, and floods, preserving your body and prolonging life to match Heaven and Earth. Wearing it for nine years, you will ascend into the Grand Clarity at noon.

**Yin-Yang Calamity-Averting True Life-Preserving Longevity Talisman**—inscribe in black on white silk and wear it on the body. It will grant you a lifespan equal to Heaven and Earth and radiance like the sun and moon. After nine years, you will ascend into the Grand Clarity in flight.

*(From the* **Cavern-Real Azure Essentials Purple Writ Scripture***)*

**Fivefold Elixir of the Cavernous Origin**

Take five fen of *ju teng* (bitter bamboo), three fen of *wei xi* (thunder god vine), two fen of *shu jiao* (Sichuan pepper), one fen of *gan jiang* (dried ginger), and one fen of *chang pu* (sweet flag). Select only the finest, freshest ingredients, cleanse them thoroughly, and pound them on a *wang xiang* day with a male child’s pestle—do not change the method. Prepare each separately, then sift finely. Pound each of the five ingredients ten thousand times, place them in separate red cups, arrange the five cups on a red table, and expose them to the open air for one night. At dawn the next day, divide them with a sacred dipper and combine them according to the method.

Mix with white honey or maltose, then pound again thirty thousand times, forming pills the size of *wu* seeds. At dawn, face the sun, kneel, and swallow three pills, saying: *"May my deepest wishes be fulfilled."* At dusk, kneel facing west and swallow three more pills in the same manner, making this a regular practice. Abstain from raw fish, pork, meat, and pungent vegetables; avoid encountering corpses, pigs, dogs, or childbirth filth—be vigilant!

The cycle begins on *jiazi* and ends on *guihai*, with the celestial stems and earthly branches as the appointed time—do not neglect or forget. Sixty-one nodes mark the constant rhythm of Heaven and Earth. Follow the regimen precisely: from *jia* to *gui* constitutes one node. If *jiazi* does not fall on a *jian* day, completing the full cycle is also acceptable. Before taking the elixir, fast for three days, burn incense, and meditate upon the spirits, then proceed.

After sixty days, the body becomes light and agile;
another sixty days, the four limbs grow supple;
another sixty days, the complexion radiates;
another sixty days, the abdomen and intestines harmonize, the five viscera strengthen, and noxious influences cannot harm;
another sixty days, the body becomes firm and robust;
another sixty days, hearing and vision sharpen.
These are the signs of the first year.

Another sixty days, the bones and marrow grow strong;
another sixty days, the fingernails gleam;
another sixty days, one’s influence becomes manifest;
another sixty days, essence and *qi* flourish;
another sixty days, white hair recedes;
another sixty days, the teeth become hard and unyielding.
These are the signs of the second year.

Another sixty days, virtue and the Dao attain penetration;
another sixty days, the Six Jia spirits follow;
another sixty days, the spirit pervades the body;
another sixty days, will and faith align with the spirit’s movement;
another sixty days, the heart opens and the eyes brighten;
another sixty days, one gains knowledge of the four directions.
These are the signs of the third year.

Another sixty days, divination and vision gain clarity;
another sixty days, the five spirits do not depart;
another sixty days, one becomes unaware of hunger or thirst;
another sixty days, the hundred spirits come to pay homage;
another sixty days, the five viscera never deplete;
another sixty days, one masters cold and heat.
These are the signs of the fourth year.

Another sixty days, one can float or sink;
another sixty days, one can move in shallow or deep waters;
another sixty days, one can become round or square;
another sixty days, one can be weak or strong;
another sixty days, one can move freely or constrained;
another sixty days, one can be short or tall.
These are the signs of the fifth year.

Another sixty days, one can be beautiful or ugly;
another sixty days, one can be large or small;
another sixty days, one can be light or heavy;
another sixty days, one passes through all barriers without obstruction;
another sixty days, the traveling kitchen appears at one’s side, and one attains the rank of immortal.
These are the signs of the sixth year.

With unceasing practice, one aligns with Heaven, undergoes a thousand transformations, and ascends into the Grand Clarity.

*(From the* **Scripture of the Five Talismans of the Cavernous Origin***)*

The Most High Jade Emperor Dao Lord said: To inscribe your name upon the white tablets of the Mysterious Register and ascend to the Jade Clarity’s Upper Palace, on the first day of the first month at the hour of *shanghe*, bathe and fast, then at dawn enter your chamber. Burn incense, face north, and bow nine times in homage to the Jade Heaven. Once done, sit facing north, click your teeth nine times, and visualize within your fasting chamber a cloud of azure *qi* rising luxuriantly, filling the room. Envision the Five Elder Immortals within the azure cloud, clad in flying azure feathered robes, crowned with *tongtian* jade coronets, holding the azure-script registers. The Jade Immortal Lords wear cloud-brocade robes, seven-jeweled jade crowns, and hold white silver tablets. Visualize the two perfected ones recording your name upon the white tablets and binding it into the azure-script register. Then, entrust your tablet and register to the Supervising Perfected Envoys and the Left Immortal of the Fixed Register, who will inscribe them beneath the mechanism of the Seven Sages of the Nine Heavens’ Imperial Kings. Once your name is fixed upon the tablet and register, the Five Elder Immortals and the Jade Immortal Lords will merge into the Hall of Light within your body. Then recite the incantation:

On the day of *shanghe*, the Celestial Origin is solemn and clear.
The Most High’s luminous canopy, the Jade Emperor descends to the court.
The Nine Perfected command the void, the Seven Sages unite in spirit.
Inscribe upon the Mysterious Register, record the name upon the white tablet,
Engrave the Primordial Record, carve life from death.
The Western Tortoise binds the register, preserving the immortal’s azure splendor.
Receive the cloud sash above, the five forms shine brilliantly.
Bestow upon me feathered robes, send down my green chariot.
Grant me to ride the flying clouds, ascend to the Purple Jade.
The Three Luminaries merge their light, the Seven Origins share their radiance.
Eternally preserve the Two Modes, Heaven and Earth endure as one.

After reciting, bow seven times in homage to the Seven Sages, swallow seven breaths, and cease. This is the method of the Most High for forging karmic ties and inscribing the tablets of the Six Harmonies. Practicing it for seven years, even those without a name in the Mysterious Register will have it engraved therein. The Three Origins descend, the Four Poles awaken their numen, and one naturally attains penetration, able to fly and ascend into the Grand Clarity.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* states: The *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected* of the Most High Great Tenuity Heavenly Emperor Lord’s cultivation of the Eight Dao and Nine Perfected’s *Jielin Yuyi* method for ascending to the sun and moon was transmitted to the Central Yellow Elder Lord and concealed within the Six Harmonies Palace of the Most High. According to the old regulations, one may receive three transmissions in seven thousand years. If one bears the azure script of Eastern Florescence and the jade characters of the Upper Clarity, and is a purple-net-enshrined living being, one may receive three transmissions within seven hundred years. The oath requires: ninety feet of silk, one catty of azure thread, and twenty-four feet of crimson silk—this is the oath of the sun’s radiance.

Twenty-four feet of green silk—this is the oath of the moon’s radiance. Three pairs of golden rings—this is the oath of the Ageless Youths. Facing north, one performs the oath-transmission on the ninth and twenty-fourth days of the fast, with seventeen jade boys and seventeen jade maidens in attendance. Cultivating this Dao for seven years, one rides a dragon in flight and ascends to the Great Clarity. Its method is especially weighty: two transgressions sever merit and cut off affairs; four transgressions incur the scrutiny of the Left and Right Officials. For oneself and seven generations of ancestors, punishment is meted out in the Three Torments of the Hell of Knife Mountains and Fire-Eating—ten thousand kalpas of rebirth, never to enter the Dao of humanity. The *Green Statutes of the Left Palace of the Mysterious Capital* states: those who seek it must reverently and cautiously uphold it.

—End of *Supreme Mysteries*, Scroll Ninety-Nine
*Supreme Mysteries*, Scroll One Hundred: *Ascending the Formless*

The Most High Sage Emperor Lord said: To inscribe your name in the Mysterious Register and return to the Nine Empyreans of Heaven, at the hour of *shanghe* on the fifth day of the fifth month, bathe and fast in purity, compose the mind and enter the chamber. Burn incense, face north, and bow nine times in homage to the Jade Heaven. When finished, face north, knock the teeth twelve times, and visualize within the fasting chamber a cloud of cinnabar qi, empty yet radiant, filling the room. Envision the Five Elder Immortals within the cinnabar cloud, draped in flying azure robes, crowned with *Tongtian* jade coronets, holding green-script registers. The Attendant Immortal Jade Lords wear cloud-brocade robes, seven-jeweled jade crowns, and hold white-script tablets. Visualize the Two Perfected recording your name upon the white tablet, binding it into the green-script register. Hand your inscribed tablet to the Supervising Perfected Messenger to be recorded by the Left Immortal Prime Minister under the Seven Sages of the Nine Heavenly Emperor Kings. Once the tablet is inscribed and the name fixed, the Five Elder Immortals lead the Jade Lords to merge into your Crimson Palace. Silently intone:

*"Vermilion brightness of the Southern Cinnabar,
Joyous union with the Upper Yang.
Celestial origin conjoins in harmony,
Six aspirations flourish within.
Nine Perfected and Seven Sages,
Fast in the numinous jade hall.
Inscribe upon the Mysterious Tablet,
Bind the register of the Western Palace.
Carve the correct script, sounding clearly,
Illuminating the four directions.
Cinnabar clouds return through the empyrean,
Descending into my chamber.
Flying azure plumes, winged and radiant,
Left spurs the vermilion phoenix,
Right reins the roaming dragon.
Six bridles lift as one,
Transcending to ascend the Flowering Hall.
Five Elders hold the covenant,
Four Poles stand in paired symmetry.
Eternally preserve the Mysterious Splendor,
Sun and moon share the same visage."*

When finished, bow seven times in homage to the Seven Sages and swallow seven breaths to conclude. Practicing this for seven years, your name as one who has attained the Dao will be fixed in the Upper Palace, the Nine Empyreans will shine in reflection, and you will ascend into the formless.

—From the *Scripture of the Primordial Register of the Seven Sages of the Cavernous Realms*

The Dao states: Those who cultivate this scripture and attain the rank of Upper Immortal will fly and ascend into the void, their bodies becoming formless, forever one with the Dao.

—From the *Scriptural Instructions on the Natural Dao of the Cavernous Origin*

Recite the homage to all heavens once,
Ten recitations revive withered bones to life.
Seven Mysteries ascend to the Vermilion Palace,
Enjoying blessings and entering the formless.

—From the *Scripture of the Numinous Stanzas of the Cavernous Origin*

The virtue of the Great Sage and host of Perfected Ones, after attaining the Dao, ascends into the formless and merges with the Dao as one.

—From the *Scripture of the Yellow Register and Simplified Writ of the Cavernous Origin*

*Responding to Transformations*

The Highest Jade Emperor, Most Sage Emperor Lord, and Nine Heavenly Jade Perfected all receive qi naturally, lodge in jade wombs, conceal brilliance in the Purple Origin, and through numinous harmony and resonance, become human. Descendants of the imperial lineage, born as perfected beings, they structure emptiness into script and harmonize the Three Qi into names. Invested with imperial titles, they respond and transform in the Upper Clarity, governing the lofty void of immortals, presiding over the Mysterious Mystery. With the passage of the four seasons, they adapt to cyclical changes, bathing, donning crowns and sashes, refining and adorning eternal talismans. They transform forms and appearances, responding to stimuli and coming into being. In the obscure and indistinct, the Dao has no constant name—profound and unfathomable, subtle and inexhaustible. Heaven and Earth model themselves upon it to establish the Great Mystery, aligning to achieve purity. Sun and moon rely upon it to illuminate the Five Agents, receiving its numinous power to attain spirituality. Vast and towering, its virtue’s source; boundless and exalted, its lofty honor. Its Dao is supremely wondrous, beyond all comparison.

The Primordial Beginning records and conceals it within the Six Harmonies Palace of the Most High. Later sages and students of the Upper Perfected’s Dao must refine and master the Primordial Beginning’s transformative forms, adapting to seasonal changes to communicate with the real, return their qi, and refine their spirits. For example, the Primordial Beginning’s August Elder assumes the qi of the Jade Void of the Primordial Beginning on the day of *Lichun* and receives the title of August Elder, embodying true form, wearing robes of proper colors, and residing in the true and upright for the ninety days of spring. On the day of *Lixia*, the August Elder transforms, receiving the seasonal change, bathing in the numinous and real, altering form and appearance to communicate with the real and absorb the numinous, ensuring qi’s eternal presence. During the ninety days of summer, the immortal soul bathes, and the numinous and real resonate. On the day of *Liqiu*, the August Elder transforms again with the season, donning the Five Constants’ crown and sash, called "immortal transformation." Qi flows through the Mysterious Mystery, filling within and overflowing without, radiance shining forth, transforming the real and nurturing qi to ensure its endlessness. During the ninety days of autumn, crowned with the Nine Heavens and transformed into an immortal, the real is perfected. On the day of *Lidong*, the August Elder unites true embryonic breathing, returning qi to its natural state, liberating form and spirit, transforming appearance into light, returning to the Primordial Beginning, refining and returning essence, nurturing and polishing the numinous and real. Light and color blend into chaos, like misty clouds. During the ninety days of winter, qi congeals and spirit coalesces, restoring the original form. After four cycles, the year completes and renews—this is the Primordial Beginning’s four transformations, adapting to seasonal changes. The movements of Heaven and Earth all have flourishing and decline, closure and opening, rest and activity, responding to the Celestial Pass. In flourishing, they preside upright; in rest, they nurture and cultivate, donning crowns and refining essence, never losing constancy.

The Dao/Way is eternal and boundless—this is the wondrous transformation’s essence.

From *The Upper Clarity Primordial Beginning’s Transformations: Original Scrolls* (上清元始變化元箓), the True Person says:
*"Having received the Sacred Treasure’s true scriptures,
practice this fast,
and first attain this great blessing for others—
thus, prioritizing others over oneself,
lying prone in forgetfulness,
and aspiring to the forgotten state,
where one’s body aligns with the Mysterious Unity."*

From *The Scripture on Spreading the Fast of the Primordial Beginning* (洞元敷齋經), it is written:
*"Guilt and fortune do not arise from others,
but spring forth from one’s own self.
The great sage thus seals his lips,
to sever all ties with malevolent causes.
Extinguishing thought, he returns to forgetfulness,
lying prone while awaiting the eternal dissolution."*

From *The Scripture on Establishing the Aspiration of the Primordial Beginning* (洞元安志經):
*"Refine the embryo and return to the Original Beginning,
ascend the Heavenly Bridge of long transcendence.
Nurturing and storing [qi] squanders the Heavenly True,
while scattered thoughts invite the common fate.
Severing the fettering womb-tree’s roots,
the mind soars beyond the Upper Capital.
The aspiration to the Mysterious Unity is fulfilled,
enlightening me to the forgotten Dao/Way and its essence."*

From *The Nine Heavens Scripture of the Primordial Beginning* (洞元九天經), the Humanly Natural says:
*"The Dao/Way is the True of nature.
Non-action is the Dao/Way’s ultimate.
Emptiness and non-existence are virtue’s highest honor.
Dullness and stagnation are virtue’s abode.
Silence and quiescence are virtue’s depths.
Purity and stillness are the mind’s neighbor.
Sincerity and integrity are the mind’s gate.
Harmony and moderation are the origin of all affairs.
Thus, one who practices the Dao/Way naturally
attains its name through nature itself.
One who masters non-action
secures longevity in life.
One who embodies emptiness and non-existence
allows the qi to flow unimpeded.
One who dwells in dullness and stagnation
shares in the eternal aspiration.
One who abides in silence and quiescence
conceals the voice within.
One who cultivates purity and stillness
illuminates the mind.
One who embodies sincerity and integrity
preserves the aspiration.
One who harmonizes and moderates
transforms into the Dao/Way’s essence itself.

Therefore, in practicing the Dao/Way,
one must first establish the natural.
I previously taught this to the Official’s Attendant, Em Yin,
and composed two chapters on the Dao/Way and virtue.
As I departed, I admonished him:
‘The Dao/Way is natural.
Those who attain it know its natural state,
while those who do not know neither its origin nor its essence.
It is like recognizing sound—
one who knows it by the ear
cannot fathom the depths of human hearts;
one who knows it by the mouth
cannot speak its marvels.
The Dao/Way’s endless expanse
cannot be fully expressed in words,
nor can words fully capture its meaning.
I wrote for you
to awaken your understanding of the natural,
so that upon attaining it, you may nurture it yourself.’

Em Yin asked: ‘How does one learn the natural Dao/Way?’
The Dao/Way replied: ‘Take nothing—
the upright qi will dwell within you;
reject nothing—
the perverse qi will depart of its own accord.
This is not the way of petitioning spirits and gods,
nor is it to repel impurities and banish the unnatural.
Purity and stillness prolong life without bound—
how is this not the natural Dao/Way?
It is not my peculiar method,
nor my solitary path.
If the Dao/Way is not natural,
what Dao/Way is it?
Non-action and non-desire—
the Dao/Way’s true application.
Emptiness and non-existence—
the Dao/Way’s abiding place.
Silence and quiescence—
the Dao/Way’s ultimate state.
Dullness and tranquility—
virtue’s gradual cultivation.
Purity and stillness—
the mind’s dwelling.
Sincerity and integrity—
the mind’s adornment.
Harmony and moderation—
the mind’s transformation.

Nurture the body through non-action,
settle the mind in emptiness,
preserve the aspiration in dullness,
cultivate the voice in silence,
calm the heart in purity,
maintain the aspiration in sincerity,
and sustain the mind in harmony.
Let the heart dwell undisturbed,
as vast waters naturally settle deep.
Let the mind reside still,
as the dragon naturally hides in its lair.
Embrace emptiness without becoming void,
cling without being bound—
like the Southern Star’s forgetfulness of emptiness.
Transform virtue and preserve the mind,
as the ancestral altars safeguard their radiance.
Establish the mind’s highest clarity,
as the ancestral halls guard their sacred essence.
Make the world not see you,
like the great fish in the great waters.
Make others not know you,
like the sun’s rising light in the east.
My boundless nature
resonates with the Dao/Way’s root,
comparable to how mountains, forests, and great marshes
naturally gather beasts and wolves,
or how deep woods and vast trees
naturally attract flying birds and myriad creatures,
or how the Red Lake
naturally draws fish, tortoises, dragons, and serpents,
or how great virtue
naturally summons the auspicious麒麟 (qílín), phoenix, and crane,
or how purity and whiteness
naturally invite the jade maidens and immortal plants,
or how harmony and blessed omens
naturally bring forth good fortune,
or how calamities and malevolent qi
naturally invite disaster and misfortune.’*

From *The Scripture of the Wondrous True* (妙真經):
*"Ascend to the skies, grasp the elixir,
roam and feast in the Purple Morn.
Hold the cosmic currents, retain the years,
and eternally enjoy the natural Dao/Way.*

*The Dao/Way scriptures say:
‘Humans emulate Earth,
Earth follows Heaven,
Heaven conforms to the Dao/Way,
and the Dao/Way follows nature.’*

From *The Scripture on the Empty Cavern’s Mysterious Chapter* (洞元空洞靈章經):
*"Floating on the vast Empty Peak,
the celestial scenery flows in the Upper Mysterious.
The beginning’s end is beyond all kalpas,
eternally preserving Heaven and Earth’s completeness.
The world’s rulers study to achieve the dharma,
while Dao/Wayists chant to attain immortality.
The worthy now receive and uphold this teaching,
transmitting it according to its law.
In the absence of one with supreme virtue,
guard its secrets and do not proclaim them recklessly.
The faithful shall ascend to the Upper Clarity,
while the abandoned shall descend to the Nine Abyss.
I speak of the Dao/Way of non-action,
purity and stillness attaining the natural.’*

From *The Mysterious Commentary on the Great Dao/Way* (洞元太極隱注):
*"The Dao/Way’s words:
‘The True Person embodies the void’s penetration,
uniting with the Dao/Way’s essence,
aligning with nature itself—
omnipotent, omniscient,
omnipenetrating.’"*

The sovereigns of the Dao/Way each have their own realm,
The True Ones each possess their own palace.

In stillness, the radiant clouds arise from the Upper Clarity,
In obscurity, the boundless void sustains the Great Emptiness.

The penetrating transformation occurs within the Vermilion Cloud Cavern,
The boundless expanse connects to the Nine Mysteries.

In silent contemplation, one grasps the stillness and attains the ultimate—
The Eight Scenes enable flight through the void.

The Great Penetration encompasses the Three Categories,
With transformations both formless and form-replete.

The stillness of the rootless teaching,
In its austerity, holds profound and numinous power.

---
From *The Nine Dao/Way Paths of the Mysterious True Return* (洞真回元九道经):
There is a substance that blends into unity,
Born before Heaven and Earth,
Silent and boundless,
Independent yet unchanging,
Circulating eternally without ceasing,
It can be the mother of all under Heaven.

---
From *The Dao/Way Classic of the Old Master* (老子道经):
The Old Master of the Kunlun Peaks rules the center,
Ascending to the Heavenly Summit.
Within the Seven Treasures Moral Vision of the Dao,
He summoned the Dao/Wayist Erling and said to him:
"My Dao/Way originates from the void’s emptiness,
Before the Great Beginning itself,
With no source from which it arises,
Yet it is subtle and does not manifest form.

In the past, I received the wondrous law upon this peak.
With my keen intelligence and wisdom, I gathered my intent and followed it.
Having purified my body for the Dao/Way, I attained subtle and profound penetration.
Seeking the Dao/Way to ascend as an immortal,
I achieved the name of one who follows the Dao/Way’s traces.

Now, seek immortality among immortals,
Seek divinity among gods,
Seek the Dao/Way among the Dao/Way.
Do not seek *nirvana* (灭度),
And you shall grasp the void’s essential principle.

Emptiness, silence, and stillness—
These are the Dao/Way’s core.
The ultimate Dao/Way is ever profound and silent;
Words spoken cannot capture its truth.

Taking and discarding show no deviation,
Endlessly sustaining the substance of things.
The method of the formless penetration is understood,
Yet the god of the middle realm is also recognized.
Coming and going lack thought,
Forgetfulness aligns with all existence.

---
From *The Classic of Ascending to the Origin* (升元经):
To learn immortality, abandon all worldly attachments.
Each thought, if sustained, accumulates.

Coming and going disrupt my spirit,
My restless spirit wanders without end.
Extinguish thought and rest in the void’s tranquility,
In stillness, enter the boundless emptiness.

Receive the scriptures as one parched and thirsty,
Hold your resolve like iron and stone.
Preserve the child to walk the immortal path,
The Five Spirits (五灵) and the talismans of transcendence.

The Old Master’s profound and silent teachings,
Expounding the Dao/Way, revering its scriptures.
With reverence and humility, I have attained immortality,
Through countless kalpas, my lifespan is boundless.

The towering virtue of the Great True One,
In stillness, it originates from the formless.
The celestial scenery constructs the void’s framework,
Riding the emptiness, one naturally advances.

The sun and moon shine as radiant symbols,
In perfect harmony, joy endures forever.

The words of the Old Master’s profound mystery,
The Three Penetrations (三洞) of the initial origin,
Are subtle yet difficult to hear,
Luminous and silent, encompassing all virtues.
The lofty and revered, the ultimate true,
Where all wondrous things reside—
The gateway to all mysteries.

---
The Mysterious True Person (太玄真人) said:
All these teachings should be exhausted in emptiness,
With form and formlessness intermingling.
Cultivate virtue and nourish the spirit,
Accumulate emptiness and condense the true.
The true body shall then be established,
Entering and exiting form and formlessness,
Hidden in stillness, reaching the utmost mystery.

---
From *The Classic of the Dao/Way’s Traces* (道迹经):
What endures forever in its Dao/Way is *nourishing life* (养生).
What remains constant in its communion with the eternal is *receiving qi* (纳气).
When the *qi* is complete, life is sustained,
Then one can nourish.
When nourishment reaches its peak, one unites with the true,
Then one can eternally ascend to the realm of life-giving *qi*,
Gazing upon the stillness of complete nourishment,
Fully relying on the borrowed and the lodged.

---
From *The True Admonitions* (真诰):
Human life is like an illusion,
Temporarily dwelling between Heaven and Earth.
If one gathers *qi* and cultivates the spirit,
With earnestness pouring into the true,
One may attain the eternal Dao/Way.

When the Dao/Way is complete, it aligns with all,
Sharing existence with Heaven and Earth,
Dwelling within the Great Non-being (太无).

If one penetrates the void and embodies the formless,
One merges with the Great Non-being,
Dwelling within the silent stillness.

Those who can penetrate the stillness—
They are invisible when seen,
Unheard when listened to.
